title: OK stay but expensive
text: Everything in my room was in order except that the room itself was quite small. I found the carpet to be dirty in some areas but the rest of the room was clean. The front desk staff were very friendly. Standard is stated to be a 4-star hotel, but in my opinion it is more like a 3-star. Everything in NYC is expensive and this includes hotels. In another city, this same room would be anywhere from 30% to 40% cheaper.

title: Amazing hotel, but pricey!
text: The Standard is an amazing hotel with an amazing location, amazing views, and an amazing staff. Right in the heart of the East Village surrounded by quality restaurants, it would be hard not to stay here again and again and again.

title: Better luck next time ?
text:
I had a very cold welcome, after an 8-hour flight : what’s your phone number, we’ll call you when your room is ready.
Nobody called…
Small, but clean room.
No light, closer filled with luggage rack.
Breakfast : the bread arrived when I had finished the omelet.
What does hospitality mean ?

title: Wonderfully cozy!
text: Clean rooms regularly stocked with excellent service. Eat at the Cafe! The food and cocktails were almost as delightful as the staff! Eggs benny and the burgers were a particular bright spot on the menu. Located in a great spot in East Village, you can walk to dozens of great restaurants and uptown is just a train ride away.

title: Family weekend in the city!
text:
I really like the rooms at the Standard. Clean, comfy, and well designed. The bathtub is a real bonus! Khori was such a delight at the front desk. She was so upbeat and helpful. Very good vibe that really made walking into the hotel pleasant after a long day in the city. 

The restaurant while good had some issues with staffing. We waited a long time but I’ve been before and it was great. They must have been understaffed this weekend.

title: Great chill hotel w/ a low key vibe.
text: Having stayed at the Standard’s sister property a couple of times this year, we decided to give the East Village location a shot. Wow. Great service and more of a cozy, smaller property feel. With an awesome bakery, Librae right next door this is a great unpretentious location for poking around the downtown scene. Kudos to the staff and management.

title: THE BEST hotel in New York !
text: Omg! Where do I begin????? Rudy and his team made my stay in New York the BEST I have EVER had! NOTHING was too much trouble and always everything came with genuine interest and concern for me. I feel I have made a family there at the Standard and I will NEVER need to look elsewhere. It quickly felt lime I had known them forever as they made me feel a friend whilst always being sensitive and respectful. Who ever is in charge of hiring staff at The Standard in Cooper Square deserves a medal because EVERYONE from housekeeping to security and front desk genuinely Made you feel so much part of their family. The hotel itself is fabulous. Very clean very groovy very attractive and you know…..so are the staff! Bravo to the BEST hotel in New York! Oh! On top of which, best location I have ever stayed in. Right in the middle of everything great in lower Manhattan, walked round corners into east village, west village, Soho, Washington Square, great restaurants and stores and subway stops on doorstep and just fabulous in every way!

title: Great on every level
text: I cannot recommend this spot more highly. I almost don’t want to ruin it by a great recommendation, but Leo and the rest of the staff certainly deserve it, they are so friendly and welcoming, great food wine list took care of everything in true standard hotel culture/style - thank you !!

title: Special, in every way.
text: In a city of 8 million people, it's easy to feel overlooked or just another cog in the wheel. Not at this hotel. From the second, I walked in the door I was met by a smiling face who said hello how are you?  From there I met Khori who checked me into my room with the same pleasant attitude as the doorman.  I made my way to the 17th floor. The view in my room was stunning! I had a 270° view of the city. The bed was comfortable. The room was clean. Every time I ran into someone who worked in the hotel they were equally as pleasant as the next. I will stay in that hotel every time I go to New York.

title: Comfortable, great location and service!
text: We spent a delightful week at The Standard East Village, chosen for our culinary tour. My hubby and I were thoroughly impressed with the experience. A special shout-out to the front desk staff, Nia and Lydia, who made our arrival seamless with a smooth early check-in process. Nestled in the East Village, the hotel's location is a treasure trove of dining options and local attractions. Our room was really nice with a splendid view of the city. It's a place I would consider staying at again.

title: On Point !
text:
Really impressed with Front desk staff. Amazing multitaskers. Watched Nia and Lydia juggle from checking check outs room service orders , moving luggage . Loved it . They both are terrific. 
Nia checked me in little early on Sunday morning without making me feel awkward for arriving hour and half or so early. My room was very nice too. When I needed a document printed and updated Lydia kindly assisted and saved me a trip to a fedex store which would have caused me a little extra anxiety. Super people. Super service. 
Sincerely Joe

title: Great experience
text: Nice hotel in great location. Beautiful views, fantastic staff. Great housekeeping.  Very accommodating & clean. Awesome bakery-Librae- right next door. Great coffee, breads, pastry’s etc.. In walking distance to many sights and attraction's. I’m going to stay here again when I return to E Village.

title: Excellent service began at the front door
text: We stopped in the bar to check out the indoor mushroom farm. We were instantly greeted by Leonora Qosaj, the Food & Beverage manger. She gave us a ton of info on the mushroom farm, and even had the chef prepare a sample of their mushroom dish. She was delightful to speak with, and the service at the bar was phenomenal. I wish we had stayed here for our NY trip, but at least we will be better prepared for the next time.

title: Amazing location & staff!
text: Amazing location everything was near by! beautiful views as well. We asked for special accommodations for our stay..specifically a city view and a tub and received both promptly. Hotel staff was super kind and really thoughtful. Would stay here again 10/10.

title: Good value hotel in East Village
text: Really good value hotel in the East Village. We had a corner room which had nice views (albeit some dirty windows). Room size wasn't large (it's NYC) but adequate. Location is great, definitely a great property for the price - would definitely stay again.

title: Perfect weekend at The Standard East Village
text: Jan 26-29 was our first visit to The Standard East Village and it was extraordinary.  The room was very comfortable and arranged perfectly for 265sf. The bathroom, with a steam shower, was the perfect size and the bath towels were better than expected. The staff, from the front desk to housekeeping were upbeat, friendly and extremely accommodating.  The location was best for us, as we were visiting friends living in the East Village.  We did not take advantage of Crunch Gym or any food or drink on the premises.

title: Not good!
text: First we had no bathrobes in our room. Which was a suite. Ok I could have called to let them know, but it I was only staying one night so I let that go. The fragrance that they pump into the lobby and hallway is quite overwhelming. But once tyou are in yiur room yiu don't smell it. My husband was not feeling well, so he pulled a small Coke bottle from the mini bar. Took a sip looked down at the bottle and it read Class of 2021. We looked at the expiration date and it said 12/21. Are you kidding me you mean no one has drank a coke in almost 4 years. I stayed at The Standard BC (before Covid) and I loved it. But this will be the last time I stay here.

title: Great spot
text: Great hotel, with a nice bed and bathroom. I wish they had a smart TV, I hate cable. When you go there, have them bring the pour-over coffee set to your room. Great staff and free gym membership to crunch - so worth it. Nice restaurant inside the hotel

title: A staycation to remember
text: I loved my stay at the standard. From the moment I stepped out of my Uber the service was superb. I was always greeted with a pleasant smile. Check in was seamless and the room and views were breathtaking. This was the perfect staycation for us.

title: Superior staff at this comfortable hotel
text: I am in NYC fairly often and this was my first stay at The Standard-East Village. It is a great little hotel.  My standard queen room was airy and bright with large windows and a big bathroom by NYC standards.  The linens were high quality and the bed was comfy.  The highlight of this hotel was the friendly, helpful staff.  From the front desk to the adjoining cafe (which also serves great food), everyone was so hospitable and provided an experience akin to a more expensive hotel. Highly recommend a stay at The Standard-East Village!

title: Pretty good place to stay
text:
Overall, this was a pretty good place to stay. I travel to NYC for work a few times a year and this hotel was on par with most that I have stayed at. I was a little bummed that I didn't get a high room as I had called to request the day before. But I think that since they let me check in early, it totally made up for it. The weather was very blustery and it was downpouring - so I definitely didn't want to walk around for a few hours before check in. I didn't press the matter since I was soaked and cold. But, just an aside, not all rooms have the spectacular floor to ceiling windows with panoramic view as described. My 4th floor room had a sizable window that overlooked the back alley and fire escapes. It was, however, very quiet. I suppose I would choose comfort over aesthetics.

The room was fairly comfortable. I did have to stop by a department store and pick up a $10 pillow, but I do that at many hotels. The bed was a little lumpy, but fine. The shower was fine, though it lacked a shelf to put your toiletries. They provide their own toiletry line. But if you have facewash or a razor, etc., there is nowhere to put it other than the floor inside the shower. The mini fridge was packed to the gills with mini bar fare, but I was able to squeeze in my own drinks to keep them cool.

I didn't try the café or bar - there is food, coffee, convenience/department/grocery stores within a few blocks. The subway is really close too.

The staff that I interacted with were pleasant and professional. The door man or concierge would greet me on every coming and going. 

So all in all, it was a fine stay for someone who was only there for a few days and had been to NYC many many times.

title: Great staff, rooms and location!
text:
We stayed at the Standard East Village for our 25th Anniversary.

The staff really made our stay special - in fact, they were so nice, they upgraded our room to a suite! Very much appreciated! (I'm sure this doesn't happen so often)

They also assisted me in ordering Champagne, flowers and few food selections for my wife and I to celebrate our anniversary. All were in place when we first entered the room. Perfect!

The suite was well appointed, comfy King bed, nice bath and had a great view (even though it was raining).

Great location - near great restaurants, bars etc.

Will definitely return if we stay in NYC!!!

title: My New Go-To Spot for Future NYC Trips
text: The room was so clean, we had a great view, the cleaning staff was top notch (even organized my toiletries by the sink!), the bell staff were extremely kind and welcoming -- 5 stars all around. While visiting the dining outlet the second time, the staff wasn't nearly as attentive so we had to walk up to the bar to order -- we weren't in a hurry so it wasn't a big deal but definitely different from the day prior.

title: Mixed Feelings
text:
The Good: 
Clean Rooms
Centrally Located to our plans
The price points were better than I expected right before NYE. 
The drinks at both no bar and the cafe were superb.
Love the ambiance 

The Bad:
The staff (eek)
There is some serious tension at the front desk.
Checking in as well as a few passerby moments to ask questions — the staff couldn’t answer basic questions. Lots of miscommunication and lack of knowledge. 
Regardless, a particular staff member that had maybe a little more tenure/experience around the matters was very abrupt and rude to both the staff as well as myself and company. It left a horrible impression as a first time visitor to this establishment.

After said interactions I said to my partner I wouldn’t be surprised if the particular woman that got berated quit as a result. 

Very mixed emotions about our anniversary visit as nothing was done to rectify the situation.

title: A smart hote
text: It's a clean good looking hotel, quiet with friendly staff. I spent my wife 6 day in this smart hotel. Everything was fine, the room was in good condition, grace at the personnel who keep it in a very good condition. My wife and me are very satisfied.

title: Not great. Overpriced.
text: Hotel was not able to check me in until 5pm. So I sat in the lobby just waiting.  Staff was not accommodating and sometimes just rude. Housekeeping was subpar. I visit New York City frequently and this was not a great place. Overpriced.

title: new yorker going for drinks
text: The design is wonderful and elegant.  The help looked like they rolled out of bed.  The shirt was tied in a knot for the waitress to show her stomach with wild hair, over done make-up and not dressed appropriate for a bar.   The other waiter  was dressed in white and looked fine but didnt want to help anyone.

title: Won't be back
text:
Pros: Modern, clean, friendly staff, great location.
Cons: 
1. The "view" was a brick wall
2. The fragrance they pump in the building was so strong it gave me a headache. It was especially strong in the hallway it made my eyes water. I mean that level of fragrance is not healthy.
3. There was a utility closet next to our room that was being open and slammed shut at all hours of the night, waking us up as it sounded like someone was opening and slamming our door.

Because of these things, we won't be back.

title: Nightcap at Café Standard
text: Had a nice nightcap at Café Standard. Super great service from Unique. The atmosphere in the Cafe is chill and there’s a lot to take in and look at. It’s always essential to have a bar/cafe with such a a welcoming vibe on-site.

title: Great service, great stay
text:
Had a very short stay at The Standard East Village but it was great. The service is really top notch. Warm and genuine greetings, the experience manager gave us a few suggestions for things going on in the neighbourhood too. 

Love the food options and would have tried more if we had more time. One of their restaurants has been turned into a holiday theme called the Partridge and we took a peek in - tinsel everywhere! Very festive. Breakfast in the Standard Cafe was excellent and getting discount was a nice bonus too. 

The rooms are not big but also not to be expected in NYC. Very well appointed and the bed was extremely comfortable. We had stayed in another hotel earlier in our stay and this mattress and the pillows were much better!

title: Mixed
text: Awesome views from the room. Great cleaning staff. Cool vibe and decor. Awesome location. 2 stars off due to a poor experience. Kimberly at the front desk was incredibly cold and rude. Suggestion- if you aren't hospitable , maybe avoid working in the hospitality industry. Maybe the Standard should take a page from Citizen M and have the job replaced with computers.

title: Proper tres chic hotel and hospitality
text: No Bar is a proper hotel bar that has a fun welcoming international vibe. Great burger and cocktails and flattering lighting and warm mood. Party space upstairs is also great with sweeping city views.

title: Fun vibe
text: Excellent vibe. The drinks were amazing and will be back!! I went to No-Bar for a holiday party with some friends. The Dj was out standing . The bartenders Rocket, Guzo and Jgave amazing hospitality . The manager Fe was incredible . I highly recommend coming here for a drink !

title: Front desk staff totally rock - especially MATT
text:
This hotel is lovely. The people working at the front desk are soooo welcoming and warm! They greet you as soon as you walk in as if you are an old friend of theirs! Also, an extra loud shout out for MATT who really went above and beyond for us. He was leaving work for the weekend, but stopped to take the time to help us locate our Uber (which ended up being around the corner and pretty far down the block)! 
The hotel room was clean and quiet. We stayed on the 15th floor and had a beautiful view!

title: It’s the people who set the Standards
text: Really comfy bed, great bar,  great front of house staff, very kind and lovely room service staff. Shout out to Mat who looked after our luggage on the last day and ordered us a cab to the airport. The guest services team made for a great home-from-home in the city. See you again!

title: LOVE!
text: So amazing!!!! The cafe is always the best and has the sweetest staff! Perfect for a nightcap if you’re staying at the hotel or just wanna pop in for a cocktail. Great drinks, ambience, music, and service! Ask for Madeline, Hunter, or FeeFee!! Will 100% be back.

title: The Standard Cafe
text: We went to the cafe with friends before a show and the service was spectacular! The drinks and food were so yummy and fairly priced! Thanks to our server Madeline she was such a breath of fresh air. As well as the rest of the staff Quara and Feefee for the lovely service!

title: Friendly, engaging, fun vibe.
text: Love The Standard.  Such a friendly, engaging, fun vibe.  The staff strikes that delicate balance of professional and personal.  I get the sense that the genuinely want me to enjoy my stay.  And, they seem to really enjoy working at the hotel.  The rooms are comfortable, clean, and have a splash of fun and surprise.  The cafe provides that needed place to hang and have a coffee (or cocktail) while the others are sleeping.  Looking forward to our next visit.

title: AMAZING STAFF!
text: Madeline, Hunter, and Fee Fee were so incredible! The fries that we ordered were hot and delicious. The drink selection was wonderful as well. The hospitality from the staff alone will make me come back!

title: Standard Café - Excellent Service & Atmosphere :)
text: My friends and I ate in the Standard Café this evening, and we had a lovely experience. The food and drinks were terrific, and the ambiance of the café made them taste even better. Our servers, Hunter and Madeline, provided terrific service throughout our meal. I will definitely be dining here again!

title: Bad communication
text: Made a reservation for a room from 8am-6pm but when I got there they said that day use rooms weren’t available. So I waited a few hours for the next available thing falling asleep in the lobby and I get asked if I’m still waiting for a room. I never got a confirmation I never got an email receipt no one told me what time check out was. I had an early flight in the morning and I just assumed I could check out in the morning. I went out that night and when I came back the room was locked apparently I was supposed to check out that same evening. I couldn’t afford to book another stay so I had to take my stuff and be in the street at like 2am with a 5:30 flight. Apparently the late fee was just as much as another stay I got charged $499. I called to see if I could refute this and I got attitude. Room was nice and clean tho.

title: No Bar magic!
text:
The NO BAR was lit 🔥 in every way. Thanks to our bartender Gustavo, he was immediately engaging and had the “one on one” relatability, and that’s why I can’t wait to visit again. Everyone was friendly. I had a brief scare and couldn’t locate my bag, and the entire team helped me search. All long my friend had it, but it was the quick response and attention from everyone, that I noticed and will remember. 
Thank-you Standard!! 

Xox Nadine

title: An amazing time
text: I came to No-Bar for a birthday celebration. Gustavo made some great off the cuff shots for us that were great! I’m a member at The Standard Miami so I’m familiar with the brand . J and Jack made us drinks as well.. the manager Fe came over and took photos and helped our celebration by elevating our experience. I’m checking for room availability so I can just stay the night! I love it

title: Excellent service
text:
I was in town for the holiday and came to the standard for a quick martini before my meal.
Mateo was the sweetest and most personable server ever. We ended up talking and he was so chill. It was a great pregame before my dinner! Service was efficient and i could feel the care put into every sip:)

title: Pleasant stay but didn't hold up to the price.
text:
My stay overall was nice! 
PROS: • Cafe—posted up here and did some work with a wonderful lunch and service. • Room was well-designed and two of the walls were floor-to-ceiling windows! • Anything I called the front desk for, it was up very quickly. • I left my sun glasses behind and they were very quick to mail them to me. • Stand-alone tub was very cool in the bathroom! • Location! Easy walk to Soho, East Village, LES :)

CONS: • The front desk was a bit unorganized and cold upon arrival. I'd say, made me feel the opposite of welcome • I found one of those single use teeth flossers (used) when I pulled back the covers of the bed—needless to say I questioned the cleanliness afterward. • The lights above the bed were pulled out of the wall, exposing the wires • There was strange, loose tiles when stepping out of the tub • Rotten smell coming from toilet (upon arrival)

Overall, it was a pleasant two night stay, but I wouldn't pay $400+/night again for the experience I had unfortunately.

title: Great stay!!
text: Amazing staff! Great location! Clean, comfortable and we had a spectacular view!! We were in NYC to loom at colleges and The Standard was in the right location for what we needed. We arrived before check in time so they happily held our bags and other stuff while we roamed the city. They gave us great ideas where to go and things to do. Would absolutely stay again.

title: Awesome Location/Great Staff
text: The Standard was perfect for a weekend stay in the city. Blending into it's east village surroundings, the hotel is low key and eccentric but clean and comfortable. Also, the   staff was amazing and really made the stay worth it.  Would definitely stay here every time.

title: The Standard East Village and Anahis
text:
This review is long overdue, and I can't emphasize enough what a fabulous experience I had at The Standard East Village. However, I must say that it was Anahis who truly made this stay one of the best for me. Let me share the story:

This trip was a last-minute weekend girls' getaway to celebrate my birthday. Unfortunately, one of my friends had her flight canceled, and her absence cast a shadow over our early morning mood when we arrived. We got to the hotel super early, and that's when Anahis stepped in. She kindly showed us a place where we could freshen up and change, considering our room wouldn't be ready for a while.

After about an hour, to our surprise, we were informed that our room was ready ahead of schedule. Upon entering, we found a delightful surprise—a bottle of champagne and a fruit tray, all to celebrate my birthday and wish us a great time despite missing one friend from our group. Anahis didn't stop there; she recommended a fantastic restaurant and the club attached to The Standard. She even managed to secure a reservation for us, which we thought would be impossible.

Throughout our stay, every member of the staff treated us like old friends. The hotel itself was stunning, and its location was perfect for all the local places we wanted to explore. Despite the absence of our friend, Anahis went above and beyond to ensure that our 72-hour trip became a cherished memory I'll always carry with me.

I'm truly grateful for The Standard East Village, Anahis, and their entire staff for making this experience so special. I wholeheartedly recommend staying here—it's an unforgettable experience.

title: Very Very disappointing
text:
The air-conditioning makes a horrible noise, we have a corner room, our toilet was blocked, we explained to reception that it was impossible to sleep, we were offered another room (the same but a few floors down) the noise is the same it's deafening, even with earplugs the noise is very very loud ... the person at reception says he can not do anything more, there is no solution when we had already stayed several times at the standard and we had not had this problem.
No one takes your comments seriously, you're left with your problem and no solution...given the price of the rooms, it's surreal.
People are very nice but unfortunately incompetent, our keys didn't work and we had to have them redone 3 times before they finally worked!
In short, this hotel is no longer a pleasant place to stay in New York, and that's a real shame, because the location is top-notch.

title: Small and filthy room
text: The regular room I get for $580 per night is as big as a regular walk-in closet in a house. It will give anyone a claustrophobic feeling. The worse thing is that the room is not clean. There are hair all over on the floor, stains on the carpet, and smudges on light switches. My bathroom smelled like a sewer. It makes you feel you can’t touch anything or even stay in the room because it’s filthy and smelly. I will never come back to this hotel again.

title: Standard without the actual standard items
text: The rooms are small but comfortable. Not all rooms have a view of the city. What is missing is an iron and a small coffee maker that is standard (no put intended) with most other hotels. The minibar had items that expired month ago, so that needs attention. The room felt dark because there are only small lamps in the room and not a main light which would really help for work.  I would not stay there again simply because of the price vs the quality.

title: Gorgeous Hotel + Great Service
text: I had a fantastic experience at The Standard. The hotel is gorgeous, especially the views from my room, and location is amazing. Lydia and Shayone helped me check in and get into a new room when my sister unexpectedly joined me. They were both very helpful and lovely to work with — made my trip so much more enjoyable. Don’t miss the bakery next door!

title: 10/10 Dayuse stay at the Standard, East Village
text: Our best friends just got married at city hall and we needed a room to drop our things and just relax before hopping around NYC restaurants and bars for the day. Getting this hotel was perfect and completely elevated the beautiful day! MUST note that Khori was the BEST. We’ve never been welcomed with such great hospitality in any other hotel we’ve been to. She went above and beyond to ensure the several hours there were worth every penny and beyond. Thank you Khori! You truly made our stay from the minute we walked in! Definitely coming back!

title: Great location, but grubby with abysmal service
text:
The only positive is the location. Otherwise, I wouldn’t stay here again. Apart from the person that checked me in initially, every other front desk staff member was rude, impatient and condescending (excluding housekeeping and porters as they were always friendly when you ran into them). 

The room stank, of mould and something else I wasn’t able to identify. There was a stain on the carpet by the bed, that could only be described as the bodily fluids of a previous guest. Given there is a 450USD incidental hold placed on your card at the start, you'd think that the guest that left this stain would have been charged for a carpet steam or similar to have this removed. The air con was malfunctioning and every time I turned it off, it came back on and it was very loud which made it tricky to sleep. 

I did ask for coffee in the room on check in, to then be sent a clunky coffee drip that wasn’t clean and impractical to use and was told if I wanted milk to buy a coffee from the bar. No tea available either. For a supposed 5* hotel, I would expect tea / coffee in the room as a basic amenity. I'm fortunate to be very well traveled and this is the first time I've ever stayed in a hotel that didn't provide this. It was also removed from my room after the first night, so I guess you have to ask for it daily. Given most visitors to New York don’t spend that much time in their room, a more practical option would also be better rather than attempting to be trendy.

There was a robe but no slippers, and given how filthy the carpet was, they would have been welcomed as I spent the entire time in my shoes not wanting to touch the floor. 
The sheets and towels were very clean to be fair. But the room in principle was grotty and I didn’t want to touch any surface. 

The lights were very dim and only went to a certain brightness, along with all of the hallways, lifts and communal areas being very dark…most likely hiding the grottiness of the hotel. If you are partially sighted, I wouldn't recommend this hotel as I have a few friends and family members who are, who would have really struggled with the lack of light. 

My door was also left open one day when I got back for the day, which I could see from the end of the hall, and when I mentioned it to the person on the desk, her response was ‘I’ll tell housekeeping to be more careful’ and she carried on with what she was doing. No apology, no asking if all of my belongings were still there…and I’d even said it in a friendly manner, as I deliberately didn’t want to sound difficult despite how shaken I was. As a solo female traveler, this made me very on edge and felt very unsafe for the remainder of my stay. Particularly as later that night there was a lot of commotion in the hallway with someone screaming and other unsettling noises in the early hours of the morning. 

There was a wedding on one of the days I stayed and there wasn’t a lift dedicated for hotel guests and one for events, instead it was a free for all and I had to queue over 20 minutes to get a lift to my room (16th floor or I’d have taken the stairs). Quite frustrating as I was on a time crunch to get ready for the evening for a show. 

When I checked out, the person on reception simply took my card and said goodbye. Didn’t ask how my trip was, didn’t smile, didn’t explain about the hold on my card and she just walked back into the office. The comments on other reviews about staff not being on the desk is also true, many of the times I would pass through there was nobody there. I've stayed in a few hotels in New York and this is the first time I've received such appalling service, every other experience I've had has been true 5*. I paid circa 500USD a night, which for what I received, was abysmal. 

I personally wish I read the reviews here before booking. This isn’t a 5* hotel by any stretch, it’s a 3 at a push. All of the reviews I’ve since read are very believable based on my experience. Overpriced, terrible service and filthy.

title: Glitz over substance
text: This is a very expensive and uppity hotel that doesn’t really live up to the reputation.  Upon arrival it was your rooms available but pay $75 to check in. At $500 a night, let me check in.  No lobbby to really relax in.  There seemed to be a lounge but it was empty.  Kroon was well out together but super small and the tub /shower challenges my shorter wife.  Bed is literally on the floor.  Went for a wedding.  Staff was five star and was service.  For a wedding I would give a 5 review.  Most of the wedding stayed at the haven sport

title: Great neighborhood, but would not choose again
text:
The location is fantastic and the hotel looks great, with a super fashionable lobby and fun-looking outdoor and bar spaces. Checked in very late on Monday night (2am) and the room was fine (3rd floor).  Went straight to bed but the street noise was extremely loud and was woken up multiple times.  I thought it was just NY and the low floor, but I didn't realize until the next morning that a high transom window was open. I couldn't reach it even standing on the desk (!) so left a note for housekeeping to close the next morning. There was a huge long desk to work at but could not find any outlets anywhere without crawling under the desk. TV is basic and doesn't offer apps like Netflix/HBO/Amazon.  There's a minibar but no in-room coffee or tea. Overall the room was fine - but not great.

But the kicker was the second night, my colleague and I came back from dinner at 10pm and there was no option to get a nightcap. The bar looked super fun and there were probably 30 people there but we had just missed last call and no exception for hotel guests. I have since looked at the website and it does show that there are no options for food or drinks after 10pm on Mon-Tues. I guess that's fair and I could have done my homework but I was surprised that a hip hotel like The Standard would not have more options for guests, especially in NYC and in this neighborhood which was definitely hopping on a Tuesday night. Both the server in the bar and the front desk staff were completely indifferent and were not helpful in suggesting a nearby option. 

Oh and then when we returned an hour later after finding our own nightcap nearby, we ran into a couple by the elevator who recognized us from our earlier attempt to get a drink and they let us know that the bartender kept serving them after we left. so maybe they just didn't want to serve a couple of middle-aged ladies after 10pm.

I just felt underwhelmed by the whole experience.  It's a luxury-priced hotel but the service and amenities doesn't match. No gym or fitness center (but apparently you can use a nearby Crunch), no coffee in the lobby or rooms (I see from another review that apparently you can request a machine?), wifi was spotty but they will sell you a "premium" option for $19.95.  Just overall not worth the price in a city with such a huge range of hotel options.

title: Good location but lacking basic amenities even at an almost $700 daily rate. Front office Staff is not helpful
text: Location is great. The views from high floor rooms are good but lower floor rooms don’t have that. Concerns are no lobby space for seating. No coffee service in the room. The bellman needs to be requested but there is no one at the entrance to greet you or offer help with luggage. The thermostat cannot be regulated for temperature and fan separately. They sent a tired old drip coffee maker through housekeeping with coffee in a canister minus scoops, creamer or stirrer. For a four star hotel priced at almost $700 that is unacceptable

title: Simply Phenomenal
text: Wonderfully accommodating and super-friendly staff. Whenever we needed something: they were on it lightning-quick, which hasn't been our experience at other NYC hotels. Loved No Bar and access to Crunch right across the street. And the view from our room...was priceless. Thank you, Standard East Village!

title: Thank you!
text: Since the moment we walked in, everyone was so nice and accommodating. The rooms were larger than your average NYC room and the hotel was situated in a more quiet pocket while still being very accessible and close to all the fun. I can’t believe I didn’t ask for his name, but there was a young man at the front desk who helped us with everything we needed during our stay and was very pleasant. However, all the staff was truly very kind and accommodating. We loved it, thank you!

title: Massive Disappointment for a “5 Star” Hotel
text: Old and tired rooms with poor furniture layout and broken bathroom features.  Screwed up breakfast three days in a row.  (Didn’t bother to bring silverware on day 3!) Private event vendor’s staff allowed to use guest elevators for loading/unloading during peak evening time, making a trip to the lobby approx. 20 minutes long.  There is no gym or fitness center on site.  Only in NYC would this hotel be considered 5 stars.  Its in 3 star shape and has been reduced to freeriding off The Standard’s brand.  (If it was called anything else, you would never bother to stay here.) Steer clear until ownership cleans house and remodels.

title: The Standard
text:
They advertise allergy free rooms but
“ ran out” of foam pillows and bedding. These reservations were made well in advance and I even checked in the day before and reminded them. We had to find another hotel at 9pm. We were only in the room 10 minutes but were charged for four waters and and a Diet Coke from the minibar…which we did not use. The manager was friendly and professional but the front desk person was not.

title: Super séjour vue imprenable
text:
Service impeccable lit très confortable salle de bain dingue vue sur la Sky Line frigo très bien approvisionné bar super !!!
Séjour de 6 nuits dans cet incroyable hôtel proche de Greenwich Village et de tous les transports! Calme et agréable !

title: Friday in New York
text: I had a room at the 15th floor with an amazing view. The hotel has a great location and is located conveniently close to many good places to go out to dine and experience the city. The cafe served nice drinks in the evening and a good breakfast in the morning. Staff was also friendly and helpful. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Bad Service, Disgusting Food, Mildewy Room
text: This hotel tries to be hip like the W but fails miserably.  The complete lack of service oriented employees confirms that management doesn't understand the hospitality business.  The incompetence begins at the front desk.  You usually have to stand there quite awhile until someone shows up.  Upon checking out I chose the email option and confirmed my email address.  No folio from my stay but plenty of "The Standard" spam email.  The service in the cafe was even worse.  I usually head out for dinner but arrived late as I had to drive into Manhattan.  I went into the cafe and sat at the center of the bar.  There were a few table of people and 3-4 others at the bar.  After an eternity of no service, the bartender was chit/chatting with 3 servers at the end, I stood up walked to the end and grabbed a menu myself.  I expected them to then start doing their jobs but no, I had plenty of time to determine my entire meal selection.  The flatbread was mediocre and I don't think the chef knows what "flatbread" means.  The Croque Monsieur was disgusting with cold sauce.  My room had a bathtub in the shower stall.  Some "hip" designer probably thought that was extra cool but it makes the shower floor impossible to clean and dry properly, making the room have a strong mildew smell.

title: Just a perfect stay!
text: I would happily recommend The Standard to anyone. The service was spot on in every department. The food was quality in the restaurant and in the room. The bed was super comfortable but my favorite part was the full sized bathtub. After thousands of New York steps it was a real treat to soak in the tub. I can't wait to do it all again!

title: Wish I’d read more of the reviews!
text:
Having stayed at The Standard in London, had high hopes about my stay in NYC. I wish I’d read the other poor reviews, as I was in for a shock.

I asked when booking for a quiet room away from the elevator. When I arrived at the front desk and checked in, the lady on the front desk disappeared for a few mins and came back with a big grin telling me she’d found me a special room. 

Only when I got up to the sixth floor did I find out it was exactly opposite the elevator. And when I got in the room, I realised how paper thin the walls are at this hotel, and that not only could I hear it every time to doors to the elevator opened, but I could also hear conversations of the people in the adjoining room and the footsteps and furniture scrapping in the room above. The very noisy air con mentioned in other reviews sounds like it’s in serious need of a service. At least it distracts from the continuous noise of the elevator and doors to the other rooms slamming. 

Unfortunately there was little sympathy from the front desk team when I went down to chat to them. I offered to upgrade and pay the difference, but they said the only other rooms  available were in that same room opposite the elevator on higher floors. A guy from the office came out, shrugged and said the hotel isn’t for everyone. So I booked into the Ludlow instead, which is different class in terms of soundproofing, size of room and decor and the service level of the team. It’s not that more expensive, so I wish I’d booked there initially instead.

Trying to see if I could get my money back for that first night’s stay I didn’t use, it then took three days for someone from The Standard to finally call me back, having called once a day to try and get hold of a manager to chat to (one wasn’t at the hotel when I had checked in initially on a Monday afternoon). When Kimberly finally called back she at least acknowledged they should have mentioned the noise issues when I booked, but said they didn’t think a refund was appropriate. Kimberly said I could come in and speak to their Guest Experience Manager, but sadly when I did later that afternoon it turned out to be Matt, the person I’d spoken to on the first day. His refrain is the hotel isn’t for everyone and there’s nothing they can do about the penalty for late cancellation, even where the room isn’t fit for purpose. When I asked whether there was anyone else I could speak to who would have more discretion to find a reasonable outcome, he threatened to call security and I promptly left. 

Whilst there’s not much they can do about the soundproofing at this stage and they’re unlikely to upgrade their air con, a shame their service level is so poor and adversarial. That seems to be a running theme in other of the reviews. Not sure if it’s poor training or an attitude higher up at the hotel, Looking through their responses to other posts, I see the customer is rarely right if the feedback isn’t positive. 

Hope they read some of these reviews with an open mind and see how they can improve their customer service and be more upfront about their soundproofing issues. I won’t be coming back to find out!

title: Great location and service!
text: The hotel is very well located, in a very nice are with no noice during the night.  The staff was super friendly and helpful. The hotel does't have a gym inside the building but they provided us passes to a great one right in front.

title: Warm, personable staff + great location!
text:
The Standard East Village was wonderful.  The property is very well situated for the subway, shopping, and site seeing. Perfect location.
I feel like the downstairs bars and restaurants were well designed. Rooms were well appointed. Only comment is that the hallways seemed dated and need an update.  
The staff was wonderful and warm. Matt, in particular, was always ready with a fresh water and offers to help. He was great.  I will absolutely stay here again.

title: Friendly Staff!
text:
Lydia and everyone at The Standard is so friendly and accommodating. This was my second stay, and it didn't disappoint. I'm already looking forward to being their guest again in October!
Happy to have found an NYC Home Base.

title: GREAT STAY!
text: What a GREAT place! Highly recommended by friends in NYC in conjunction with my event on the Lower East Side. I can't recall experiencing a more energetic, efficient and friendly staff.  Every employee I dealt with from the bell boy, front desk to housekeeping and cafe were amazing! extremely comfortable bed  and bedding and the salad I ordered in the lovely little outdoor cafe was excellent as was my server! Thank you all for a woderful stay!

title: Good Hotel
text: Overall we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is very clean and has a cool laid back atmosphere. The hotel is also conveniently located in the East Village near the subway and there are several great restaurants nearby. However, there were issues with the AC and the pillows were too flat.

title: Swindled a bit
text: The room was decent.  Smaller that expected even after the upgrade.  Asked for late checkout (3 PM) and was charged $140 plus fees for that.  Then, got interrupted 3 times between 1230 (free late checkout) and 3 pm.  Was also told about a “black car service” that the hotel could arrange for us to go to the airport.  They said they would call and set it up for us at the rate of $95.  When the car showed up it was a freshly spray painted and heavily damaged black Nissan with a Lyft sticker on the window.  Lyft was $45-$50 for the same trip.  Also, the ac barely worked.  Getting to the airport the driver said they only take cash for the worst valued ride in America.  If I use a card it’s 10% charge.  I was fine with the hotel right up to the end and then felt very deceived.

title: The standard in East village rules!
text: Wow! What an amazing stay. First time to East Village, the Standard team was best i have ever encountered. The front desk was super helpful made us feel like we were regulars!  King corner room was over the top- with 16th floor views, super comfy bed and cool bathroom to boot.  The cafe for breakfast was also a treat - eating outside, yummy omelets and coffee. Neighborhood vibe was wonderful- great places to eat and try new things. Easy walk to multiple subway stations too. We’ll be back!!!

title: Gorgeous Gorgeous GORGEOUS
text: Spent a night at The Standard, East Village having already experienced their other location in Chelsea and it exceeded my expectations. Our Front Office Agent, Nia, was incredibly hospitable from the start and gave us a corner king on the 19th floor that had the LITERALLY the most amazing views of the city. Café Standard grows their own oyster mushrooms and like served it with this rosemary oil--OMG would like literally go back just to order them. Don't even get me started with their hallway of private bathrooms below the lobby that was probably one of the nicest and cleanly singleton bathroom setups I've seen. Overall, The Standard East Village is gunna be my go-to when visiting NYC and I highly recommend it to all. <3

title: A true gem!
text: A beautifully unique hotel in a great location. Our junior suite room was clean, roomy and had a spectacular view. Comfortable bed, amazing bathroom. Very friendly staff - each and every one smiling and happy. Lots of restaurant and shopping choices. We will be back!

title: Fantastic staff and location
text: Fantastic Experience!  Location is great.  Cafe has very nice happy hour.  Staff is exceptional from the front door to the desk to the bartender at the cafe - all wonderful!  The east village has great food and easy subway stops to all places in Manhattan.

title: Great neighborhood, fun hotel, good price.
text:
My wife and I left the city in 2002 to start a family but stay in a hotel many weekends per year.  Last month we stayed at the Standard East Village. 

It’s a hip and clean hotel with comfortable beds and a fun bar.  One avenue over is exciting first avenue with tons of amazing bars and restaurants.  Highly recommended!

title: So much potential but...Meh
text:
I spend a decent amount of time in the neighborhood so I have stayed here many times. As a frequent guest I was disjointed when  I was told it would be an extra $75 for a 1:30 checkout...on a Wednesday when the hotel was nowhere near full.

Also, there are 3 elevators. 1 for staff and freight and the other 2 for staff, freight and guests if they can fit...It's a joke how long you need to wait and how often the elevator stops on a floor only to see cleaning staff with a cart apologizing for stopping you. I'll stick to the Hyatt Union Square going forward.

title: A lovely time at The Standard East Village
text:
We have found our NYC home! Great staff, comfy beds, decent sized rooms.  Food and beverage is excellent and location is ideal to visiting East Village and surroundings.
Rooms are quiet with great views of the city.  Bottled water provided daily and plenty of space to work at the room desk or in the cafe and garden areas.

title: Great spot great price
text:
Great place and great price!
Great service! Everyone working really wanted to make sure we had a great time! Comfy beds. Amazing shower. Very walkable location. Khori really helped us out and let us store our tuxes for the wedding we went to. Also great bar in the hotel

title: Just an Ok stay!
text:
This was a return trip & my last stay here was fabulous so I decided to stay again. However, it was not the same. I had gotten emails that the room had been refreshed & was excited to see them. Unfortunately, my room was not  or did not seem refreshed! It was a small dark room on the 3rd floor overlooking what looked like trash & old used kitchen equipment. The door to the room was hard to get in & out of the room, clearly a messed up lock.
I had asked for a high room upon check-in but they could not offer me one as all the rooms had been booked for other guests. I assume it was  because I found the cheaper rate on Expedia & did not book thru the hotel directly which I usually do. Front desk clerks were not nearly as friendly as before so that's part of it too. Good help is hard to find I guess. I did not use the Crunch gym day pass either which is part of the extra fee you get charged. Their guest experience guy sends you emails & checks in with you in advance of your stay...which makes you feel very welcomed unfortunately he is not at the front desk!
They did offer free bottles of water & that was a bonus since it was SO hot in NYC. Not sure if I will stay here next time even though is it very close to my daughters apartment.

title: Not worth it
text: I stayed for one night and forgot a pair of shoes and a new bottle of wine after checking out, when I returned a few hours later after noticing they were missing I was told neither was found in my room. I reached out to them regarding the issue and never heard back leading me to believe my items were stolen. Keep in mind you will also be charged a $35 facility fee even if you don't utilize them, would not recommend them, and will never return.

title: Friendly NYC Staff
text: The hotel is conveniently located near restaurants, bars and the subway.  You can walk to Greenwich Village, NYU, and more if you like to explore on foot.  The downstairs restaurant/bar is a great starting off point, whether in the morning for breakfast or as a pre-dinner cocktail spot.  Most of all, I appreciated coming back after a full day to made beds, fresh towels, bottled water and a clean room.

title: The Truth About The Standard - East Village
text:
Was there for a music video shoot. Matt, you are amazing. Hooked me up with an amazing corner room (1509). Anika and Jim absolutely hooked me up with a great terrace spot on the 21st floor on 4th of July for the shoot. Couldn't have done it without them. Dijon upstairs, the best. Cory and Jen at the front desk always greeted me with a smile (and water!) -

The room was great, the bathroom awesome, never had to wait for an elevator.  I've always had a great time at The Standard, but this was my first time at THIS location and I will never go anywhere else.

Oh, and the bakery next door has an INSANE pesto/pistachio croissant that cannot be missed.

You guys rocked my world. Thank you for taking good care of me!

title: Broken Air Conditioning - Poorly Maintained Rooms
text: I spent a staycation for one night in July. We have a baby so we wanted to sleep in and enjoy it. Well the air conditioner broke in the middle of the night and the room got so hot we woke up at 6am. I called the front desk and asked for help. They told me there were no other rooms (doubtful) the manager also wasn't sorry at all and had no solutions. She also said the air conditioner might just be off. She sent the engineer who confirmed the fan was broken and the unit needed to be taken out. When I called back the front desk told me the engineer said it should cool down soon, but I told her no the engineer said the fan was broken and the person at the front desk admitted he did say that. I could no longer get a hold of the manager. They told me they would refund me the $30 facility fee. To me it was a waste of a night at a hotel. It was almost 80 degrees in our room in July. The room in general was not maintained. There was only one robe, which had makeup stains on it. The pillow case had tears and holes in it. We found someone's birth control on the floor so I'm assuming the room wasn't cleaned that well either. Then when we went to pick up our bags after they held them there was a long line. They couldn't find one woman's bag who was trying to get to the airport. It was clear this place was poorly managed. For the price, I won't go back to the Standard. There's so many other hotels at this price point.

title: dark hotel,  basic rooms, disappointing customer service but  a good area
text: very small room with noisy air conditioning  we had 2 problems with the room that needed engineers     the mandatory $30 per room per day for water, wifi and gym access was not expected and we didn't get the water     no customer service  dark areas - halls, lifts   good location

title: Wonderful experience, beautiful hotel & the staff are the best!
text:
I cannot recommend this hotel enough!!! My experience was flawless. No task was too big or small. The front desk team were so genuine and helpful. 
The beds were so comfortable, clean and great value. The location was ideal for exploring. 
I would highly recommend booking for your stay, great value. 
Ill be back, see you guys in August.

title: Setting the Standard
text: The Staff at the hotel are amazing. I was brought to the standard east village through a series of unfortunate flight delays, and the team really made sure that I was taken care of a comfortable. The rooms are chic and clean, and the beds are some of the most comfortable in the city. Khori and the front desk team are amazing at what they do, and really made me feel welcomed and valued. 10/10 recommend the Standard East Village, if you're traveling or  just happen to need a hotel in the city, this is the perfect place to be.

title: Amazing all around
text: I was on the 17th floor - and while the room is on the small side, it had the most iconic views! Totally comfortable size and the best minibar options than I’ve seen in ages! Great bath products also! The soundproofing isn’t the best - but it’s not terrible!

title: Wonderful welcome from staff.
text: Enjoyed our time at The Standard. Lydia's welcome when we phoned in a question and also when we checked in was the most genuine, heartfelt welcome ever received at a hotel. We enjoyed her warmth and the view from our room. Pleasant New York place to stay.

title: Very Standard Stay
text: We love the location - East Village. The room was very standard for the price we paid with no special touches. We loved our breakfast spot in the restaurant - brunch is highly recommended with great staff. The London location was a lot more memorable in my opinion.

title: Excellent location and service!
text: We really love this location and the staff at the Standard East Village is so friendly and helpful. We upgraded to a Downtown Studio and while it was small, it had everything we needed and a fantastic corner view! Great bathroom and mini bar too! Rooms are nice and quiet which is a real plus. Thanks again, we will be back!

title: Great location!
text: This hotel was great!  The location in the East Village was at the heart of everything--tons of coffee shops, dining and shopping were easy walking distance.  The room was small, but one of the bigger ones available in NYC.  We got a corner room and it was worth it for the light and the view.  There were tasty treats in the minibar and the bed was comfy.  The people at the desk were nice and helpful and even helped us resolve a Travelocity reservation problem (we accidentally made two reservations and they allowed us to cancel one with no penalties).  The hotel had a good room service menu and on-site dining options.  It's kind of a "hip" hotel, but we're 60 and did not feel out of place.  We would happily stay here again.

title: A great place to stay in nyc
text:
This hotel was clean, friendly, in a great area and had a great bar. 
The bed was super comfortable with great light in the room! I was so happy with it! 
It’s in a cool laid back part of the city and very well located!

title: Good, but fix the TV
text: Much to like about this hotel, mainly location and room size. But not only do they do that infuriating thing of locking the TV down so the remote does nothing apart from flip between fuzzy “local” channels, they actually have an entire Apple TV box strapped to the back of it that you can select in AirPlay when on hotel Wifi but there is *no way of using at all*, as confirmed by the front desk. Which feels like a pretty elaborate form of gaslighting.

title: The staff is lovely
text: Well-run hotel. `The staff is lovely - a shoutout to Khory at the front desk - she was wonderful - she took care of all my needs and was extremely courteous and thoughtful. Room was cleaned promptly and appointed with sufficient supplies.

title: Follow up to noisy review
text: So following up to my earlier review, we asked to be moved away from the thoughtless noisy neighbors and it was done seemlessly.  Quiet room and party that went till 3 on Friday night might have been confined to the weekend

title: The ultimate rip-off!
text: If you are looking to experience the ultimate ripoff, look no further and check into The Standard East Village. This Hotel wins first prize for the worst price/quality relationship hands down! …and stay clear of the impertinent front desk staff, unless you enjoy being insulted. Only redeeming factor, the views, if you are lucky enough to get an upper floor room. Too bad the rooms are too small to fit a chair to enjoy them.

title: Wonderful Way to Experience the East Village
text: Hip, modern, comfortable, and clean hotel ideally situated in the East Village with easy access to other parts of Manhattan.  Helpful, friendly staff exude a relaxed, calming vibe.  Front Office Supervisor Khori is the absolute best!

title: Location, Staff, Attention to Detail
text: Returned to the Standard after three years and had a wonderful experience. The front desk staff reached out ahead of time, remembered me from my email, offered a room upgrade, and when I called about one of the lamps in the room (which was working!) I came back the next day to find that all the lamps had been replaced. The warmth from the staff is what made the experience special. Looking forward to being back here for the next NYC work trip.

title: Warm and welcoming
text: Staff are kind and attentive and make you feel at home, which is a big deal in NYC.  I was on the 16th floor and had great views of downtown.  The hotel is clean, but the biggest plus is the hospitality.

title: Love me some Standard East Village!!!
text: Lovely hotel in the East Village, my old stomping grounds...my goodness, how it's changed around here… Still very cool neighborhood. Really charming old-school lobby with modern hotel attached. Nice little café with enclosed "outdoor" area... delicious food (try the house grown mushroom terrine!) and drinks. From booking over the phone with Met, to the moment I was greeted at the door by Shavone, checked in by Khori, Emily, and Danielle, to the excellent service at the cafe with Tai, Collette, Natalie & Alexis, the free bike rental with Obi, and check out with Kimberly & Nia, and my encounter with the lovely Director of Housekeeping, Zoryana, my experience was 100% five stars!  Josh, the GEM, made the stay that much more special by sending me a nice little bottle of wine to greet me in my room and making me feel so welcome, I feel like part of the family!  I will definitely be coming to stay here again & again! Thank you Standard East Village team… You're all amazing!

title: Great location and amazing staff
text: I do not think we got the right room (booked a corner King and it was not a King bed and the windows were not floor to ceiling) but that didn't stop us from falling in love with the location (steps to EVERYTHING including the fabulous McSorley's just around the corner) and the people that worked there were all very friendly.  You can feel a very inclusive atmosphere there and the perk is their cafe along with a vibrant nighttime bar as well.  Would definitely return here.

title: Pleasant surprise!!
text: Rare to find a NYC property that checks all the boxes but The Standard does. Friendly staff that actually answers the phone. Fine location and vibe and nice room views for sure. We received a room upgrade without requesting and though efficient in size, we did not want for a thing with great amenities and housekeeping. Josh at the front desk was welcoming beyond works and genuinely gets hospitality. Thank you!

title: The Standard is way above standard!
text: We love this hotel. Josh the experience manager is fantastic and took great care of us. Nicole, Colette and James provided exceptional service for our breakfast. All of the staff are great… without exception. This is our second time here in the last six months and we will definitely be back. Our dog Sandy liked it here even more than us! We highly recommend this hotel.

title: A welcoming experience
text:
KINDNESS, is the word to describe my feeling at the Standard. The staff welcomed my parents to NY for the holiday. They made my family comfortable by first attentively welcoming us with a smile and warmth. Any questions I had, they were clearly answered. Offering my father an umbrella on the rainy day was so sweet. I got to enjoy the CRUNCH gym day pass provided and enjoyed that. The fresh juices are so refreshing. They very much enjoyed themselves and that makes me happy. 

Thank-you for providing the perfect stay for my family. 

Much Gratitude.

title: Our best stay in Manhattan!
text: I stayed at the Standard East Village just for one night but I had the best experience! Khori from the front desk was the best as they welcomed us very well and even celebrated my PhD acceptance with the cutest treat. It was a very pleasant surprise and a nice touch to our stay. If you are looking for a pleasant stay in the city - I highly recommend the Standard at East Village! Thank you Khori and the team! :)

title: Great birthday!
text: Amazing staff and experience! Close to everything and if you don’t wanna leave your room the bar downstairs has a great vibe  and great drinks! I brought my puppy and they provided a bed and bowls too!

title: A great weekend stay!
text:
A weekend getaway with friends. We really enjoyed our stay! The hotel is well located, and the studio suite was well appointed.  The whole team was wonderful and helpful. Good vibes all around. 

Special shout out to Corey who went out of their way to make our stay easier! Thank you!

title: Great stay in the east village Standard Hotel
text: Great room, pillows and bedding comfortable, fabulous views, speedy service, great support, punctual cleaning, everything: just right! Restaurant food is VERY good. Rooms are well stocked with basics you might need. And the lobby feels like there is a party going on :)

title: Lovely hotel in East Village
text:
Loved this location. Nice & quiet. The staff were very friendly & welcoming. We loved our room on the 17th floor with great views from a corner room! The bath tub & shower combo was awesome too! very clever. Enjoyed lunch at the restaurant that grows their own mushrooms! Had drinks in the bar too.
Used the gym pass one day & that was great. we will certainly return.

title: Modern, Comfortable, Clean.
text:
I stayed here one night with my partner.

Check in was very smooth.  A gentleman met us at the curbside when we pulled up and helped us with our bags.  Front reception was very nice and the process quick.

We drove in and they have an agreement with a parking garage around the corner for $20.

The room is small but that is the case with all NYC hotels.  It was very clean and the bed comfortable.  There is a full mini bar with snacks if you want to pay additional.

Great location for what we had planned.

I would certainly stay here again.

title: Le petit bijou... with wonderful service.
text: We had a lovely long weekend here. The hotel is really fun and feels so intimate - so nice after ducking in from the busy streets. The staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. Shay helped us get set up a few weeks before arrival, and the front desk staff were all great during our stay. They always had a smile and a hello for us. The hotel staff are also very engaged with communications. We felt kept up to date with emails and follow-up messages about a room switch we were asked to make halfway thru our stay. They gave us the same room type, and we were treated to the pleasure of meeting Paige who was very gracious to give us a few moments of her obviously busy time. We love the location of the hotel, and we love the size of the property - so accessible to fun, both! We look forward to our next visit.

title: Great hotel and location in the City
text: We stayed here at the end of a New England cruise in order to watch the Village Halloween parade. (A must see event) The hotel is very comfortable with seating and desk areas in the rooms and walk in showers. Everything was very clean and I found very quiet my room had a great view of Manhattan. The hotel restaurant and bar is vibrant and we spent quite a bit of time there but the restaurants in the local area were more attractive for dinners out. Walking distance to Katz and if you have not had that experience you need to go.

title: Perfect Stay for a quick In and Out trip
text: This place was great, but wasn’t trying too hard.  Excellent attentive staff without being stuffy, and the room was great with all the amenities I needed, and not a lot of fluff.  The location is perfect and super close walking distance to lots of great stuff.

title: The Standard East is a “must stay” n NYC
text:
This hotel is a “must stay” if you are going to New York City. It’s fun, friendly and just fabulous. We were there with a group of family and friends to celebrate a wedding. Everyone (12 couples) couldn’t stop raving about The Standard. The rooms are clean, extremely comfortable and the views of the city are amazing. We had a corner room and waking up to the view of the city was breathtaking. All of the amenities were well well thought of, especially the ample outlet with USB ports on each side of the bed under the side tables. No more crawling on floors trying to find an outlet to charge your phone, etc. 

We also loved the cafe bar for breakfast and drinks. The menu has options for every palate and the quality of the meals was A+. There is another beautiful bar, restaurant and fun outside yurts. They do everything possible to make you feel at home. We even got an email from the Manager in advance of our stay asking if we had questions or if there was anything special we needed for our visit. You’ll love it.

title: The Standard = The Amazing
text: My wife and I have become addicted to The Standard, previously the Highline location and now East Village. I’d make world travel a priority in order to check out other locations. The food is AMAZING. The environment - AMAZING. Our rooms have been a home away from home - better actually. We’re in love.

title: Loved the hotel!
text: Stayed for a weekend in January and loved everything about the hotel but especially the staff. They were lovely and very helpful, and always with a smile on their face. Great location in the east village with good views.

title: Great experience
text: The hotel has a No Bar which is awesome. Cool crowd, delicious coctails, fun athmosphere. High five to the staff. Especially to Ramon. The hotel is in an area full of life day and night. Mostly for guests 18-50, not so much for those below 18 or over 50.

title: Excellent to experience NY. Basic rooms with fun environs.  Swift checkin . Clean but simple experience.
text: Friendly staff. Very good location . Basic rooms; all you needs for a a couple of nights stay in NY. I enjoyed the young people scene and the accessibility to the rooms. Checkin was seamless. They won’t keep your bags for long upon check out. Consistent experience.

title: Loved our stay at The Standard EV
text: We found the hotel staff to be over-and-above accommodating and very nice. We loved our room, with two walls of floor-to-ceiling windows - amazing views uptown and down, and had breakfast every morning in the restaurant. This is a great property, I highly recommend!

title: Hotel per giovani nella East Village
text: Hotel nel quartiere East Village molto giovane e vivace.  Ingresso un po’ buio. Hotel adatto soprattutto per i giovani. Camere molto pulite. Non consiglio la colazione mentre c’è una Bakery a fianco con dei dolci buonissimi. Nella zona non mancano cafè e ristoranti. Subway comodo. Vista incredibile.

title: New Fav Manhattan stay!
text: One fo the best Manhattan stays in a while. The location is perfect for easy walks and places to find good eats. If you're feeling lazy, the Hotel room service menu is on point. As far as amenities, everything has been thought of. There was literally nothing we needed that wasn't already part of the basic stay package. The hotel staff is high level hospitality, but Khori (guest services/front desk) really set the bar from the moment of check in. Obi was friendly and happy to help with luggage and picture taking. We have definitely found our spot for future NY trips and we'll seriously consider the other locations on other trips.

title: Bad experience, expected more for The Standard
text: My fiancé and I stayed the night for NYE and had a terrible experience. We were “complimentary upgraded” to a corner suite on the 4th floor, not realizing how low of a floor it was and how loud it would be. We arrived back at the hotel around 12:30am to music blasting downstairs at the club. We called the front desk and asked to be moved to a higher floor. The hotel was sold out, we were told, and there was nothing we could do. The front desk told us to use the earplugs provided and that the music would be done by 2am. Well past 2:30am, the music was still blasting and we were unable to sleep. During this time, my fiancé tried to take a bath - the water was filthy brown (see pic). Expected a lot more for a $600+ night stay.

title: My favorite NYC hotel
text: I've stayed at The Standard EV many times over the years as well as the The Standard  Highline. I've always loved the vibe of the hotels and their locations - they're just overall cool and casual, but still feeling elevated. I recently stayed at the EV and the experience was yet again great. The team is always personable and friendly, the restaurant and staff were wonderful, and the room was comfortable. The guest experience manager, Josh, made himself available prior to my check-in and all the way through to my checkout. I actually saw him as I was departing and he was just as gracious, making sure I enjoyed myself and ensuring that he'll be available and accommodating the next time I plan to stay. Always with booking at staying at The Standard, and can't wait to get back.

title: Great Experience
text: This was my first stay at The Standard and the view from my room was gorgeous. The staff was friendly and provided impeccable service. I loved the bathtub, the lounge, the food, all of it was such a great experience at this well-maintained proeprty, I will definitely be back!

title: 5 star team
text:
My partner and I stayed at the standard for a little new year staycation. And we had the best time!
The rooms are so cute, stylish and most importantly- CLEAN! 
I must say the highlight is the staff- they really made the stay so much more special everyone was so kind and helpful. Shout out to Kimberly at the front desk! Such a warm, inviting personality- we will definitely be back!

title: Unresponsive, unapologetic
text: Our room was entered during our absence on our final day. Reported it to the front desk who dutifully mirrored my alarm but did nothing. On checking out was told the manager was talking to housekeeping to see if they had entered the room - although they shouldn’t have since it was checkout morning - and then failed to close the door properly when they exited. Was told manager would contact me to tell me the outcome of conversation. Never heard back. Alarming that the hotel should take an incident like this unapologetically in its stride. I was never asked if anything was missing and no apology was ever offered for whoever entered,  leaving our bags vulnerable to theft (we were about to check out so our bags were packed with our valuables).

title: Worse hotel experience in NYC
text:
Worse hotel experience in NYC
Extremely poor customer service - untrained front desk staff . Poor iterations with customers .
Poor decoration in the room .low quality furniture . Multiple stains in the carpet - 
Avoid this hotel .

title: Must Stay.
text: This hotel is appropriately named as it should be the standard for hotels to thrive. From the friendly hotel staff to the great food recommendations (Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken is a must-try) and cleanliness.  I am extremely grateful for the early check as I arrived in town. This will be my new go to hotel anytime I am in town for business and leisure.

title: What a great experience
text: 1st time in NYC & I’ve heard great things about the East Village; so happy I choose this hotel, the location was perfect. So many great restaurants & walking distance to soho. Kimberly helped with train directions & she was so patient with us. The yurt was a fun experience as well, wish it was longer. Plan on returning in the warm months with some friends, they did mention the hotel getting a renovation.

title: Very disappointing.
text:
The standard has a reputation of being really cool... well my experience wasn't so. My room looked like a hospital room. Tiny tiny... all white, with glaring fluorescent lights, and a drab grey curtain. 
The internet NEVER worked for my phone.
There is not a single microwave for guests use in the whole hotel.
the location is the only thing that seemed worth it at all. 
the resort fee covers a couple of water bottles I guess? oh and the Crunch gym across the street. 
nice staff though! 

but I will never stay here again.

title: Outstanding Property
text: This property is in a prime location with access to several train lines. Upon check in I was greeted by Kimberly who was very warm and friendly she informed me of the amenities offered at the property and what is nearby for good restaurants. My room was nice, nothing to rave about but exactly what I needed for a few nights stay. All in all I will return to this property.

title: Just okay
text:
The hotel wis well located, rooms are very small, but knew this before hand.  The restaurant, which we only had breakfast in-don't expect much.  Cold coffee, employees who look and behave like they could care less, etc.  Beware of hidden fees.  Never told when booked about this "facilities charge" of $30/night.  Manager at front desk says that it is for the amenities.  Other than wif which was spotty, there are no amenities-although he said we could pay to use the fitness center across the street-another employee who seemed like he didn't want to be there.

So, in summary-if you want to be in a good location, with a small but clean room-this would fit that bill.

title: A+ vibe A+ Location A+ Staff
text:
My soon to be ex wife and I came down from Westchester and had a staycation here a few weeks ago trying to rekindle that old flame. Didn't seem to work ha, but we definitely enjoyed ourselves none the less. 

Lucky us, we booked the weekend the winter garden had just opened so that was fun. The bar and restaurant on site is amazing.  The front desk was helpful in assiting us with buying Broadway tickets as we as other destinations that were in walking distance of the hotel. 

Outside of the top tier service provided as soon as you step in, the hotel's downtown location can't be beat. A quick walk to SoHo and Lower East Side with lots to do, see and eat in the immediate area. 

10/10 would stay again

title: Perfect stay
text: I did three nights in December. If you prefer Lower Manhattan, The Standard is a no-brainer. Everything is just a few blocks away, also most major  subway lines. I stayed alone but would easily recommend for couples. All NYC hotel rooms are tiny, but this one was slightly above average. Good bathroom and best shower in forever. If you prefer high floors, the view is amazing. Front desk always super helpful (they gladly store your packages so you can FedEx things here).

title: My Stay.
text: I had an amazing time during my weekend  getaway. Even though I live in NY, at times it’s good to be a tourist. The front desk, was able to recommend a lot of new but enjoyable experiences. Khori was awesome and very knowledgeable about activities, museums, restaurants, and bars.

title: Wonderful weekend and Amazing Staff.
text: Had an amazing experience. I Loved the views of the city from my room and the front desk staff was well mannered and very helpful. The yurt was fun, especially making s’mores! I wish they had valet parking but the garage wasn’t too far away

title: Way to kill the vacation mood
text:
Way to spoil a Christmas trip, @The Standard at East Village.

We were having a beautiful trip when Kimberly called at 11 am and informed us that we need to return to pack our room and move to a room that will not be available until later!   For an inspection!!  On Sunday!! No remorse!!  No consideration!!  Right??

I booked this trip as part of Amex preferred hotel program.  Will share this vacation spirit killer with Amex too.  

Will you want this experience?

title: Great little trendy hotel
text: The hotel atmosphere was amazing !! Very clean and the staff was great ! The cute little bar down stairs had great food ! Location location location . I felt very safe . Close to Soho,and Little Italy. It was a pretty quiet street for New York . That’s what I loved so much about it . Will go there again !

title: Good Times
text: My partner and I couldn't have asked for more during our recent stay at the Standard in the East Village. Josh, Khori, along with each staff member we met were pleasant and happy to help us. We struck up many conversations with the Cafe Standard staff and we were welcomed as if we knew them for years.....we will be back for sure.

title: The Standard Village
text: Awesome customer service ! The staff was wonderful and gave great recommendations for places to visit ! The hotel is must see and the view is excellent! The hotel was close to the museum of icecream !

title: Swanky but not clean
text: Something we experienced that was unusual for such a prestigious brand of hotel, was the cleanliness of the room. The carpet had a huge stain that looked as if someone threw up.
