While the pink lips is the cutest thing, it had a torn part and looked dirty. We were grateful to have been upgraded that I didn’t feel right asking to change rooms.

title: Rocky start but the hotel came through...
text:
Considering I found this hotel through Amex Platinum and it was part of their Hotel Collection my expectations were high.  Upon check in I received an email from Samuel welcoming us to the property.  Great, I love the personal touch.  Upon check in he told me we had been upgraded to a deluxe king so all was looking good.  As we entered our room I was disappointed due to the small size of the room.  This "deluxe" king was smaller than the room I had paid for.  When I called down to speak to Samuel about this he told me it was smaller but that it was still an upgrade, I'm still not sure how, and that he couldn't move me to a larger room until the following day.  Bummer.  It was only around 4 pm which seemed hard to believe but we moved on.  
The hotel is in a great location, yes! The large windows are really fun and definitely get you into the NYC downtown vibe.  The hotel is cool.  The service is great.  Overall we had a nice stay.  
The next day we moved to a larger corner room which was better.
Not sure I'd stay here again but I might.

title: Great time in the East Village
text:
My friends and I both had rooms here over Halloween and we all agree this is a must to return hotel in Manhattan. The rooms are very comfortable including a very large shower. 
The number of great restaurants within a short walk is incredible but extends out to many more options for short Uber rides. 
We also enjoyed the cafe/bar and staff service during our stay.

title: The Standard East Village was Amazing. Khori is the GOAT!!
text: Fantastic Hotel and Staff! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Standard in East Village. Super shoutout to Khori; Khori went well beyond the call of duty in making my stay the most enjoyable hotel experience. Khori represented the brand/hotel beyond the 5-star ratings and positive reviews I read online before committing to stay at the hotel — a great ambassador for the brand. I definitely will stay at the East Village location again!

title: THANK YOU, Natacia, Khori, and the entire staff!!
text:
Stayed for four nights and had a lovely stay. As always, Khori welcomed us with such kindness and her radiant smile. Natacia was incredibly gracious when I had some feedback before checkout, and she could not have have been nicer or more helpful. 

Some of the staff is new, but they're doing their best and very committed to making sure everyone feels well taken care of. The rooms are always clean, quiet, and comfortable, and the views are amazing. 

I'd love to see masks required in common areas as Covid rates spike again in NYC, but that is just a personal preference.

Thank you again for another great stay, with a very special shout-out to the wonderful Natacia and Khori!! You're the best. I won't stay anywhere else. :)

title: Really great hotel/launching pad for East Village (especially if you have teens)
text: Love, love, love the Standard. We alternate between the East Side and the High Line but I was with my 18 year old who prefers the East Village as a hang out. We've been going to the Standard East Village for years, and it never disappoints. You can't beat the location--close to all subway lines, and despite the busy street, relatively quiet. I love this part of the East Village and prefer it to the louder Bowery/LES area. We had a great 15th floor room (double beds, which are hard to find in NYC hotels) with a corner view of the Village Voice. The room was clean but spacious for two. We didn't spend a ton of time at the hotel, but I love the in-house restaurant and cafe (great for a burger or late night drink). Definitely will keep coming back.

title: FALL IN LOVE WITH NOHO ALL OVER AGAIN....
text: The Standard EAST VILLAGE has become one of our favorite city hotels.  We get to explore all the new hot spots on the LES and NOHO in total comfort.  The corner King rooms are the best entry level room.  About 275 SF but large bathrooms and 180 degree views of downtown and The One building.  I love the open Garden on site for daily meals.  You can't go wrong with The East Village location.  Best location if you plan on spending most of your time downtown.  We were grateful for JOSH on site, who controls front of the house.  Josh offered an array of hotspots and suggested new locals to  help create a memorable dining and event experience.  We were grateful.  There is no SPA  onsite but you can easily book a Spa day at Bliss in SOHO or Joanna Vargas Day Spa is a quick cab ride away.  Easy to book an in room massage as well.  When you don't plan on spending a lot of time in your room but plan on working and exploring downtown NYC, this hotel is a top option.

title: Good Intentions
text: Very friendly & accommodating front desk staff, led by Josh. They definitely want you to be happy & satisfied. Grateful for Josh's advance email arranging our ride from LGA. Room was tiny - even for NYC standards. Our daughter ordered a birthday surprise of champagne & charcuterie to be in the room when we arrived at 3pm. She was disappointed we never called to say thank you so she checked in with us at 5pm but nothing had ever been delivered. She called the staff who finally brought the bottle and snacks (but no glasses!) as we left for dinner.  Following morning, we put Do Not Disturb sign on door so we could sleep. Room Service woke us bright & early with breakfast (ordered by another child of ours). Coffee & eggs completely cold, went untouched. Hate to think what these two "bust" surprises cost our thoughtful kids.

title: The Standard in Excellence!
text: We love staying at the Standard. It’s an integral part of our ever-fun & stimulating visits to NYC. The excellent, attentive staff go the extra mile to make one's stay special (for instance, they ushered in my husband's birthday with a sweet treat waiting in our room) .  We enjoy starting our day in the café downstairs for tasty bites, lattés (albeit a bit small size for coffee addicts), and watching the city wake up. The comfortable, stylish rooms we've stayed in have exceptional views and maximize the cozy space (the bedding's dreamy!). Great location in the East Village: close to restaurants, museums, clubs, shops & public transportation. The Standard is our go-to home in NYC!

title: Weekend Getaway for Anniversary
text: Absolutely loved the hotel and location.   We had an amazing suite on the 18th floor with great views.   Josh made our stay extra special to celebrate.   We typically stay at the Standard in the Meatpacking district, but this may be our new favorite spot.   Definitely recommend!

title: Stay at the Standard, East Village !
text: Hotel was amazing. The cafe downstairs is cute and the food is delicious. The hotel itself is beautiful, very chic fun vibe but still upscale. Elevator is IG worthy. We ordered room service for breakfast (avocado toast with salmon, an almond croissant and coffee) and it was so fresh. We will stay again.

title: Fabulous Service, Location, Restaurant/Bar
text:
Usually stay at the Highline when I travel to NYC for biz, but the last time was pretty bleak.  A local friend recommended the Standard and it was close to perfect.  The room was small, but comfy, gorgeous view, sexy bathroom and loved the linens.
The bar/restaurant/patio all perfect, loved the vibe.  The service was impeccable...I requested a quiet corner room and they accommodated me last minute, they comped a number of items in the restaurant, I will now never stay anywhere else.  Love this place!  Very worth the price...

title: Enjoyed
text: We moved from a hotel that was not to our liking and very much enjoyed the hotel. The suites are great with excellent views. The location is actually very good as it is the quiet end of the Bowery/Cooper Square - just far enough away to not be hectic. The service is smiles, and restaurant good and reasonably priced. We would happily return.

title: Quick stay!
text:
I love the location of this hotel. It’s close to many interest points downtown. 
I think the maintenance group
Can check out the court sins which is the last
Investment on the list. But it’s important for the curtains to look good. Make you know they care for the premises. 
The service is wonderful and helpful

Thanks

title: HIDDEN CHARGES THAT THEY DO NOT TELL
text: I just stayed at The Standard on a 4-day business trip to New York and realized (when they emailed me the bill) that they had charged $30 dollars/day as a "facilities fee" according to them to cover the use of internet and water they put on the room. Something that is generally free elsewhere but it looks like at The Standard the super-high price one pays for the room does not yet cover the use of the facilities. Even thought the room was pre-paid they did not inform me of this charge at any point in my stay.  THIS REALLY SUCKS!

title: OUTSTANDING!!!
text:
I have stayed in some of the finest hotels in the United Stated and Europe, but I have NEVER felt as welcomed and comfortable as I did during my stay at The Standard, East Village. From the moment I stepped into the lobby, very late on a Thursday evening to the second I left two days later, every detail was superbly attended to. I was greeted with warm, friendly greetings and beautiful smiles, offered a bottle of water - perfect for the steamy hot summer evening, and asked (with genuine sincerity) if there was anything I needed. 

The kindness with which I was greeted at the front desk was extended to every single person who walked into the hotel. Guests had questions and needs of varying sorts, and every request was met with a response of, "Of course! I am happy to do that for you." 

Anahis and Jashia were two women in particular who I saw several times as I waited for my family members on the days of my stay. One morning in particular, I saw both of these incredible women waltz through a period of time that would have flustered me, yet they cheerfully helped two overwhelmed guests who were wrestling with a tower of luggage, assisted a couple in securing a cab, lead two weary women to a comfortable and quiet place to rest, and helped a caller on the phone decide on the best room to book based upon availability, bed options, price, and room location within the hotel. All of these events happened within the span of fifteen minutes. Neither of these woman broke a sweat. Both of these women had broad, joyful smiles at all times - the kind that brightened the entire lobby. I have only written about a fifteen-minute moment of my stay. I was there for two days. Every interaction I had with members of The Standard staff was equally remarkable. In every space of the hotel - the lobby, the restaurant, the bar, the hallways, was noteworthy. Need I say the service was superb?

Breakfast at the restaurant (outside, sheltered from the street) was spectacular. Eggs Benedict with the most delicious breakfast potatoes anyone? My family members each ordered different egg dishes and were equally impressed. Service again was stellar. The chairs were not terribly comfortable, but I find that sitting on outdoor chairs on a hot summer day in shorts is rarely a comfortable experience. However, I will gladly sit on the chairs again to recreate the otherwise incredible dining experience.

Even if my future trips to New York don't take me to the East Village, I will plan to stay at The Standard, East Village in hopes of seeing Anahis and Jashia again. They and  the other employees made a positive and enduring impression on me.

title: A WOW Stay!!
text: The team at Standard East Village are one of kind, so friendly, kind & attentive. Nothing is too much trouble for them and having stayed for over 2 weeks, Josh & the team truly made me feel at home; recognising me at every moment, even if just a friendly hello as I walk past the front desk. The room was a perfect size for my long stay with plenty of space for my luggage and clothes. My favourite spot in the hotel has to be Cafe Standard! The team were super friendly and attentive and remembered me the whole time, they made me feel so at home. The food was also so good and always came out fantastic.

title: Stay here to get the best of New York! (Especially for couples getting married!!)
text:
As a NY-er of 10 years, I had to stay at Standard E. Vil. for the night of my wedding and it was even better than expected! 

Standard upgraded us to a corner room overlooking downtown, perfect for getting ready + pictures, we had our "first look" in the lobby and they sent champagne and sweets! The friendly service at the Standard hotels has been a mainstay in New York since they opened here and I couldn't be more thrilled to have stayed with them on my wedding night. 

We had sweet messages on the day-of and after our stay from all of the Standard staff - front office manager Will and the guest experience manager Maggie, and they made any accommodations they could to facilitate our stay (making sure lost friends and family found our room, letting us in early for hair & makeup, holding the dress up front, you name it)! 

So appreciative of the kindness and thoughtful service of the Standard family!

title: Outstanding Staff
text:
The staff here are so nice and helpful. Shout out to Khori in particular!
A bit of constructive criticism about the rooms though-For the price I would have expected nicer rooms. The view was nice but the room was tired-needs a refresher.

title: Good and bad
text: The staff are great - genuinely friendly and helpful. The location is great. The shower is great. however, the room is/was tiny  - so small that there was no privacy in the bathroom - and by the time you pay all the taxes + + + + $30 per day for complimentary water ???? how is that complimentary ??? ..... it works out very expensive for a very small room. No, we wont be returning, but thanks again to the wonderful staff.

title: Treated us with utmost care and great service!
text: I stay at Standard EV all of the time, and the team is just so damn special and kind to us. They help with whatever we need, and are just generally so pleasant! We feel so lucky to have a place to stay while we work that feels like home!

title: It exceeds the standards
text: You can't go wrong with this hotel! The other reviews did a good job covering everything. They paid attention to our requests before our arrival. Everyone will go out of their way to assist you. The entire crew is extremely kind and helpful. The heated floors in the bathroom are ideal for any season. I suggest the hotel and its location near NYU in Cooper Square.

title: Great front desk staff, room was a bit dingy
text: Stayed one night as a mothers day staycation gift. Really loved the people who greeted me at the front desk--they were super helpful and friendly and funny! The room, which was upgraded to a higher floor, was small and in dire need of a good clean. There were weird stains on the headboard and bedside radio, the outlet box next to the bed didn't work and it just felt kind of grimy. Would be amazing if it felt a little cleaner.

title: Almost Perfect But For Two Things...
text:
I had a lovely stay in this wonderful hotel in the East Village area.  Fantastic view from the 20th floor; great bar, restaurant.  Service and housekeeping staff were incredibly amazing and helpful.

My two complaints concern mornings and evenings.  It is unconscionable that a hotel of this caliber does not have any way of providing early rising guests with coffee: no in-room Nespresso, etc; no coffee pot in a communal area; and cafe wasn't open.  Had to walk to a nearby 7 Eleven for canned coffee.  No bueno a this price point.

Similarly, the bars closed a bit early for a nightcap.

Other than that, I would almost be willing to stay there again.

title: Needs work
text: Great front staff, could not have been nicer. Although in upgraded room,it was very small, neede a good cleaning, more plugs would have been nice. Good hotel but not a good value, even in an expensive city like nyc.

title: Good bar and restaurant
text:
We stayed one night for family get together. 
Pros: 
Friendly helpful staff
Easy check in
Good restaurant and bar

Cons:
Rooms are not clean, stains on carpet, bed sheet
HVAC grill filled with dust balls

title: ALWAYS CHECK YOUR BILL
text: 2 days back from staying at the Standard I discover the hotel has made a whopping error in billing. In their favour. Double billing with a wrinkle. Weird add ons that also make no sense. Need to call my bank right this minute.

title: Friendly staff but the room needed basic routine maintenance
text: The staff was friendly and we enjoyed our stay for the most part. The room was pretty good however some things did not work, needed to be adjusted, or were just not well thought out. A partial list:  the bulb above the armoire was burned out, the stick for the large floor to ceiling curtains was completely missing so you had to grab the curtain to pull it over while being careful to not pull it down off the track, the light switch in the bathroom was broken, the mini-bar fridge leaked water on the floor. A design flaw: there is no plug on one side of the bed (ie. only 1 person can charge their phone next to the bed). While the hotel did fix a few of these things for us, most of these should have been addressed before a guest arrives.

title: Incredible stay!
text: Everything you need in the cool heart of NY. The room with an very complete frigobar. Excellent quality toiletries. Breakfast in their bar downstairs… incredible.”The garden” a must go! Being in the middle of the big apple you can hear birds singing in that restaurant outside! Great drinks and dishes. Service extraordinary all over!!! Thank you! Can’t wait to go back!

title: Khori has made me a lifetime customer of this hotel!
text:
Amazing location, clean rooms, great views, but the most exceptional thing about this hotel is the staff, and especially Khori! 

Khori goes above and beyond in giving me the best guest experience (communication, empathy, and problem solving) that I've ever encountered at any hotel before. As a result of Khori's expertise, I switched to The Standard East Village from another hotel for my week long work stay. In addition, I also extended my stay for a few more days to fully enjoy what the hotel and neighborhood have to offer. 

The hotel is located in the wonderful neighborhood of East Village with delicious and diverse food and drinks options. With easy access to public transits nearby, it means that the rest of New York is just a few steps away. At night, it also has a vibrant energy that makes you feel alive.

Khori had made my experience in NYC incredibly special. This is a hotel with class and fun. Thank you for making my trip memorable!

title: The best place to stay in NYC!
text:
There is something about this Hotel, that is just so beautiful and Magical! The staff, are your best freinds for life! 
Will never forget my new Family!!!
Will be back very soon! You guys are something really special! 
The food and the drinks are amazing! Service is Par Excelenance! The most genuine people you'll ever find! 
Khori, Rodney and Domenique! 
Guest relations: Destiny, Obi, Samir and Dijon. Front desk: Anahis, Jashia, Domenique, Rodney, Khori, Emily, Natacia and Kimberly!!!!

title: Seriously needs a good scrubbing and update
text:
I was really disappointed with the quality and shape of the room. There were too many stains on the carpet, long streaks of (what I hope were) coffee stains made worse by the desk chair, beaten up furniture, a wonky A/C system, a small window that wouldn’t close properly and a bathroom that can seriously use an update. The Apple TV screen mirroring didn’t work either but that’s a small issue.

I asked if I could be moved to another room but was told that 95% of the rooms need new carpeting.

I’ve stayed and dined at Standard Hotels in other cities, including the Standard High Line, and have always been impressed with the quality of the food - which was great during this stay - and the caliber of the staff but the rooms are in bad shape and desperately need an update.

I plan to return there in August and do hope that it will be a much better experience overall.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: From the moment you walk into this hotel you are treated like family! They make sure you have everything you need.  Jashia, Natacia  and Khori ALWAYS had a smile on their faces for every guest!  The rooms are immaculate and very comfortable. We had a corner room and the view was spectacular!! The location is perfect to get anywhere in the city!  This will always be our choice when visiting the city!

title: Very nice hotel in nice locale. Staff is great
text: Staff here made the stay, but the rooms and location were great too. Khorri was exceptionally great staff wise. I injured myself on the trip and she made sure I was able to get around and helped with anything I needed. Would definitely stay here again

title: Attentive Staff and Amazing View of the City
text:
Standard East Village is a great property for those who want a nice view of NYC and be near great coffee shops, eateries and bars. My check in process with Anahis was great as she was super welcoming and friendly! She explained all the amenities that I would get as a guest like Crunch fitness access and even gave me a room upgrade. I stayed in a corner suite with expansive view of the One World Trade Center - jaw dropping. My room had a tub but didn't have a chance to use it... Next time, I'll stay here for longer so I can take advantage of it!

Super clean, such nice staff (shout out to Anahis, Obi and Frank) - I am a fan!

title: Trip
text:
Wonderful, courteous receptionists, extremely, pleasant and, and always have smiles on their faces. 
 helpful.
Room very clean and comfortable.
I always stay there, when I’m in New York. 
Great restaurants nearby. Love it.

title: Super amazing staff!
text: Khori provided such a fun and friendly check-in experience, and went above and beyond to make sure we go the exact room we were looking for! Khori took my stressful travel day and turned it around completely. Based on that experience we canceled our stay at another hotel and rebooked at The Standard East Village! We can’t wait to come back!

title: Fun Summer getaway!!
text: I highly recommend the Standard East Village.  Great vibe, super friendly front desk staff made my girls trip just perfect!! Big shout out to Khori for going the extra mile to make my birthday so special!! We will definitely be back!!

title: Anahis was the best!
text: Anahis was extremely helpful sorting out payment methods and helping me out with my laugagge - I had a lot, and ways with a big smike. Really all the staff was super friendly. Would definetely come back.

title: Great view of the City!
text: I loved my stay with The Standard. The location was perfect for me. However, I had a lot of issues with my room. My shower head was busted, my toilet kept running and I had to jiggle it for it to settle, my blow dryer was broken, and the T-stat wasn't working with me. I kind of felt annoying after asking for help after the third time that I decided not to share any other issues. Great reception & cool bar.

title: Amazing space, even better staff!
text: Jashia was a treat from the moment we arrived to the very end. The front desk team was so accommodating and helpful throughout our stay. There are a bunch of membership hotels around the city that don't make you feel as welcome or as inviting as the team did at the Standard East Village. Will definitely be back again!

title: Friendly customer service
text: the staff was amazing and really friendly. the hotel is within walking distance to hip neighborhoods and shopping district. great bakery next door too! my only gripe is they’re charging high rates for an outdated hotel. everything smells musty and the curtains couldn’t be drawn properly - it’s small thing like this that make a difference when you’re paying rates like $500-600 a night. do better, standard. or are you, low standard?

title: GREAT EMPLOYEES !
text: The ladies at the front desk quite literally were some of the friendliest and most professional employees I’ve encountered in NYC. Thank you Anahis, Natacia and Jashia for being awesome and providing such a premium experience for a super easy 24 hr hotel stay!

title: Jashia is the BEST!!! Simply amazing
text:
I recently stayed at the Standard EV and had the most relaxing and wonderful time. The room was beautiful, quiet with stunning views, and very comfortable. The hotel was busy, but it never felt crowded. And it's in a perfect location, too, in the coolest, most vibrant and artistic neighborhood in the city. But that's not all: the front desk employees, notably Jashia & co., are the reason why the Standard is such a special place to be!!

Side note: I have stayed at the Union Sq. Hyatt and found the staff unfriendly and rude, and the room dirty and poorly decorated. I have also stayed at the nearby Moxy and found the room cramped and kinda gross, and the staff was completely checked out, barely acknowledging guests. My point is, I will *never* stay anywhere in the neighborhood but the Standard! It is far and away the most awesome hotel in the area. Truly.

I want to note that I received the warmest welcome from Jashia at the front desk. She is SO nice, friendly, patient, and endlessly helpful. Beyond that, she is just delightful to talk with! Her radiant smile will make your day. I am grateful for her dedication and thoughtfulness, and will be coming back soon!!!

Thanks for everything!

title: LalalaLOOOOOVE The Standard East Village!!!
text: My husband and I stayed here while I was traveling for work, and we absolutely LOVE this hotel! Perfect location, incredible staff and lovely views from the room! We enjoyed all the amenities, the Garden, the bar and the viiiiiibes at No Bar ;) 10/10 would recommend and we'll absolutely be back! <3 love yall!

title: Just like I remembered
text: Pre-pandemic, I stayed here 75+ items on mostly work trips. So I got to know the staff and the people.  While many have left, I'm still in touch with a couple -- that's how much I like this place.  The room, view, garden, bar area, and staff were great.  And you cannot beat the location.  I have to especially thank Jashia, Anahis, and Domenique for doing everything they could to make my visit for my birthday a lovely and relaxing time.  I'll definitely go back - again.

title: Best stay!
text: I loved staying at the Standard! It’s vibey inside the hotel and is in such a great, accessible spot in East Village. What impressed me most was the service! Everyone was so friendly and eager to help. I was also accommodated when I was in a pinch and I feel so grateful for that. Next time I visit I’ll stay here again!

title: Good but front desk staff lacked professionalism
text:
F&B manager was great (Leonora).
Greeting by front desk employees at arrival was terrible. # of them behind the desk didn't move a finger when they saw us (senior couple) struggling with our suitcases through a very narrow door. Then the only sound that came from one of them was "ID and Card" no please, no hello, nothing. Totally unprofessional and disappointing. At departure, the employee was pleasant, but the copy I requested by e-mail is not yet received after over a  week and two phone calls.

title: Nice room, friendly staff, but . . .
text: First-time customer. We checked in and asked the front desk to send up ice.  They were quick to say yes, but it never arrived.  Once in the room we couldn't figure out the thermostat, the TV hookup or how to turn on one of the lamps.  No instructions in the room for anything.  There was a cordless device (radio?) on a bedside table but no indication how it worked. Tried plugging in an iPhone to see if functioned as a speaker, but no luck.  It did not respond to blue tooth. The on-off switch made no difference.  The brand was Nude but, again, no instructions.  Tried to call the front desk, but no one answered.

title: Good service
text: I stayed at Standard EV the second time for NYU graduation and it was very good.  The location is very convenient for 3, 5 and 6 trains at Astor Place.  It has many good local restaurants 5 mins away from the hotel.  The front desk is very helpful and personable.  I left a pair of prescription glasses at the safe and they FedEx to me in 1 day.  I will stay there again with no hesistation.

title: Mr.
text: My Stay at the Standard absolutely exceeded my Expectations! Khori Ewan, and her staff provided fantastic service. She was kind enough to upgrade my room and assisting with all my wants and needs. Highly recommend, and will be coming back!

title: Hard pass.  (Lovely staff, tired and grungy property)
text:
I have been traveling to NYC for business for many, many years, so have realistic expectations on size of rooms, noise, etc.  This was my first stay at the Standard-was there for almost a week.

The staff at the front desk is lovely.  Always greeted me with a smile and seemed genuinely interested in making my stay great.  The property itself however was massively disappointing.

I rejected the first room (which I never do) as it smelled strongly of mold and something else that was unidentifiable.  Moved to a second room (which was smaller).  The room wasn't terribly clean, the layout was very, very challenging (desk lamp didn't work, desk chair a torture device, lighting in the bathroom like a nightclub).  The HV/AC was malfunctioning, so the room generally stayed arctic for the duration of my stay.  The carpets look like they hadn't been vacuumed in ages. There was no iron or ironing board in the room, and one of the outlets in the bathroom didn't work.  Annoying most times, but at $700/night?  Maddening.  

The capper was the restaurant.  The staff apparently willfully ignores customers so they can chat, and the food (when it finally arrived) was ordinary at best.

The hotel should stop spending so much effort on shouting about how cool it is and channel that energy into things like cleaning the rooms and replacing the lighting.

title: Good hotel / great staff
text:
Front desk were excellent, so friendly!!  There was lady who was super friendly (walked with a limp) sorry forgot her name she was a super ***.

Location was good 30 mins to Time Square. Taxi from airport flat fee $50/60.  

Prince Street/ Elizebeth Street is 10 min walk. 
Meat packing district was about a 40 min walk.

title: A nearly-perfect NY hotel
text:
First the bad news: the rooms were just OK. The bed was perfectly comfortable, the bathroom was always clean, and the minibar was a secret highlight. The room was also tiny (which is to be expected in a Manhattan hotel room), there were a few small stains on the carpet and scuffs on the furniture, and the furniture (especially the endtables and closet) felt IKEA-like in how cheap they looked. This was especially jarring considering how much care they seemed to put in establishing a capital-L Look in the public spaces (a slightly more punk take on turn-of-the-20th chic). I could've bumped this to 5 circles if they'd just added some art on the walls, or something to give the room a little more personality. If there's someone on staff reading this, please bring the same kind of character apparent in the public spaces into the rooms. 

Now the good news: everything else was great! A+ location, within walking distance to at least 4 subway stations, and dozens of great little bars and restaurants. I might come back to use it as a home base just to explore the neighborhood. The restaurant was much better than I expected from a hotel, especially the sourdough waffle w/apple butter during brunch. To jump back to the previous point, I think they should work on adapting the public spaces to create a more living-roomy, come and hang out vibe, since the rooms themselves seem to be primarily meant for sleeping.

title: Already booked next trip
text: Have stayed in various hotels in the area and decided to try the Standard. The exceptional service at checkin was a welcome surprise especially after taking a red-eye. The room was spacious by NY standards and very comfortable. The views were magnificent during the day but the night time views were even better! At checkout was again afforded the same cheerful courteous service by Anahis. Everyone was so helpful, I will definitely stay there again.

title: Would never stay at this or any other Standard again
text:
I have low expectations for NYC hotel rooms - you expect they will be tiny and in buildings that were retrofitted (versus new builds).
I was even disappointed beyond that. The carpet was FILTHY - looked like someone spilled a jug of Kool-Aid in one corner, and bleach in the other corner, with coffee throughout the rest of the room. I didn't walk barefoot once.
The furniture was cheap and damaged. The orange lighting in the bathroom was worse than a Zara changeroom and the fluorescent lights above beds weren't exactly "ambient". The single bathrobe was ripped and stained.
A concierge bot emailed me a couple of days ahead of my stay asking if I needed anything. I responded asking for help with restaurant reservations. No response. If you're going to have a concierge bot, it should probably work.
For a lower rate, I would sooner stay at CitizenM - same location, great hotel amenities, tiny but practical and clean rooms.

title: Not up to The Standard's standard
text:
I was underwhelmed and disappointed throughout my whole stay. Everything was average or below. The room looked and felt dirty, there were stains on the furniture, and the linens were white and far from pristine. Even the robe (which was packaged in plastic) had stains that looked like blood on it.

Because of how I felt, I didn't sleep in the hotel 2/4 nights, opting to stay with friends.
I ordered room service once and it was terrible. 
Staff were friendly. 

Would not recommend and won't stay again.

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: Probably the nicest hotel I’ve ever stayed in while in NYC - well except for that $100 a night 5 star hotel during the peak of covid. But we are now back to reality and now that I’ve been here, this will be my new go to. Love the location, size of the room, the linens and bed.The front desk staff were also engaging and friendly. Happy to have found this place

title: Très bon emplacement et vue unique
text:
Nous avions déjà été à l’hôtel The Standard de Chelsea. Les deux offrent des vues incroyables sur les toits de New York. Les emplacements sont exceptionnels et vous permettent de sillonner une bonne partie de Manhattan à pied. En revanche, le système de chauffage / climatisation est une catastrophe. Ça ne fonctionnait pas. À tel point que nous avons dormi sans. Le personnel est gentil mais ne comprend pas bien nos problèmes ou alors fait semblant de  ne pas les comprendre : grosse odeur d’humidité comme si la chambre n’avait pas été aéré depuis des jours. Le ménage dans les chambres laisse à désirer. 
Mais après il faut accepter de payer pour la vue et l’emplacement qui sont dingues :)

title: Clean rooms, efficient hotel!
text: Our stay was perfect. Room was ready when we arrived. Clean room, great floor plan with a good view. Front desk was helpful and efficient. We even enjoyed breakfast in the restaurant attached to the hotel. Very cute atmosphere. We will definitely be back!

title: Lovely view, responsive staff, unclean linens
text: The view is beautiful and the front-desk staff were wonderfully warm, responsive, and thoughtful. No complaints about them! But our room wasn't very clean--the moldings were caked with dirt. And one of the robes I was given, which was wrapped in plastic and so I even wondered if it were new, had bloodstains on it. Not great.

title: Lovely hotel with a great staff
text: Loved everything about this hotel: location, restaurant, room, and most of all the staff!  From the front desk to the restaurant servers to housekeeping, these folks are truly exceptional.  Friendly and helpful from start to finish. Will be the reason I return.

title: Valentine’s Day
text:
Barrington was the first person I spoke to when I called the hotel in valentines day. Barrington made sure that I was satisfied with my reservation before booking and made sure to ask questions to get the perfect room for me and my bf. We had a last-minute change of plans and ended up having to stay in the city for the night and Barrington was super helpful in What otherwise would have been a pretty hectic process on one of the busiest nights in February.  I would totally recommend the standard Hotel to everyone. The room was beautiful and the customer service was impeccable.

Thank you Barrington

title: THE STANDARD SET A NEW STANDARD
text:
I had one of the best stays I've ever had in a hotel and that's saying a lot . When you walk into the hotel you get a nice chill and inviting vibe that just resonates throughout the lobby.
From the moment I checked in i was welcomed with open arms. I have to give a shout out to the front desk and especially Rodney!!. They were more than helpful with anything I needed help with, I appreciate how genuine they all were. 
I will definitely be back sooner than later =)

title: LOVELY YURT DINING EXPERIENCE!!!!!
text: My husband & I had a LOVELY dinner in the Wintergarden in a private yurt.  We arrived for our 7:30pm rez on a Thursday, entrance is in the hotel, and taken outside to their Wintergarden.  There are quite a number of yurts outside for 2 people to, I believe, up to 6ppl.  The yurts are super cute and cozy with sting lights (dimmable) and a heat lamp overhead.  The tables and chairs are bar height seating and is just enough room for the 2 of us which gives a very warm, romantic, cozy vibe.  Our waitress, Michelle, was FANTASTIC and really added to the experience.  She was personable, sweet, and on top of the entire meal.  The staff also all wore masks the entire time and we were checked for vax status upon entering.  The specialty cocktails were great and the meal was fantastic.  I would HIGHLY recommend an absolute lovely experience here!

title: Perfect room to come back to for rest during a business trip
text:
I loved having my homebase in the East Village during a business trip. There are so many good bars + restaurant's in the area, and its central to the rest of the city. 

Amazing views, and the most comfortable bed!!

title: Awesome Spot
text: really enjoyed my time at the standard both times i've stayed. great proximity to the lower east side and close to the train. the cafe is great and a perfect place to get some work done while eating shishito peppers. the showers are great, beds are comfy, and most importantly - the staff is great. I highly recommend this place as long as you don't take my room from me.

title: Human
text: The Standard is the literal standard for customer service.  From concierge, to housekeeping, to the restaurant staff - everyone treated you like family.  Big shout out to  Ben, Taylor, and Sylvia, as they were the local tour guides I never thought I would need.  My experience could not have been the same without their recommendations.  To sum it up, I will only stay at this hotel when working in New York.

title: Amazing stay with epic views
text: I had a great staycation at The Standard, East Village recently. The staff was warm and very attentive, location is great and the room was perfect. The Downtown Studio has one of the best views in the city. I'll definitely return.

title: Great location & staff
text: Super fun property, rooms are on the small side but average for NYC.  Delicious brunch and was especially fun dining in a yurt!   No Bar had a fun vibe and really great cocktails.  Every staff member we engaged with was super friendly and nice.  Hotel is also in a great location.

title: Reset,Relax and Reflect!
text: I needed a quick staycation to just relax and reflect. Before my birthday I like to have quiet moments to myself! The Standard went well Above and Beyond of relaxation. From the moment I checked in I knew I was in good hands. Thank you to Anahis and Rodney at the front desk, they were pleasant and very helpful. Who doesn’t love great customer service! The moment I walked into my room, I could smell how clean my room was! With everything going on that put my mind at ease. I was greeted with a personalized birthday card, macaroons and a bottle of Prosecco! If that’s not heaven I don’t know what is!!! The view was breathtaking, I didn’t know how I was going to leave. The bed was comfortable, my favorite spot in the whole room. The bathroom was beautiful with a luxurious tub made for bubble baths! Let’s just say The Standard has a customer for life! You will not be disappointed, can’t wait to book my next staycation!

title: You made the entire stay fab!
text:
This is the perfect hotel for a weekend getaway in New York. The customer service or white glove service I should say is a best kept secret at this hotel. Please keep it a secret and don’t overwhelm the staff lol these guys have the best energy.

Everyone was so friendly, so helpful and warm but no one made an impact on me like Berry. He was truly so cool and friendly, he felt like a long time friend! And still his professionalism was unmatched.

 Berry is truly an asset. I loved his energy so much I ended up buying The Standard Hotel T shirts with him and chatting about the city.

Great experience. I can’t wait to come back.

title: Barrington is EVERYTHING!!!
text: I’ve attended a few Drag Brunch Sundays at the SEV but this time I was fortunate enough to book my first staycation for my birthday weekend! Upon checking in I met the one and only BARRINGTON!! Not only was he friendly but he was kind enough to upgrade my room that included a beautiful view, king sized bed, and tub (that bathtub y’all!!). The next morning he greeted me at checkout, had a lovely conversation, and even comped my room service breakfast!! The hotel itself was very clean, the staff had masks on the entire time (which I really appreciate), and I felt very safe staying over night by myself. I told myself after that night I should definitely staycation in the city more and this hotel will always be my first choice, as long as Barrington is there to great me with a smile under his mask!! He deserves ALL the flowers!!!

title: So happy to have discovered this gem!
text: We truly loved our 4 night stay at The Standard East Village.  The front desk team was courteous, efficient and helpful. Housekeeping was spot on.  The room on the 18th floor was super quiet.  The linens and towels were luxurious.  The only thing lacking was a coffee maker in the room.  But thanks to room service, a pot of hot coffee was not too far away.  On our next visit to the city we will definitely be staying at this little gem again.

title: Exceptional all around!
text: Best hotel in NYC. I stay in so many, and very few match this The Standard. No shortcuts in the buildout, finishings, sheets and mattresses, shower, superb service, super clean, lovely, smart and proactive staff, and the level of interior design are top-notch.

title: An Amazing experience!!!
text:
My best friend and I had the best time at the standard. My cousin recommended this hotel and it didn't disappoint. Rodney at the front desk was super accommodating and answered all of our questions.

The room and view was one of a kind, Can't wait to come back and visit.

title: The Standard East Village truly is a Gem.
text:
I did a solo day in the city and booked this hotel, as I love The Standard, I live in Miami. I was immediately greeted with amazing energy from Barrington at the front desk who was genuine and thoughtful. He made me feel at home and upgraded my room also because he saw my birthday was coming up. He was so helpful and really attentive, this is the energy that we all truly need. Being immediately welcomed with warmth is always a great sign, I expected nothing less from The Standard. 

At the bar, Peter was absolutely incredible and such a delight. His knowledge of the bar was outstanding, he gave many recommendations of drinks to try, and his outspokenness also made me feel comfortable and loved the genuine conversation. 

I’ll absolutely be coming back for these gems.

title: LUXURY Experience In My Own City! Staycation Approved!
text:
I am the Queen of Staycations. I'm a New Yorker and I love my city, so at least twice a year, I like to do a luxe staycation. This weekend I stayed at The Standard; East Village and I have to say that this hotel is TOP NOTCH LUXURY!
The hotel is beautiful inside and out. The decor is modern and unique which I really loved. 
I was greeted so nicely at the front desk by Barrington. He was just very pleasant. I felt his smile behind the mask which is nice during this time. Great customer service!
My room was cute and comfy but THE VIEW was everything a New Yorker or tourist could ask for. They also had champagne and strawberries waiting for me along with a really nice handwritten note welcoming me. That was a really lovely gesture that I will never forget. I kept it as a reminder that great service and good people still exists. 
Room service was also amazing. The food is delicious!!! I got a cheeseburger and fries. The food was fresh and came hot. 
I truly enjoyed my stay and look forward to coming back and leaving another great review. 
If you're in NY and need a getaway without going far away, please visit The Standard; East Village. If you're a tourist looking to be in the middle of city and have a luxurious experience without breaking the bank, this place is it!
Thank you Natasia for creating such a great experience for me and thank you to the whole staff at The Standard;  East Village! Can't wait to come back.

title: Amazing hotel!
text: Their hospitality is top of the notch! Everyone was very helpful and very kind, with smile on their faces. The room is not too big, but it is still comfortable and with such big windows, the view was amazing. We got to stay in the 18th fl with view of midtown and East River. We weee able to see the beautiful sunrise! It was such amazing experience! Cleanliness is also great! Our room got cleaned everyday, and the housekeeping people are very nice too. The area are perfect for us. Lots of parking space, so that’s a huge savings in Manhattan. Last but not least, they do not charge for our furry baby, which is a big win! This will be our go-to hotel moving forward when we are in Manhattan! Recommended!

title: LUX start to 2022
text:
Walking into the lobby, the front desk was attentive and warm. Check-in was a breeze. Staci is phenomenal- she planned activities that I would appreciate. She was well informed and available even during their busiest times. The room had a jaw-dropping view of NYC (great for influencers who want a panoramic view) and the bathroom was picturesque with its unique foil-like silver curtains. The bed was cozy, safety lock, hangers for my gown, single use toiletries, etc. Room service wasn’t a long wait and delicious. I had the traditional breakfast, eggs, toast (gluten free options), and bacon. There was a bottle of champagne chilled awaiting for me- loved the personal touch. This was great way to kick of the new year and a delightful staycation. If you are a NY native, treat yourself to a stay. Promise it’s worth it.

Feel free to tell them Natasha sent you!

title: The most amazing hotel in New York!!
text: Loved every single minute at this hotel. The staff was so kind and accommodating, couldn’t have asked for a better place to stay in NYC. Absolutely want to stay here again and again and again!!! The rooms are so cool, relaxing, and don’t even get me start on the views.

title: Where do I even start…
text: From beginning to end the whole experience was amazing!  Staff was accommodating and beyond nice, Barrington was so sweet and really made my anniversary special (you go Virgo!). The room was clean and comfortable upon arrival and the overstocked mini bar had everything you really could think of, the ambience alone of the hotel was sexy,playful and fun, and in a great location, they really took my requests and made magic happen. Thank you so much team! Cant wait to be back.

title: Fantastic view, location, staff and vibe
text: The Standard was a refreshing experience in NYC with a panoramic view from the corner king room, unique dinner in a yurt in the winter garden, delicious breakfast and super accommodating staff! We will be back.

title: Fantastic Service — Extraordinary
text: Celine literally froze for me!! She was so amazingly helpful. I stay at The Standard East Village regularly now that my daughter started NYU this fall. Love it. Hip. Great service all around! Excellent brunch.

title: Best possible location, fantastic views
text:
We really enjoyed our trip to the Standard - I honestly don't think we could have found a more central location, the East Village has the best/highest concentration of bars and restaurants. We have many friends on the Lower East Side and this hotel is dead center between that neighborhood, Chelsea & West Village, Tribeca, Union Square. There's a few subway stops nearby but the one on 8th near NYU was super close and easy to get uptown with. 
The Standard front desk staff were super efficient and helpful. We sprang for a corner king and the views were definitely worth it. Not a huge hotel room but for NYC we thought it was fair, and the bathroom was quite large. I didn't hear any other guests - although the bar downstairs seemed constantly busy, the rooms were quiet and we slept well. My only critique is the large curtains in the room were difficult to maneuver and needed to be cleaned, I imagine that's an update that would take some time. The mini bar probably had the coolest assortment of snacks and drinks I've seen. Would absolutely stay here again!

title: Glittery and relaxed (if necessarily at a distance)...
text:
When my daughter received her green light to graduate in December, we booked a staycation.  

We knew what we wanted: East Village cool, possibility for chatting and catching up, proximity to a few (old) favorite haunts.  The Standard, East Village delivered.    

We had a fun, sleepover-style night, a gorgeous view.  Room service coffee was excellent. Breakfast downstairs was perfect. 

Staff was gracious, relaxed, attentive.  

COVID precautions were spot-on and upheld.

title: Exceptional!!!!!
text: “Barrington” is a wonderful name we’ll never forget!  The amazing, warm and enthusiastic reception he, Danny and Princess gave us when checking in set the tone for a world-class experience.  For my wife’s 40th, they went the extra mile by having balloons, strawberries and a card waiting!  A touching and memorable surprise.  Our room was fantastic with gorgeous panoramic views spanning the Freedom Tower to the Empire State Building.  Bed was VERY comfortable!  Can’t wait to return to experience one of their famous corner king rooms on our next visit to the city.  We loved every minute of our time spent there, and are grateful to this outstanding team for making us feel right at home.  Highly recommend, with our hopes those mentioned above will receive accolades for their impeccable hospitality!  Cheers to The Standard - East Village!!!!

title: The Best week in NYC
text: We stayed here for four nights during our first time in NYC and it was perfect. The front desk staff was so friendly at check in/out and the housekeeping staff was amazing. This was the perfect location for us as we did all the touristy things in the city. Beds were very comfortable and bathroom was clean. Love the vibe of the Standard’s hotels and this place exceeded my expectations. Loved our stay here and would highly recommend!

title: The magic has gone: tired and dated.
text:
I’m sorry to say this hotel has really lost what made it special a few years ago. It feels tired and unloved; there doesn’t appear to be any desire to create a magical or memorable experience, with little regard for customers. For example, checking in was interrupted by the receptionist answering the phone during the process (really rude, I think) and you’re left to fend for yourself.

The room - for around £400 per night - isn’t worth the money at all. For two tall adults you feel on top of each other, with a small amount of room around the bed to manoeuvre. The storage is laughable - three clothes hangers, and no shelving. So I just kept everything in an open suitcase on the floor.

The window (17th floor) was cracked, so during the night I was woken by a dripping noise, which was water coming through. I had to go to the bathroom to fetch towels to lay down along the window ledge. I reported it, but no word of an apology.

The decor is a bit worn out, the door doesn’t really feel secure (there’s a noticeable gap) and staff regularly use the guest elevators, meaning you stop at several floors as you’re trying to get in and out.

Check out was bad; no friendly conversation. No asking how was the stay. Just ‘how do you want your receipt, email?’ Sums up the whole experience now - driven by money, with no investment in the hotel or experience. Time to look elsewhere.

title: The Standard East Village has lost its sparkle
text:
I’ve stayed at the Standard loads of times on business and pleasure. The location is awesome and it’s usually a great experience. 
Sad to say it’s gone downhill. 
Gone are the friendly bell boys, helping you with your bags and greeting you when you arrive. 
Instead, was greeted by two sassy front of house, who answered the phone and were talking to other guests mid check in, while another was rolling her eyes on the phone to a guest complaining.
The room we had (a standard king) was so small we barely had room to store our things. 
The glass in the window had cracked and we had water coming into the room when raining.
Overall, the hotel feels tired, unloved and a bit stagnant and for £400 a night you expect something a little better.

title: Great hotel
text: My room had everything that I needed, very clean and well appointed with a fantastic view. The food and beverage selections were wonderful and the Café had cozy, comfortable in-door and out-door seating (both exposed and heated enclosed options). The staff was warm, friendly and very accommodating.

title: Coffee only from 8am... really?
text: The place is cute but tired, understaffed, the lifts are a real problem but the main reason why I'm not going back there is that the bar opens at 8am which is far too late. To get a coffee at 6am I had to go out and get a really bad coffee at some dodgy 24hr pizza place. I mean they could have at least given a nespresso machine in the room, right? The other Standard Highline is far better. Huge disappointment.

title: 10 Out Of 10
text:
Yes to the views ! 
Amazing staff; they went above & beyond to help make my birthday special. Everyone we interacted with was so nice & helpful. They had great recommendations for things to do, see & eat. Thanks for the birthday fruit plate as well, it was fresh & delicious. 
We will definitely stay here again !

title: Understaffed and poorly managed.
text:
Bad experience from start to finish. Clearly understaffed and poorly managed.

First, there's no lobby lounge or anywhere to hang out in the hotel.

Checkin is at 3pm, I called at 9am and 1am, both times saying it's important that I get to check in at 2:45pm because I need to be uptown at 3:30pm. I get to the hotel at 2:45pm and my room isn't ready, and they don't have an ETA. I wait until 3:15 and my room still isn't ready, and still no ETA. I can hear that it's the same deal with other people checking in. I'm now late, so they say they'll put my bags in the room as soon as it's ready. I get back at 5:30pm and my bags are still in the lobby. 

The room itself (King Corner) has a bad view without privacy, dirty, greasy handprints all over the headboard (and on the top, where they'd clearly held it during sex), stains on the carpet, etc.

We order breakfast at 7:15am, are told it'll be here around 8am, it finally gets delivered at 8:42am. We had to cancel our morning meeting. 

Won't be coming back.

title: Horrible customer service skills - front desk
text:
My reservation was 8am-5pm for a workday. I called ahead to say I’ll be in at 9am. Got there and was told my room wasn’t ready. When I was asked why, the lady at the front (assuming manager) told me “we didn’t have to take your reservation, we did it as a courtesy, we are maxed out.” Had to sit in the lobby and  got in the room at 9.42am and still had to leave at 5pm. No discount, no amenities. The worst part was “we didn’t have to take your reservation.” Right. Hotels don’t need guests. 

The restaurant was very nice, the staff were very pleasant and the breakfast was great.

title: Great hotel, very bad check in experience
text: Excellent location, great views, very nice cafe. Ver bad check in experience. We did not get whar we had booked and confirmed over the phone and the solution was a paid upgrade!! After that we enjoyed our stay and liked the hotel. We highly recommend the cafe for breakfast and evening drinks!

title: Excellent Hospitality
text: Planned a 6 day trip at The Standard and it was everything I could’ve asked for! My first time coming to New York and upon arrival my friend and I were warmly greeted by the friendly reception staff. The room we stayed in was clean and the view was beautiful. The location of the hotel was right in the center which made it really convenient when it came to commuting to places, we mostly were walking distance which was super convenient. Thank you once again to Barrington and Rodney for the lovely hospitality and for all of the amazing recommendations that were given by them. These little yet impactful gestures will be the reason I will book at this hotel next time I visit New York.

title: Perfect 4 day weekend
text: Everything about our stay at The Standard in the East Village was exactly what we needed. Perfect central location for spending our time in Soho, Noho and the rest of the Village. Just posh enough- just hip enough, quiet comfortable rooms with amazing city views. Staff is super on it - everything was clean and stylish snd welcoming. Would absolutely stay here again and again

title: Parents only trip to NYC with friends
text: Loved our stay at the Standard! Comfy bed, soft linens, great stylish layout, quiet nights. Shower amazing, great little touches and amenities. Front desk staff kind and helpful. Location is really great… central to so many NYC gems. THANKS!

title: Disappointing
text: Like many businesses these days it seems The Standard is having a hard time finding good help. While the location is convenient it appears this hotel caters to the parents of students at NYU and millennials. If you are a professional traveling on business you will be disappointed. Wi-Fi is terrible, room phones almost unusable, no room service, no early morning coffee service, no business center. They call themselves charming and cozy which they are - but not for a professional trying to do business.

title: Wonderful stay
text:
Barrington and the crew at the standard east village are so sweet and kind. They go above and beyond to make their guests feel welcomed. I would 10/10 recommend staying here ( with your dog too!). We’ll be back. 

Michael

title: Great service from kind people
text:
Upon entering the lobby the Standard East Village  transports you from the noisy city to a relaxing yet modern- chic environment. Barrington and Rodney were both friendly and engaging. They noticed that it was my birthday and made me feel excited to be celebrating it there. The room itself was spacious 
and quiet, I couldn’t hear any of the noises of the city. Overall a wonderful experience I won’t forget!

title: Nice boutique at East Village near NYU
text: I visited my daughter who is attending NYU. The hotel is convenient to East Village, SOHO shopping area and 6 Line subway.  The front desk is very personable and efficient.  I particularly like seeing Natasia who always welcome people with a beautiful smile.  I stayed at a corner King that has a nice view of the city.  The room is average in NYC standard.  I enjoyed my stay and will return again.

title: Loved Biergarten
text: Stopped by Biergarten to use the bathroom, manager got us to stay for some beer and a pretzel. Very sweet. Fun place and Benny the bartender knows his stuff. The staff seems very happy which speaks volumes. Thank you Benny and Claud

title: Love the location, would never stay again
text:
The people are great here and very warm and welcoming, so I do feel bad for writing this review. Our room was just awful. The tiny rooms feel even smaller because they don't maximize their space. Our bathroom door wouldn't remain closed until I fixed it myself. Our bathroom, and thus our room, smelled of mildew. Our shower wall was caving in where someone had pushed part of the fixed through the wall and it hadn't been fixed. 

The view is incredible and the location is awesome, but for the kind of money it costs to stay here.

title: Great hotel, service falls shortly
text: Great things-comfortable, clean, great view, nice bar, can’t beat location. Felt understaffed. Got a standard queen despite prepaying a king; only  saw after checkout. Still waiting for that receipt more than a week later to call and fix!

title: great staff!
text: The Standard is East Village has become my NY home away from home.  I now consider myself a regular.  Why?  The location is ideal, fully embedded in the community, the hotel is easily accessible by all public transportation and is anchored in a safe, friendly neighborhood.   The rooms are clean and comfortable and feature floor to ceiling windows that offer great views.  Mainly though it's the staff.  Natacia, Rodney, Kimberly, Barrington, Lisa---everyone is great.   Analis checked me in this past trip immediately put me in a good mood given her professionalism and warmth.  Everyone is cool---the restaurant is delicious, the wait staff and bartenders all super-chill and friendly.   No complaints! thank you SEV!

title: Great Stay
text: Everything from booking our room to the hotel bar & restaurant was great. the staff was very friendly and attentive. We really enjoyed our stay at The Standard and I would recommend it to people traveling to the area.

title: Perfect for girls weekend !
text: I stayed at the Standard East Village for a girls weekend to celebrate my bachelorette.  Hotel staff was friendly, thoughtful and accommodating and the rooms offered a great view. The restaurant / bar downstairs provided the perfect meeting spot throughout the weekend and the cocktails were delicious.

title: Clean, economical size, luxury price
text: So to be clear it’s not “bad” but it’s certainly average. Especially for the price. I won’t name competitors but you can easily get some luxury experiences for similar or lower price than The Standard. I think my expectation was set to this level of other New York experiences over $400/night and what I got was clean and efficient but probably more like a Holiday Inn with a very nice lobby up front. Come check out the bar or cafe but sleep somewhere else.

title: Great Hotel, Best Location, Awesome Team
text: Love this hotel! I’m here monthly for company meetings. The rooms are clean, with comfortable beds, great bathrooms, and super centrally located. The entire staff is so nice, friendly and accommodating (the manager Natacia is always patient and accommodating and Lisa at the front desk is super sweet). The restaurant is casual and easy for meals and the rooftop space has been fantastic for our team meetings/events. The gym access to Crunch across the street is great to get a full workout as well. Highly recommend for business or pleasure travel to NYC!

title: Everything you need AND an A+ location
text: Room is a decent size and has everything I needed > storage space, wardrobe, TV, spacious bathroom, great shower size and water pressure! Location is A+ and so central to get around, visit restaurants, etc. Room service incredibly prompt, and hotel housekeeping does a fantastic job with their daily cleaning. Highly recommend.

title: Rodney is fantastic!
text: There's nothing more comforting than starting your stay off with great service with some of the first people you interact with at a hotel - and Rodney at the front desk provided just that at the Standard East Village.  He was so attentive and helpful - thank you for all of your help!

title: EXTRAORDINARY SERVICE, EXTRAORDINARY HOTEL
text:
Fabulous home away from home! Danny and his warm and friendly team ensure your every need is met! These people are seriously awesome and fun and you will love them!!

We love eating our meals in the treed courtyard or in the lovely restaurant where you can sit inside or out. The menu is varied, the food delicious and well priced and the atmosphere is cozy and warm.  

The hotel has done a great job keeping the hotel spic and span, hand sanitizers aplenty and proof of vaccination is required to eat in the restaurants.  

The location and proximity to NYU is an absolute bonus.  We moved our daughter into her dorm in September and literally rolled her bags from the hotel.  The hotel nicely stored her extra luggage until move in so her room was not cluttered!

The hotel rooms are bright, the pillows and beds extra comfortable and we love the well stocked frig in the room!  
We also enjoyed using the gym across the street and picked up free passes at the front desk.

We will continue to stay at the Standard and are looking forward to returning to NYC for Parent’s Wkd.  Book now! You will not be disappointed!!

title: A lovely hotel choice for parents visiting their NYU students!
text:
This hotel has the perfect location within close proximity to NYU's campus.
  
I got an amazing rate from Fine Hotels (Amex Plat card) which upgraded my King size room to a corner room (Junior suite) with a sunken tub and views of the Freedom tower.  The bed had great linens and the mattress and pillows were heavenly.  The mini bar was stocked with the most creative and unique items that I have ever seen....you're going to have to see for yourself...I don't want to ruin the surprise :-) 

My reservation included 2 bottle of water per day, but the front desk was happy to give me water to take to my room when ever I requested.  

Due to this pandemic, I think they were definitely understaffed, but everyone who was there was so happy to assist me with anything I needed.  Ramon (in charge of security and often seen at the front entryway) was always happy to greet me and hail me a cab (even during the rainstorms!).  He goes above and beyond to provide quality service to his guests.  It's nice to see someone who takes his job so seriously.  You can tell that he is grateful for his position and it is so nice to see the respect he has for his job.

Taylor was also an exceptional employee.  She works in the restaurants/bar.  When I met her late in the evening at the bar, she was a bit overwhelmed and (on her own accord),  she went out of her way to apologize for the service she felt she was not providing to me.   When I saw her the next day in The Garden we recognized each other and had a lovely conversation about her NYC life.  She was very personable...so refreshing, especially to find someone like this in NYC! ;-)

Natacia is the last person I want to mention. I don't think I ever got to meet her in person, but I interacted with her over the phone before I arrived.  I had a few concerns about my reservation and she quickly made sure that everything was taken care of before my arrival to make sure I had a 'stress-free' visit.

All in all, I would highly recommend The Standard East Village for any NYC stay.  It is so close to the subway you can get to any NYC neighborhood in a pinch, or if you prefer, Ramon will hail you a cab ;-)  I loved my morning walks and loved reading about the local establishments that they recommended for coffee and shopping (this was given to me in my welcome email I received prior to arrival- another touch I don't think other hotels offer). 

For those wondering about COVID safety... the rooms were exceptionally clean! I felt very safe during my stay.

title: Perfect hotel
text:
Great hotel operated by a wonderful staff. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Loved the on site restaurant/bar - must have had 5 meals there. Walkable to West Village. 
I would stay again and highly recommend for those wanting to stay in E village

title: Bug Infestation
text: I stayed at the Standard in East Village after doing research on the hotel beforehand.  I used to stay at The Standard hotels in Los Angeles frequently, so I came to expect a certain caliber of customer service.  When I checked in I found that my room was infested with bugs.  I notified the front desk and they treated the issue very nonchalantly.  They finally moved me to a new room and I was charged full price for that room.  The new room had a moldy odor in it.  The Standard is certainly not taking precautions to sanitize their rooms because of the Covid pandemic, as most hotels out there are.  If a clean room in East Village is what you’re looking for I would avoid The Standard at all costs!

title: Very limited services, tiny rooms, and loud
text: We stayed at the Standard for two nights, and were not thrilled with our experience. Despite a room upgrade, our room was remarkably tiny — even for a Manhattan hotel — and despite a higher floor, there was significant street and hallway noise. It's also useful to bear in mind that the hotel and bar downstairs attract a party-forward crowd, so you should expect to encounter that type of element whenever you're leaving and arriving at the hotel. Room service was unavailable, and housekeeping is operating with a bare-bones staff, so it's challenging to receive a room cleaning. This is, to a certain degree, understandable, as hotels begin staffing up post-COVID, but it's disappointing that the existing staff did not seek to offer any remediation. The room was modern in style, but the overall decor feels distinctly early 2000s, and the room was clean, but sheets did smell heavily of bleach. If you're interested in partying in the East Village, I would recommend this hotel, but would otherwise suggest steering clear.

title: COVID is not an excuse for bad service. Stay elsewhere!
text:
Currently staying at this hotel. Would not recommend it at all!
They list room service as an amenity but fail to mention that it is only from 8 to 4. Their website does not have updated info re their services and amenities.
Also, was told at check in that breakfast is served from 8 to 11, but this morning was informed that they decided to end it at 9:30.
If I had not called at 9, there would be no breakfast! Then, they send breakfast in containers in a paper bag without plates, coffee in a paper cup. When I asked for a mug, they said "due to COVID" they are unable to give you a mug. However, they are serving food and drinks using proper crockery in their on site cafe and garden. The concierge staff was rude  when I asked for the mug. I wonder what his reaction would have been if asked for a plate.
Moreover, info differs based on the person you speak with re anything.
Takes about an hour to get coffee. (P.s. there isn't a coffee machine or kettle in the room). Took 2 hours to get water.
I have been staying at hotels in and out of the country since Sept 2020, and this is definitely the worst service. 
COVID is NOT an excuse for bad service. 
Room is nice. Bed is comfortable. Needs some refurbishment. Aircon stopped working in the middle of the night and switched to heat on its own. However, the engineer did come by to fix the thermostat. Stained towels.
Called amex travel as thats where we booked the hotel. Its part of their hotel collection which is shocking! Ames travel supervisor was unable to get through to the hotel manager. She called several times. I am assuming there isnt a manager!

title: Do not Book for Special Events!
text: Disappointing. I had requested early check in (1pm) for a wedding at the hotel. Picture ready by 3. Room was unavailable until 3 leaving no choice but to upgrade for a fee. What kind of hotel charges for an upgrade when the room booked is unavailable at the promised time?! We were barely on time for the wedding and out money. Unacceptable!

title: Where to begin....
text:
Upon entering the hotel I was ignored for a good 5-8 minutes by the person at the front desk. It was bizarre given that I was clearly the only guest standing at the front desk (note that this happened a second time with the same staff member when I came back later in the afternoon to fully check-in into my room. Oddly enough this person working the front desk had no problem attending to the white male guest who passed by...while I stood there waiting) .  Luckily someone who wanted to do their job made it to the front desk and helped me check-in my bags. 

Unfortunately my experience at this point did not improve. As I inspected the room I found a USED and UNOPENED CONDOM in the bed of my room. The front desk attempted to apologize and placed me in a somewhat less favorable room...this new room looked like it had not been cleaned in awhile given the amount of dust and the soiled carpet.  But I guess that all beats finding a used condom in your room. 

Generally the vibe of this hotel is a cross between a college dorm and a WeWork space.  The layout of the space is generally dark and unwelcoming (I guess they are going for a club vibe?), the rooms throughout the hotel are narrowly configured with entry doors that slam with ease. I did however find the engineer of the building to be very helpful...The engineer came to fix my A/C that stopped working during the middle of the heatwave that hit the area in late June.

Overall avoid this hotel if you can and find another (especially for the price).

title: Did not meet expectations
text: Arrived to a hot room because the window had been left open. Though I stated we were two guests there was still only one robe provided when we got to the room. The carpet had stains, as did the curtains. All air vents in the room were so dusty I’d doubt they’ve ever been cleaned. Some of the mini bar items were expired, as well, which was disappointing. I would give the room two stars, but I left three for my review because the front desk service was phenomenal. I would not shell out the money to stay here again because we did not feel the room was worth the cost. The hot water did not run out after filling the tub, and that was nice, as well as the bed linens. Otherwise, not worth the room price. We expected a cleaner, more updated and well kept room.

title: Awesome!
text: Staff was great, always willing to help and make you feel like at home. The room had an incredible view and was full of sunshine. The bathroom was really nice and the bed could not be any more comfortable and huge. I would certainly recommend and will surely come back to this place.

title: 5 star service
text: Was incredibly impressed with the quality of service at the Standard East Village during my stay this past weekend. There was a mixup with the dates of my room booking (my fault) and they reacted seamlessly to help me re-book and honored my original rate. In addition, they upgraded me to a much better room with incredible views and throughout my stay they were very attentive and accommodating. Was impressed by this superb level of service, which I would not have normally expected unless I was paying $1,000+ a night. Will absolutely be staying at the Standard again the next time I return to New York City.

title: Overbilled and can't get their attention
text: The hotel was fine.  The staff was nice.  No housekeeping service because of Covid. But they overbilled me, charging more than what was on the reservation confirmation for the nightly rate.  I have called them 3 times over the past week, and no one will return my calls.  Also, beware of the $30/night "facilities" charge.  That wasn't on the reservation confirmation, nor did they tell me at check in.  Definitely will not be staying there again.

title: Just what I needed!
text: My trip was as a solo traveler, to visit my daughter who just relocated to the East Village, after 16 months of pandemic separation. It was a wonderful reunion as face-timing just cannot replace a real-time hug! My stay at The Standard made this visit even more perfect. From the moment I checked in, until the moment I checked out I felt the folks there did all they could to make my stay a comfortable one. I worked out at the Crunch gym right across the street gratis as part of my stay - Crunch is so much more than any typical hotel gym so that was a treat. Room size is small but typical of what they are in NYC size wise - who cares about size when they are well-appointed like at The Standard, with a great bed, given one doesn't come to New York to hang out in a hotel room anyway. The Garden is lovely, a very unique space, and we spent hours sitting out there talking. I am so grateful to the staff at The Standard for ensuring my stay was a seamless one, as I know transitioning from NYC being shut down to being full open status right around my visit so quickly was no easy feat.

title: Great staff, great location, serious flaws
text:
I'll start with the good - the staff were friendly and quick to help with anything I needed (at least, anything they could help with). The hotel's got great views (especially from the rooftop) and is perfectly located for anything you'd like to do in the East Village, with nearby subway access making it easy to get to the rest of the city. 

However, the wifi was so slow I couldn't take zoom calls (the upgraded option at $20/day wasn't any better), there was a lot of sound that leaked in from other rooms (not rambunctious partying, just inadequate soundproofing), and as pretty as the garden is, the food was underwhelming and overpriced (thankfully there's loads of nearby alternatives).

title: Amazing vibe, amazing people
text: The Standard East Village is a wonderful place to stay. The staff are super friendly, the food is unreal, the rooms have unobstructed views of practically every angle on NYC. Book it soon, you won't regret it!

title: High-quality hotel in an excellent location.
text: The Standard East Village is well-located near Union Square and NYU and the 6 train.  The Standard Queen Room where I stayed for 2 nights was clean, well-lighted, comfortable, and more spacious than most NYC hotel rooms.  The front-desk and cafe service were both very cordial and helpful.  The breakfast food in the cafe was very good.  My only big beef is that they add a $30 "service fee" to the room rate for things that should be part of the room rate (irritating; just make it part of the published rate).  And they charge for EVERYTHING (even items like a shoeshine cloth or charger plug if you've forgotten them).  Minor quibbles:  (1) breakfast doesn't begin until 8 am, so if you're leaving for a morning flight at JFK or EWR you'll not have time for it; (2) the lamp light in my room was burned out.  But I would stay here again -- it's a cut above many nearby hotels.

title: Good room, excellent location,awful service
text: While I understand we are still in the Covid pandemic, I was completely disappointed in the service provided at this hotel.
