The lack of daily housekeeping, a room with items in need of repair and not replacing daily water & trash pick up was disappointing. Asking for additional pillows was also not responded to.

title: Funky, fun.
text: Friendly and helpful staff. Clean rooms. Enchanting garden for meals with yurt tents. Young, funky crowd. Go to the roof and surprise!! Since our daughter moved in around the corner, this will be our go to hotel on visits. We have already booked stays in June and July.

title: Fun Hotel
text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Standard. Staff is great and food at the cafe was quite good. My only criticism is that the room seemed tired because the carpet was stained, the lampshades were falling apart and the bed frame was really dinged up. The views are amazing and the location is great.

title: SEAMLESS ENJOYABLE STAY
text: Right out of the gate the front desk reception was accommodating,welcoming and reassuring our stay was going to be enjoyable. The  room was immaculate.Every aspect was new and every inch functional. Attention to detail was very evident. Overall the desk staff, particularly Rodney ,was exceptional. The hotel was central to our needs.Safe area also. Heated vestibule area was appreciated as well as roof top 360 platform with comfortable seating and spectacular views. Dining within was unique ,fun and enjoyable. Would definitely book here again.No remorse at all.

title: Disappointed
text: Room was fine. Would have rather had a glass shower than the shower/tub, but not a big deal. Views were excellent. Food was very good. Location excellent. But we had no housekeeping service, and when we asked about it, were told "you had to request it by 11 am", which, of course, no one ever informed us. And when we complained they simply offered clean towels. Won't return.

title: The best experience ever!
text:
Danny and Rodney are absolutely the best and truly made our stay.  Danny was our host and he went beyond my expectations. We booked a corner king and the city view was breathtaking! Talk about that sunrise, priceless!!!!! The bed was super comfy, I loved the shower tub duo. For a quick weekend trip or longer stay don’t hesitate to book here because you are in the middle of everything !!! Just a walk from soho, a quick Uber ride uptown. I’ve stayed in many hotels in NY and I must say the way we were taken care of here, you just can’t put a price on it. 

Can’t wait to come again!

title: SOLO self care Day
text: Exceptional front desk service. If you ever have the privilege of having Megan the day you check in, she is super friendly and very welcoming. Super polite, super friendly staff. What really sold me was the bathtub and separate stand up shower in the Deluxe King room on the 8th floor. Though they do not have a gym on site you can get a guest pass to the Crunch directly across the street. Also tje penthouse rooftop view is AMAZING. I would say the price can be a little over tje top but the bathtub and the staff made it all the worth wild. I would definitely go back. Lots of places to eat right in the area.

title: Adventure in the city.
text: After walking pass "The Garden's" decorative yurts and finding I needed reservations we settled into the dining area. We enjoyed a light dessert and flirty banter. There was a charming photo booth down near the restrooms. After a few drinks we decided to check out what an evening at The Standard had to offer. At the front desk we check to see if they had a room available with such short notice. Luckily they did and the check-in process was simple and discreet. The room was not only clean and spacious but had a breathtaking view that continued throughout into the bathroom. Every corner of the space is perfect for any photogenic moment.  The room service menu caters to a healthy yet flavorful pallet. (I went with the acai bowl). With a noon check out staying in was an easy tasks. The front desk attendant was pleasant and informative with assisting with check out Moving forward, The Standard will be my go to hotel whenever I'm in Manhattan.

title: One of the best views of the city... FREE
text: I was indecisive on where to stay and looked for HOURS. I had never really been to Manhattan and we were going for a quick weekend. I highly recommend this location. We upgraded to a king corner room and it was well worth it. It’s tub was incredible and the fridge was stocked with anything you want. Got a time lapse of the beautiful sunrise over the city. It’s hard to feel a place out by looking at pictures and at first I thought the room looked bland, but it’s actually perfect. The bed it INCREDIBLY comfortable... we actually want to get the same mattress topper at home now. The room is simple and cool but perfect for a quick stay as we were exploring the city most of the time. Parking is easy (around the corner) and they will hold your bags if you want to keep exploring. Oh yeah and you have access to the penthouse on the 21st floor with an incredible (almost) 360 view of the city around you. You definitely have to check it out.

title: Amazing stay, fantastic location
text: The Standard is in the absolute heart of the East Village. If you're coming to NYC to see the sights, there's no better location than this. Their outdoor dining was delicious, and they even had adorable little "yurts" set up to make things extra cozy! Every part of the experience was great and we can't wait to come back.

title: Fantastic stay with my family
text: Booked this last minute for a quick trip to NYC with my kids and had the best experience!  The hotel staff was super nice and accodomating.  Great location where you can walk to a lot of places and also multiple subway stops close by.  The rooms were clean and bright with great views.  The best surprise was the rooftop deck!  360 degree views of NY.  Looking forward to returning for another stay!

title: My family and I had the BEST experience!
text: The Standard East Village is located in a prime spot. You have union square, east village, and a short walk to Soho.  Aside from the location, the amenities that this hotel provides were enjoyed by us all!  My kids and I ate on the rooftop overlooking the Empire State Building and the Freedom Tower! They had an awesome ping pong table my kids enjoyed playing with. The Standard East Village also provided bikes! My bestie and I took a bike ride along the east river and it was gorgeous!

title: designer
text:
amazing city views.
bright bright bright.
CLEAN!
attentive & gracious staff!
excellence in service.
great location.
food delicious.
would stay again most definitely.
beautiful sunrise views. 
from my arrival to my departure my stay at the standard east village was seamless.
thank you & see you again soon.

title: Always incredible
text: The view is incredible mini bar is amazing it's my favorite hotel in NYC! The Garden restaurant is great and the staff is friendly and helpful. There's shopping and great food close by and the rooftop lounge is great.

title: The Staff is Great
text: My fiancé and I were there recently for a week. The staff was fabulous and on top of everything, as NY hotel staff usually are. The only downside was the guests in the room next to ours (we were in 1105) were smoking in their room. This is a problem I have with the guests and not the hotel, but it made the stay less enjoyable as the rooms are small and their smoke woke me up at 4 am. I will stay at this hotel again despite that, it is not the hotel’s fault. Man some people...

title: Drinks at The Standard Cafe
text: Met up with some girlfriends at the cafe in the front. The drinks were amazing. I highly recommend the No Problem cocktail - delicious!! The staff had such great vibes that made us want to stay all night. Thank you Damon & Brooke for taking good care of us. Can't wait to come back soon! 10/10 recommend to check out the cafe!

title: FABULOUS!
text: Absolutely fabulous hotel!! Have never slept in a more comfortable bed. The pillows, the mattress, the comforter, the sheets...heavenly! Everyone working there was so kind and helpful. I highly recommend this lovely hotel! I will for sure be back! Thank you!

title: Hotel with an attitude
text:
First I had a room that smelled like poop.
The bar tender intern can't make cocktails but still serves it.
The WiFi is incredibly slow, even after upgrading to their "premium wifi".
The front desk is completely overwhelmed, having to do 5 jobs at once. He's picking up calls in the middle of serving customers.
The bar front of the house is selective and lets guests know they "came too late" although she was just seating other people. When complaining about she is still waiting for other guests she mentions to complain to her manager.

The attitude of anyone I've talked to is "What's up" as in "what's your problem". It feels like a very hostile environment.

title: a truly FAB experience
text: i got this hotel for my parents and it was the best decision i could have made. the hotel made all of downtown super accessible to them! there was no shortage of restaurants, parks, shops, etc. for them to explore. the room was also spacious, pristine, and comfortable — and had the most divine skyscraper views. i deeply appreciate the hotel staff, they were nothing but kind and patient with my parents and made their stay as enjoyable as possible. A+ all around!

title: Excellent service! Excellent location! Excellent atmosphere!
text: I saw their ads online so I booked their junior studio for my anniversary staycation. Everyone is amazing and nice there, especially Franck and Daniel who assisted me with the set up to suprise my girlfriend, as well as Megan who made the beautiful bed with roses on for us. And their penthouse has a spectacular view of nyc that No one should miss. I highly recommend this place for couples, but maybe not as family friendly.

title: Underwhelmed
text: I had an overnight stay at this hotel and I have to say it was underwhelming at best. The best part of my stay was the great customer service I received from Ben and I believe the host, "Rachel" at check in. The low-points of my stay were the stained carpet in the first room I checked into, which was rectified by Ben by switching me to a larger room with a better view. The larger room with a better view had empty shampoo, conditioner and body wash bottles which I found out after I had already gotten into the shower. At dinner, the restaurant staff ignored me as I sat in the restaurant for about 30 minutes before being attended to. Thankfully Rachel the host was able to resolve the situation and made sure my food order was put in before the restaurant closed. Overall the hotel had a cool retro vibe. I have stayed at other Standard Hotels in South Beach and LA but this one was by far the worst experience.

title: Nice staycation get-away
text: We treated ourselves to a night here and very much enjoyed the location of the hotel and the view. Our room was a corner king on the 17th floor with views east and south and it was very quiet. It had a fairly small but nice tub which was also the shower and an extremely soft (too soft for my taste) bed. Breakfast was included and was very nice in the café. We had wanted to try out the winter garden as well but changed our mind when we heard about the $100 minimum consumption per person requirement - it was also booked out on the weekend. We enjoyed our experience but compared to the High Line Standard we found that the better value for money - the room there was much bigger, cosier and better equipped. This one in the East Village had a desk but not an area to sit for two people and the lighting situation wasn’t great either. In some areas it felt and looked a bit incomplete - cables lying around, the heating vent was noisy, there were no slippers and just one robe... it somehow just didn’t have a perfect feel to it the way the room on the west side had. But it was still enjoyable and nice to have such direct access to the lower east side and all the neighborhoods around it!

title: Lovely hotel, great view, but loud party ruined sleep
text:
I stayed here with my family for a two night staycation. The room was small, but with an amazing view. Staff was courteous and helpful. 
Overall we had a very good experience, with the notable exception that there was an extremely loud party in the rooms above us that stretched well past 2 am. I went up there to check it out to make sure that it wasn't just a moderate party and that it was just thin walls that were to blame. It seems that someone had booked several adjacent rooms for afterhours partying, and that many people were squeezed into the tiny rooms, with drinking games and whatnot. The noise could clearly be heard throughout the  hall.  I called a couple of times to complain, and the desk was very polite and told me that they would send up security right away. Unfortunately, the noise would die down somewhat, but then start right up again. I barely slept that night. 
It's too bad because we really like the hotel and location, and we had a nice dinner at the cafe's outdoor dining setup.  I would also advice against getting room service for breakfast; as another review mentioned we got a slice and half of toast and a to-go cup of cold coffee with no milk.  Better to go down to the cafe or grab a coffee around the corner.  
As for the partying, it may have been a one-off, or maybe people are booking rooms to get around the early closing hours at bars. I just wish the management was a little more serious in shutting it down.

title: Cool building and location, lacking in almost everything else.
text:
Charged a $30/day facility fee for access to the gym and common areas of the hotel. Staff refused to remove this from the final folio. Rooms which aren’t classified as a suite are downright uncomfortable to spend time in. While the bed was ok, the desk chair was intolerably uncomfortable to sit in for more than a few minutes. The carpeting was dirty, walls were cracked, and charging outlets for your devices were scarce. The room I selected was a king deluxe. 

If you wish to enjoy your room for anything aside from sleeping, best to explore other properties.

title: Beautiful view...poor experience
text:
My husband and I stayed for a night for a staycation over Valentine's Day weekend. We splurged on a King Corner room so we could enjoy the view. 

Our room was both by the elevator and had a door to the adjoining room next door. The door was NOT soundproofed in any way, because we could hear everything (and I mean, everything) happening in the room next door as if they guests were right next to us. It basically felt like we had no privacy, which is a shame. 

The next morning we ordered room service for breakfast, and it took an hour and a half to arrive- we had to call the front desk just to ask for an update. They said it was "on the way up"- and then took another 30 minutes. When it finally came, 30 minutes before check out, our food was cold. My french toast was a single piece and burned, and the "pot of coffee" was a single, luke warm to-go cup. My husband's "pot of tea," on the other hand, came in 3 individual to-go cups.

title: The ultimate staycation
text: My fiancé recently surprised me with a weekend getaway for my birthday and this hotel blew away all my expectations! The hotel helped create a romantic setting by having champagne and my favorite snacks awaiting upon my arrival.  The view of the city from our room was spectacular, and the guest service was outstanding. The food was amazing - whether we were eating at the Standard’s restaurant or ordering room service, everything was delicious and service was immaculate. We are definitely going to come back and I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Even though we live across the Hudson in NJ, it still felt like we were on vacation. It was so lovely to have a mini staycation, and even in this climate, we felt very safe as all of the covid protocols were followed above and beyond by the hotel.

title: Had the most fabulous Staycation at the best hotel!
text: Every part of our stay at the Standard East Village was superb, from check in to check out. Danny was super friendly when checking us in and gave us a beautiful room with incredible views of the city. Franck helped us with room service and the food was excellent - highly recommend the Standard burger! Overall, cannot recommend this hotel enough, the rooms are stylish and comfortable, the food is amazing and the staff are incredibly thoughtful and attentive! Can't wait to stay here again.

title: Wonderful Staycation!
text: My partner and I celebrated our anniversary with an overnight staycation at the Standard EV and boy was it an evening well-spent! Danny, Franck, Paige, and the whole Standard team were wonderful and the views were phenomenal throughout the  room. Highly, highly recommend!

title: Staycation
text: My partner and I both work from home. We decided we needed a change of scenery and booked a room at the Standard East Village location for one night. When we arrived we were greeted by Megan, who was very helpful. We followed her instructions and completed our contactless check in. We entered into our clean spacious room and settled in. We ordered room service, sushi and wine. The entire staff was very kind. Overall our stay was just what we needed. We will definitely book again! Thank you to the entire staff for showing us care even in the midst of a global pandemic! We are grateful.

title: Hotel with a Heart and Great Energy
text: Hotel was super full of Energy and Covid safe.  Staff being not only Hip but kind, thoughtful and anything needed it was taken care of in minutes.. no second call or chasing them.   This is a super location for business and personal, close to everything in walking distance.   Front Desk Franck was super with his personal attention and the staff around him.  I can only say 5 stars all around and handling 2021 in style.  Keep being fabulous.

title: Not so bad
text: So I decided to do a staycation for my birthday. The gentlemen with glasses who checked me in the front desk was so nice and helpful. Check in was a breeze. I went to the room, corner king in 1602 and the view was spectacular. I will say that the bedding was clean, however, there was hair on the bed but I bought my own cleaning products and took care of it, using disinfectant to spray the sheets and pillows. The lip pillow needs to go lolol. The bathroom was clean and had enough towels. Only other complaint I have is there was no iron lol. Oh and I was super annoyed by the fact that I had a room there but couldn't eat at the restaurant downstairs. The hostess had this really dismissive tone. It was my birthday and she could've accommodated for one person. That also played a large part in me not ordering room service because I know where it was going to. Other than that, staff was nice and when I called for the desk for help to close the window they sent someone up right away.

title: Good but devious
text: It is a great location, lovely staff, ok rooms, great bar.  However, the quoted room price is a lie!  They added a 30% facilities fee to my room!  I wasn't holding a convention there.  Classic bait and switch flim flam

title: Fabulous room for a quick stay
text: Excellent top-notch service from the staff for a last-minute stay! The comfortable and affordable room had a beautiful bath with a large soaking tub and a separate shower. And the rooftop had a great city view for relaxing!

title: Excellent service; beautiful rooms and views
text: I stayed at the Standard in August during COVID with my daughter before her move in to college dorm. We came with a trunk FULL of bags and dorm stuff. Franck Hermann, the Director at the Front Office, greeted us with two carts, unloaded and brought everything up with a smile. 3 days later, he did it again with even more stuff as  my daughter moved in. This was just one example of the superb service all around. Rooms and public areas are clean and completely COVID safe, hand sanitizers available everywhere, the rooms are beautifully decorated and the atmosphere is fun and professionally managed. Kudos on a great experience - we were thankful for all your help!

title: Great View and Staff!
text: Got the Downtown room, view was amazing! Danny at the front desk was super helpful. We ate at the Garden, which was beautiful and perfect especially during covid. There was a $100 minimum per person which I thought was a bit high but added up quickly with drinks and food. Overall great experience and staff!

title: Expected more
text:
The rates are really cheap because of the pandemic, however the experience of the hotel room itself was poor overall. The room wasn't very clean. hairs on the sheets, the mini bar was filthy, the tray where the food was looked like it hadn't been cleaned for a long time. Crumbs and old food on the bottom and almost every food item was expired. Which says a lot when it's a can of pringles and a snickers bar…

The cafe food was good and the service there was great.

The front desk and cafe staff were very nice however the restaurant hostess was very rude. When asked if a table was available and if anything was set aside for hotel guests, she was flippant and dismissive and walked away.

title: Great Dining Experience
text: My friends and I decided to have New Years Eve dinner at the Standard and it was a fantastic experience. We booked a private yurt and felt extremely safe especially under the current Covid-19 circumstances. Our hostess was kind and helpful with all our requests. The food and drinks were exceptional. I highly recommend the espresso martinis. Heather was our event planner and she got everything right. We even got in contact with someone named Shirley and together they both got us desserts for the special occasion. We will definitely be visiting again. Happy New Yurt!

title: I would come back
text: The staff was always so so nice and helpful with my 1 million questions and requests. They really made me feel welcome. Highly recommend the bathtub. Very small cons- the mini fridge didn’t get cold enough for me, and there was some stains on carpet, and I couldn’t cast any movies from my phone to the tv, but otherwise it was perfect. I realized with the view I had, I didn’t even need to watch movies. I am a tough guest to please and for me to not want to leave says a lot.

title: An appropriate name for this hotel
text:
I have been intrigued by Standard Hotels since it's first property opened in Hollywood 20 years ago. I had a last minute change of plans and booked a 1 night stay in a corner king room. 

Looking through the countless images of the rooms and suites on tripadvisor, you'll see large regular and corner rooms with near floor to ceiling windows unlike the corner room I was assigned to. The windows were pretty high, beginning around my chest and going to the ceiling. There were a couple push open windows and was curious to see if that helped regular the room temperature better. Big mistake. The windows are so heavy, they are nearly  impossible to close and create a forceful draft that rattles the front and bathroom door unrelentlessly.

The desk and bedside lamps are unintuitive to turn on and I found myself going downstairs to ask the desk staff how to use them (the front desk can be difficult to reach over the phone, before and during your stay, and had the most success in communication if i go to them).

Outlets are few and far between and I only found 1 that wasn't used, under the bed. The bathroom has a strange, poignant and off-putting scent to it. The scent of the Hotel's branded Davines hair/skincare products have a unique smell to them as well but is irrelevant to that of the bathroom. The bathtub is awkwardly set higher then the floor and found it to be quite dangerous in getting out of the shower, even at my height, 6'2. Also there was not a steamer or iron located in the room.

When I made the reservation I booked the "standard time" rate which they advertise it as a rate that lets you choose your check-in and check-out times. After making the reservation, the fine print states that it applies to reservations made with at least 7 days notice. I did book my reservation the morning of my check-in but this was one of the rates that I was able to select, booking from the hotel directly.

Even after feeling underwhelmed and slightly disappointed with my first stay at a Standard Hotel, the have a delightfully different point of view of what a hotel can be. I love the tenement entrance, the fluorescent lights in the elevator, the hand drawn map on the room cards, the lobby decor and. more.

title: The Standard really does set the standard!
text:
I was a little nervous to stay at a hotel during the pandemic, but felt very assured from the moment I booked with The Standard East Village. I've stayed at multiple locations (pre-covid19), and trusted cleanliness would be a high priority. Check in is all virtual on your phone before you arrive, so the concierge merely hands you a key with a gloved hand. Room service is delivered hands-free. The room was comfortable and they were even able to accommodate my request for a separate tub and shower! The amenities were lovely. Really an ideal staycation.

My only note would be that I wish the room service came on a platter. They gave individually wrapped meals (which I appreciated for safety!) but it was a bit difficult to eat in bed! :)

title: The Standard (of what a hotel stay should be)
text:
My wife and I have stayed at amazing hotels around the world. I found The Standard (your location) to be very quaint. The staff is very friendly. The rooms were cozy, (perfect NYC size) clean, and comfortable. 

What we care about most is friendliness, cleanliness, and comfort. You guys have it all. Keep up the great work.

title: Wonderful Stay at the Standard EV
text: Traveling during a pandemic is far less enjoyable but the team at the Standard EV made me feel comfortable, safe and taken care of. The room was incredibly clean and comfortable and housekeeping only comes when you request it. The front desk staff could not be more accommodating or helpful. The outdoor garden restaurant was great also, we sat in a “yurt” which is an open-walled enclosure that has a heat lamp overhead. Compared to most outdoor dining in NYC, there was plenty of room separating you from other guests. The food is also delicious highlights including the hot cocktails and the pasta. I would definitely return back when I need to be back in NYC.

title: Displaced but felt like home!
text:
In March when the world was just starting to learn about COVID my roommate was traveling in Italy and I was forced to live out of a hotel for two weeks while she quarantined. 

It was rough to be displaced for two weeks with everything that was happening in the world at that time but the staff at the Standard East village honestly made me feel right at home. Daniel (the manager) and his crew were so friendly and welcoming and knowing I was kind of stuck there unexpectedly went so above and beyond just to make sure I felt comfortable. 10/10 would stay there again, hopefully next time under more fun circumstances!

title: Great View, Cozy Stay, Convenient Location
text: Loved staying here. They were Covid-safe, friendly, and very helpful. Some of the best restaurants, Il Buco Alimentari & Jones, are just around the corner as well as Kettl for some of the best tea. I was there for a 9-day stay and I will definitely be coming back.

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: This hotel was great! From check in to check out, the service I received was top notch. Very friendly, very accommodating, VERY comfy. Great venues (all which include tasty food) and the staff almost felt like friends lol I knew of the brand beforehand but now I get it! Also very safe. Sanitizing stations everywhere and they’ll stop you right in your tracks if they don’t see a mask. Don’t miss out :) thanks again guys

title: Best hotel in nyc
text:
I’m going on just about my 14 night stays here at the Standard East village. I am
Not a huge fan of the bustling atmosphere of the Big Apple at times , but the endless amount of opportunities to transcends one’s comfort or just a little getaway from New Jersey is sometimes in order.  The staff at this incarnation of the many others (Miami Standard Spa is enchanting as well ).  To be honest , the East village standard hotel is ultimately the best location I’ve ever experienced + ALL are top notch hospitality professionals.  •Yesterday, I was struck down by food poisoning and after a short wait to ensure that the service rules were followed and the staff member had been in line with the others .  I’m not going to say that the lobby is my favorite place to get updated , as I am not sure if my “look” is that of the chic , jet setting types with unusually low thresholds of patience, it was understood that these individuals at the front desk are overloaded with their tasks (baggage claim, Smiling, special Nyc types of personal accommodations and they are also responsible for room service and minor security issues and this is on top of being constantly barraged with questions about pretty self expected Personal attentions  ( it’s Manhattan).  All this is going on while the team members- I believe lead by Franck who is the best team leader in hospitality. He is Calm +understanding, and listens to the guest whom he is engaging with- as all the staff does. Very nice to see this personal professionalism in the hustle and bustle of Manhattan.   ALL team
Members of the Standard LES are wonderful and thoughtful.  It’s my sanctuary from the world.  Continued appreciation.  It’s not easy,, yet these hospitality pros have mastered all of it... thank you for your understanding and I’m not going to be using any competitor hotels in the area .. I hope Always. Keep up the good work!

title: AMAZING stay - felt like second home
text: I spent two weeks at the Standard east village and it truly became my second home.  In fact I extended my stay because I loved it so much. The staff treated me like family and was sure to take care of any needs. The room itself was beautiful with the best views of the city - and quiet - with an amazing tub and a lot of space. The cafe downstairs has a great vibe and was a regular spot for me, whether I was meeting a friend or needed somewhere to work during the day. The staff was always available and extremely accommodating if I needed anything. Combination of fun, energetic vibe but still quiet and peaceful makes this my go-to hotel in NY. Thanks Standard!

title: Great spot in the East Village (dog friendly!)
text: We picked this hotel last minute because of its close location to some friends we would be visiting, but it’s attentive and friendly staff, wonderful views, nice cafe and the comfort of its safety protocols made it a perfect spot for our 3 days in New York. The hotel was very dog friendly, both in its policies and its staff, including everyone at the cafe. We had a higher room which provided great views of everything from the Freedom tower north to the Empire State Building from its floor to ceiling windows. As it was our first trip to New York during Covid, I would like to note we felt very safe and comfortable. We highly recommend The Standard if you are going to want to be in or around the east village and especially if you have a dog!

title: The Standard Does it Again
text:
Franck and his team exemplified The Standard experience; polite, professional, ever flexible and helpful, great vibes - they just get it. 

From Downtown and WeHo to Miami and Meatpacking, I have to say the East Village was my favorite stay yet. The whole crew (Danny, Lisa, Megan and all those I couldn't recall my name but certainly won't forget!) made our stay extra special. 

Couldn't recommend the EV spot for a vacation, staycation and everywhere in between. And extra points for the excellent safety protocol through cv. 

Much love!

title: The chicken club is a must-have!
text: Great location, great service, great views! Service was courteous and prompt, as well as friendly -- made my stay relaxing. Cozy room with a great view and comfortable bedding -- I would recommend it highly!

title: Great stay
text: Easy Covid check in, great service (they even got me ice bags for an injury I already had). Beautiful rooms and views. Great service in the restaurant. They were incredibly careful about sanitation and distancing yet maintained a hospitality attitude.

title: Always outstanding — no detail overlooked!
text:
I can’t say enough great things about the Standard in East Village (and the Meatpacking location as well, for that matter!) To put it briefly: the magic of this hotel is their unfaltering attention to detail.

The staff are spectacular (thanks for everything, Franck!), the amenities and rooms are uniquely and thoughtfully designed, and the location is one of the best in NYC. I stay here regularly for nights on the town and am never disappointed. I recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family, and even when visitors from out of town aren’t staying there, I generally bring them through to one of the trendy bars or restaurants on site (I cannot wait for No Bar to reopen!! And the grilled cheese & tomato soup combo at the Café is drool-worthy!!) I thoroughly enjoy my time at the Standard and can’t wait to explore more of the company’s location in other cities once regular travel resumes post-COVID. 

One last thing — do not miss out on the merch! I cherish my cheeky Standard souvenirs.

title: Perfect location, warm hospitality, incredible views
text: The warm welcome from the folks at The Standard East Village is like checking in to your own personal apartment building in New York. The garden bar is the oasis you need after a long day of meetings and the view from every room is fit for a postcard. The small details throughout your stay are so thoughtful... hand sanitizer, ear plugs, thimbles, etc. I can not recommend this location of The Standard enough... I will be back soon.

title: Low Standards at this Standard
text:
Worst of the US locations. Pretentious staff, cant be bothered to give any details at check-in, or even greet guests. Or maybe its just me that they opted to ignore.  

Room service, if they even answer the phone, is terrible. First time I tried to order they said the kitchen was closed at 9p. The menu says 10p so they should update those, or at least tell guests upon check in. Tried again the next afternoon. 2p, called three times. No answer. Decided to go down to front desk to see what was up. There was 1 employee there, doing nothing. Not on the phone. Not checking anyone in. No one else even in the lobby. I asked if he’d heard me calling his reply, “Im the only one here.” Didnt know it took 2 people to place an order, but fine. Placed the order. Got the food, which was left in a bag on the floor. Gross. But, they forgot my drink. I called back down to say they’d forgotten and they same dude says, “well, I didnt forget it. Someone else did.” Okay, so how does that help me? Another 15 mins. Order complete. 

The pillows had a funny smell to them. Not a dirty smell, more like a chemical.

Being down staff due to covid is not an excuse to treat people like crap. Prior to the East Village location, Id stayed at the High Line location  - AND IT WAS AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE! Friendly, diverse, accommodating staff with covid precautions throughout the property. East Village was the total opposite.

title: Great visit to the the Standard East Village
text: My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary and stayed for 2 nights at the Standard East Village. The rooms, lobby, and roof deck were all really clean and everyone was wearing a mask and plenty of hand sanitizer in the lobby. We had a great stay and loved going out to eat in the East Village and having drinks at the Standard bar in the outside seating area. We're already planning a trip back before the end of 2020!

title: Welcome Back!
text: Thank you for the warm welcoming. Marcos was amazing at check-in very positive and knowledgeable. My stay was beyond perfect for it was like I was the only one there (so quiet & peaceful) welcome back guys stay safe. Lisa thanks again for the well wishes on the way out...

title: FABULOUS STAY! A++++
text: Must book your room now!  My daughter and I had such a fabulous stay at the Standard.  We spent two nights in this chic hotel and were so impressed by the staff --especially Daniel.  He went above and beyond for us, arranging a late night dinner up on the roof top deck, was so warm and welcoming and made us feel right at home.  The room decor is modern, with comfortable beds and large windows that overlooked the city.  Excellent COVID precautions, no contact check in, room was very clean and there are sanitizer dispensers in strategic locations.  We thought the food was delicious and well priced and we treated ourselves to room service one am.  The hotel is in a fantastic location, has a lovely, private garden where you can have a meal/drink, or if you want to eat out, many restaurants/choices within walking distance.  They even have a gym, should walking around the city not tire you out enough:).  Cannot recommend this hotel more highly and will absolutely stay there again and again!  Thanks so much for a wonderful stay!

title: Wonderful staycation
text: We live in the Bronx but were constrained in our travel choices by Covid.  I saw a post about vacationing in a New York City hotel and ended up booking three nights at The Standard East Village.  Our room had beautiful views on two sides 19 floors up.  We walked all over the East Village, visited Veselka for blintzes, Superiority Burger for beautiful salads and Caffe Panna for ice cream.  Traveled a little ways to The Morgan Library to see the David Hockney and Bettye Saar exhibits and saw the re opened Museum of Modern Art.  The Standard has a cafe and garden with outside seating and offers room service.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  A wonderful stay during a difficult time!

title: The Standard East Village soars like a Phoenix from the ashes of COVID
text: We felt like we won the lottery when i checked in with my wife and 1 year old into The Standard East Village in NYC.  Firstly, the person that came out to help us with unload our Range Rover which was stuffed to the max with our luggage and baby stuff happened to be the Front Office Director, Frank Hermann, who saw that we needed space and gave us a courtesy upgrade to the largest swankiest room in the hotel on one of the top floors with an exhilarating view of manhattan from the Freedom Tower to the Empire State Building.  Seems like, during Covid-19, the hotel kept their top staff and managers to provide an even better than standard service and attention to detail, an all-star team if you will.  And boy, did we test them.  Having a baby means we need help.  They bought brand new humidifiers for us because our baby was sensitive, they whipped out of these amazing face masks that were so high quality they performed as if they were custom fit.  They helped us with fresh towels and room cleanings multiple times a day with the most cheerful demeanor that I thought i was in some kind of Hollywood movie and we were the royal family of Siam.  One night there was a party on the rooftop of a neighboring hotel which was a little loud, not so much but enough to keep our baby from sleeping at 7:30 pm and Daniel Alvarez, the night manager called the NYPD to make them stop.  Pretty cool.  Lisa at the front desk during the mornings was super sweet and with the most cheerful smile gave me one of their fancy face masks in super chic black whenever i absentmindedly would leave my room without one.  Special requests?  No problem.  I have to have sprouted organic steel-cut oats every morning and the hotel chef prepared them for me precisely per my cooking instructions every morning at no charge.  Oh, and then there're are our two dogs, Chanel and Ponzu.  They need lots of attention and service.  The staff were so understanding and accommodating because i know how hard it is to clean up after them since at home, I'm the maid, and the manny and the general on call slave to my wife and kid.   Not at the Standard, East Village.  I didn't have to lift a finger.  Now that's a 5-star hotel vacation.  One more note.  There was this super sweet Tibetan Houseman who came by with fresh towels on demand, emptied mini-fridge whenever we needed even more space for our baby food and fresh fruit for us all.  The whole team was top notch.  Seamless.  Daily maid service was impeccable which is hard enough to come by during the best of times.  The whole staff at The Standard East Village were hip, super cheerful, and most of all, sublimely competent.     Bravo.

title: Great staycation during COVID times
text: We did an overnight stay at The Standard over Labor Day weekend and it was as good as we had hoped given the circumstances. Staff was super friendly, a ton of sanitation stations and very clear health guidelines which made us feel safe. The room was comfortable, albeit a bit small. Overall, great stay and would definitely stay here again.

title: Great views, modern design and home feeling service
text: This was a great staycation for me, enjoyed a beautiful room, with lots of natural light and a great view while working from the room. All staff were very helpful and friendly to make me feel at home.

title: Great weekend stay!
text: Had a wonderful time at the Standard, the place was clean, efficient and made us feel beyond at home. Staff was very kind and loved to chat! Will surely stay there again! Looking forward to recommending it to friends as well.

title: Hotel fine... Parking Nightmare
text: Front desk help was terrific.  Easy, safe check in.   Nice, smallish room with a beautiful view of midtown.   Only negative was parking - garage was 2 blocks away and highly disorganized at pickup.   Took me well over an hour to get my car - probably just a bad day, but still.... added an hour onto my 7 hour trip home.

title: Fabulous staycation
text: I live in manhattan and took advantage of the great rates at the standard east village and changed up my views working from home. Hotel was superbly clean and had a wonderful night stay. Highly recommend

title: Pretty mediocre.
text:
Cons;
Small rooms with a very small amount of window space for light. No coffee in rooms. Lighting wasn't very bright. Desk chair was uncomfortable. Front desk got into a screaming fight with delivery man about wearing a mask and using front door.  That was lovely. waited 30 minutes for coffee in the lobby bar since they just got there and no coffee was made... paid 5 dollars for coffee for that pleasure. 
hotel was pretty empty and they didn't upgrade me. 
Pros: 
check in was lovely except for the fact they were empty but didn't upgrade me. Sheet and bed were nice. Place was clean.

title: I love the standard
text: The standard east village is my favorite standard. Super small, boutique vibes with a great restaurant and bar. Highly recommend. The manager Franck is the best! The view from the rooms is amazing, you can see the whole east village. The location is great too if you're spending most of your time downtown. It's close to all the trains too which makes it super easy to get around

title: Birthday Weekend
text:
I did a floor take over as part of their post COVID re-opening, the whole experience was phenomenal all the rooms were exceptionally clean. My guests and I had the best time. Highly recommend.

The views are INSANE, the beds are so comfortable!!!!!!

title: The Standard East Village
text: This hotel was so beautiful with an amazinggg view! The rooms are nice and clean. The staff were very helpful throughout my stay and answered any questions I had. The location was perfect because there were so many options to go eat at. 10/10 recommend.

title: Arrived in town for work and almost forgot what I was doing.
text: This hotel is literally The Standard. I enjoyed staying here for almost an entire week because of a business trip that got prolonged. Usually that’s a nightmare for having to book a room and work more. Keeping my room was nothing more than a friendly chat with the staff who was more than willing to do whatever I asked of them. Now let’s talk about the view. Hands down, the best view from the middle of the city!  I’ve never experienced New York City from that vantage point. The rooms are very modern and comfortable. Parking was very easy and right across the street. Since I parked my company vehicle there the entire time, I thought I’d have an issue with food... nope. A quick walk around the corner and you’re face first into some of New York’s best food offerings.  I cannot say enough about the hospitality shown from the staff here. They knew me by name and would even say hi if they saw me outside. My one complaint is I wish I could have stayed longer and extended my work trip. Will be back soon!

title: Wonderful Stay, Even In Era of Covid-19 - August 2020
text: Have stayed in multiple NYC properties in the $300/day range over the past 25 years. The Standard brand and this East Village property in particular is unique - truly a "boutique" property. Splurged on a "Downtown Studio" and the views were truly stunning. Wouldn't describe the room as "Grand" but very well appointed, clean and quite comfortable. The service was top notch even in these difficult times of COVID. Front desk staff always presented with smiles and were thoroughly professional. What is most impressive and truly unique is the 21st floor balcony which feels like a private terrace offering 360 degree views of the city. I enthusiastically recommend this property and the Standard brand and will most definitely book again.

title: Favorite hotel in NYC
text: The room was a corner room with a beautiful view of NYC. The restaurant offers great food and even better cocktails. We enjoyed the patio/garden int he back of the restaurant which was not overly crowded. I always stay here when visiting NYC.

title: Fantastic Hotel in the East Village
text: We chose The Standard for our last visit to NYC for the location alone, but we were so thrilled to have found a great hotel awaited us in the East Village. The hotel is nicely appointed, has a lively bar and outdoor cafe/garden area, wonderful city views from the rooftop deck and our room was very nice. We travel to NY frequently and have adopted The Standard as our new place. Highly recommend if you want to stay near NYU without the Greenwich hotel prices. The Standard won't disappoint!

title: Trendy, modern hotel in East Village with Incredible Views
text: The Standard, with 21 floors, offers some of the best views of the city one could imagine -- of both uptown and downtown.  The staff is friendly and helpful, and the rooms are spacious and very clean.  Wonderful hotel!

title: First Hotel Experience during COVID
text:
I decided to book a last minute room for a night at The Standard when I had to work late in Manhattan. I actually live in New York but in the outer part of Queens, so when I needed to work late this week I figured it would be easiest to stay in the city. 
To be certain, my expectations of staying in a hotel during this confusing time are a bit worrisome, so I chose the Standard based on their reputation. They are known to have very nice accommodations, excellent staff and an overall good atmosphere - which after all, is what's important after an exhausting day at work (or out on the town during normal circumstances). After staying there I have been reassured of the hard work they have made to keep that reputation during the most difficult and trying time for the industry. 

I arrived late, sometime after 1am. This is generally a time of day that most people have the least amount of patience but I was met by two very friendly staff - so friendly, in fact, it threw me off guard a little. I mean, let's be real, it's the middle of the night, and I don't expect anyone to be friendly, but they were genuinely helpful and got me checked in and on my way to my room in no time at all. 

On my way to my room I was able to observe that the hotel was indeed very clean. When I stepped into my room, it smelled clean, there was hand sanitizer available for me to use, and I had noticed some small differences in the bathroom amenities from my stays at hotels prior to COVID. The bed was amazing, and the full open views of Manhattan from my 15th floor room were the perfect touch as I fell asleep. Everything was perfect. 

In the morning, I enjoyed a very nice meal at the cafe attached to the hotel. Again, friendly staff and amazing food! The espresso was perfect and if you do stay here, please please try the fresh orange juice! 

Overall I couldn't be happier with my stay at The Standard, and I will most definitely be staying there again in the coming weeks and months on long work nights - and I will absolutely be recommending my friends and family stay there as well if they want a pleasant, safe and comfortable experience during this weird COVID era. 

If you are having doubts about staying in a hotel right now, do yourself a favor and book a room at The Standard. You won't be disappointed. 

Thank you to all the friendly staff that made my experience a breeze!

title: Great visit during pandemic, felt safe
text: I booked a night here in August, as I had an appt at Mt Sinai in Union Square. Loved the attention they paid to COVID-19 safety procedures. Cheeky signs reminding people to wear masks, as well as sanitize hands. Plexiglass barriers at the front desk. Really nice disposable thimbles so you felt safe using the elevator. Reasonable parking rates in a nearby lot. I didn’t try the bar or restaurant but both had outdoor seating. Room service was also available (but there are lots of restaurants with outdoor seating nearby too). If i needed to be in this area of the city again, i would definitely come back.

title: Great location, great service, great amenities
text: I was really happy with the hotel. The location can't be beat - it is in an interesting neighborhood with lots of great restaurants nearby. The hotel is charming and the staff friendly and efficient. I love the floor to ceiling windows in the room, which filled the room with light (another benefit of this neighborhood is that the surrounding buildings are lower than in midtown, allowing light into the room). I particularly appreciated the amenities, most specifically the large towels (bath sheets rather than standard-sized bath towels) and a full-sized and powerful hairdryer. The shower was also huge. The only criticism I have is that there were no drawers in my room, so I was not able to fully unpack my suitcase.

title: Wonderful staff!
text: My first time back to NYC since the pandemic and I wasn't sure what to expect. The Standard made wonderful accommodations to make my stay as safe and clean as possible, while still providing a fun and casual experience. The staff was so warm and friendly, I felt like I was staying at a friend's very cool place in the East Village, rather than a hotel equipped for a new era of social distancing. The location is obviously stellar and that rooftop deck with a glass of wine while the sun goes down can make you forget all your worries and remember that NYC remains one of the best cities in the world.

title: Much Needed Escape
text: Stayed first week of reopening. Staff was wonderful. All common areas and room was extremely clean and sanitized. Views from the room were breathtaking. The bed was extremely comfortable and in classic Standard fashion the hotel just screams sexy

title: Great time!!
text: Spent a wonderful night at the Standard in the East Village! The room was comfortable and the staff accommodating!! The view from the rooftop lounge was breathtaking!!!I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a get-away in NYC!!

title: My home away from home
text: My recent stay at the E. Village felt like coming home, the front desk staff were extraordinary in extraordinary times (I’d visited the first day after reopening post-covid). I was in town to see friends before leaving the US for an extended period. Hosting friends at the penthouse, then a larger bunch down in the garden, was the exact open-air, socially distanced sayonara I couldn’t imagine having anywhere else. They’ve provided the same chill, emotionally intelligent, competent service I’ve experienced at West Hollywood; the High Line, and Miami. I don’t stay anywhere else.

title: My new favorite spot in Manhattan
text:
This hotel was a great spot to spend a weekend in NYC. My husband and I had a short getaway to spend sometime just 2 of us as well as meet some friends (we used to live in New York). Franck (Director of Rooms) went above and beyond to make our stay exceptional: upgrade, bottle of rose on arrival, etc. His fantastic team was very attentive too. We had a great view of Manhattan skyline through hotel’s panoramic windows. 
At night we would meet our friends in hotel’s restaurant called The Garden. Comfy, hip and private yet lively atmosphere- we had good drinks, good laughs and good times in general!!! Thank you The Standard Family, we will be back!!!!

C&K

title: Best Stay So Far In NYC
text: First of all the view from the Junior sweet is amazing! The food downstairs was excellent and fairly priced. Franck and Lisa at the front desk took care of us really well. This will be our go to when we want to get out of Philly for a couple days.

title: Cool, comfortable, safe
text:
First and foremost huge thank you to the amazing staff!! So helpful, kind, knowledgeable and responsive. 
Super comfortable bed and spacious. Fantastic location close to everything you could want. Covid policies well enforced. 
Thank you!

title: Awesome getaway
text: Had a fantastic getaway with my girlfriend.  Incredibly accommodating staff, lush amenities, and a fantastic experience in one of the finer parts of New York city.  The penthouse is awesome, as is the garden area.  The café is a wonderful spot for people watching.  Would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a place to stay in the area.

title: Did not feel safe
text:
We had previously stayed at The Standard East Village, so we were looking forward to staying there  for three nights for our wedding anniversary. The Standard advertised their reopening with their safety precautions. 

On our second night, the hotel allowed a loud party with smoking to take over the rooms adjacent to ours. I was told they had scheduled the party for the entire 14th floor pre-Covid, but ‘accidentally’ booked it on our floor. Awoken at midnight, we called the front desk three times, wondering how they could enable a large party in NYC during Covid 19. I continue to be dismayed and disappointed that, upon opening, this hotel would blatantly violate basic pandemic expectations.
We have stayed in two other hotels in NYC during the last two months. Those hotels were extremely careful. 
The hotel was decent enough to not charge us for one night. However I was assured management would contact me due to my safety concerns. I did not receive any contact. 
Unfortunately I now have doubts about the care this hotel has for safety and well being of their guests.

title: Amazing experience!
text: Had the absolute best time celebrating my birthday at the East Village Standard! With everything going on in the world, I was feeling a little bummed out thinking I was going to be “stuck” in the city to celebrate my 30th. After a chance encounter with Frannk while popping in for a quick cocktail the week prior, I learned about the hotel reopening and the availability to have access to the gorgeous wraparound penthouse, which is usually rented out for private parties.  He gave me his card and let me know they could make it special while still safe. After thinking about all the fun memories I’ve had at other Standard locations I decided to book it! From the moment I arrived to when I left everything was easy and seamless. Every member of the staff, from the front desk to the person delivering the numerous ice buckets I requested was friendly, accommodating and professional. The personal touches like the “Happy Birthday” messages on the mirrors to the delicious champagne waiting for me in the room really elevated my experience.  I had so much fun I even extended my stay another night, which was also almost too easy to do! I felt safe and truly cared for by everyone there. The view from the rooms are a reason to stay here, but it’s really the staff that made all the difference. I didn’t really think you could top the summer rooftop parties in LA, but this location is now officially my favorite. Plus their espresso martinis from the cafe are an absolute must! If you’re questioning whether or not to stay here, don’t. If you’re looking for a place that will go above and beyond to make you feel comfortable this is it! All you have to do is book it and enjoy, while they take care of the rest! Now I just have to think of another excuse to book my next trip.

title: Exceeded Expectations
text:
Hello Everyone! 
For my girlfriend's birthday this year, she wanted to stay in a NYC hotel with the picturesque skyline view and to have a tub. Upon my search, I came across The Standard Hotel that has one location on the West side of Manhattan and the East Village location. From the pictures online I could see that the views were awesome with floor to ceiling windows. I went with the Studio King option which was more than reasonably priced.  Booking the reservation was easy online through their site and I made a note that my girlfriend wanted the skyline view and a tub. A couple of days later a representative reached out to me that they received the request and what time we would be arriving. 

Upon arrival, check-in was very smooth and the staff was super friendly. We were surprised with a bottle of champagne waiting for us in the room to start to celebrate her birthday. Both of my requests were met in a high room floor (almost the top) and a giant tub. The best part was that every part of the room had floor to ceiling windows that showed New York City. In the bathroom, another floor to ceiling window was present so as you take a bath or a shower you are able to have the beautiful view which was my girlfriend's favorite part. We were able to watch the sunset over champagne and the sunrise over coffee.

During my stay, I didn't have one complaint, everything was seamless from start to finish and this hotel checked all of the boxes for me and exceeded expectation. Bargain of a price, friendly staff, staff that wants to make your stay special, a beautiful view, beautiful room, comfortable bed, and prompt service. 

My experience with them will make me not even look or recommend for another hotel in New York City. I will definitely be staying here in the future and would like to try out their Highline location as well. 

Thank you again The Standard

title: A review - better late than never
text: I was recently going through an old bag and found David Burgos' business card in it! I had held onto the card as I had wanted to leave a review about how fantastic he was and how memorable he made our stay at The Standard, East Vil. My girlfriend and I stayed for a week in Nov last year. Our experience was fantastic, in large part due to the warm and helpful service we were shown by David. He was working as the night manager during our stay and was particularly helpful in the early hours one morning when we needed a room swap. He was kind and courteous and fun, an asset to any business. I hope he is still working with you and that we can reconnect with him next time we stay! Hopefully as soon as possible.

title: Amazing customer service
text: I normally stay at other Standard locations so I was excited to give the east village location a shot. I had such a great and relaxing stay. The rooms were clean, quiet, and spacious with amazing views of the city. Customer service was top notch especially with the front desk. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in Manhattan without all the hustle and bustle of the city.

title: Excellent Front Desk Staff!
text: I recently stayed at the Standard in the East Village after our girls trip to Mexico City was canceled due to the coronavirus. My friend and I wanted to stay at a hotel that wasn't in either of our neighborhoods and near a friend's apartment. We were really excited to check out the Standard since I've been before to the excellent Narcissa restaurant in the hotel. Our stay was made extra special as Danny at the front desk heard our story and was able to hook us up with a very nice room on the 20th Floor and a bottle of champagne to toast to our staycation. The shower with steam was dreamy and our views from the Empire State Building down to the new WTC and over to the Brooklyn & Manhattan Bridge. I highly recommend looking for an upgrade to one of the suite types as the room were fairly large for NYC standards. Thanks to Danny and the staff at the Standard for making our visit memorable!!

title: Rooms are good but room service needs improvement
text:
We stayed at The Standard East Village for 3 nights and were looking forward to it prior to our arrival as I have always been a fan of the concept behind The Standard but never stayed there before. 
As we arrived early, our room was not ready, no issues because we got to drop our bags and then set out to explore the area. We came back to the hotel to have a coffee at the cafe and were surprised by the disinterested service level. As we were seated by the bar we also heard the chatting between the staff members and I guess you had a change in staffing policies and maybe management? They were not happy in their workplace at least... 
Later we went for brunch/lunch at Narcissa, the restaurant was full but we got seats at the bar. The bartender who looked after us was great which spiked a bit more confidence in the F&B team. 
After lunch we were checked in to the room and the room was spacious and ok, albeit a bit dated, would have appreciated plugs on both sides next to the bed however! 
Where the hotel really falls short however is the roomservice. We used it 3 times during our 3 night stay and every time it was the same disinterested and almost rude person taking the orders over the phone and the person that actually delivered the room service made you feel like you had interupted her from something way more important and the entire concept of room service was an inconvenience to her. Quite the shame because most of the things we did order from the room service were rather good.

title: Super Hippes, großartiges Szene Hotel auf der Bowery
text:
Das Standard East Village ist das perfekte Hotel für einen hippen Stay in NY.
Das Hotel ist perfekt gelegen. 5 min zum New Museum, in 5 min ist man mitten in SOHO und die Bowery ist schon selber super szenig. 
Die Zimmer sind toll eingerichtet und 100% sauber. Einfach die Qualität, die man von einem THE STANDARD erwartet. Auch die Restaurants sind super hip und werden Abends auch von hippen NYern zahlreich besucht. Das Frühstück im Cafe ist super und für ein "Continental Breakfast" mit 18 USD auch nicht übermäßig teuer. Ich werde bei meinem nächsten NY Besuch auf jeden FAll wieder ins Standard EV eichecken.

title: Wheelchair user well cared for
text:
I stayed at The Standard for a couple of nights while on a business trip. As a wheelchair user I am used to so-called accessible rooms being anything but, and hotel staff being less than accommodating. 

The staff at The Standard went out of their way to insure my stay was excellent. They contacted me ahead of time and were very responsive to my questions about bed height and shower bench. When I arrived they were quick to assist me, and when there were some small issues with the room, such as desk placement and shower head, they send someone up straight away to fix things. 

While the room wasn’t perfect, their level of responsiveness and willingness to help made for an excellent stay. They even delivered my luggage to my office on the day I checked out. Would highly recommend to anyone requiring special accessibility.

title: Cozy, comfy
text: Went to tour NYU w our daughter and stayed 1 night here. They were very accommodating with our luggage while we went on our merry way. They gave us a late checkout and held our bags again while we found lunch nearby. The beds, linens & towels were better than most pricey chain hotels. We will be back!

title: Just one night close to meeting family
text: Great boutique feel, very clean, quiet, cool location. Check-in a little slow as I was competing with the 'phone. Although not on business I needed to be smart so no iron in the room was a negative - no coffee also not ideal (but well stocked minibar). Much better than the chains.

title: Above and Beyond Stay!!
text:
I recently stayed at this incredible East Village Hotel and the views from the 17th Floor were incredible/amazing...from the World Trade Center up to the Empire State Building. WOW!!
The staff was extremely polite and accommodating. Wherever you were in the hotel, they were at your service!! Even a random encounter in the elevators, brought smiles from the staff, to inquire about my stay, and ensure that all was well.

title: Pas idéal en famille
text:
J’avais une chambre double double pour 5 nuits avec mes enfants de 10 et 14 ans (les seuls de l’hôtel) nous avions pris le pack petit dej à 350 dollars sans les tips 
La vue est magnifique mais il n’y a pa du tout d’espace dans la chambre et les toilettes sont dans la salle de bain
L’accueil à l’hôtel est assez froid et on a été  obligés de prendre le petit dej continental inclus dans le pack au café en bas ou on a l’impression de déranger 
Nous avons eu 3 fois un serveur juste odieux au petit dej et le chocolat chaud n’est pas compris dans les boissons chaudes 
En plus petit dej continental n’est pas bon mis à part les viennoiseries qui sont correctes 
Le mec de la réception avec qui j’avais parlé plusieurs fois m’a demandé ma carte d’identité pour me remagnetiser la carte de la chambre 
Bref on s’est senti mal dans cet hotel et j’en ai eu pour 2400 Dollars pour 5 nuits j’ai vraiment regretté le Sofitel
Sinon le quartier est super et la vue dingue sans doute plus sympa en couple

title: Gorgeous penthouse party
text: We recently held our company's party in the penthouse & it was absolutely incredible! The wraparound views of Manhattan were breathtaking, the staff were so considerate and the hors d'ouevres were delicious! We were thrilled at the outcome of our event and I would absolutely recommend.

title: Médiocre
text:
Bonne situation, vue agréable 
Chambre exiguë, rangement minimaliste 
Climatisation extrêmement bruyante et quasiment impossible à régler en température. Mini bar très bruyant !
Service inexistant ou de très mauvaise qualité (accueil, petit déjeuner ...)
Un hôtel globalement très médiocre, à éviter

title: Home away from home
text:
Spent 4 days and 3 nights with my wife in NYC, and wanted a more LOCAL feel to this trip vs highly touristic areas and attractions. I booked us at the Standard East Village and it really set the tone for our trip. Perfect location in Cooper Square across from the Village Voice, friendly and accommodating staff, perfectly sized room (for Manhattan anyways), comfortable bed and the biggest and best bath towels in the world (I will need to find that vendor and buy some for our home). Oh!, and heated bathroom floors? Can't live without them now. 

Drinks at the Standard Cafe became our ritual after long days of walking and loitering all around the extended Village area so we could catch our breath and make dinner & evening plans. Anthony made sure we were well taken care of, which is why we kept going back (ok, maybe the in-house grown mushroom toast and that amazing tomato basil sauce that came with the Andy Warhol grilled cheese had something to do with us returning as well...). 

Everything is walking distance from the hotel, a couple of short blocks to St.Marks Pl, Washington Square and NYU, Greenwich Village, Soho, etc.  And Astor Pl Subway station is a short 3min walk so no need to spend any time and money sitting in traffic in a cab or uber.

Overall, the Standard East Village was the perfect HQ for our extended weekend and we miss it already. Until next time!!

title: Sub Standard
text:
We will be heading down to NYC to celebrate my wife’s birthday and visit my daughter(again) who goes to NYU next week.  

We’ve stayed at places like  Washington Square Hotel and The Marlton, then moved on to the  Hyatt at Union Square. I kind of dig places like the Marlton and The WSH, but my wife likes a hotel, well a little more modern and less dark. So we tried the Hyatt then the  settled on the Standard when visiting the East Village area. Thought I’d pass along my thoughts on the Standard.

In the past (over the last 3-4 years) we have stayed at the Standard as our go to when visiting. We have probably been there around 5 or 6 times usually for 2-3 weekend nights each visit. We normally stay in a corner room and request a high floor. Our 1st time was great and our 2nd time was equal to the first. 

So we kept coming back. The room and staff were good and the hotel’s attempt at a cool hip vibe worked. Those times the staff seemed customer and service oriented.

However, after those first few times staying there the quality of out visits deteriorated. Our room floor requests were ignored, the valet/bell person was nowhere to be found, the rooms felt tired (especially the bathroom).

On one visit, the room we were given had a lovely view of a wall. I complained but the front desk said there was nothing they could do the hotel was full. I informed the front desk staff that my floor and room request was sent  2 months ago via email. I was told that I should not have emailed but should have called the front desk. Making it seem that it was my fault. Yes it was my mistake  thinking  the hotel would read an email sent by a repeat guest. My bad.

I usually vote with my feet when things start to go south and would often suggested  to my wife that we stay somewhere else,  but she, like me , tended to overlook these slights and opt for the hotels location over satisfaction , so we continued to stay there.

Until our last visit that is, around October/November2019. The issues I highlighted above remain: location of room barely meeting request, no one to help get bags out of car, a tired room (is it too hard to have outlets next to bed). And an indifferent staff. One thing I use to like was that  Crunch across the street  was included in the room rate. Now they charge a “$25 resort fee”.   

What made us decide this place was done…was during our last stay we were checking out,  I gave my key to have the valet to get the car. He stated it would be about a half hour which was normal and expected. So we went to the café/ bar to order coffee and a quick breakfast.

It was early Sunday morning so not busy or crowded. We sat for a while and  someone finally waited on us and we ordered.  We sat for a longer while…. No coffee yet…she came back without coffee but asked for our food order…so I ordered some eggs….waited…no coffee…waited…no coffee or food. You know what did come, yup, our car.

The valet got our car faster than they could get our coffee!!!!

We just left since our car was there . I went to the front desk to get my key,related  what just happened. The manager, I assume, said what happened shouldn’t have. Yeah, no kidding. We left and drove a block or two for breakfast  at Veselka.

They poured our coffee as we sat down, amazing!!!

So we won’t be staying  at the Standard next week.

 I’ve made reservations at another hotel nearby, The Bowery- I wish I did this for prior visits, but inertia is hard to overcome sometimes. This hotel  emailed me within and 1/2 hour of my reservation being made asking when we would get there and answered a question I asked in the reservation. 

My daughter will graduate in May, but we will still have the pleasure of visiting her and the east village area for a few more years to come.

If next week works out we I’ll book a couple of rooms in May for 3 days in May for the graduation.

title: Basic Amenities
text: The hotel is very friendly and in a good location and clean and tidy with very comfy beds. The room has no coffee or tea facility, one dressing gown for two people, the TV does not work and everyone on the street can see you in the shower as there is no blind or curtain in the bathroom. At the weekend the music from the bar is very loud and kept us awake at night. We can not fault the friendly and helpful staff and the clean and tidy rooms, their just needs more attention to detail in regard to the set up of the rooms.

title: Incredible views and pretty much the BEST staff ever!
text:
I cannot say enough about my stay. The hotel is gorgeous inside and out. The rooms are ULTRA modern, clean, well appointed, killer wet bar, and the view. Wow! 

On top of all of that I had a very important FedEx package which arrived before I did. As soon as I checked in they let me know that they had received it and had it delivered to my room. 

When I told the front desk person that I would prefer something with a view they upgraded me at a very reasonable rate to the 17th floor, corner room, KILLER view. 

And everyone on their staff smiles at you! I felt welcomed and taken care of. A RARE occurrence in these times. 

The best stay I've had a hotel in years. Truly. And I travel a fair amount.

High recommended.

title: Great Stay!
text: The rate was great..The bed was comfy..The staff was helpful..Neighborhood is fantastic. And the cafe/bar stays open late for drinks and great food (spicy chix sandwich!!!). Perfect place for me in NYC!!!

title: Wow, exceeded my expectations
text:
So walking in to this hotel I was a bit hesitant as I typically go for the brands where I know what to expect.  Upon walking in I was greeted by three people and was promptly taken care of by a Front Desk Agent who told me all about the hotel and breakfast and gave me a dinner recommendation.  I was offered assistance up to my room and once there the Bellman offered any additional assistance and left.  the room was clean and bright I was a bit worried about the huge windows however the curtain took care of them.  I enjoyed this stay, even in the early hours of the morning there were people to help and take care of what I needed.

Thank you for taking great care of me!!!!

title: 65th Birthday Party
text: Invited 16 people for overnight stay at the Standard, East Village.  From the planning through the weekend, staff couldn't have been more helpful, kind or willing to do whatever was needed.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.  Would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone.  Gratitude extended to Alyssa, Valeria and entire staff!

title: The Standard raises the bar
text: Just stayed at The Standard in East Village for the first time. It was quirky, eccentric and awesome. The staff are a collection of individuals, super nice and couldn't do more to help. I had a fantastic corner room with amazing views of the city. Breakfast was fresh and delicious. For those who like things a little more corporate and perfectly formed with marble and clean lines this won't be to your tastes, but for those who like a little more personality and a sense of humor in their life then this is spot on.

title: Special occasion
text: Had a lovely birthday stay at the Standard East Village. They couldn’t have been more accommodating and sweet. Our view was the best and the service was exceptional. It felt cozy the entire time. Stay here.

title: Independent Experience
text: Not a chain hotel although there are a few other Standard Hotels. Every staff person was extremely courteous, professional, helpful and friendly from the moment we entered.  Busy bar scene on Saturday night but once you step in the elevator it was quiet.  Room not large but large windows enhance the feel and you don't feel too confined.  Room efficiently laid out, very clean, comfortable bed.  A good deal for NYC if you want something different.  Agree with other comment about no coffee in room and glad to learn I can ask at front desk next time.  Breakfast in Cafe very good, fresh ingredients, great service.We will be back!

title: Perfect
text: Thank you all, every single encounter we experienced this last week was impeccable. From the doorman to front desk, the manger in the Cafe and all the staff top notch. I come to NY for the gift show and women's market a few times a year, this was my first time staying at the Standard East Village and its is going to be my new go to. Thank you all so much!

title: Not bad, though a bit outdated
text: I feel the rooms here need a serious remodel as they seem quite outdated from many years of wear and tear. I also was not a fan of there being no coffee service in the rooms which to me is a bare minimum standard and having to go get coffee is silly when you’re waking up in pajamas. So I didn’t like that. And room service was somewhat inconsistent but I appreciated one major thing that moved them from a 3 to 4 star - the bell person delivered a food delivery from outside which hotels normally hate doing.

title: Dreamy Weekend in East Village
text: The beds at the standard are so comfortable, The shower and sauna feature is like being at a spa and the view from the windows in the bathroom and the bedroom is magical. I can't say enough nice things about this place. Truly the best hotel I've stayed at in the city. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

title: Vacation
text: This hotel is perfect for couples who want to explore the city. The staff is very nice and the cafe/bar has a really nice vibe. We had a great view of the city. Many of the main things we went to NYC to see and do were walking distance from the hotel.

title: Beware of Corner Room Upgrade
text:
When we checked in, we asked if there were any upgrades available. The receptionist offered us a "corner room" overlooking Cooper Square, but that it would be more expensive. Unfortunately, they were pretty liberal with selling a "corner room". Yes, it the room did have a corner with windows on two sides, but one of the sides was looking directly into another "corner room" 5 feet away.

After checking out and speaking with the manager (who was very courteous), he apologized for the misunderstanding and rectified the situation.

As far as the room itself, it was fine. Small, comfortable bed, limited conveniences (no coffee).

title: It was...nice
text:
We wanted a room with a tub and a view so we were offered a corner room upgrade that included the tub as well as a view. The restroom and bath were amazing but the windows were filthy so the view was taken away from. Also, the TV offered an option to airplay from your device. It would work until you tried to stream a movie or something then it would error out. Once looking into the error it was for the internet not being fast enough to support the streaming of video. There was an option to purchase faster internet for $19/day.
The staff was very friendly and helpful though and the hotel as a whole had a great vibe.

title: Best staff
