text: This hotel, while modern and chic, also offers warmth and kindness from its truly remarkable staff.  Even though my work was on the upper east side, my wife and I chose to return to The Standard.  It's worth the subway ride.

title: Great location - great views
text: We stayed at Stadard East Village for 5 nights with the family and really liked it. The location is extremely good, the staff friendly and the views spectacular with the large windows and the building being the highest in the area.

title: Happy we stayed here!
text: We were in NYC for a few days around Christmas. The hotel was in a great location as we have family in the lower east side and it is close to the subway lines too. Maggie G. the manager of the Guest Experience made our visit so much nicer. She helped us arrange tickets to see the Rockettes ( which was amazing ) We also enjoyed the cafe in the mornings and had dinner on site one night. I would recommend this hotel and happily stay here again!

title: Great Hotel
text:
My husband & I spent the weekend in the city - celebrating our anniversary. 
The people at the Standard could not have been better. 
From Lisa at the front desk checking us in--- to Kevin with valet. 
The Cafe is a sweet little spot -one of the best breakfast we have had in a while.  Sidney & Anthony served us and were knowledgable and helpful. 
No Bar is a fun spot too. 
The room!!
The VIEWS!!
Great location and good time all around. 
Thanks Standard!

title: Great NYC hotel experience
text: The location alone would be enough to give the hotel an excellent rating. However the standard does more than provide a place to stay in a great nyc neighborhood. The standard has beautiful, clean and efficient rooms. The service is excellent and the employees made a point to let us know they are always available for questions or concerns. The hotel itself also has very a New York City style cafe, bar and restaurant (all which had great food and drinks). I would definitely recommend the standard to anyone visiting from out of town or looking for a staycation in nyc.

title: Loveeeeee it
text: This is my 2 nd stay here and we love it. The location is very convenient to subway, restaurants, bars, convenient stores. The service is superb from the front desk to porter to the maid. Room is so comfy and the city view is amazing.

title: Loved!
text: Simply fabulous! Outstanding location, beautiful property, comfortable rooms and friendly, helpful staff. From the valet parking to the front desk to the restaurants, everyone was just terrific. Kosta gets a special mention!

title: Yes.
text: We came in after a long day in the city trying to wind down.  When we realized we didnt need to.  The staff were so beautiful from Rodolfo when we were greeted to our amazing bartender Kiki. Everyone was very attentive and professional.   Where have they been all my life? I love this ciry.

title: We loved our stay at The Standard! Perfect East Village location!
text: My wife and I recently stayed at The Standard in Manhattan's East Village with our dog and cat. I guess you could call it a staycation because we live only a few blocks away. We booked a room for one night to celebrate the first day of the new year, and it was pure bliss. We watched TV, ordered room service and enjoyed a spectacular view of the East Village. We were impressed with everything from the hotel's clean, modern decor to the wonderful room service breakfast. Everyone on the staff, including the front desk team and the woman who brought us our room service order, was friendly and helpful. We are definitely going to recommend this hotel to our friends and family. Some advice for out-of-towners: Stay here! This hotel is really close to the Tenement Museum, which we highly recommend (you have to book tour tickets ahead of time), the Merchant's House Museum, the Metrograph movie theater and a ton of other East Village and Lower East Side sites and restaurants like Veselka, Frank's (Italian) and Yonah Schimmel Knish. Actually, you can easily walk to Soho and Greenwich Village from here, too. Even though we live here, we will definitely treat ourselves to a night at The Standard again, but we won't bring our cat this time. She really prefers to be at home. :)

title: Très bien
text: Hôtel vraiment magnifique avec une vue incroyable dans les chambres , un personnel très gentil et accueillant l’hôtel est bien situé avec de nombreux fats food autour (dunkin donut , shake shack.....) je recommande vraiment cet hôtel

title: Winter Garden
text:
I came here for brunch with some friends and we LOVED it. The service was absolutely amazing - staff was so nice, welcoming, and helpful. The food and drinks were great too. 

A special shoutout for the fact that the place was SO CLEAN AND WELL PUT TOGETHER. Truly wonderful experience. We will come back for sure.

title: Exceptional Service from Marcos and team!
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed at The Standard for our Christmas holiday staycation and were amazed at the service we received. Marcos at the front desk was warm and welcoming from the moment we entered the hotel, and he really helped make our holiday special. Given that it was Christmas Eve we wanted to make the night special and he helped us upgrade our stay to an amazing studio suite with a gorgeous view of East Village. It was really beautiful.(We had a little trouble finding the lights at first, but a quick call downstairs and Marcos helped us out again  😫😬).  

To add to the holiday atmosphere we visited the adorable winter village and had drinks in a yurt followed by cocktails at No Bar where Ricky and team were equally awesome. I can’t express enough how great the service was by the entire team at the Standard. We will definitely be back!

Thanks again from Nick and Bri.

title: An exceptional stay in NYC
text: We just returned from enjoying Christmas in NYC. We had an exceptional stay at the Standard Hotel, East Village. I have stayed at another hotel in this neighborhood -but The Standard was much nicer, friendlier, and more economical. The staff was personable,friendly and attentive. Our room with a view was superb. I will be returning to this hotel and strongly recommend it.

title: Fantastic spot and Fantastic Staff
text:
My husband and I used to live on the Bowery for nearly 15 years and have since moved upstate. We have tried a few neighborhood hotels when we return to the city, and this was our first stay at The Standard--we will most certainly be staying here again. It is not unusual to get a "spam"-like email a day or two before your arrival at a hotel, asking if you have any special requests. However, it is highly unusual to actually receive a personal reply if you DO need to take advantage of the email and make contact with someone. I immediately received a reply from Franck, who addressed my questions both via email and by phone. Upon check in, the front desk staff did everything to make it as smooth as possible. I had family coming into town and two rooms with different names, and it was all done without a hitch. The professionalism and kindness from the staff was across the board. 
Additionally, the rooms were GREAT. The bathrooms were unusually large for a NYC hotel bathroom and they were clean and pristine. This should also go without saying, but the doors and walls were thick and heavy which makes for as quiet of an experience as possible for a NYC hotel room.

title: The Sky Line 😊‼️
text:
Nice time spent in this Hotel, really confortable and well positioned to walk around the big apple ‼️
Amazing view from our room, and delicious breakfast in the morning.
To come back, for sure👍🏼‼️
Well appreciated from every component of the Family.

title: Exceeded Expectations!
text:
Going anywhere with four young adult/teenage children is challenging. Trying to find accommodations that are hip, cool, spacious and affordable is nearly.impossible. The staff at the Standard East Village recognized that I had booked 4 kids in one double room. Without me asking, the hotel staff thought connecting 2 rooms together would offer my kids more room and an extra bathroom. Genius! Cannot thank the staff enough for their thoughtfulness.

We loved our trip to NYC so much we will be back. No chance we'd ever stay anywhere else. Thanks again to Franck and the staff!

My best Diana Lach

title: Wedding weekend with friends
text: We had a fantastic stay at the standard east! The staff is exceptional going out of their way to help in any way needed! Rooms were spotless and very comfy! Highly recommend the corner king for gorgeous views!! Even room serviced and was delicious!

title: Phenomenal Service
text: I've never been compelled to write a review on anything before but in this case, I had to. I stay in hotels across the country roughly every other week. Most of them cater to corporate clients or bill themselves as 4/5 star hotels. None of them are as accommodating and helpful as the front desk and management of The Standard East Village. I initially intended to stay for 5 days and move to another hotel in the city but decided to extend the stay because of how warm and inviting the staff was. They accommodated room changes, deliveries, last minute reservation changes and every other hassle a guest can throw at them and did it with a smile. Food on site is also excellent. Can't say enough about the experience and also happy to have found my go-to NY hotel.

title: Poor design, not worth the money
text:
I had very high hopes for this hotel visit as we were going to a wedding at the Bowery only a few blocks away.  Was not impressed by the front desk staff or front door staff - rarely was someone there to open the door even when your arms were full of bags or luggage.  The front desk clerk gave me the wrong directions to the elevator. 

The room itself was very small which is to be expected for a hotel room in NYC but the design was so poor it was baffling.  There was only one bedside table on one side of the bed that is about 6" x 6" barely large enough to hold a kindle and some reading glasses.  The tiny bedside table did not have a reading light, nor were there sconces or any other sort of light in the bedroom other than a harsh fluorescent light coming from the headboard that shined onto the ceiling.  The lamp on the desk did not work and did not even have a switch that I could locate.  The power outlet near the bed did not work.  There was not closet, only a small wardrobe with 4 hangers that were difficult to access and impossible to hang a full length coat in.  The shower door did not close when the bath mat was set out on the floor so when you opened the door, the mat just crumpled up against the toilet.  Such poor design all around I cannot even cover it all. 

The coffee the next morning came within ten minutes but a small pot was $16, without gratuity.  

I would rather stay at a Marriott or similar where I know they will have a reading lamp and a shower that I can get in and out of with a bath mat intact on the floor. 
Extreme disappointment.

title: David Burgos made the trip.
text: Just finished 5 days in NYC at this hotel. It was just an "ok" experience. With a little training on building "connections" with the guests, it could be fantastic. Many of the interactions seemed transactional. Not all, but enough to matter. David Burgos (front desk, overnights) was probably the person who had the most rapport. He was genuine, made good eye contact, conveyed warmth and was ready to make a future reservation with just a mention of it on my part. He jumped at the chance to offer to help. The maintenance folks were also friendly and helpful. I understand "hip" hotels want the "hip" experience, however, I think you can have "hip" "trendy" with "warm and friendly." I'm a self-admitted travel snob and my expectation is that every interaction will make the guests feel like they matter. This was a 50/50 experience. I will stay here again and hope the warmth and guest-centered experience will be obvious.

title: Trendy hotel in the middle of the action
text:
After staying over the Upper West Side for a week, we wanted to try a different experience and decided to book into the Standard Hotel on the Lower East side.

This hotel has great right from the start – delightful front desk, especially the young ladies. I think it was Sarah? – she watches Aussie comedy show “Kath& Kim”. She is particularly delightful as were all the staff, as well as the porters and room service teams.

The location is great for exploring the East Village and surrounding areas.

The hotel has a bar/restaurant attached that is convenient to pop into for a drink before heading back to your room at night, or for a quick bite in the morning, before heading out.

Rooms are lovely, we had city views which were spectacular. Not overly huge in terms of space, but we don’t expect it to be too roomy in Manhattan.

It’s on the pricey side, so look at for the best deals on the booking sites. You might get lucky.

title: Cutest Winter Wonderland!
text:
I went with a friend to their Winter wonderland garden! They have the cutest set up of heated yurts (they look like little cute tents) and have super cute decor with plush fur seat cushions. While they are outside allow for private conversations as they zip up. It has a nice intimate feel. You forgot that you’re in the middle of the city. It’s wonderful to go at night because it’s nicely decorated with lights and Christmas trees. It’s a small intimate space and have availability for a small group or large one. The staff were very friendly and allow you to just hang out without nagging to leave. I defeated recommend the winter toddy drink and the spiked cider! The cheese fondue plate is delicious and a ton of food! It comes with a huge plate of bread, pickles, apples, and pickled veggies. Their prosciutto plate is also great! We were stuffed! 

I recommend it for a date night, girls night, or just a wonderful place to catch some drinks and get amazing pics!! It’s a must see if your in the east village!

title: Daughter’s first NYC visit
text: Wife and I took our 22 month old daughter to nyc for the first time and stayed at this great hotel. Amazing staff, awesome room with incredible views and close to everything we wanted to do that weekend. Will definitely be staying there again.

title: Who needs a Hyatt?
text: Great staff, cozy intimate boutique , great views. A charmer indeed! The staff here are in genuine high spirits and are very personable. Leanaro and David were lovely to speak to so early, who knew people could be so cheery at that time. Even the bellboys were sweet hearts! Loved my experience here and I’m sure to come back! Next time, I will try the yurts.

title: Great stay great staff!
text: My wife and I were in town to visit our kids and really enjoyed our stay.  The staff at the hotel were terrific-especially Kevin and Adriane at the front desk, and the hotel had a great location and a fun vibe.  Looking forward to our next visit!

title: Amazing place, awesome people!!
text: Awesome experience from check-in to check-out!  Loved the hotel, and loved the dining experience even more.  Had Thanksgiving with family and friends in Narcissa and enjoyed an innovative menu with a touch of tradition.  Also had fondue one evening in the winter garden in one of the yurts (look it up) -- something you HAVE to do!  My favorite spot was the cafe where the highlight was grilled cheese and amazing tomato soup - better than mom used to make!  The cafe has a mushroom farm above and behind the bar. Ask the bartender about it. Had a great stay, highly recommend The Standard!!

title: Professional, gracious -- a class act
text: Our experience at The Standard, East Village, could not have been better. The facilities are exceptionally sparkling and comfortable. The HUMANS, however, make the experience remarkable. Front-desk staff like Adrienne and Marcos and David are professional, engaging and warm (and gracious in fielding some special requests); Giovanni and Matt make the comings-and-goings easy; and Frank and Valeria in the back office are extremely helpful and responsive.

title: Greatest time ever!
text:
My fiance and I visited the hotel for our anniversary and it was the best hotel we we had the pleasure of staying in! The location was perfect for a night out as well! 

Maggie made some great suggestions and we followed through and weren't disappointed!

Overall it was an awesome stay!!

title: A solution-oriented hotel with an amazing staff !
text: I visited The Standard once again and was welcomed with open arms by the staff and the on-site manager Jade. It had been some time since I've last visited and she remembered me which was comforting although surprising. She was more than accommodating to my guests and I  , ensuring we had everything we needed. The staff in general greeted us when we walked in, was so attentive and made sure things were smooth. It's always a pleasure being in an environment where you don't have to worry about the details because the team on-site is taking care of everything. Jade is such a sweetheart for recognizing me and giving me VIP treatment (even though I  had a standard room) because I  felt special and so did my friends. Sad to go but looking forward to coming back ! Thanks for the 2nd go 'round Jade !

title: Amazing Staff
text:
Franck Hermann, director front office is extremely professional and took all of our needs into consideration which made us return to this hotel. The entire team excels and are always accommodating
Special thanks to:
Alexander del Rosarrio
Adrienne
Lisa
Maggie
Kevin
Gio
And the rest of the staff. 
Excellent housekeeping and we highly recommend the Standard as a place to call home in the big Apple.

title: The Standard continues to live up to its reputation
text: My husband and I stay here for work often and we always have a great experience. The staff is friendly and fun. The food is great. The atmosphere is alive. And the rooms are comfortable and clean. And you can’t beat the location. David Burgos in particular at the front desk checked us in and couldn’t have been nicer. He accommodated our room request and then some!! What professional and friendly service. And Alexander del Rosario also reached out in advance to see if we needed anything. Anyway I can’t say enough nice things. We’ll definitely be back!!

title: Perfect stay for my daughter's birthday
text:
We had a great night and birthday celebration for our 4 year old daughter, along with an amazing dinner at Narcissa (they grow their own mushrooms here... yum!) and a nice breakfast at the cafe.  We got VIP treatment from Will at the front desk adn Tom at the Cafe.
A perfect stay.

title: Amazing
text: A few girls from college and I decided to do a NYC trip and we ended up staying at The Standard. Not only were the rooms ADORABLE but the staff was great. Adrienne at the front desk was so welcoming and gave us some wonderful recommendations—bars, restaurants, shows.  She knew it all!  I can’t say enough good things about our stay. This hotel made our girls trip so special.  We will definitely be back.

title: Outstanding service!
text: We received friendly, outstanding service - especially from Alexander - during our recent stay. We loved returning to our cozy room after long days wandering around the city. It was our first time staying in the east village and will definitely return to The Standard.

title: Wonderful location, exceptional staff!
text: We had a wonderful 4 days at the Standard East Village. The location is perfect for visiting NY as many restaurants and shopping are within walking distance. The room (1109) was wonderful as it had two queen beds,  a 360-degree view of the city, a beautiful bathroom with a soaking tub and a shower.  The room was very quiet, not even sound from the street below could be heard easily. We had plenty of space for our clothes in the closet and a minibar with all sorts of creative treats for late-night snacking.   We were visiting NYU and the University is a short walk from the hotel, which made the hotel feel like a home away from home.  We had two beautiful breakfasts and a festive cocktail hour at the Cafe.  The wait staff and bartenders were very friendly and knowledgeable about the food and wine.  The food was delicious, we had Mexican omelet and french toast, with a cappuccino and matcha latte and everything, was over the top delicious.  Every member of the hotel staff was extremely friendly, helpful and efficient.  We were helped with speedy room service for a late-night dinner, an exceptional front door staff that flagged us cabs to see broadway shows or head to meet friends.  The front desk staff printed our tickets for us and they were waiting when we came off the elevator.  Upon check-in, the front desk staff also helped us to upgrade our room because they felt it would be a better space for us as we prepared for our visit to NYU.   Everything was done with care and each guest was treated as if they were extra special.  A BIG THANK YOU to Adrienne at the front desk who spent extra time talking with our son about HER experiences at NYU,   All around our visit to NY was enhanced by our choice to stay at the STANDARD and we will be back again and again.

title: Perfect location, great staff
text: Right in the heart of Soho, the perfect base for a good night out, to explore the surroundings on foot, find great restaurants and simply soak up New York. Great team at reception and in restaurants, helpful, funny, happy. Breakfast was tasty. Will be back.

title: Family birthday weekend celebration
text: We have had another fun and enjoyable visit at the Standard-East Village (SEV). This time we went for an 85th birthday celebration and the staff at the SEV were as welcoming and accommodating as ever. Not only did we have the spectacular views of the city and the comfie bedding we have enjoyed in the past, but everyone wished our honoree happy birthday and made sure we had everything we needed for the perfect weekend. The personalized birthday wishes complete with treats and bubbly that the staff arranged to have in our rooms were unexpected surprises for the birthday lady and her crew. Thank you to everyone at the SEV for making our party weekend a memorable one!

title: NYU AUDITIONS AND DJ CON
text: Location was perfect for visiting Soho, Noho, Greenwich, NYU, Freedom Tower, Little Italy, Chelsea and Midtown.  I had two very clean and modern adjoining rooms that were on 8th floor with great panoramic views. I would definitely stay at the Standard East Village on my next trip to NYC.

title: Great location and staff even more amazing than the views!
text: We rolled into The Standard, East Village for the weekend after having spent a few days in midtown for work which, while a must for some, is an only-when-necessary for us! It's legit a dream team at TSEV. Lisa and Maggie have got customer service down and quickly cancelled out the chaos of the previous few days. - they couldn't have been more engaged, thoughtful and nice.  And can we talk about Giovanni & Matthew?! From making sure we were bundled up enough to be prepared to walk out the front door (that wind chill was no joke) to pointing us in all the right directions (most importantly, to the fantastic wine place down the street) - they made coming and going easy and really fun! The smiles were contagious and the hospitality was stellar - it's a repeat for sure.

title: Cozy and posh with excellent views
text: I stayed here for two nights on a business trip and loved it. It has a small hotel feel -- attentive service, quiet, super-well laid out rooms, great views. I'm picky about beds and these were the firm, well covered in duvets, and generally just so fine I didn't want to leave. A great place for couples or solo travelers.

title: AHH-MAZING
text: I spent a week in NYC for a class and was recommended this hotel.  It looked to be close enough to my school.  I was in sticker shock at the price, but since it was close, decided to book a week stay.  I was VERY glad!  The staff is exceedingly friendly and, in my opinion, genuinely meant it!  They were exceptionally helpful for anything from walking directions, subway suggestions, restaurant advice, my morning drink (thank you Alexander!)!, etc.  I felt very safe.  Special mention and major shout out to Alexander Del Rosario, Assistant Director, Front office.  He was so very kind and patient with me and my questions, and exceeded my expectations when I needed something.  Additionally, I want to mention awesome staff of Adrienne and Marcos at the front desk.  Giovanni and Pedro, bellmen.  There were others, whose names I failed to get, but this is a great place, and if I am back in the lower East side of NYC, I WILL stay here again.  I will mention that there are no mini fridges in the rooms, that would have been convenient, and my bathroom was almost as big (it seemed) as the sleeping area. Great view in my room of skyline.  But loved the bathroom amenities, shower was terrific!  Very nice stay indeed.  Thank you all for making this a terrific stay!

title: Nice Hotel in the Village.
text:
Would definitely stay here again.

We stayed 3 nights. Great location, nice rooms, one of the largest bathrooms I have seen in a NYC hotel (free standing tub, separate glass enclosed shower, large towels, heated floors. Nice view of the city.

Shout out to front desk staff, especially Adrienne, who was pleasant and helpful in answering questions we had.

title: Excellent venue for hosting a private dinner
text: We hosted 15 guests for a private dinner in the hotel restaurant Narcissa, and it worked out splendidly. The private room was spacious and quiet, the food was good, and the service was excellent. I'd recommend this venue.

title: Cool hotel with excellent service with good location
text: We stayed for two nights and really appreciated the friendly staff who gave excellent service. I was not so familiar with the lower part of Manhattan, but I have to say that the location was really great. Walking distance to SoHo, to Union Square and also easy access with several subway lines a few minutes from the hotel. The hotel has cool atmosphere, the rooms are quite big and very well equipped and we just loved the big window with a view in the bathroom. The café and the outside bar are nice and cosy! I can really recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to have a relaxed but cool place to stay in lower Manhattan.

title: Vue à couper le souffle
text:
J'y étais déjà allée deux fois et c'est avec grand plaisir que j'y suis retournée pour ma dernière nuit à Manhattan. L'endroit a un peu changé depuis mon précédent séjour, mais pas l'esprit ni la vue ! Une véritable carte postale. S'endormir avec les lumières de Manhattan et se réveiller dans le soleil qui inonde progressivement la ville est un véritable enchantement. La vue étant l'atout principal des chambres, il faut bien sûr demander un étage élevé.

Les chambres en elles-mêmes sont assez standard, c'est le cas de le dire, mais bien équipée, notamment la salle de bains. Bonne literie également, mais une déco passe-partout. Encore une fois l'intérêt de cet hôtel c'est la vue ainsi que son emplacement (quartier animé, beaucoup de restaurants, de bars, de Coffee shop pour le petit déjeuner).

Accueil très agréable et professionnel.

title: Fabulous Work Trip
text: This hotel is located in a gorgeous part of NYC. Restaurants and bars are accessible, and there's a strong creative synergy around for productivity. Love the service, cleanliness, and chicness. Will definitely come back and recommend to others.

title: NYU visit
text: Great place to stay to be walking distance of NYU. Our view was great. The hotel itself is very nice, we enjoyed the cafe and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. Very clean and comfortable rooms.

title: Matters To Me
text:
We have stayed at The Standard East Village four or five times and have never been disappointed. The people who work at the hotel are super nice, friendly, and very accommodating. The beds are comfy and the room is always spotless with upscale amenities.
The only thing I would say in the negative column is that the rooms are pretty small, but in New York City that is not uncommon or surprising. The hotel is an exciting place to be with a bar and restaurant on the main floor.

title: Buena ubicacion y buen servicio
text: La ubicacion es interesante, el servicio es bueno pero las habitaciones son extremadamente pequeñas (ayuda que sean vidriadas) y el wi fi es de pesima calidad. No satisface las expectactivas que uno se hace cuando se aloja en un hotel de la cadena The Standard

title: Our favorite NYC Hotel
text:
Great Hotel. clean, modern with a warm and good atmosphere
Great staff. From the front-desk to the cleaning staff. They all gave their warmest smiles and walked that extra mile to make our stay great. 
Great location. At the center of our favorite part of NYC.

Already look forward to our next stay!

title: Tiny, noisy, over-hyped.
text: Have had consistently great experiences at Standard properties. This one however, is full of quirks -- an elevator that can take a long time to wait for, paper-thin walls, noise from adjacent closets used constantly by cleaning staff -- one of the worst NYC hotel experiences. Smallest rooms, even by NYC standards.

title: Went to see a great Play, romantic dinner and an excellent overnight trip to New York from Long Island.
text: What a great Room and the view was amazing, clean, neat, everything you could want. Toured the entire hotel and bar with staff that seamlessly handed us off from one thing to the next. It was so nice. I can’t wait to do it again. We had dinner in nearby little Italy. Breakfast at Katz’s Delicatessen. Toured St. Patrick’s Cathedral. Mass. Great night sleep. Great nice Shower! Fantastic Trip from anywhere. Ron

title: Birthday Done Right
text:
Hi. I recently stayed at the Standard EV for what was supposed to be one night, but without hesitation extended to two, thanks to the killer time and stellar service provided. 
The location speaks for itself, it's the East Village of NYC, literally, everything is at your fingertips. The design of the hotel is gorgeous (tip: the staircase to the sub lobby restrooms is very 'instagrammable'), the food & beverage outlets are superb, and the staff is always around to greet you with a smile. 
My room itself (a corner king, maybe?) was beautifully configured. Yes, a tad small, compared to the suites at an all-inclusive resort in Cancun (THIS IS NY PEOPLE, we don't have space!) but like I said, smart and cozy design. 
Housekeeping was fantastic. Quick and friendly!
I must say my stay was absolutely made thanks to the front office team. Someone caught wind that it was my birthday, and without requesting a thing I was upgraded and given a lovely birthday amenity. Sometimes, it's just that little extra touch that really makes a hotel home. A very special shoutout to David Burgos, the overnight manager. He was incredibly charming and always made us laugh when returning to the hotel after our adventurous evenings. He really went out of his way to make sure my friends and I were comfortable and had the best time. 
Much love standard EV, I will be back! :)

title: Trip to east village
text:
We loved the location. Hotel was very hip and cool. Loved our corner king room. Housekeeping was great. Rooms are snug but very comfortable. Loved the beds. We walked everywhere. Already booked a room for december

Dr b

title: An amazing weekend wedding
text: We got married at The Standard East Village on October 12.  We rented out the Penthouse, and stayed in the Downtown Suite. Everything was incredible and I cannot express how breathtaking the Penthouse view was!  Our back drop for the ceremony was gorgeous and the level of service provided by Kira and her event staff was top notch.  Our friends had an incredible time and all of them complimented the hotel and their staff for being so warm and accommodating during their stays. I also highly recommend staying in the Downtown Suite, it was such an incredible comfortable room with another fabulous view. The East Village is a fantastic neighborhood to explore, and The Standard Hotel fits right in with their fun and laid back vibe. If you want a fun place to throw a party or even just a weekend get away, you can’t go wrong with this hotel!

title: This hotel has all the amenities!!
text: This is about my fourth time to stay at the Standard Hotel, East Village.  True the closet is small and it would be nice to have more space.  Why would I sit at the desk in the space that feels like a closet, with no view out the large windows?  The corner room was prepared nicely otherwise and we were able to enjoy the sunrise from our bed in the mornings.  Overall a nice experience in an evolving neighbourhood.

title: Great hotel in amazing location
text:
I recently spent a week visiting my children in NYC. Below NYU is the city's most exciting neighborhood. 
At the Standard, my room was quiet and spacious, with tremendous views, and the staff was as nice as could be. They had everything I needed. I will be back!
PS The city is amazingly CLEAN. Well done, New York!!

title: The Standard, East Village: what you see is not what you get
text: Recently I was on a trip to NYC and I stayed at "The Standard, East Village" hotel. The hotel charges USD600 per night, which I consider fairly expensive, therefore raising expectations. The first impression was good, hotel looks nice, new and with an obvious effort to look modern. I went to the room and my first disappointment, a very small room and also very small storage space. The closet was not so small, but half of it was used with a minibar. During the night, I had to plug out the minibar due to the excessive noise it was making. I was also bothered by the number of things they offer you to buy, in an obvious upsell strategy, being one of them the robe. For that piece, a note in the bathroom tells you that if they find the robe missing, it means that you have decided to purchase it, and you will be charged something around $100. The interesting part is that the cleaning service disappeared with the robe on my second night and I had to discuss with the reception about that, since I did not want to be overly charged for a standard hotel robe. I also sent a few packages to the hotel and it took a while for the hotel staff to find them and deliver properly. The Wi-Fi is extremely slow, but you can easily upgrade paying extra $20. I was trying to download something and the estimated time in the hotel was 3 hours. In a public Wi-Fi I manage in 5 minutes. One night I went to the bar for a drink. The attendant did not have a clue about what they have in the bar and prices. Also, the music was so loud that I have decided to finish my drink in my room. Last, when returning for the last night, my key was not working. Talking to the reception, they made a mistake and finish my stay one day earlier. It took me some time to convince them that they made a mistake and therefore they should not charge any extra to my bill. The hotel looks nice, they make an effort to look modern, but the service is very poor and their effort to upsell is annoying. I still prefer old style hotels with good service.

title: Great business trip stay
text: I stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip and really enjoyed it. Room was clean and well laid out. WiFi was reliable. You can use a nice gym across the street. Car service for airport was good. I would definitely stay again.

title: Best NYC hotel!
text: I have stayed in many NYC hotels and this one was the best by a mile. The room was wonderful, clean, large (I booked the double double) and an amazing view. Location can't be beaten. What makes this hotel so good though is the staff. Adrienne (who we met when we checked in) and Maggie are assets to the hotel! They made our stay wonderful, with a lovely bottle of wine and brownies for my mum's birthday. The only thing I can suggest the hotel to improve is housekeeping which is inconsistent. For two days it was perfect then one day, they took our bathrobes away and did not bring new ones, another day towels were not changed. However, this hotel still deserves 5 stars!

title: Great first visit!
text: I chose this hotel because it's very close to my daughter's dorm. I had a feeling I'd like it, and I was right! It has a fun,  contemporary, "funky", yet elegant vibe, which I appreciate. The staff is AMAZING. Every single person I interacted with was genuinely friendly, polite and helpful. It seems that everyone who works there loves their job. The room was comfortable, the room service was speedy and delicious! I will definitely continue to stay at the Standard every time I visit NYC.

title: Consistently delivers
text: After using several hotels in the area, the Standard East Village has become our go to.  Great location for  the East Village, Lower East Side, NOHO and SOHO.   The staff from the Doorman, Bellman, Check In, Conceirge, Room Service and House keeping are always attentive and helpful; most times without requesting anything.   Rooms are clean with amazing views.  Despite an active bar and club on the first floor, the rooms are quiet. We have stayed here several times, on the last visit our room rate included breakfast which I did not realize; upon check out they credited us for the breakfast we did not use.  A really nice touch.

title: "Easy to work with event staff!"
text: I had a fundraising event at the Penthouse at The Standard, East Village this September for my non-profit, and the staff was accommodating, and very helpful making everything run very smoothly day-of. You can tell they definitely have great experience with events. The atmosphere was amazing!

title: Another Great Standard Stay
text: The Standard East Village never disappoints.  Our visit last week was perfect, as usual.  From check-in with the very accommodating Will at the front desk, to the guest manager, Maggie, to Erin in the bar/cafe and Joan, the bellman, our interaction with the staff was outstanding.  Every person went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and pleasant.  We have never had a bad experience at The Standard.  It always rises above our expectations.  Every time we leave, we are looking forward to our next trip to NYC and our next stay at The Standard.  Thank you to all who make it such an outstanding experience.

title: LOVE MY STAY EVERY TIME!
text: The only place I stay when I come to NYC.  I often come to visit my son in College and this is my "standard!".  I have and will always stay here.  Perfect location, wonderful and welcoming staff.  They email before your stay to make sure your needs are taken care of, set up a driver to/from the airport, etc.  Feels like a home away from home+ because of the added service.  It's in a less "touristy" part of the city so that you can really enjoy and fall into NY life.  Walking distance from so many great, must see areas too though.  And, the thought and consciousness that goes into the food/wine they serve is an added bonus!  So yummy.

title: GREAT LOCATION, Great Staff, Small Rooms
text: I have stayed here on many occasions to visit my child in college near by.  I love the location, I love the staff, I love the look and feel of the public spaces.  Room service is very good.  Rooms are very small.  Food in the restaurants on site, are VERY limited after 9 pm.  The room price is very high.

title: AMAZING STAY!!!
text:
My girlfriend and I had an amazing stay at this Standard property. It was our first time staying here and we can recommend it to everyone. The staff was very attentive and incredibly friendly. The room was spacious with amazing views all around. We also had dinner at Narcissa which was fantastic! The next time we fly back to New York this will definitely be the place where we will be staying. Thank you Maggie, Franck, Kevin and the rest of the team for making this stay special! 

Greetings from The Netherlands

title: Home away from home
text: Standard EV is my go-to each time I’m in NYC. Staff is helpful and joyful, location is amazing, cafe downstairs is perfect all times of day & night. Rooms clean and modern. Maggie even left us a nice welcome gift to make sure we felt right at home upon arrival. Crunch gym access is a huge plus, as we don’t like to skip out on the gym while away, or be stuffed into a small gym with two machines. Walk everywhere, close to subway. Coming back soon!

title: Best view and amazing staff
text:
We stayed in a Deluxe King room on the top floor (we had emailed asking for a high floor and were given the highest :)), and the view we had is beyond words. We saw Williamsburg Bridge, Manhattan Bridge and Brooklyn Bridge as well as Lower Manhattan, and of course the charming streets of the East Village just below. The room itself was everything we could have asked for, most importantly a huge and very comfy bed! The minibar had probably the best selection of snacks and drinks I've ever seen. All staff we spoke to during our stay were amazing, not just business style friendly but really kind and genuinely nice. 
The location of the hotel is ideal. Manhattan is perfectly walkable from that spot in any direction, and we found the immediate surroundings (East Village and Astor Place) to have a very welcoming and inspiring vibe. I would stay at the Standard East Village again any time I visit New York again.

title: More than a hotel...
text: The lobby is straight out of a Wes Anderson film and the rooms are minimalist with a pop touch. Everything was clean and the bed was super comfy. Big shout out to the bellman Gio and the front desk girl Adrienne.

title: Under the Stars Fundraiser
text:
The NYSPCC's Junior Society hosted their annual fundraiser, Under the Stars, on an amazing night in late September. The views are spectacular, the food is delicious and plentiful, and the bars kept up with the high demand of our guests.

The Standard staff in the event department was very generous in helping us make for a successful event that guest are looking forward to again - MANY thanks to Teresa Nolan and her staff!

title: Excellent stay, super sweet staff
text: I stayed at the Standard for a week for work and it honestly was above my expectations. As a former New Yorker, it was the perfect location — not touristy, close to all the things. My room so so clean and modern, and I loved going to sleep and waking up with that VIEW! But mostly, the staff was just so kind. I got a note from the manager, Maggie, on my first night welcoming me, and Adrienne at the front desk hooked me up with a great local discount. From the people who helped me with my luggage (thanks for popping it in my room!) to everyone at the front desk, thank you! This is now my hotel of choice for my work trips and I've already recommended it to my team.

title: David very helpful!
text:
Got at The Standard pretty late on a Saturday for a one night reservation my flight got cancelled and the standard was the BEST place to be stranded at. Dave at the front desk went above and beyond and gave me the Do’s and Don’ts of pizza in the area since room service was closed. Everyone had energy here, even at 3am! And the cafe was quite quaint with a quick coffee and croissant to enjoy outdoors. Can’t wait to come back for realsies!

Ps, Bleecker Pizza is great!

title: Tiny but nice...
text:
Cute hotel in an area I needed to stay in. The room is very minuscule, well-appointed, but it is not big enough for more than one person, and should you have a large suitcase, such as I did, the room was really too small for one person.

The decor is nice, it’s a funky vibe, no lobby, no real place to sit or meet people, and it was fine. For a 2-night stay it was okay, certainly very clean and the room was nice, but its tiny size would make me reconsider going again.

They certainly try hard and the service is excellent, but I would have preferred more room to breath.

title: Excellent stay at Standard East Village
text: My husbandand I stayed at the Standard east village for 3  days in the month of October. We had the best experience. The hotel is very clean, nice ambiance, and great location. The staff is extremely nice, they go beyond to make you feel welcome. We had access to the lounge which made our stay perfect. I would recommend this hotel to everyone from business to leisure trip

title: Eclectic mix of atmospheres to enjoy unique foods and beverages!
text:
We vacationed with our son and his fiancé. We had two rooms, conveniently located across from each other. Although our basic rooms were not spacious, they were fully equipped, clean, comfortable, and cozy. 
Room service was speedy and all requests were fully addressed!
We will absolutely choose to stay here again!

title: Excellent birthday “staycation”
text: My partner and I celebrated my birthday with a little staycation at The Standard, East Village. The lobby was so cozy and inviting, and the room had a view to die for. The staff was so kind and very helpful. It was so great to have a beautiful home base in the heart of one of my favorite neighborhoods in Manhattan. We are already planning our next stay.

title: Extremely poor value
text:
I've stayed at this property several times in the last ten years. Every time I checked out, I was stunned by how much I had to pay for how little.

The rooms are the size of a bathroom, the bathrooms the size of a closet. That's for a 'deluxe'. No coffee machines, no minimal amenities.

There is hardly any recognition for people who come back multiple times, other than a card from Maggie, the 'experience' manager. You still get the same matchbox room.

The building has not been very well kept. It shows in the rooms. My bathroom window would not close, resulting in a lot of noise. The A/C unit sounded like a jackhammer, every few minutes. Corner are broken a frayed. There is only so much paint one can apply to hide the defect.

The biggest issue every time I stayed, and this time was no different, was the lack of elevators. One is permanently broken. One used for service, and one is supposed to serve guests over 21 floors, but is also used all the time, unapologetically, by service people. As a result, I waited every day, several times, up to 20 minutes to get up or down. Unacceptable at a $500 a night hotel providing so little for the money..

The only thing going for this property was the location, but I see there are now other hotels and some nice AirBNB locations. Time to move on.. I feel utterly stupid for having stayed there again..

title: 5 days and nights of fun and great service
text:
We spent 5 days here with two teenagers.  We had two rooms and ours was room 1407.  The Standard team here headed by Frank really has its act together.  The service and attention to detail is superb in every respect. From dining, to the front desk, the doorman, and even housekeeping, this place runs like a well-oiled machine staffed by delightful people who clearly enjoy their work.  

The hotel has the right mix of seriousness and fun.  The service and food are seriously good.  The decor, design and young crowd are fun.  The garden is a great place for an evening cocktails and quieter conversation.  The cafe serves fantastic coffee and a great breakfast with a French bistro flair.  The green juice is fab and healthy.  The granola and yogurt is also a great way to start the day. Breakfast service is excellent and friendly. 

The hotel has access to a decent health club  (the Crunch) and a Soul Cycle, all very close by. 

The doorman and front desk team went out of their way to help us solve a complicated transportation problem, recommend restaurants, and generally keep us happy.   

Room 1407 is a nice corner room with a great nighttime view of the Empire State Building.  It’s cozy and modern.  And the complimentary bottle of rose from the management made it even nicer.  The view just makes you want to spend extra hours in bed relaxing or reading. 

This is also a great place for couples without teenagers who want to enjoy a lively upscale atmosphere.

title: Home away from home in NYC!
text: My husband and I had an excellent time on your property! Adrienne was great. We had the best greeting at check in and the vibes were always so positive. The design of this property is so unique and eclectic, we love it.  The room was super clean and comfy and the view can’t be beat.  We love the cafe, the design is so inviting and the food is delish - especially the French toast sticks! We can’t wait to stay with you guys again when we make it back to the city!

title: Great just needs a bit more attention to detail
text:
The Standard is in a lovely location in New York a bit out of the rat race.  
The rooms, especially for one or two people is cute and the views really help give you a sense of space.  I think the staff are lovely and attentive and the facilities lovely.  They just need some work on consistency.  For example, an iron in the room should be a must.  Some of the cupboards have hanging that goes front to back which is completely impractical.  One day I would get a pack of things for the bathroom and a fashwasher the next day I didn't. It was just very inconsistent in this area.  The hot chocolate cost me 10.50 US which is another inconsistency.  Apart from that, I think it has "good bones" and just needs to work on "polish".

title: My favorite!!!
text: The Standard will definitely be my standard from now on. The location is great, our room was wonderful with big windows and a great view, the staff was exceptional  treated us like royalty but that was because we had our dog Winston. They are very dog friendly the only place in the city I have ever stayed with no dog fee ! See you next time Standard!!

title: Cool vibe and nice place to stay
text: I loved the chill vibe of East Village. Plenty of restaurants and bars close by but not as crazy as Soho or midtown. Still walking distance to Soho, Chelsea Market, East Village bars/restaurants (with the exception of Broadway and midtown). If you are looking for something a bit smaller, unique, homey and personal, this is a great choice.

title: Penthouse Event
text: My company had a fantastic panel event on the 21st floor this past week. The Standard was extremely helpful with any and everything that I needed. The food was great and our guests seemed to have a great time - even though the weather was not in our favor the entire event.

title: Trip
text:
Had a great experience. Outstanding customer service from kevin C and David B!!! Will definitely be back! Definitely one of the better experiences I’ve had at a New York hotel. The Standard is somewhere that people
Should stay

title: Great place to stay in East Village
text: I love staying at this hotel in East Village. It is in a convenient location, the rooms and bathrooms are spacious, they have a great breakfast indoor/outdoor area, a groovy garden bar with the best Frose' and a wonderful staff in all areas. They will arrange car service to and from the airport and the use of Crunch gym right across the street.

title: Amazing room with a view, great staff and location, just perfect !
text:
Amazing room with a view, great staff and location, just perfect ! 
The room was just beautiful with a view on the WTC, room super clean and bath products are amazing !
Just a perfect location in the heart of LES walking distance to Union Sq and Soho.
Thank you so much for an amazing stay !

title: Just Wonderful!
text: Excellent venue/hotel in a great location, gorgeous property, and accommodating, attentive and super staff! Our event was held on the rooftop and the event staff were a pleasure to work with and made the event one to remember!

title: East village place to stay
text: Awesome hotel in a great location for the east village traveler! We walked nearly everywhere and the one time we went down to the financial district we just caught the subway! Rooms were a decent size for NYC, but we booked a deluxe king room so others may be smaller, bathroom had a heated floor which would be nice if the weather was cool, but it wasn’t! Go to the No Bar and order a cocktail, it’s basically attached to the hotel and allegedly has some of the best cocktails in the city. The garden bar is a nice spot to hang out and apparently the cafe is also pretty happening because it was slammed every time we went by. The only issues we had were we bought a package to include a photography museum and the New museum, the photography museum was closed and the New museum was, in my opinion, a bust. Also, the air in our room kept blowing warm air so we had to call the front desk the second day and he reset it, but we had to do it again the next day.

title: The Standard East Village is by far the best hotel in NYC= Adrienne at the Front Desk
text:
This is just a quick note to let travelers and The Standard Hotel know that after extensive and detailed research of hotels in NYC- I was incredibly impressed by the attention, detail, warmth and guidance I  received from Adrienne Pluta (working at the Front Desk) for The Standard. I travel frequently for business as well as personally- but not often do I have the opportunity to interact with someone in the hotel and hospitality industry as professional, efficient and positive as Adrienne. Not only did I book this trip due to my phone conversation with Adrienne, but if the hotel is as amazing as Adrienne is (which I'm sure it will be) - all my future stays in NYC will be solely at The Standard, High Line. Adrienne brings a huge value to this hotel and they are very fortunate to have her - as I was fortunate enough to interact with her. 
Follow up- The stay at this hotel was amazing. The room room was quiet, spacious, beautiful and extremely clean; the bathroom was magnificent and "state of the art" ; service was timely and very polite as well as accommodating; "check in and out" was smooth and efficient. The location is located in a convenient and great location, as well. 
Adrienne Pluta was as fantastic "in person" as she was on the phone and probably the best and most professional I have ever met in the hotel industry. (I travel extensively for business.) This hotel is a "must" if you are traveling to NYC and desire the best hotel. ( I don't rate anything very often, but  great customer service and terrific hotels need to be shared to elevate industry standards-therefore don't miss the The Standard East Village". :))

title: Again and again
text: Another wonderful stay at The Standard East Village. My husband and I decided to stay overnight after his all day business conference. Going to The Standard feels like “ home” to us and at the same time feels like a lovely getaway. Thanks to Maggie and Xjehn who made sure we got a lovely bottle of wine and delicious goodies, including a giant cookie, for my husband’s birthday which was also that same night. We first stayed at this hotel a little over a year ago and have been back 4 or 5 times since, thanks to the warmest connection we made with the amazing Paige ( who has since been promoted off site) on our initial visit. Looking forward to the next visit.

title: best east village hotel
text: This hotel is special! It has a wonderful location, really attentive and kind staff. The restaurant food is delicious as are the drinks. The rooms are really quiet and clean with furniture lines that are sleek. This is our go-to hotel when we are in the city.

title: Disappointing service
text: Great location, tiny rooms, but I upgraded to a corner King room which was much better. Do not eat breakfast their, unbelievably slow and belligerent service. We were a big group, over 25 who spent a fortune and the auto response from staff was no. Can we check out two hours later, extra $100 they  said so queried and they rather than saying yes of course let me check made a big fuss whit checking with someone else and I had to go back to them to find out. Someone else in party asked for same and got told no. Wouldn’t go back due to service

title: E Village Gem
text: Great property, staff and location.  Staff very attentive and responsive.  Rooms are well appointed and clean.  Good sized bathrooms for NYC hotels.  Great dining options.  Will definitely return when coming to NY.

title: Awesome service
text: Dave and Kevin were so kind and helpful all week with recommendations and just being friendly. We were upgraded from a king bedroom to a studio room for the last night which had even more beautiful views of lower Manhattan. All of the bell hop workers we saw and interacted with were upbeat and helpful. Would definitely book here again. Thanks Dave!

title: Amazing Labor Day weekend Brunch
text: Friends and I stayed for one night at this hotel, we had brunch at Narcissa and We were treated like royalty so we loved it. Franck at front desk was outstanding. Oh and the food is yummy, potato fries the best!

title: *Exceptional* service from booking, to planning the visit, through our stay, and in follow up
text: I started staying at The Standard, East Village on business several years ago and it has become my favorite for personal and business.  Nowhere else have I been received so warmly, had issues resolved so quickly, been remembered visit to visit, and had staff be so committed to a consistently great experience.  It truly has become a home in the city, and I believe a great value for a New York City hotel.  Great food/drinks and recommendations for local spots.  Their car service is better than ride share or taxi for getting to the airport.

title: Stay Here!
text:
I’ve stayed at many hotels over the years of varying quality. This has been by far one of my favorite experiences. In all honesty the quality of the staff alone is very similar to my experiences at the St. Regis and in some regards even better. They make you feel at home and pampered at the same time. Before we even arrived I had received emails letting me know they would make sure my baby had a crib and was taken care of without me even asking. They promptly return emails and answer any questions you might have which in my experience is not always the case with modern hotels.
Upon arrival we were exhausted and disheveled and they quickly put us in a room to rest well before our check in time. The room was spotless (that never happens anymore) and perfectly cool after coming in from the summer heat.
The beds are super comfortable and I found the size of the room to be perfect even with a toddler pouncing around. 
When they delivered the crib I was amazed to receive a pretty nice one. Usually you just get a sad pack n play but this was well thought out and very cozy for our little one.
One of the things that made us really love this hotel is that no one ever said no when we asked for something. Every person took a moment to see if they could find a solution for our needs and every time they did. We are so impressed and equally thankful. 
The hotel itself is very well appointed. It’s beautiful and clean. It’s in a perfect location for everything you could need or want. Close to the subway and close to some of the best cultural “must see and do” of nyc. Unfortunately we didn’t have a chance to eat dinner there but breakfast was delicious! Room service is exactly what you need. It has a handful of very enticing items and a great wine list that’s also well priced for a hotel. Not like most hotels that have a sad pizza for $20 and like two mediocre wine options.
At night it seemed to get very busy and lively and although it was pretty loud once we got into our room we couldn’t hear any of it. It was absolutely perfect.
I had previously lived in nyc for a long time so I know a lot of the hotels there. I can say without a doubt I will never stay anywhere else when visiting. Don’t waste your time looking at other hotels. You get what you pay for and here you get a little bit more.
Thank you Standard east village for making my trip wonderful and for taking such great care when it came to my baby. I am a forever fan.

title: Perfect nyc trip!
text: Loved everything about the standard - fab location, fab staff, super clean chic bright and cozy room, gorgeous garden and great onsite cafe/bar. Will definitely stay here again in future trips! Thank you!

title: One of the best in town!
text: Great hotel, location and customer service. We had a blast at Narcissa Restaurant with friends, delicious food, specially the grill octopus! The patio makes you feel at home, must go. Highly recommended!

title: Hassle free Honeymoon
text:
All the team at the hotel were so helpful and accommodating...they could not do enough to make sure we had the best experience. They were a credit to their organisation. 
The location is absolutely superb and the rooms are clean and have a cool decor and comfortable beds.  
The toiletries smell so good and the shower was excellent (unlike most NYC hotels).

title: 10 /10 un séjour exceptionnel avec une équipe au top et aux petits soins!
text:
Des chambres bien équipées et calmes 
une vue à couper le souffle!
une équipe toujours accueillante et bienveillante, jamais à court de propositions 
pour nous faire découvrir la grosse pomme sous toutes ses coutures ;)
nous avons adoré le quartier, qui nous a permis d'apprivoiser New york!

title: Overall average
text: The hotel was ok. Room was small and looked like a budget hotel room. I was put on a low floor and would have paid more for the option to have a floor. My window looked directly into someone's apartment. I've stayed at the other location and the hotel is nicer however I prefer the east village location. Location is 5/5. Service was good

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: We chose this hotel due to the proximity to one of the NYU dorms. Overall, we had a very nice stay. Friendly staff and great vibe. There is a nice bar and garden area and both offer unique cocktails. We stayed in a corner room that had big windows and was a good size for a NYC hotel.

title: The Standard - Aptly Named
text:
Booked the standard well in advance and got what is by New York standards a great price. So can't fault them on value. Check in was a smooth and fast process. The receptionist seemed aware that we couldn't be bothered with an overload of pleasantries that late at night and got us sorted with a room key asap.

The location in East Village is really good if you are after something that is a little bit out of the hustle and bustle of uptown, or the mundane downtown. Lot's of local vibes and eateries around. Fairly easy to get up or downtown on the subway. The 'R' line is great. Don't forget just how big Manhattan is. Uber's are actually super expensive and take forever. Walking or subway is preferable.

The room at the hotel was nice, clean, modern, small. The bed was super comfortable. The best thing about it was definitely the view uptown - what more can you ask for when staying in NY other than a rocking view.

Place would be well served by things such as a 24/7 snack bar and a more chilled vibe downstairs at reception area.

title: Above average hotel
text:
The vibe is young and hip. For a couple of 70 somethings, our first steps into the hotel lobby were disorienting, an impression quickly put to rest by attentive doormen and desk staff. In fact, all the staff that we encountered including housekeeping, security, maintenance, bartenders, and wait persons were friendly and helpful. All of them made us feel comfortable. Special regards to Giovanni and his coworker as well as the Cafe bartender.Thank you, Maia, for finding and returning my wallet! Shout out to Kevin for quick "problem-solving" and and Adrienne at the front desk who told me my wallet had been found. Thanks also to Will Erwin for welcoming us back.
Bed very comfortable, great view of Cooper Square. The tree-shrouded garden was a welcome oasis on a 90 degree day. 
You're within walking distance of a cornucopia of restaurants/watering holes  in any direction but the Cafe and Narcissa restaurant are excellent options.
Love the quirky, fun-house decor. 
This being our second stay, a third visit is a no-brainer.

title: The W O R S T - hazardous cracked window !!!
text: We were placed in a room on the 17th floor with a cracked window with packaging tape. The disaffected millennials at the front were arrogant and dismissive about our concerns with our 2 and 4 year olds pressing at the windows in this 9x20 space and did not switch our room. Do not expect The Standard in the east village of NY to be anything like LA. It’s a shoe box with a cracked window and some nicely designed pillows with lips. Someone warned me this is where people went for one night stands and what I dismissed from afar now resonates. The tiny hairs on our sink that I wiped up on arrival now are just sprinkles on this disappointment sundae.

title: Great staff = great service!
text:
I went to NYC for my niece's wedding. Not having any knowledge of the city and wanting to keep things as simple as possible, I booked a room at The Standard where the ceremony was being held. What a piece of good fortune! Located in a great neighborhood, the hotel was in walking distance of many of the attractions of lower Manhattan. A nearby subway station made longer trips easy and convenient.

The hotel has an easy-going, relaxed atmosphere similar to a backyard garden. Rooms are bright and offer good views of the surrounding city. Very comfortable bed and spacious bathroom. The ceremony was held at the "pool-less penthouse" which has panoramic views of the city and was the perfect spot for the gathering.

The best part of my stay was the friendliness and wonderful customer service provided by all members of the staff. Everyone from the front desk staff to hospitality to maintenance and housekeeping were unfailingly helpful, happy, and dedicated to making my stay pleasant. They are all great ambassadors for The Standard and NYC. I would like to thank Lisa, Giovanni, Marcos, and Adrienne especially for their efforts.

title: Modern and hip hotel in a nice location
text: Our family stayed in a double corner room with lots of glass and an excellent view.  The room was spacious by NYC standards at 325sq. ft. and modern. The location was perfect near many restaurants and a residential area but an easy walk to many landmarks and destinations.

title: Overall Excellence
text: Excellent hotel, beautiful rooms, delicious food and a wonderful staff! I would recommend this hotel. It is a perfect location in the heart of the lower east side. The corner king room provides additional views of the city.

title: Petit déjeuner agréable et copieux
text: Nous nous sommes arrêtés deux fois dans cet hôtel pour le petit déjeuner où nous avons été très bien reçu dans un cadre sympa. Plats bons et copieux et service impeccable. Un bémol (relatif à New York...): le prix. Compter 40$ à deux.

title: Service Makes It!
text: I stayed here on business in early July, and every one that we encountered on staff went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of. Specifically, Adrienne @ the front desk, Gio the bellman, & Samantha at the bar downstairs all really showed up for my colleague and I. I will definitely stay again, and recommend!

title: Staff was incredible
text: The hotel was fantastic. Ideal location, large rooms, cool vibe. Most importantly, the entire staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They even emailed us before the trip to see if we had any specific requests. Highly recommend.

title: Friendly Personnel
text: The hotel is a walking distance to shopping and sightseeing areas. Shoutout to Alexander and his team for taking care of our stay and requests for my family. The outside garden space is great for such hotel. Can’t wait to return!!!

title: First Time Staying in East Village
text: Came to New York to celebrate my sister-in-law's 30th in the East Village and ended up staying at The Standard. It's a cool location in the center of it all and front desk Adrienne was super helpful, she suggested some great things to do. We got to see improv at UCB, which I'd never done before! Ended the night at the bar with some cocktails, which wrapped up a great sibling weekend. Couldn't thank everyone at The Standard enough!

title: Favorite Hotel in New York
text: I travel to New York 4X a year for work and The Standard East Village is BY FAR my favorite place to stay.  The beds are incredibly comfortable, nice products from Davines and each room has incredible views. I love the restaurants, fresh pastries daily with real fruit preserves, I also love the Chorizo and Eggs. The staff make me feel at home, welcomed and taken care of.

title: The worse Guests and the Best understanding Staff
text: Ultimate Nightmare for any family ?  - Visiting NYC with two  boys 15 & 16 years The ultimate gift -stunning views 19th floor- great service and hotel staff keeping the family busy with recommendation in Manhatten and getting us tickets for any event on short notice - It was our 3rd stay within 3 months and we will be coming back again and again - perfect neighborhood to explore this great city that never sleeps

title: Good service, nice rooms
text: The Standard is a European style hotel with elegance, style, and that boutique feeling that makes is comfortable. The staff is attentive and friendly. Only there two days so I was unable to explore all that the hotel had to offer. Would definitely stay there again when in that area of NYC.

title: Perfect Getaway Weekend
text: I visited The Standard East Village over the weekend and every was ideal. Front desk was welcoming from check in to check out, room had a fantastic view and food options were aplenty. I didn’t know what to expect but I know I made the right choice, I will be back at some point soon!

title: Favourite place to stay in New York!
text: Everyone is friendly and helpful - great location and one of nicest spots for breakfast ever! Stayed here at least four times now and I am consistently delighted Definitely my favourite place to stay in New York.

title: Loved everything about this hotel!!!
text: I highly recommend this hotel for people of all ages. We are in our late 50s, visiting our son who lives in the East Village. This hotel was perfect in every way.  We enjoyed every bar and restaurant at the hotel and entertained his friends (in their 20s) there and they loved it.  The bars/restaurants at the hotel were so great that it made it hard to leave to go elsewhere for food/drinks. The service was outstanding in every way.  Our room was delightful, with an incredible view of the city.  The food was great and our son and his friends loved the cocktails. So glad we stayed here; we'll stay in The Standard again (in other locations, too).  My husband is very picky and he loved The Standard. We both loved everything about it, and, again, our son and his friends loved it, too.  I'm sure they'll return for meals and drinks. Everyone who worked at The Standard was lovely - they seemed to enjoy working there and they provided outstanding customer care.  The decor was fabulous.  The hotel even has a room ("The Perch") for visitors to use when they need to get some work done; it was really nice. We hated to leave....!

title: I will ALWAYS stay at The Standard in the East Village when in NYC.
text: Though I've stayed in many hotels in NYC, for the past few years I've only stayed at the Standard in the East Village when visiting my daughter in NYC. This past stay there, August 1st-4th, both a friend and a cousin came with me, each having their own rooms. They also thought it was an excellent  and cool hotel.The staff is warm, friendly and very professional. They care about their guests' hotel experiences. The front desk staff, the doormen and valet, the servers in Narcissa, and the more casual bar restaurant, all knock themselves out for their guests. The lobby and restaurants are in an old NYC building, and both the staff and the small size of the older building, provide the sense of being in a five star boutique hotel. In fact the lovely older building is conjoined with a beautiful modern glass skyscraper, and yet one always has this sense of a large ratio of staff per guest. The decor of the hotel is cool. The rooms are always clean and look brand new. The linens are so fine. Room service is fast. We enjoyed all of the meals there. The service is very attentive. The rooms are quiet. I've never heard noise from the hall or from other rooms. I could live in The Standard. I consider it home when I come to NYC. This visit the manager left a sweet welcoming note, and bakery goodies for me on arrival. I love this excellent hotel!

title: Amazing, friendly service!
text: My daughter and I had driven to NYC from Boston that morning to wait for the movers to arrive and get her new apartment set up.  We didn't finish until after 7pm and arrived at The Standard exhausted, starving and in desperate need of showers.  Will at the front desk saw that we were frazzled and offered us a free upgrade to a gorgeous room on the 11th floor with an incredible view.  We cleaned up and went down to eat at Narcissa.  While we were waiting for our meals we were brought 2 glasses of bubbly, from Will, to congratulate my daughter on the big move.  How incredibly nice!  We loved everything about this hotel - the people, the room, the restaurants, the location.  Thank you to The Standard

title: Quick Trip to NYC
text: I had the most amazing stay at The Standard East Village.  After an exhausting day of travel, I arrived in the city much later than I had anticipated.  The lovely front desk staff quickly checked me in and offered me a complimentary upgrade to a beautiful room (1807).  The room had a fabulous view, was very clean and quiet.  My only regret was that I only got to spend one short night at The Standard.  Can't wait to go back and actually check out more of what the Standard has to offer.  Thank you Maggie, Will and Kevin for making a rough day so much better!

title: Stellar Service, excellent location, Small rooms, Few amenities
text:
I would qualify this Hotel as Hipster-oriented. The decor and general ambiance is most unusual kitsch mismatch. Everything has been re-thought from the dress code of the personnel to the contents of the mini-bar.
The properly trained people who work there are always kind and offer a smile. Before they decline a request, they will make their best effort to explain why and offer alternatives.
The room we got had a great view but was small, especially if carrying luggage. There is a small custom armoire, containing a safe, a mini-bar and hanging space. Aside from that, a small desk. 
There is a shower (who needs a tub).
The breakfast cafe is superb.
Do not expect anything else. That’s it!
No old coffee in the lobby nor vending machines or newspapers.

title: Classically Romantic
text: My partner and I wanted to stay in the lower Manhattan and she recommended the standard. Oh so NOT standard! Quiet and quaint in the day, a mini party at night. The view makes it feel like you live in NYC. What a great vacation. Room service until late and nearby bars until 4 that were just our style. Even the front desk were at a can do attitude. The front desk manager was great with diner places and was happy to show his tattoos from our neck of the woods. Thank you David for being very personable. Can’t wait to come back and check out that rooftop again.

title: Best Birthday Ever!!
text: I booked a room for my mom and I for her birthday, and The Standard could not have been more accommodating. They gave us a fantastic room and made my mom’s visit so special. Special shout out to the Narcissa team for an amazing brunch as well!

title: Room with a view
text: The room and service was great. Food is also really good at Narcissa and the bar. Location is ideal, super close to SoHo, LES, East Village, Nolita etc. I also like the fact you can use the Gym across the street from the hotel.

title: This hotel is excellent, the location perfect and the staff lovely.
text: We've stayed here on previous occasions and every time we do, we are greeted warmly.  The Front Desk staff is incredibly helpful and makes you feel very welcome.  The hotel is in a fabulous location and the rooms are clean, nice and well priced.  I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good option in NY where prices are quite insane but this hotel is a perfect oasis in the city.  In particular, Kevin and his staff are always there to assist with reservations, cars, etc.   They are knowledgable and accessible.  A great place to stay in NYC!!

title: Thin walls and hip halls
text:
The Standard is a well-known hotel brand, no doubt. With locations in great cities and neighborhoods, creative art inspired spaces and rooms and an ultra-hip flavor for a wide variety of clientele. 

I appreciated The Standard, East Village for its location, style, open spaces, comfy bed and, friendly service. 

I didn't appreciate the price I paid for the corner king due to the sounds (not coming from the outside, but rather from the inside) of my neighbors good times and various languages and yes, the doors shutting and closing at all hours. Just thin walls and very tight room configurations. Now I know!

title: Lovely time in NYC celebrating my husband's birthday
text:
We stayed at the Standard in Eat Village. We felt immediately at home! Staff at the front desk was courteous, but also extremely engaging and personable and had a great sense of humor. They immediately made us feel special and facilitated everything we needed. 
The hotel location, amenities, room were all perfect with fantastic views of cooper union. We loved having our breakfast at the outdoor café, enjoyed an evening drink at their beautiful outdoor enclosed garden and invited our son for a delicious dinner at their restaurant.  Food and drinks were delicious. 
The whole place was a charm. We will be back!

title: Extremely high level of service for the price
text:
This is a gorgeous property with lots if attractive design touches. The location doesn’t get much better, two short blocks to St. Mark’s Place and it’s many restaurants.

The hotel has at least two bars, one a cafe style eatery, and one more of a club, which puts on interesting events.

Above all, the staff was absolutely top notch, about what you’d expect from a much more expensive place. Overall, this is an excellent place to stay at a very reasonable price for the location. Definitely give the front desk and bellmen staff a raise!

title: Great weekend getaway!
text: I extended a business trip in NY and had the best experience with the Standard East Village. It's centrally located, has great customer service and I love the cafe and the gardens cafe. The views are unique as well with floor to ceiling windows.

title: Traveled for business, east to check in/check out and has many eating options in/close.
text: Great room, friendly staff and overall great experience. I plan to stay again and enjoyed the convenient places to eat inside the hotel and easy access to NYU school of arts. Had coffee meetings at Cafe Standard and enjoyed the easy access to the street for my guests.

title: July 4th Weekend
text: Maggie and Franc were so warm and welcoming. They really went out of their way to make sure that we were comfortable and enjoyed our escape to Manhattan for a long weekend. The rooms are super comfortable with great views to match. We can’t wait to return and recommend staying here for anyone who wants a locals vibe from the neighborhood.

title: Great Hotel
