text: Highly recommended. Hotel has a fun atmosphere and fun rooms with great views. We were traveling as a family of five, manager Franck wisely placed us in two adjoining rooms. Hotel is in great location. Highly recommended.

title: Setting The (highest) Standard in NY’s East Village
text: We (my teenage boys & I) set out to explore NYC for 3 nights and without a doubt The Standard East Village was an outstanding choice for us. The vibe is cool and incredibly friendly - surprisingly, a tough combination to find in NYC.  The rooms are full of light thanks to huge picture windows (I recommend the corner rooms!), offer fantastic views of the East Village and beyond and generous in size. The location was superb - everything within an easy reach whether you’re walking, taxi’ing or riding the subway.  The food at The Cafe is great and the evening ambience is fun. Highly recommended! We’ll be going back, for sure.

title: Outstanding staff with comfortable room
text: This was our first visit to the Standard and we had absolutely outstanding service from the time we drove up in front of the hotel until we left.  The room was larger than we expected for a hotel in this price range.  The heated floor in the bathroom was a nice little benefit.  The bed was comfortable and the staff was universally friendly and helpful.  The hotel is close to the metro and it’s located in an interesting area.  Overall it was a great place to stay and we hope to come back.

title: Home away from home
text: Being part of the Standard family, since the creation of this amazing brand, sometimes makes me leave my own home to be catch up, share the vibes, be pampered and cared for my Standard extended family. Et voila! Nothing better to be Standard!

title: Have stayed more than a dozen times - favorite NYC hotel
text: I've stayed here more than a dozen times over the years for both business and personal travel. Super nice/efficient staff. Clean rooms. Good location of you're looking for East Village, with easy subway access for multiple lines. Lots of great restaurants nearby.

title: Fabulous experiencie, great staff that makes everything happen
text: I´ve spent 4 days cellebrating my wife´s bithday, and we had an amazing time. Each one of the SEV helped us having this amazing trip. Nice bar, and excellent view.he location of the hotel is convenient to many outstanding restaurants, shopping and night life.

title: Friendly 'Can Do" / 'Make it Happen' Front desk staff
text: I had a very important meeting at the hotel and the front desk was extremely helpful in getting my documents printed. Franck really went above and beyond in making sure that I had everything I needed.

title: Fabulous experience at The Standard!
text: From the moment I arrived at The Standard, Adrienne, the front desk receptionists was extremely friendly and accommodating in handling my luggage prior to the check in time. The location of the hotel is convenient to many outstanding restaurants, shopping and night life.

title: Come here for the people
text:
Though admittedly a loyal to the Highline location, the EV Standard was a great surprise. Kevin and Will went above and beyond to make my birthday stay the best; with little gifts and a fabulous upgrade!

I can’t stress enough how great the staff is here; the vibe is warm, welcoming, but still upscale and chic. I never thought I’d say this, but I may have a new favorite staycation spot!

Bonus tip: no-longer-new-but-still-new-ish gay bar NoBar downstairs is a refreshing addition to the queer nightlife scene. I’m a sucker for pretty space and great drinks, and they’ve got both.

title: A glass box floating over Manhattan
text:
It had been a while I had not visited the Big Apple and the moment I got out of my car from the airport I knew I was in the right place . The Standard has a level of service and staff that is so helpful and prepared , but above all efficient . 
Its funky and luxury at your finger tips. Having a little Garden to sip your tea or read your mails is unique and also makes you feel you are in a private town house . 
The reception staff are able to source you the best of New York in seconds and deliver   with passion and a big smile . 
I was amazed to see the amneties are "Davines" a very rare sought after brand in Europe and who offer's it to  clients are using the best they can find and that is a very lovely way of greeting your guests . Thank You ! 
My room was a little glass  nest overlooking the city  and the views were mesmerising and all was perfect from the lighting to the linens . 

I am addicted to your smiles and super service, thank you

title: Amazing stay at The Standard!
text:
From the time I stepped foot out of the car, the staff was helpful, accommodating and friendly. I arrived when it was pouring rain with a lot of heavy bags and the staff was so quick to tend to my needs and ensure I had everything I needed to have a comfortable stay. 

Throughout my vacation, the staff was consistently amazing, making for a stress-free stay.

In terms of the hotel itself, we had a spacious, clean room with stunning views of the city. The bed was comfortable, and everything was just perfect!

For neighborhood, East Village is as good as it gets. Walkable area, with tons of awesome restaurants, bars, shopping, close by. You can get anywhere in the city in just minutes from here, which also made it easy to get around and explore New York. 

I will definitely be staying at The Standard for future trips to New York!

title: A fabulous gem of a hotel!
text: From the get go upon check-in, I was warmly greeted and well looked after. I was lucky enough to be staying for just over a week and as a result they put me on a high, quiet floor, with a fabulous view over the New York skyline. The rooms were a moderate size and included all amenities. The bathroom was great too. There was an event at the roof top bar one evening which was absolutely incredible and made my trip. What a wonderful hotel! I've already been singing it's praises to my other colleagues who frequently stay in New York. Thank you to all the staff who looked after me so well. I will be back!

title: A hidden gem!
text: This boutique hotel was a sweet find with courteous staff to greet you and to help upon arrival and departure.  My room was exactly what I expected and more with well-used space, an impeccably clean bathroom, and a glorious bed.  The corner window provided a beautiful view of the city and great light.  The hotel has a neighborhood feel and is nestled in a robust shopping and restaurant area with great access to NYU facilities.  Will definitely stay again!

title: James Beard Dinner Weekend
text: The upgraded suite gave us a panoramic view of the city and we enjoyed hanging out at the restaurant downstairs. They had a great happy hour and delicious oysters. The high line jogging trail is also right outside the front door of the hotel. The Stardard rounded out a fantastic weekend in NYC.

title: "The Standard" IS So MUCH MORE IN NYC !!!!
text:
Needed to stay one more night in NYC, and I found the Standard East Village just around the corner. The front desk was so nice and suggested we should call for a reservation. As soon as I did that, Andrea was wonderful giving several options for rooms and pricing very fair. 
The Standard has everything outdoor/indoor tables and a great Bar.  You will feel like you live here and don't want to leave. Assistant Director is awesome!

title: Clean, convenient, hip in a great location
text: Stayed overnight last minute. Very good rate. Super location. Room was small but clean and well appointed with a fairly modern bathroom and good views - and quiet in spite of all that was happening downstairs. Several bar/dining options - vibrant scene.

title: They make you feel like family
text:
At the Standard East Village, you’re more than a guest at a fabulous hotel. You’re part of a family. From the first friendly confirmation email from Maggie, to a final good-bye hug from Lenora, the café manager, we were treated with warmth, respect and kindness.

Shout outs to Ivan and Tom, our breakfast waiters who happily accommodated my high-maintenance requests. Uber-kudos to Nora, the Standard’s very own bread baker who creates the healthiest sour dough using organic grains from local farmers. And high praises to their restaurant, Narcissa, for the creative veggie options and drop-dead charming secret garden patio. Can’t wait to go back.

title: Outstanding Stay!
text: Celebrating my 30th in NY was a great idea, but staying at The East Village was an even better idea. If you looking for a warm welcome and fantastic service, this is the spot. Our room and view were something out of a movie. Looking forward to our next visit soon!

title: Treated like family!
text: We loved everything about our stay! We were treated with much kindness & the staff was extremely warm & hospitable from the time we pulled our car up until we checked out. The room was comfortable & charming with awesome views. The hotel is fun with a very cool & eclectic vibe. The weather was ideal, so we especially enjoyed relaxing in the gardens & eating brunch with our family outside at Narcssaa. The food was AMAZING & the waitstaff was outstanding!  This is our new favorite brunch spot in NYC. It  was our first stay at The Standard, East Village & this has just become our go to hotel. We can’t wait for our next visit to our new favorite hotel!

title: Another epic stay at The Standard East Village
text: In the past few years, I've used this hotel regularly for work travel. When we decided to take a weekend away wiht friends, The Standard was still top of my list. And it didn't fail to deliver! Great service as ever. The garden theme of Edward Scissorhands was great and made the perfect setting for morning breakfast or evening drinks. Food in Narcissa was again impeccable. Rooms top notch. The location is ideal for connecting uptown and downtown. Our friends were also delighted and will stay again too.

title: Fantastic hotel in prime location
text: I was in the city for one night only to see my favorite band, Killing Joke, play a nearby venue the Poisson Rouge.  I decided to treat myself with The Standard and am so glad I did.  The room was fantastic; the view and the open view in the shower was memorable.  Very professional front desk and accommodating of my need for a quiet space to take a conference call.  I would return for a longer stay without hesitation.

title: Fantastic room and view over NYC
text: Fantastic location close to good restaurants and busing night lifenight. Very nice room with fantastic view over the downtown skyline. A bite expensive and the personal are nice but young and superficial.

title: Cher, froid et prétentieux
text:
Nous avons voulu essayé le concept Standard et avons réservé une chambre de coin, haut située, 400$/jour.
L’accueil, ou plutôt l’absence d’accueil au sens littéral. Il n’y a aucun salon, mais un couloir avec deux bancs au bout duquel on vous prend passeport et carte et vous remet vos clefs sans sourire et sans aucune indication sur l’hôtel. Quelques renseignements seraient pourtant utiles ne serait-ce que pour trouver le restaurant. Nous avons par la suite demandé où se trouvait le roof-top visible sur les photos du site et n’avons obtenu que des réponses évasives et ne l’avons jamais trouvé.
La chambre. La vue est vraiment très belle. Bonne literie. Installation électrique sommaire (rallonge au pied du lit) et éclairage limité. Impossible de ranger les vêtements de deux personnes pour un week-end dans le tout petit placard. Vous les entasserez donc sur le bureau installé dans un recoin de l’entrée. L’inverse aurait été moins hype mais plus pratique. Un fauteuil pour deux, pas facile pour le petit déjeuner.
Horreur absolue : pas de machine à café dans la chambre ! Heureusement, le service d’étage est rapide et nous l’avons vu une fois souriant. Cela fait l’expresso à 15$ (livraison et tip compris). Du coup, nous avons pris nos breakfasts dehors. Pas de gym non plus.
Salle de bain correcte. Pas de toilettes séparées.
Quartier parfait pour visiter Manhattan sud. 
Le quatrième jour, nous avons demandé à garder la chambre deux heures de plus, on nous a demandé de payer une demi-journée. C’est le Standard Time ? 
Et pour finir, le doorman essaye d’extorquer quelques dollars au taxi que nous avions hélé nous-mêmes, altercation …
En résumé, les prestations d’un Ibis (et encore) pour le prix du Sofitel. Alors profitez bien de la vue (c'est l'étoile) mais réfléchissez bien avant et ne prenez pas à moins de 200$.

title: If you haven’t been to the garden..you haven’t lived
text: Home away from home is a understatement to describe the standard east village. I am a local New Yorker and here me when I say their summer garden is the best place in town. Girls night, happy hour, a late lunch with a book and frose...any and all of these activities are perfect for this location. Nestled next to the lobby this cute court yard makes you feel like you have escaped New York City for a magical summer afternoon. Once you see the sculpture shrubs, the corn hole court, and the little details of this oasis you two will think you and your girl friends just unlocked New York’s best kept secret. Oh and if that doesn’t intrigue you...the frose was next level. Incredible staff as always will be back ASAP.

title: Awful room - immediately looked for a new hotel
text: I’ve stayed in a few different hotels in New York over the years and this room was by far the most disappointing. Immediately upon entering, it was tiny, barely enough room to turn around - if there were two people, you couldn’t both walk around the room at the same time, it’s that small. Room furnishings are on par with a college dorm room - poor quality, flimsy, and ugly. I immediately proceeded to the check-in desk and to their credit, they are reimbursing me for the second night of my stay so that I can check out first thing tomorrow morning and move to a different hotel. Frankly, I don’t even want to stay tonight but I don’t want to throw $500 down the drain either. Stay far away. I wish I had known better.

title: Magical
text: I absolutely loved my stay at the Standard East Village! The views were magical from my luxurious king bed as I sipped the hotel's complimentary bubbly. The stay was perfect with quick service and a warm and friendly welcome from Marcos and the ladies at the front desk. Special thank you to Maggie!

title: the Standard east village delivers amazingly again .
text:
We returned to New York and the Standard East Village in March 19 - once again the people the place the room and the service was totally fantastic.
Paige and the team delivered again making sure our room was great and the lovely personal touches like a hand written note welcoming us back makes it so special - Love this hotel I can’t recommend it enough ! I

title: Check out
text: While I stay at this location often for business it really bothers me when I start hearing doors being knocked on in the hallway at 9am and “Housekeeping, housekeeping, housekeeping”. This morning while trying to sleep in, housekeeping walks into my room at 9:30. Check out is NOON. This alone will make think twice when booking my future stays in the area. Well, I’m up now might as well dress and pack so they can clean the room, and charge someone else $425, and not let them check in until after 3pm 😩😤

title: Meraviglioso!!
text:
Un hotel molto suggestivo a 2 passi da Astor Place e 10 minuti  a piedi da Union Square!!
Una calorosa accoglienza ed un team all'altezza della situazione!
Un ringraziamento speciale a Will Erwin,supervisor del Front Office!!
L'hotel è una struttura futuristica ma allo stesso tempo minimal e con una storia centenaria.
La mia camera era la 902 ed era molto panoramica!! Immagino che al 20/21 piano siano ancora più panoramiche.
Consiglio quelle ad angolo perché hanno quasi mezza stanza con finestre ampie e,ripeto panoramiche!
La pulizia è garantita come gli ottimi prodotti per doccia e le lenzuola sempre ordinate e se volete potete farle sostituire quando volete!
TV credo 50 pollici con la possibilità di ascoltare tanta buona musica! Cassaforte e WiFi gratuito!!
Giù all'albergo,annessi allo stesso 2 bar al chiuso o all'aperto. Dipende dal tempo.
Cassaforte e frigo bar con tutto ciò che eventualmente occorre!
Il primo giorno troverete una bottiglia d'acqua e degli stuzzichini molto buoni.
Mi hanno omaggiato di occhialini con l'app da scaricare per vedere col telefonino in 3D.
Prezzo adeguato agli standard Newyorkesi.
Io lo consiglio vivamente per tanti altri particolari che non sto ad elencare perché dovrei scrivere un libro!!!😊😉😘

title: Very Friendly - relaxed
text:
This was my second stay at this hotel (last visit 2-3 years ago) chosen for its location and proximity to meetings that I had while in town. 

My stay was for two nights and throughout the whole experience, the staff in all areas of the hotel were friendly and accommodating without a whiff of superiority that I’ve experienced recently in other hotels in the city. 

I dined at the hotel restaurant for breakfast and lunch and was very happy with both meals... although no gluten free bread options, but If you can eat bread, the in-house baked was delicious. 

The corner king room I reserved for this visit was perfect with a good view and more space to spread out in. It’s not super fancy, but indeed modern, bright, fresh and comfortable. The bathtub in a shower stall was a bit strange... I’d prefer a shower stall that I didn’t have to climb in and out of, but I suppose this setup would make a person who prefers to take a bath very happy.

Great job by the staff!

title: Only if you get a room on a high floor
text:
Have to disagree with the majority of reviewers below. It's quite expensive and I'm not convinced it delivers value. It's not that close to much at all, close to the East Village but by definition, that makes it relatively quiet and certainly much quieter than the Standard Highline.
There is nothing special and distinctive about the design features and the room features (other than the wardrobe) are relatively ordinary. Little things like iPhone and iPad chargers (without an adaptor) are missing and the lighting is not great.Two nice touches are its pet friendly (with no additional charges) and the Garden attached to the lobby.
Surprisingly, there are significant differences between the rooms (not just the views).
I moved rooms from 1 forth floor to a high floor so I could enjoy what the hotel is best known for - the difference is huge. But apart from that, the first room had poor features and was very poor with the lighting.
Apart from that, there is nothing extra supplied, As a VIP with most hotel groups, I normally get a bottle of water or something, here nothing, and had to pay $4 for a glass of milk.

title: THE STANDARD and NYC
text: The hotel is located near everything...Franck is a great Manager, The front personnel [ John, Kevin, Christian, Hector] were very helpful with everything including Parking issues....Tom did a wonderful job in the Cafe. Speaking of the Cafe, its menu surpasses other restaurants in the area and it also has wonderful drinks, wonderful breads and better than normal breakfast menu...The Standard also a Japanese Garden area fro the weekends which is amazing to relax and eat.....Lastly...wanted to thank the ENTIRE Hotel staff for making our Anniversary weekend a most memorable one.....

title: Great location
text:
My son booked this room for me and I was very pleased. This east village location was perfect, close to subway, restaurants etc. I had a corner king room and the view was great. The bed was very comfortable. I really liked the layout, since my son was visiting often, the bathroom is behind the room (bed) giving you maximum privacy. 
My luggage was lost for a day but the front desk staff was very accommodating in supplying everything I needed to be comfortable. I spent 3 nights and felt refreshed and rested upon my departure 
The staff was very friendly and always on hand to help with questions or concerns. I will definitely return to this property.

title: Kevin & Hector were amazing!
text: Truly impressed with the level of service & hospitality shown by the staff, specifically by Kevin and Hector at the front desk. Their warmth and helpful attitude were very much noted, and I will happily rave about their service to anyone who is looking for accommodation in NY. Thanks again, Kevin & Hector! True MVPs.

title: Truly exceptional service
text: This must be named “The Standard “ because it is what all hotels should strive to be.  The staff at the front desk is young, beautiful and vibrant , and helpful above and beyond the call of duty.  My husband and I stayed here Easter Weekend and we were on the phone with the front desk from the moment we left Penn Station. ( Kelly, you’re a saint )They gave us subway suggestions, held our luggage and hailed cabs for us. The rooms are VERY nice , luxurious beds and a gorgeous bathroom. SPOTLESSLY CLEAN!  We had drinks in the garden, dinner in the restaurant and champagne in the cafe the next day. We will definitely come back on our next NYC trip. What a delightful place!

title: Love the Standard East Village
text: The Standard East Village is a great find and good value in a fabulous location. Modestly sized (as are most hotel rooms in NY), fun and comfortable rooms with all you need, a warm and welcoming staff and several opportunities for top of the line food and drinks. We especially love the garden bar when the weather is nice.

title: Accueil agréable et vue incroyable
text:
Très bonne expérience au Standard East Village où nous avons eu la chance de loger au 17ème étage. Les vues à plus de 180° sont incroyables de jour comme de nuit et cela seul justifierait de le choisir.
L'accueil est très agréable, le personnel accueillant, le jardin-bar magnifique et sa situation dans New York est parfaite (il s'appelle East Village mais est en fait à un bloc de Nolita et 10 minutes à pied de Soho).
Seul bémol la climatisation trop bruyante dont nous aurions préféré nous passer et que nous n'avons pas pu éteindre.
Nous reviendrons sans hésiter !

title: Nothing is Standard about The Standard
text: Our stay was fabulous. Great location, beautiful rooms, tasty food and an amazing staff. Staff were welcoming, accommodating, professional, caring and fun. We where there to visit colleges. Braina (sp?) was especially kind and ask her grandmother to get directions  for us to get us where we needed to go. We were well taken care of!

title: Easter week vacation.
text:
There is no better place in the East Village , period! 
Location,  price , service . Rooms.

The beds are like heaven .
The views from the 3rd floor up are great. 
The bar has an incredible ambiance. 

I have stayed at the W . The Hyatt.  The Bowery.  They are no match ......

Ernesto

title: Great location, even better staff!
text:
We loved our stay at The Standard. The location is fantastic - great food, shopping, access to transportation. It’s got a really funky, fun feel to it.  The best part is the staff - everyone, every single staff member I interacted with was very helpful and pleasant. I’ve stayed at top resorts and hotels around the world - Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, One & Only - and it’s the staff that can make your stay that much better. 

One tip - get a corner room on an upper floor if you can. Nice view and you’ll appreciate the little extra room.  Even though you probably want to spend more time outside enjoying NYC, it’s nice to be comfortable when you come back to your room. 

Finally, here are a few food tips. Joe’s pizza, Momofuku Noodle bar, Milk Bar are all within easy walking distance. If you don’t mind a short ride, try Indian Accent - the best Indian food with a modern flair. 

We’ll definitely come back to The Standard.

title: The Standard, East Village : what else ?
text:
Location is perfect (close to the subway station and easy access to the main spots)
Warm welcome by the team
Very great rooms : comfortable & large beds, bathrooms of quality.
Friendly atmosphere in the bar & the restaurant.
Quality of service.

title: Amazing stay.
text: My girlfriend and I made a reservation through Expedia very last minute. When we arrived the reservation had not yet processed yet, we just landed in NYC after a 6 hour flight from California and all we wanted to do was go to sleep. The system was taking a little longer than usual. Maggie Ordonez the manager saw we were sorta getting stressed, she immediately called Expedia, located the reservation and got us to our room in minutes. Her and her staff made us feel right at home, everyone was very welcoming and full of cool recommendations of breakfast joints and trains to catch to the cool sights. I'll definitely be coming back here, I also had a amazing latte in the morning from a young lady at there cool vintage bar that was laced with a healthy selection of liquor. Thanks to The Standard East Village team!

title: Great room and fantastic service.
text: I stayed at The Standard, East Village for one short night - but could not recommend the spot more. Even though I was only on the 7th floor, the views were great - the room perfect and the service at checking was without fault. I've staid at their other facilities as well, and the service is baseline great no matter where I've been..

title: The Standard in Hospitality!
text: I had the pleasure of staying at The Standard East Village for a combo work and fun trip at the end of March. First things, first: Heated floors in the bathroom!! It was amazing. Super comfortable bed and linens and if you are lucky enough to stay on the city view side of the building, WOW. Had breakfast in the cafe a couple days and also took a delicious iced latte to go every morning. Every staff member I encountered during my stay was super helpful, attentive, kind AND had a sense of humor, which I appreciate. I look forward to staying again when it's nicer outside to take advantage of the outdoor elements Standard has to offer. I book a lot of travel for my company and will definitely be keeping The Standard on my shortlist for NY hotels! Special shout-out to Paige and Franck and their team for making my stay easy from beginning to end!

title: Fantastic New York Staycation!
text: I booked last minute on hotel tonight and was so thoroughly appreciative of the awesome service, cleanliness, and attentiveness I received all weekend from staff. No Bar has great eats and the minibar selection is also stellar. Friday nights at cafe standard boast a funky DJ and a great vibe. Location is really central to downtown hotspots if you choose to leave. Would definitely stay again!

title: Great room and service
text: I've stayed at the Standard East Village several times now and each visit has been comfortable and enjoyable. The rooms are well appointed and clean, and frequently have great views as well. I think location is convenient as it has both easy access to shopping/restaurants as well as metro, and I like being able to use the full gym across the street. The hotel costs a bit more than some other local offerings, but I've found that its worth it as the little things are done right here.

title: Very helpful and attentive staff
text: Room's were adequate, and clean - will not disappoint. Location was excellent. I especially liked that you could use the gym across the street for free with a front-desk provided pass! When I left my phone on the exercise bike the hotel staff were super helpful in getting it back for me - a potential catastrophe to lose my primary form of communication/getting around the city on my first day.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Great hotel. 
Kelly from the front desk was fantastic, I was in NYC for my anniversary and she put us on high floor with great view. 
Paige, knew it was a special occasion and she sent I surprise to the room. 
You guys made our stay!

title: Great customer service and awesome staff!
text: Used The Standard for a company event and had a great experience from contracting through our arrival. Every person I worked with was kind, competent, and very responsive. Would absolutely book again when in NYC!

title: Wonderful experience at The Standard East Village
text:
All-around excellent  experience from check-in  to check-out. 
-Front desk accommodating and friendly. 
-Comfortable room 
-Perfect downtown location for exploring the LES, SOHO, east village and west village. 
-Staff went out of their way to make sure we had a pleasant stay.

title: Great time at The Standard
text: Love this hotel! This is our 2nd time staying here. The entire staff is, hands down, one of the best we have encountered - friendly, helpful, efficiently attentive, making you feel at home. Before we arrived, Paige filled us in on the "happenings" both inside the hotel and in the area, including that the restaurant was growing their own culinary mushrooms, and baking their own bread - delicious! We arrived early, so took the time to eat in the Cafe. When our room wasn't ready because the occupying guest wouldn't leave (no fault of the hotel), Maggie and Kelly went out of their way to accommodate our tight schedule. They had our luggage taken to another room so we could get ready to join friends for dinner and a play. Our luggage was then moved to the room reserved for us when it was ready. Now, that is SERVICE!!! We highly recommend The Standard, East Village. Always a fun stay.

title: Fun!
text: This place is wonderful. Super clean yummy food, drinks and coffee. Paige at the front desk was absolutely awesome, going out of her way to welcome me an hour before check in and being so gracious in the process. Very cool bathrooms and awesome mini bar.

title: well above standards!
text: i had the best time staying at this hotel. kelly and giovanni were so welcoming, warm, friendly and helpful. i felt like they were my buds and they made me feel like i was staying with friends. my first morning i was able to get a soy latte to go, and it was the most delicious latte that helped fuel my day. i had breakfast out on the covered and heated patio my last day, and despite the rain, it felt like i was indoors. i wish i could have stayed longer, but there is no doubt that i will be returning to this hotel the next time i am in the city.

title: Last minute NY trip
text:
Flew into NY to surprise daughter for her 23rd birthday. Kelly (front desk) was welcoming and lovely. Corner room was very well equipped and well sized by NY standards. 
FYI - the toiletries were luscious!
Spent way too much time in the cafe - afternoon tea, breakfast and lunch. I was on a short timeline and the rainy weather kept me inside. The staff was extraordinary!
Will stay again and highly recommend!!!

title: Milestone Birthday Celebration
text:
The Standard in the East Village was everything above the standard, they were unbelievablely AMAZING!!! I planned my Mom's 60 bday celebration  for the city and The Standard was the ideal to make the 24 he celebration happen! From their super flexible Standard check in/out option, to their amazing guest services team and attention to every detail to make my Mom's bday a truly special and memorable one! I cannot thank them enough! 

Plus the rooms and amentinies are amazing, you gotta check it out!!

title: Super Cool Place
text: I loved the hotel and my room had amazing views through the panoramic windows. The one issue I had was that the room itself wasn't really optimized for actually hanging out inside...like the wifi barely worked and the TV had no guide, but I also understand that most people aren't chilling in their hotel rooms in NYC. I was for one afternoon/evening and would've appreciated a little more function. BUT, I would totally stay here again and recommend it.

title: God beliggenhed
text: Dette hotel ligger i East Village lige ved Cooper Square. Hotellet er lækkert indrettet og med flot udsigt. Der er et tilknyttet fitness center overfor. Bar med udsigt. Hvis man vil se en anden og mere afslappet del af Manhattan så er dette hotel et perfekt udgangspunkt med vildt mange upcoming restauranter og fede barer. Ligger tæt på NYU

title: Great and friendly service
text: I had a quick one night stay.  The location was good, easy to get around.  The room was nice and very comfortable.  The staff were so friendly and helpful.  I bumped my head as I was packing (my own silly fault), the staff were very attentive and wanting to make sure I was ok, they also had their client relations manager check to make sure I was ok and if I needed anything.  It’s the little details that make a place a pleasure to stay at.

title: A better place to stay if working in midtown
text: My office is at 53 and Lex which is not my favorite part of the city.  It’s so much more enjoyable to stay here at the Standard and get all the benefits of being in the much more interesting East Village.  It’s a very easy ride up the subway to midtown. Great one-of-a-kind bars, restaurants and Shops.  Close to Greenwich Village, Alphabet City and Soho so you can easily explore all of those areas on foot from here.  The hotel is a very comfortable boutique hotel with great personality.  Recommend a higher floor to get a great view of the skyline looking toward the East River.  Great sunrise views.  Excellent service by everyone on staff.

title: Neighborhood feel in a hotel.
text: Fantastic service. Fun food and drink options in the hotel and nearby that make you feel like you've gone exploring even if you don't want to go too far. Great views in the rooms. Easy to get to if you're driving into Manhattan.

title: Good location, issues with service
text: My friends and I stayed in two rooms that happened to be placed next to each other (coincidence since we made the reservations separately and checked in at different times). Their room seemed fairly nice but ours had additional wear and a really strong chemical air fresher odor, especially in the bathroom that never went away. The main problem was with check out. We were asked to confirm we had laundry done (which we never did). We told them no (since we were there for 1.5 days) and they said nothing would be charged to my card and they'd email a folio. I find out 2 weeks later they charged me $72 and didn't send me a folio as promised. I called the front desk and was initially met with resistance about removing the charge. Then, I waited for the folio I never got with the worker on the phone since I wanted proof of them actually refunding me this time. It took ~9 minutes to arrive. During that time, the worker tried to say the email is slow because of nonsensical reasons like daylight savings times. They really need to improve their computer systems and emails so these things don't happen again.

title: Producers Trip NYC
text: thank you for the high-quality service and attention. the staff was amazing and the rooms were impeccable, with an amazing view. The team was very pleased with the stay, and although short and sweet this time, they hope to be back for a longer visit in the future.

title: Above and beyond excellence in hospitality: how I found a treasure after a night of fear
text: I go to NYC for work monthly for business. I was booked at another hotel. Around 1:00 am the fire alarm goes off. I open my door and smell the smoke, run down 9 flights of stairs filled with smoke. We are outside with fire engines, the hotel evacuates. we are all shaken up.  I ask that they put me at another of their properties.  I arrive at Standard East Village at 1:44 am, at the desk Kevin, aware of the situation, had prepared a room "I'm going to spoil you and make sure you can sleep well" he had gone the extra mile of having grooming supplies ready for me.  I only had my coat nightgown and wallet.  The next morning Franck, also aware of the situation (clearly the communication is efficient in this hotel)  helps me find a room at the SEV for the rest of my NYC stay.  "we're booked, but we are going to push through and make it happen"  He found me the perfect room for the rest of my business trip. Paige the head of guest services arrives and hands me her card "please let me know if there is anything you need, we are here to take care of you."  I was able to move to the new room ASAP.  then left for my meetings. Coming back from my work Martin, welcomed me back.  He had noticed that I was French and so engaged in my native tongue. It was nice after a long day to be welcomed back with so much warmth.  I got to the room and Paige and Franck had left a kind note and welcome gift for me to relax.  Throughout the stay whether it was Ana the manager of the cafe, Alex who makes amazing coffee, Eleonora who explained their bread program, and Ivan who serves at the cafe.  the entire staff is deeply welcoming.  the consistent message is you are safe, you belong, we are here. every single person had the same message of warmth, kindness, support, resourcefulness.  this is exemplary behavior in hospitality.They regularly checked in to make sure that all was going well.  I cannot thank them enough.  After a night of fright at the start of a massive work week, the way this team made sure all my needs were met allowed me to focus on my work.   I stayed in 2 different rooms, they were both incredibly clean, aesthetically pleasing, the linens were lush, the bathtub fantastic etc... The place is quiet so you sleep very well. Please also check out their restaurant Narcissa they had a blue crab salad and smoked japanese eggplant that were pure heaven.  I'm an executive coach who is a stickler for details and elegance in service. the SEV team hit it out the park and beyond. so grateful for their quality and impeccability of  service .this is now my destination of choice for my monthly trips to NYC.

title: Making you feel home away from home
text:
The Standard East village is a smaller boutique style hotel. Great location, super rooms, great restaurant and bar. Most of all I enjoyed the kindness of the staff. The director Franck Hermann went out of his way to please me. All the staff is so friendly and helpful and made me feel comfortable at all times. I stayed in other places in the area, but nothing compares to this and I for sure will be back. Thank you so much for all. 
Janine Portenier, Israel

title: A New Find
text: The staff at the Standard East were incredibly friendly and helpful during my recent stay.  My room looked west over the city and was very comfortable and had hooks for hanging my coat and bag, which I always appreciate.  Breakfast in the cafe was lovely -- great service, reasonably priced, and very sweet staff.  Location can't be beat.

title: Now I can't stay anywhere else!
text:
From the moment you walk in you're greeted by the lovely staff in an elegant lobby. You're surrounded by artwork and installations. You can take a tour and snag the view from the top floor (unparalleled). The bar, restaurant, and beer garden could have you lost for a night or two or three on their very own.

Well done, folks! You have a long-time, loyal customer here. Huge shoutout to Paige and Gio for the excellent customer service! The Standard turned a business trip into what felt like a getaway. I can't recommend it enough.

title: Social media influencer. (@kelz) Instagram
text: Had such an amazing stay. Staff was friendly and super welcoming. I wish I could give this more ratings felt comfortable very clean hotel as well. I’ll for sure be staying aging when visiting New York

title: Home away from home
text: I've stayed at this Standard property several times and have had a fantastic experience each visit.  From the welcoming and accommodating staff who assisted with Narcissa reservations and generously provided late check out to help ease a hectic schedule I had on my checkout day; to the spectacular in-room views, cozy robes and pillow top beds, and handsomely stocked minibar - The Standard East Village offers a trendy and comfortable home away from home.  The location is prime and the service is on point, and I always look forward to my next visit.

title: A gem in the East Village
text: I had the most amazing stay here at the Standard, it was definitely a home away from home. All the staff were so accommodating and lovely which made the stay hugely enjoyable and very easy. I had the pleasure of meeting the GM, David during my visit and got the chance to express how much I enjoyed the property. Narcissa, the hotels main restaurant, was a definite highlight and was easily one of the best meals I had during my trip to NY. The rooms were spacious and had great views of the skyline, comfortable beds and very clean. Definitely going to be coming back here in the future!

title: A terrific hotel in NYC!!! What a find!
text: We loved this hotel!  Went into the city to see STOMP and needed an overnight hotel. We are on the road most of the year and stay at lots of places and this hotel has some some very nice, unique touches that were very cool.  The bathroom was awesome and the beds were extremely comfortable.  The staff was very helpful and the food and beverage choices for room service were also very good. We will definitely stay there whenever we are in the city!  Thank you...and thank you for following up after our visit!

title: Great hotel! From the views to the service!
text: We had a great stay at the Standard hotel! What first charmed me was the location but we ended up spending more time at the hotel! Between the room’s city view to room service, everything at the Standard was wonderful. Within the block there are amazing restaurants and bars. Great vibe every night. Front desk is a Dream! They helped me book a surprise getaway for my partner and they created the perfect getaway! We will be back again!

title: Everything we hoped for and more!
text: The stay at the Standard and their accommodations were spot on.....it was a great location as well as clean and the customer service was amazing. Maggie was a dream, she handled all of our reservations and went above and beyond....she really helped our trip be the best trip I have ever taken! I highly recommend the Standard East Village....the food was also great as well as the atmosphere and just all around was everything we had hoped for! The view from our room was incredible!!

title: Awesome weekend getaway
text:
We loved everything about The Standard. The staff was personable, knowledgeable and welcoming.
The room was modern & new, with fantastic floor-to-ceiling views. The mattress was super comfy and room was very quiet.
The bathroom was efficient with a large shower.
Coffee at the cafe was excellent and our breakfast package was fantastic.   We've never had such an extensive continental breakfast. The best hotel in the E. Village. We look forward to a return visit.

title: Top notch service, above and beyond!
text: We booked one night at Standard to celebrate my husband's birthday. A couple of days before we arrived, Maggie reached out to welcome us and ask if we were celebrating anything. I gave a few suggestions of things my husband likes and she made it happen in the realest way. We were continually delighted and surprised. We felt card for, looked after, and oh so comfortable. Looking forward to our next stay here!

title: Great location
text: We stayed at The Standard for four nights on an extended weekend stay. Check in was seamless and we were upgraded to a corner room on the 18th floor. The room was a good size given how small NY hotel rooms are known to be. The room, the view, the bathroom, the linens were all terrific. The only negative with the room was after checking in late we noticed in the morning that the bed sheet was badly stained with red wine. This was reported to housekeeping and there were no such further  problems. We only ate at the hotel once and that was in the cafe. Food that we ordered there was very good, as was the service and bar. The only downside of the lounge was the selection and volume of the music being played. Obviously tailored to a younger crowd which is certainly understandable. The location of the hotel was perfect, with most areas of the city easily reachable by foot or car. All staff are very personable and helpful. A very nice hotel in great condition.

title: very disappointed in the service
text:
we spent 3 days here last month. We had breakfast in the cafe. Our order took about 40 minutes to arrive-- we didn't really mind because we were reading the paper and relaxing. But when it DID come our eggs were stone cold and the bacon was burnt to a crisp. We sent the bacon back and got a new order in 2 minutes that was pale and waaaaaay undercooked. This seemed purposefully passive aggressive to me. We just paid and left and didn't eat it-- no offer to take it off the bill.
We went out for the day and came back around 4 and the room was still not serviced. I asked about this at the front desk and was asked if I had called for service-- I said I didn't know I was supposed to! I said we would go out for another hour and could the room be ready by then? The front desk was brusque and said no promises-- we came back and it was still not done. We gave up. None of this seems right to me at a hotel at this price point.

title: A designer's dream!
text:
This is the first time I stayed at The Standard. I came in for fashion week to do a show. The staff was extremely helpful with everything. I really enjoyed the stay. I highly suggest this location!
Stevie Boi

title: Fantastic homebase in NYC
text:
My fiancee and I stayed to celebrate our engagement, his birthday and our anniversary!

The Standard made our weekend super sweet with an upgrade complete with an incredible view, some sweet treats and a bottle of bubbly.

The staff were incredibly personable and kind. 

Details are their strong suit.

Love this neighbourhood - well located in between the Village, LES and Nolita.

Thanks for everything Franck, Paige + Will! xo

title: Stunning Views! Naughty confession...
text:
This was our second stay at one of The Standard hotels in New York.  We had stayed earlier at The Standard, Highline, and wanted to try the other side of lower Manhattan for a change.  We could not have been happier.  The Standard, East Village, is smaller, more intimate, and yet offers features that make it stand apart from any other hotel we've been at in New York.  
We booked a Downtown Suite, Room 2008, and were blown away by the views of the World Trade Center looking south, and the Empire State Building looking north.  The huge windows made the room feel bright and inviting, even on an overcast winter day.  While there are items mentioned in other reviews, such as the missing coffee machine, we found it best to use the staff's more than welcoming advice to move around and explore the area, as well as the hotel.  It started with great communication ahead of our visit.  Special thanks to Will for picking the perfect room for us.  We checked in at different times and Will had taken care of everything, including a nice welcome tray with snacks.  
For dinner, we went to the Narcissa, had excellent red snapper and shared a fluffy delicious mille feuille.  Combined with a bottle of wine and coffee, the price was very reasonable for an up-scale restaurant.  Evening drinks in the Cafe Standard were creative and delicious.  We had several cocktails and none of them disappointed. We returned for Breakfast and sat outside in the heated patio area.  French toast as well as the White Egg were fabulous.
We do have to make a confession. Being on the 20th floor, we knew that we were just one level below the Penthouse level, where frequently parties were hosted.  Our room was completely quiet, no street noise, no noise from above.  Out of curiosity, we took the elevator to the 21st floor and were stunned to find a complete range of designer clothes displayed as part of New York Fasion Week.  Professional lighting was installed and being avid photographers ourselves, we couldn't help but sneak up again and take pictures, many of them not appropriate to be shown as part of a Tripadvisor review.  We had our own little Fashio Week.  Thanks!, and hope it won't be held against us.

title: One of my favorite hotels in Manhattan
text: I have been staying in this hotel when ever I’m in Manhattan since it was the cooper sq hotel. It’s a hip stylish hotel, food is amazing , drinks are premium and service is excellent. They take care of their staff and the rooms are beautiful and clean, I would recommend this hotel to any business or upscale visitors. True class!

title: Standard East Village NYC, a very nice place !
text: I spent 4 days in this very nice place and I really enjoyed it. Tremendous view on the sky (from my bed !), changing color by the sunrise and the sunset, in my 10th floor room. Nice room and bathroom, fancy  and comfortable. No noise and such a good sleep. Both restaurants are very good, particularly the Narcissa’s brunch ! And above all, a very kind team. The hotel is located next to Soho and offers artistic events. It was exactly what I need for my business trip, mixed with chilling time. I’ll go back, for sure.

title: Great service for group of 15!
text:
Our company recently booked rooms at The Standard EV for 15 VIP guests traveling to NYC for an event. Valeria (The Standard's sales coordinator) and her team went above & beyond to make the visit seamless! 

We made several special requests and last-minute changes to our block—and The Standard team was so gracious and responsive over email. They proactively thought of every detail and helped us coordinate cars for our guests, etc. 

Would highly recommend to any company hosting out of town guests!

title: Greatest Service!
text: I cannot day enough about the service and ease at this property. Super fast check in and adorable rooms. Have to give a special thank you to Jocelyn in the restaurant bar as well as the others there they are all extremely friendly and make great creative fun drinks. The burger is out of this world as well. Also Joan (pronounced Joe On) was a delight in helping me leave on time for the airport having spent a little too much time chatting with my son in the Standard Cafe!! Can’t wait to go back this hotel really makes you feel very welcome like staying at your best friends house for a weekend !!

title: Amazing Experience!!
text: We recently held a a small business meeting ing the Overlook Boardroom, and we had a wonderful experience. From the moment we began communication, the staff was friendly, prompt in replying, and flexible. The service on site was exceptional: attentive and not obstructive in any way. The team was incredibly professional, communicative, and went above and beyond to meet our needs. The room was immaculate and perfect for our meeting. Would definitely book again, and in fact, we already are! Thank you so much to the team at The Standard for really creating an experience to be proud of!!

title: Incomparable experience
text:
This is only my second stay at the Standard Hotel and my first  review ever. The entire team went so above and beyond to accomodate my trip that i had to highlight it publicly. 

The thing that sets this hotel apart is the management. The personalised services, attention to details and utmost professionalism in communication is something that I never experienced in the many years I’ve travelled the globe. 

I can’t thank the team enough for how great I get to feel whist being there.

title: Obsessed with The Standard EV and their employees!!
text: I have always been a fan of The Standard East Village but this last stay really proved why it’s my favorite! All of the staff are always super helpful, friends, attentive and more! However, Maggie specifically helped me this past stay and when I had a small bump in my reservations she smoothed it out quickly and with ease. The room I booked (a standard) was beautiful and I was completely content and was even upgraded the last night of my stay! I definitely will be returning time after time!

title: Great Location Great staff
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Standard, East Village. It is very centrally located, the staff was wonderful, very helpful and friendly. We had a room with an amazing view. I will be coming back to stay in NY and without a doubt will be staying here every time.

title: Setting the standard
text: Martin and his team went above and beyond in helping make my first experience in NYC unforgettable. I've worked in customer service in some capacity my entire life. Good customer service is easy to find, excellent customer service is like finding a unicorn. The Standard in the East Village is that unicorn. Their attention to detail and genuine interest in their guest made me feel more at home than my moms house. The hotel's aesthetics were modern yet eclectic. They have clouds for beds and a magical outdoor garden bar. The café offers yummy food throughout the day; I recommend the Andy Warhol after a long cold day of hitting the concrete jungle. The Standard has set the standard in the hospitality industry. I look forward to many more stays with Martin and his team at The Standard East Village.

title: Home Away From Home...But Better!
text: I love the Standard East Village.  The location is great near markets, access to transportation, NYU, good food, etc.  What makes this place stand out though, is the staff  - from accommodating my needs with an extra night due to bad weather, treating me special on my birthday, top notch recommendations.... and the room service is GREAT too! Shot out to Paige!  The overall vibe is super chill and love the art they've selected throughout.  I've stayed here numerous times and will continue to do so.

title: Wonderful Hotel!
text:
We attended an event at the hotel this weekend. The rooms are cute with an amazing view! The location is perfect for SOHO and NOHO. Great places to shop and eat. The restaurant has great breakfast and a busy night life.

Juan at the front door and bellhop was wonderful. He handled so much for us over our stay. Every detail was anticipated and prepared for to allow us to just enjoy our time in New York City. Martin, the asst front office director was very helpful at the main desk. 

No small details were overlooked at this gem at Cooper Square. I will recommend to all!

title: "A wonderful experience"
text: We had such a wonderful experience at the Standard - East Village -    In all my travels to different hotels, I have to say my husband and I both agreed, this hotel was the most accommodating and was always willing to go above and beyond for their guests, from check-in to breakfast the next morning!!!!!!

title: A++++++++++++++
text: Stayed at the Standard East Village for work and had over 20 meetings in a week.  The staff were so accommodating, friendly and made my stay relaxing and helped keep me rested for all the work I had.  Paige that worked the front desk went out of her way to help a Birthday surprise that my husband planned throughout the week.  She is amazing.  Will, the manager of Standard East Village makes this my must stay when I come monthly to New York.  Love Standard East Village!

title: Perfect night
text: I have been to every Standard outpost in both NY and LA, and this - my first time staying at the East Village Standard on a whim - was by far the best. Great location. Clean, comfortable room and great bathroom w waterfall shower head. Best part was the warm welcome provided by Kelly the front desk manager that evening who checked me in; she embodies everything that the Standard and every other hospitality brand should aspire to.

title: A wonderful stay at this gem in the East Village
text:
It started with the wonderful treatment in the lead up to my stay and continued all the way through to the follow-up care that this amazing team showed me and my fiancee at our stay at The Standard, East Village.  Paige (side note: an absolute star!) and her team made us feel special through not only their words but their actions.  We arrived in NYC early and they took care of our bags but then were able to check us into a room early, which we were very grateful for.  During our stay, they were quickly attended to our needs and any requests that we had (at any time of the day or night). 

The location of the hotel is perfectly accessible to all parts of NYC by subway or foot. The hotel's cafe and restaurant both have menus full of scrumptious food and drink and we wished we could have stayed longer to work our way through them!

I honestly couldn't speak highly enough of this hotel and the warm and generous people that run this establishment. I'm almost regretting writing a review because I selfishly want to keep it unknown from the masses!  But...paying it forward to all of you out there - stay here and you won't regret it, I can promise you that.

title: Fantastic Stay
text: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel in December just before xmas.  If we could have stayed longer, we would have.  The front desk staff were always smiling and acknowledging our arrival and departure and they even gave us a call after we checked in to make sure everything was OK in the room.  The room wasn't massive, but you don't need a big room in NYC because you shouldn't be spending time in the room.  However, we wanted to stay in the room with the views! Room 1110 (i think)had views of 1 World Trade and the Brooklyn bridge.  the bed was very comfortable and as many other reviews say, those heated floors in the bathroom are a dream!  Lovely rainfall shower as well.  Fantastic hotel and will definitely return on our next visit to NYC!

title: The Standard is a Great Place to Stay in a Prime Location
text: I loved this place!  It's an such a great location and has two bars and a restaurant.  They also give you free passes to Crunch Gym across the street.  The staff was very friendly and while the rooms aren't large, they are still very nice.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

title: Nice home away from home!
text: Enjoyed my stay at The Standard East Village for the third time this year! Franck Hermann who is the Front Office Manager always provides me with a rate that is better than my Expedia rate! Contact him directly and he will provide you with the best rate! The staff is so friendly and helpful! The atmosphere is also very nice and the cheeseburger is a must! NYU and Union Square are within walking distance. The restaurant and bars around the hotel are great, but try the restaurants at the hotel first. You will not be disappointed!!!

title: Another great overnight stay
text: Love this quirky, hip, boutique gem in the east village. Another great stay, this time thanks to the accommodating and efficient Kelly and Will, and Marcus. And as always, the wonderful Paige, who made sure to look after us personally on this return trip. Added bonus was having fondue and hot cider drinks in our private, heated yurt for 2 ( thank you Ashley for following up in our email requests, finding us in the cafe this morning) in their Winter Garden. Looking forward to our next planned overnight stay in March, although we might not be able to wait until then to return.

title: Terrible Management
text: We checked in for a honeymoon weekend. Champagne never arrived, meals were delayed, room did  not get cleaned and front desk supervisor, sarcastic as can be. Do not stay here ! Consider staying at the Bowery close by.....they are a pleasure

title: Amazing
text:
Wow - Franck and Paige and the whole Standard team are wonderful. They took such great care of my family and I and made our stay one we will remember always. Beautiful rooms, fantastic view, warm friendly staff, delish food and drinks and a neighborhood to call home. Thank you. 
Michael Dellla Femina

title: The BEST Home Away From Home
text:
I just finished up a stay at The Standard - East Village and can't say enough about what a wonderful experience it was! We arrived early, and the the team there was so accommodating and got us into our beautiful corner room quickly. 

Speaking of the team there - Franck, the Front Office Director, and his team couldn't have been more welcoming and helpful! After a long morning of travelling, lugging around bags, etc. it was so refreshing to walk in and immediately have such a warm welcome and feel so at home. They were quick to assist with anything we needed - from help with our bags, directions around the neighborhood, or restaurant recommendations. They did a phenomenal job at creating such an inviting atmosphere! 

The hotel itself was beautiful as well. First of all, It's set in a neighborhood filled with cute spots to visit and so much character. Secondly - my room itself had the most stunning, unobstructed views of the city and absolutely took my breath away when I walked in! THe bathroom had an amazing tub as well to relax after a long day! Even the minibar was well-stocked which was great when I got a late-night chocolate craving (although the room service menu looked fantastic as well)! 

All in all - I had the absolute best time and truly felt so at home staying at The Standard - East Village. This trip was a business trip - but can't wait to plan a return visit for a long-weekend getaway! :)

title: Long weekend in NYC
text:
Stayed at the Standard East Village for 3 nights recently, and had a terrific time.   Our relatively spacious Corner King room had plenty of light, and amazing views.

The hotel feels very hip (and pleasingly quirky) but the staff were all friendly and welcoming.  Excellent location - so many great bars and restaurants within a short walk, and only a few minutes from the subway.

title: Wedding weekend
text: We booked a block of rooms for our son's wedding weekend. From our initial encounter with Valeria through the moment we arrived to Matt's welcome,  continuing with the front desk's help in all things, the  wonderful staff in the restaurants and bar,  the warmth of concern and personalized care was felt by all. The location was superb, the view unbeatable, the staff beyond compare, the restaurants are incredible and the bars amazingly cool and fun. It surpassed expectations of seasoned travelers, ages 2-72. Friends of the wedding couple, as well as family and friends of their parents didn't want to leave the wonderful rooms! We can't wait to return!

title: Amazing stay and incredible chef!
text: Wonderful 3 days at The Standard. Small, client focused, personalized care from elegant and happy team. Beautiful unobstructed views looking east, a stunning way to start the day! Room 1704. Breakfast made memorable by Chef Max Blechman-Gentile. Fresh bread made by him every morning, the toast, beyond expectation! I will definitely be back. Great location, fun neighborhood, perfect stay and reasonably priced! I felt pampered and I’m not broke! Book here!!

title: Belle expérience New-Yorkaise !
text:
Idéalement situé à côté de bars et restaurants et très proche notamment du chouette quartier de Soho, nous recommandons cet hôtel moderne pour :
- service qualitatif et chambre propre 
- sa vue sur les grattes ciel (un conseil : demander une chambre le plus haut possible afin de vous réveiller face à New-York et de vous endormir la tête dans les lumières de la ville) 
- ses petits déjeuners variés avec des produits de qualité
- son restaurant semi-gastronomique le Narcissa avec de délicieux plats aux recettes innovantes
- ses cocktails à consommer dans une yourte chauffée si vous y séjournez en hiver ;)
Ou sinon allez écouter un peu de musique du côté du bar, il y a toujours de l’ambiance le soir !
- son personnel souriant, jeune et cool 
Vous l’avez compris, nous n’avons aucun point négatif ! Et nous comptons bien essayer celui de Los Angeles cet été :)
N.B : les prix des cocktails et des petits déjeuners sont assez corrects pour le standing de l’hôtel.

title: A great home away from home - in the heart of NYC!
text:
Familiar with The Standard series of hotels, I was excited to stay with the East Village version having heard great things about the cool fitout and events they run. 

I definitely wasn’t disappointed - the bar/breakfast area is super cool, the restaurant amazing and we were treated to the winter Yurt hut event, despite missing the time cutoff! 

The staff were absolutely amazing the entire stay, friendly and outgoing with plenty of recommendations. Ask for a room with a city view, I’m sure they’ll oblige if possible, then you can wake up to the NYC skyline like we did!

title: A recommander...
text:
Accueil chaleureux, personnel jeune et dynamique, café rétro et branché.
Situation géographique parfaite, calme et proche du métro ( Astor place).
Chambre très confortable. Vue magnifique (15 éme ) terrasse panoramique au 21 eme à ne pas manquer.
Petit- déjeuner continental compris dans le prix très copieux et de qualité, mais dommage de ne pouvoir déguster un « American breakfast » à la place. 
A recommander absolument !!

title: Christmas vacation
text:
I only stayed for one night because I made a schedule mistake at my first hotel. But I will stay at the Standard East Village Hotel for future trips. It was very modern and the bed was very comfy.
It was centrally located and close to transportation. The staff was friendly and very helpful. It was easy to get to the airport with the shuttle service.

title: Hip Property + Stellar Location
text:
The Standard EV is a great property for business travelers or staycations. Clean and hip rooms with great amenities. The neighborhood couldn't be better. Close to the charm of the East Village shops and nightlife...not to mention some iconic establishments such as McSorley's Ale House.

Additionally, the service is fantastic, the bar and cafe are must visits for an early morning coffee or late night drink whether you are staying on property or not.

title: Manhattan Getaway
text: We had a fabulous stay at the Standard the second week in December.  It was freezing outside, but once we got inside we were greeted warmly with a huge smile and a great attitude from Kelly.  Everything about this property sang to us. We had a great spacious room with a view of the city.  All linens were soft and dreamy.  The downstairs restaurant and bar were great places to stop by... oh, Andy the heart village!  The best thing I’ve seen in Manhattan in a long time!  Will definitely come back.

title: Overpriced hotel, paying for brand
text: We booked this hotel based on what we had heard about The Standard hotels. Unfortunately, it didn’t meet expectations. Room pokey, dark reception area, no complimentary tea and coffee in the room. Not worth the $400 we paid. Also be aware of additional charges.

title: Best hotel ever!
text: I always love staying at the Standard. Friendly staff, chill vibe and such comfortable rooms. The bed is a dream in itself. Also, you can't beat the location for food and shopping. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in NYC.

title: Perfection!
text: Nothing short of perfect here! Friendly, knowledgeable staff, clean and comfortable rooms with beautiful views. The bed is heavenly, the bathroom has a wonderful shower and a separate soaking tub with great products. The food is terrific and the location is ideal. I will be a regular at this amazing hotel. Special thanks to Kelly at the front desk who is absolutely adorable and my deepest gratitude to Franck, the manager for extending himself in every way possible.

title: Amazing experience
text: Martin and Paige from The Standard made our trip to NYC amazing. And everyone else on the staff were incredibly friendly, from the desk staff to the maintenance folks. Our room was awesome with amazing views of the city. The restaurants and bars all had great drinks and food, and the atmosphere/ambience of the whole hotel was funky and elegant. Lots of great places to walk in the area. I can't imagine staying anywhere else, really. Highly recommended!

title: Wonderful Staff and great location
text: I had a great time at the east village. Hotel was very clean and had cool red room lighting, in great location for food (alot of good ramen), and best of all; the staff! That is what truly make them a standout in hospitality. If your thinking of staying here DO IT! Ask for Maggy at the front desk for always smiling and her help with finding great room, kelly for always saying hello and pizza locations, gio in lobby for great talks, and ashley in the cafe for fast service with a smile! I will be back!!!!!!!

title: East village - great views
text:
A lovely stay - our first in the East Village. Great corner view room - worth the extra $$$ for the sunrise and sunsets from the 18th floor. 
Friendly and efficient front of house staff.
Early checkin and checkout option really useful. 
Thank you Standard Hotels!

title: Amazing Experience!
text:
We just had an extraordinary holiday party in the Penthouse at Standard East Hotel and I'm thrilled to report that it was by far one of the best events we have ever had - a complete triumph!  The hard work, attention to detail and professionalism shown throughout did not go unnoticed.  Everyone at the Standard (from the Front Desk, to the wait staff) went above and beyond the call of duty and made a unique contribution to the success of the evening. In particular, the events team headed up  by Teresa Nolan and Kira Allen: both are absolute pros, lovely, accommodating and dedicated to ensuring a stellar event. 

I would also like to recognize each team member that worked the event in hopes that they receive a  thoughtful and deserving hand of applause: Misha & Dinne for being the very capable and tireless captains that evening; Sasha, Dhondup, Zach and Dannish for keeping us refreshed with your fabulous cocktails and friendly service and Foyshal, Shannon, Harsema, Ariana, Eliza and Pedro  for maintaining a positive attitude in the midst of hard work – bravo! 

With all the positive feedback from our guests I hope to make The Standard East home to future corporate events.  Thanking you all once again for all the untold efforts put in by everyone on your team – thank you!

title: Yet another amazing stay at the Standard East Hotel!
text: What can I say about this phenomenal property.  This is my go to hotel when I am in New York City.  The rooms are beautiful, the staff is amazing and the Grill and Narcissa restaurants are great options.

title: Wonderful holiday venue
text: Narcissa housed about 50 of us for our holiday party this year. It was a very intimate location and service was impeccable. I come from a restaurant background and can assure you, you will get the biggest bang for your buck hosting ANY event at Narcissa. Teresa, Ben and the whole team did an amazing job while not intruding into anyone's experience throughout the night. Thanks for a wonderful time Narcissa!

title: One Night in the Big Apple
text: Ended up staying in NYC during a quick business trip to the Northeast last week. My group stayed in New Jersey but I decided to take the train into NY for the night because I love seeing the city during the Christmas Season. I stayed at the new Standard (East Village) hotel and it was absolutely amazing. I had a great room with a magnificent vie. The suite had a huge bathroom with separate shower and bathtub. The bathroom floors were heated (an amenity I must get for my house). The staff was fantastic and they all looked like models. I will definitely be back when I have more time to experience this amazing property.

title: First Stay - Great Property
text: As someone in the industry that has stayed at many different hotels in many different places around the city, I was impressed with The Standard East Village. It is nicely positioned between midtown and downtown, allowing easy access to both midtown on the east side and a lively after work scene, being south by Soho and East Village. With my office being on 3rd in midtown, it was a quick ride up in the morning, without having to deal with the stresses of crosstown traffic. And the hotel itself was great. Service, from the time you walked in to the time you walked out, was perfect. Always there for you and a much more boutique approach to customer service. I was most impressed by that, as the High Line is much larger and so you do not get the boutique feel. Also, the food options were top notch. You have got to try Narcissa, their in-house restaurant, if you are there. But make a reservation because it is a hot spot. I want to thank the staff and the GM, David Lopez, for all that did to make it a great stay. I will be back. Thank you.

title: Great hotel, great service and great location
text: We stayed at The Standard East Village for a week. It was a wonderful experience with very helpful staff. The location is perfect for subway access as well as being in the hub of great restaurants and bars. I would highly recommend and would stay here again in a heartbeat. Thank you to Martin, Mirko & the team.

title: Fun Hotel with nice rooms and great views
text: Love all the Standard hotels.  Very friendly staff at this one.  Great location!  I do wish the rooms were a tad bigger, but it's Manhattan.  Cool decor inside and out.  LOVE The garden patio and cafes.  Can't wait to go back here again soon.

title: Best Location, best rooms, best views and amazing staff- Back again its so good ......
text:
We returned to the Standard East village again after a fantastic stay earlier this year. 
Paige Seigwardt from the Standard who looked after us so brilliantly on our earlier visit did the trick again - We had a great corner room with views out looking towards Williamsburg bridge this time.
Location is fantastic for bars restaurants and shops - subways are close if you want to head uptown or over to Brooklyn   
The winter garden had just opened at the Standard and is cool as is the Narc bar so if stuck with the weather you can stay put ...
We even met the duty manager who introduced himself and said hello 
Its so good we have booked to return next year can't recommend it more highly for NYC

title: Always the best in the East Village
text: The Standard East Village has become our go-to hotel every time we're in NYC. Why? Simple - it's always perfect, always dependable. The staff is consistently friendly and helpful, the rooms are a good size and very comfortable, and the neighbourhood can't be beat. There are great Off Broadway theatres very close by and lots of terrific restaurants to choose from. We always look forward to spending a couple of days at this hotel.

title: Amazing Staff!
text:
During my stay I lost a necklace and medallion, a family heirloom. The staff (front desk, concierge and cleaners) were absolutely fantastic throughout the whole process. They went above and beyond in their efforts, from shredding vacuum bags to checking our changed linnens, which ultimately led to us finding it again. It was stuck and hidden in the bed frame. 

On top of the fantastic staff The Standard has great rooms and location. 

Highly recommend it for your next stay in NYC!

title: Fun, Comfortable & Immaculate
text:
This was our second visit to The Standard, East Village and once again, they exceeded our expectations!! The staff is amazing, the views are fantastic and the beds are super comfy!! We will definitely be back!!!
Patti & Gregg

title: Great Hotel, Terriblr Restaurant
text: The hotel rooms, staff, room service etc were outstanding but the restaurant, Narcissa, was godawful, possibly one of the worst restaurants in the known universe. Service was adequate, atmosphere no better than that of an upscale airport diner, seats that were closer to the ground than the table. There were three of us. Wine was vintage 2016 and 2017. Every entree was terrible.. My short rib steak had no meat on it AT ALL. Total fat and gristle. Seriously, NO MEAT. And this was after I had asked if it was similar to short ribs. Inedible. I sent it back for chicken which was okay but you don’t have to be Einstein to make chicken, although I asked for the sauces on the side which was a good idea because they were totally inappropriate. My wife ordered Branzino which was hidden underneath some indescribable sweet sauce that killed the the taste of the fish. My daughter had red snapper which was drenched in a bath of curry and tasted like... well...curry. Price with tip —$280. Narcissa is an example of what happens when a chef tries to outdo other trendy chefs and does not care if his “creations” were meant to be eaten.

title: Awesome down to the fine details!
text: Everything was exceptional this week, from the amazing welcome sign in the bathroom to the tour and happy hour, you made us all feel so special. Your team even put my colleague in a yurt when she wanted to get some work done early one morning! The team here is fabulous!

title: Great Hotel, love the location!
text: Favorite hotel in NY. Great location in terms of being able to access the subway, walking distance to so many parts of Manhattan. Higher floors have great views. Rooms always clean, and they have a nice breakfast spot. All in all perfect for an NY stay!

title: Amazing Hotel, Even Better Staff
text: Absolutely amazing hotel and staff. I live in Toronto and planned a surprise proposal in New York for my girlfriend while she was there visiting some friends. I called the hotel once I had booked a room and asked if bringing some champagne so it could be on ice when we arrived later would be a possibility. Not only did they honor my request, they upgraded my room free of charge! The hotel has a very chic and modern feel to it and I would definitely stay here again. I recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay and thank you again to the staff!

title: Coolest hotel in NYC!
text: My wife and I chose the Standard East Village to be our home in NYC for 12 nights while working on both a film and music project and we are so glad we did. The staff is the most helpful I’ve encountered in all my travels and the service and food are great. Whoever designed this hotel has really succeeded in both design and comfort and the area is my favorite part of NYC - bohemian and cultural. The views of the skyline from both our rooms was majestic. We loved the Standard in Miami Beach and now Standard East Village too. We’ll be back ...

title: Hotel Stay
text: Stayed for only one night for a quick mini moon and loved the place! Paige hooked it up and was able to get a great view with some special goodies. Staff were very helpful and nice. A bit pricey, but would definitely come back!

title: Great hotel, wonderful staff, perfect location!
text: We recently stayed at the Standard East Village and had a perfect NYC experience. I was traveling for work and my parents were in town for my father's bday. We all stayed at the Standard East Village and could not have been happier. The rooms were spacious and cozy with great views of the Bowery and city. The staff were helpful, friendly, accomodating...everything you would want. Will and Kelly made sure everything we needed was attended to and the restaurants at the hotel were delicious! We will definitely stay there again. This is really a perfect place to stay, great location, quiet rooms, friendly staff and delicious options in house and nearby! Thank you Standard East Village!

title: Great week in New York!
text: This hotel was just everything we expected and more. Views were great, very spacious and will stay again. Staff very friendly, restaurant gardens were so relaxing. And the bonus, heated bathroom floors. The price was reasonable.  Will stay again!

title: Hotel stay
