text: This hotel had the best view. Gorgeous view of the sky line. So spacious and the bathroom floor was heated!!!  A must in November!  Staff very friendly. The restaurant had great food! NARC BAR was nice. Best guacamole and chips!  All around a great hotel and will be staying again!  Thank you STANDARD staff for the great stay!

title: AMAZING WEEKEND IN NYC!
text: On my first visit to NYC, by myself, to visit family. I had no idea where to stay. Due to the reviews/location/size, I chose The Standard East Village. Best decision I've made in a long time. I was able to secure their car service, on a Friday night, from LGA. I was pleasantly surprised w/the quaint lobby. Very unique! My room had windows from floor to ceiling w/the best views! I was in awe of the skyline at night! Slept with my curtains open! Went to Broadway show, ate at NARCISSA, fabulous food! Breakfast in my room w/that view! I will be back NYC!!

title: Amazing Staff and Experience
text:
The hotel was a fun place to stay and a great location. The one thing that stood out the most, was the staff. They were genuinely interested in making sure you had a great experience at The Standard. From the time I checked in to the time I checked out the consistent level of friendly and professional staff was amazing. I wanted to at least mention a few names, I am sorry I can't remember everyone's name. Franc, Martin, Paige, Kelley and David and all of the staff were  attentive and took a lot of pride in their jobs. Hats off!! 

The heated floors in the bathroom, the wrap-around windows and the comfortable bed were the highlights of my guest room. 

The restaurant on-site, Narcissa, was amazing. I loved the ambiance, however, I must say the food and service were by far one of the best restaurants I have been to in NYC.  I'm not sure if it is quiet gem of not, but it was very busy for a Monday night and the flavors of the food were over the top. 

Thanks for the great stay at your hotel. I will be back!

title: VERY THOUGTFUL MANAGEMENT AND STAFF, AMAZING VIEWS AND LOCATION!
text: I arrived after a lonnnng flight from LA and was still traumatized by the massive fires and overall  despair that's  in the air there.  SO when I arrived and my room wqasn't quite on par with what I wanted, Martin Weiler, the manager, didn't miss a beat and promptly took care of me.  A smile, an upgrade, overall courtesy!!  Immediuate4ly put a smile on my face, not to mention the staff with Kelly and Jacob.  Everyone here has been so very very gracious and accommodating.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!  Plus this hotel is in walking distance to some really great NY spots!

title: Great Location, Terrific View, Top-Notch Front Desk Staff
text: Great location, terrific room (huge view, from Freedom Tower to The Empire State Building), and what a front desk staff! Smart, fun, and helpful. These are the things that we're always looking for in a hotel but rarely find. We'll be back!

title: Stylish space, welcoming staff, spectacular views
text: The first time I checked in to the Standard East Village, the front desk staff asked what brought me to town. I explained that it was my first time performing at a nearby venue, and I was nervous. That afternoon, a bottle of bubbly arrived in my room with a note of congratulations from the staff, wishing me luck. That's the kind of place this is - as friendly as a local bed-and-breakfast, with more style than far snobbier hotels. On my most recent visit I was on the 20th floor, with one of the best views I've seen in any New York Hotel. The Empire State Building to the right, the sunset to the left. The restaurant is fantastic. Basically, the Standard East Village has earned my loyalty. I'll stay here whenever I can.

title: I had an excellent stay at this hotel. The staff is very friendly, the room was very clean, the bed is very comfortable,
text:
great hotel.very good location.perfect.easy to walk or taking the subway,
I heard about the good restaurant, unfortunately I didnt have the chance to taste the food, but next time i am going to visit the restaurant,

title: Always a great experience!
text: I have stayed at this particular location several times. The staff is so friendly.  The onsite restaurant Narcissa is amazing!  And the location is really great.  the rooms are small like any NY hotel, but the views are terrific.  Everything is very comfortable.

title: Extraordinary Service at The Standard, East Village
text: The staff at this hotel are incredibly kind, thoughtful, and helpful. I stayed for a week and was blown away by the level of exemplary service I received. The staff are knowledgeable and their recommendations are spot on :)

title: Ótimo hotel, bem localizado, super atendimento
text:
O hotel é ótimo. Tudo muito novo e de alta qualidade. 
Tem um clima de balada, com café, dois bares e um restaurante.
A localização é ótima para quem quer aproveitar a vida noturna e os restaurantes do Village e Soho.
O quarto é grande para padrões de NY. Banheiro muito bom, com piso aquecido.
A equipe foi super atenciosa, receberam uma encomendas e prestaram ótimo atendimento.
Voltaria com certeza.

title: Mom
text: Fortunately for my family there is a Standard in Cooper Square. We have two sons living in NYC. One lives across the street and the other lives around the corner. This boutique hotel has it all. Over the top pleasant staff, immaculately clean rooms, great restaurant choices, and easy walkability to fun things to do in NoHo.

title: Great location to visit NYU students!
text:
First time I've ever stayed at the Standard.  And it was a fabulous experience!  It started with responsive and most friendly correspondence with Rachel in Reservations who did her best to find us a room with two double beds for my granddaughter and I...Ended up booking a Corner King Room...absolutely great for us even though it had one king bed...Great location to walk to NYU, so many restaurants I cannot even name them all, Whole Foods, and etc.
Will definitely return soon.

title: The Standard, East Village and Narcissa, a NYC must!
text: As a Hospitality Expert, I have traveled the world and experiences many hotels and restaurants over the years. I simply must share the fun I had this past weekend with my friend Ana who was visiting from Rio De Janeiro. It was great catching up and sharing updates on our companies and potential business partnership. Brunch was at a wonderful restaurant called Narcissa located at The Standard, East Village. The service at Narcissa was spot on! The menu was unique and the food amazing! I recommend the French Toast for the table as a starter and Duck Hash as an entrée.  If you’re not familiar with The Standard, East Village or Narcissa, they are a NYC must! Mathew, a Bellman at The Standard, East Village, Rodolfo and Nolan at the restaurant Narcissa are Hospitality Extraordinaires!

title: Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff
text: The moment I walked into the hotel, I was greeted warmly by Paige at the front desk. She immediately made me feel like a valued guest (this was my first stay at any Standard Hotel). As she checked me in, she introduced me to the hotel manager, Franck, who was also very personable and welcoming. They then handed me over to Giovanni, who showed me to the room. Gio has such great energy and enthusiasm, it's impossible not to immediately be impressed with him. The room was very nice, not very big but well appointed, modern, quiet and clean. I has breakfast in Cafe Standard. It was so delicious that I ended up there for a late night bite. The next day I had lunch with friends there, and I have to say, every meal was fantastic. The weather was nice, and they have a lovely outdoor area that we enjoyed.Service at the restaurant was impeccable, as well. There are two other restaurants that I was not able to try, narcbar and Narcissa. They looked very nice and I will be sure to try them on my next visit to Manhattan. The hotels location was terrific, there are tons of places to walk to in the area, and it's an easy and quick trip to Brooklyn, which is where I had to be in the evenings. Paige checked on me a few times to see if I needed anything, and Franck was there to check me out when I had to (reluctantly) leave. I travel a lot, and my experience from start to finish was well above most places I've stayed at. Sincere thanks to Paige, Franck and Giovanni for their wonderful hospitality. I will not stay at any other hotel in NYC from now on, The Standard, East Village is now at the very top of my list. Can't wait to come back!!

title: Excellent service
text: We had the best time staying at The Standard, East Village! Our room was a corner king, and the view was amazing! The front desk staff were all friendly and helpful. I had a small issue and Ian at the front desk resolved it immediately. The housekeeping staff was excellent and respected that I had to work from my room, so they came later in the day each day, as requested. The bed and bedding were wonderful. I haven’t slept that well in months! Cocktails, breakfast, and lunch at Cafe Standard were excellent (try the Word Up!). The Andy Warhol entree at The Garden absolutely hit the spot after a long day of traveling. We will absolutely stay here again on our next trip to New York, and will seek out The Standard brand for future vacations.

title: Daughter's wedding by Eric S
text: It was September 28,2018 and my daughter notified me that she had good news. She said she was getting married October 5, 2018. After getting over the initial shock and elation, I had to accept that she was flying in from Prague and marrying her boyfriend of 15 years. It wasn't until October 3, 2018 that she allowed me to make a hotel reservation in Manhattan for the happy couple. She stipulated that the hotel had to be in the East Village since the Karaoke bar they reserved was in the area. The other demand was that the hotel be ready at 12:30 PM so that they could get ready for the City Hall ceremony at 2:30 PM on October 5, 2018.She picked 3 hotels from my list of 8. Two hotels told me that it was impossible and brushed me off as a crackpot. The Standard not only humored my request, but did everything imaginable to fulfill my wish.Paige at the Standard should get the medal of honor for service above and beyond the call of duty. She made sure a room would be ready and offered me 3 choices. I picked the corner room which is spectacularly windowed with breath-taking views. There was Champagne in the room and complementary brownies courtesy of the hotel.I work in the luxury business and I know what it means to feel pampered. This was an experience above and beyond all of our expectations and will absolutely return to this amazing hotel with it's phenomenal staff.

title: Great location and great service
text: We loved this hotel- easy walking distance to Soho, and other spots.  The staff was great, even the housekeeping.  The have a nice little coffee shop that converts to a appetizers cocktail bar later in the day.  We had a corner room on a high floor (which I highly recommend). Only wish was I would have really enjoyed free water bottles.  We will return.

title: Just loved it
text:
We staied for a week a family of 6 and all of likes the Hotel very much. The location is great since East village has a lot of small cosy restaurants with the best food from all over the world and its close to 3 subway lines making it easy to go everywhere.
The hotel has an extraordinärt view, nice cosy rooms and a wonderful staff.
We just loved it!❤️

title: Great location and great hotel
text: We absolutely adored staying at the Standard. They made us feel like part of the furniture and took the best care of us, even finding us a doctor available on Memorial Day. Franck and the team were welcoming and attentive. Nothing was too much trouble.

title: 2nd and 3rd visit
text: 2nd visit for 7 nights with a 2 night break at Southampton then 3rd visit on our last night in NYC. We like this hotel because it is one of the few in the area that have rooms with two double beds. Half the staff are superstars, one young bloke was amazing. The others very much too cool for school. The dude in the cafe with the baby pink hair, didn’t actually speak a word when interacting with us. Odd. Avoided the cafe like a plague for breakfast instead opting for Gemma down the road. At 10 years old the place is starting to show its age but I guess in a city with 60 million + visitors a year and not enough hotels to supply those visitors, quality sometimes is let down. Checked out with a specific taste in my mouth, like they’re doing you a favour allowing you to stay there.

title: Where Customer Services Lives.
text:
The Standard exceeds all expectations....there’s a reason why we never stay anywhere else. 

The number one reason for us is Paige, Director of the Guest Experience. This woman will help make your stay unforgettable. We stayed here a year ago on our wedding night. The corner king was outfitted with snacks, quality bottled water, champagne and a personalized note from Paige. 

Fast forward to last weekend which happened to be our one year anniversary. Not only did she remember us, Paige managed to place us in the same room we had our wedding night! That doesn’t occur at other hotels. This is THE place to stay when in NYC. 

The second reason, as if you needed one....the beds. OMG the beds. You fall fast asleep in mounds of fantasy clouds. I’m a serious bed snob so trust me, the beds are amazing. 

Lastly, the onsite bar is quite fantastic. Great food and knowledgeable bartenders. 

Take my advice...stay here and sleep well.

title: superior!
text: The Standard is excellent. The rooms, while NYC size, are sufficient for a comfortable stay. The bathroom was spotless and is plenty large enough for two. Full size shower, plenty of towels and two comfy robes are provided, along with the usual shampoo, conditioner, soaps etc.  The staff is wonderful. Every single staff member, from housekeeping to the front desk really engages with the guests. The front desk staff was very knowledgeable about things to do in NYC in the East Village.

title: Great location, overall great hotel, but...
text:
The good:
Great location, modern design, smallest room was big enough, great views from the room’s window, Bluetooth speaker is a nice touch.  Minibar well equipped.  Very nice restaurant, with great service.
The bad:
Bed sheets were heavily stained.  Found out only in the morning.  Read similar reviews, so I suspect it’s not a singular mistake... 
shower had a weird unpleasant smell.
I arrived early morning.  Receptionist promised to text or email me when the room is ready.  Never did.
On checkout day, cleaning lady entered the room twice without knocking between 9:30 and 10:00 (before checkout time)

Overall good value for money.
Could easily get 5 stars with a bit more attention to hygiene and service.

title: Just a great stay, it was hard to leave!
text:
I loved the room, the bed--and the way the room was decorated.  It had everything I needed, and one great thing, lots of easily available plugs.  No getting behind the desk, everything was right there.  The view was amazing, she shower was great and it actually turned on without lots of time spent deciding how it would work.
The location of the property was perfect for a weekend or a week, I'll be staying there again the next time I visit NYC

title: Solid quieter bar for drinks and snacks
text: Came here on a Sunday night with a group of friends. Solid drinks and good small snacks. Quieter typically which is nice. The decor of the restaurant is French brasserie style. Nice outdoor space that was fairly empty. I had some cocktail shrimp which were good.

title: Funky Room Vibe, but great service
text:
Odd room themes are very kitschy (giant red lip pillows) ans the Red (score) button above the bed is cringeworthy.
Front desk crew is excellent, and the attached restaurants are fun and decent food and drinks.  The room key gets you into their Highline night club as well.

title: Great hotel!
text: We loved our time at the Standard! Our son was married there last weekend. The hotel was very accommodating with all of our requests from getting into our room early so our 2 year old grandaughter could nap before the rehearsal to Providing extra goodies for her. The front desk folks and event plannerss were very welcoming and helpful.

title: Fabulous property, great location
text:
Had the pleasure of staying at the Standard East Village twice on this trip, both were a pleasure. They upgraded us to a Suite on our second stay this month, seems like loyalty has its perks! It’s located in the heart of the East Village, surrounded by great restaurants and bars a short walk away. The new GM David has breathed new life into the place and the Standard is a breath of fresh air.

We were looking for an informal, yet fun property, in a local neighbourhood with great service. It checked all boxes and we can’t wait to return, it’s become our go-to in NYC. Thoroughly recommended 👍

title: Great views, great neighborhood and great service
text:
I love this hotel and it is the only place I stay during my frequent trips to NYC.  The neighborhood is awesome!  On my latest stay I saw a beautiful sunrise from my east-facing view.   The staff is exceptional and my  twenty something daughter feels like she could make friends with the people who work here,  because everyone is so
approachable, kind, youthful and good looking! And yet as a middle-aged person, I am always treated with warmth and respect.

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: We got 2 nights at this hotel as a gift and it made our trip to NY perfect! The views are breathtaking and the bed is one of the best beds we have ever slept in. Room was spacious and bathroom had warm floor and with a big bath with (again) a great view over Empire State building and others. Great location, just a few steps from 8th street metro station. Many options for eating out around. Staff was fun and super friendly.

title: Feel the Love 2
text:
First impressions:  A lovely friendly non-corporate welcome.  It was night so didn’t get the full effect of my corner room on the 9th floor but my first thought was oh this (standard) room is really small and lucky I am staying here on my own. Also mini bar takes up half the wardrobe so really depends then on priorities. Would definitely book a larger room next time if required.  Black out curtains tick and very quiet apart from a touch too loud air con which I needed help with (after a long flight) to turn off.
Also still haven’t worked out how to turn on my desk lamp.
Fantastically comfortable bed with those feather mattress topper things. Bliss.  
Good, spacious shower and lovely products although I have given up on the black soap.  Am wondering if I can be seen at night from street level with the light on.  Can I??
Here for 8 days and now it is day 6 on Saturday morning.  Light streaming in and fully bonded with my room. Haven’t fallen out with anyone either.  It would be difficult as the staff are so naturally friendly, except in the the cafe where I had breakfast on my first morning (can be daunting for some people) and the staff on that particular morning were a little cool for my liking.  However, I have been back since and met with other staff and that was a one-off.
The chai latte was disappointing too.  Truly the only tiny negative experiences!
A highlight?  The chicken poppers in the bar with a perfectly chilled glass of Moët. 
There is a huge gym just across the street which I understand guests can use (don’t know about fees etc...)
The design is functional/retro with some interesting artwork in the lobby and a garden and outdoor seating for people watching. Then there is the cafe and a top notch restaurant using produce from their own kitchen garden.
The hotel is perfectly located within walking distance of  everything in the East Village/Soho and Greenwich Village and the area feels perfectly safe to walk around alone day or night.
Very happy and would highly recommend.

title: super Sejour à New york
text:
cet hotel agreable et son personnel convivial est situé dans un quartier calme et proche  des principaux sites touristiques.
Nous avons apprecie sa modernité, sa chambre spacieuse ainsi que sa literie confortable, avec en plus une vue sur l Empire State.
Nous  le recommandons donc sans restriction. Et en plus le directeur parle français!
Couple de Lorraine.

title: Frequent Business Traveler
text: The folks at The Standard East Village always make my stay a memorable one. The front desk team learned my name and helps with my bags and seeing me up to my room. The housekeeping staff will do later turndown service if you want to have a lazy Saturday and sleep in. In-room dining is good and delivers late. Great location in the East Village and great restaurant and bar options all within the hotel. Every time I am in New York I stay at The Standard East Village! <3

title: מלון מעולה לחגוג ירח דבש!
text: מלון מקסים. כבר בכניסה למלון רואים שהוא מטופח, נקי ונעים. הצוות אדיב מאוד! שידרגו לנו את החדר לאחר שציינו שאנחנו בירח דבש וקיבלנו חדר מדהים עם נוף מהמם, מרווח יחסית לניו יורק ואמבטיה גדולה ומפוארת. הצוות עזר לנו גם במהלך השבת ויודע מה שומרי שבת צריכים כאשר מציינים בפניו מה גם שבית חבד במרחק הליכה. מיקום מעולה ומגניב, מומלץ ביותר!

title: Fantastic East Village Hotel
text: Enjoyed a fabulous 2 nights at The Standard Hotel in East Village and will definitely return! The corner king room I had was a great size with all the amenities I needed, and then some. The floor to ceiling windows let in tons of light during the day which I loved and the bed was super comfortable. The bathroom was stylish and clean with an awesome tub and the bathroom amenities were delightful. The front desk staff and bellmen were all friendly and very helpful. I had a cocktail and lite dinner at Cafe Standard which were both delish. Location is fantastic and you can easily walk to all the East Village hot spots. Thank you for a wonderful stay! I'll be back!

title: Lovely Birthday Stay
text:
Stayed here a few nights for my birthday. Paige was exceptional--she did an amazing job planning things for my birthday room. I was so happy with my stay and felt really special and taken care of.

Specifically, she sourced a lovely floral arrangement. I've lived in New York before and I was surprised by how beautiful it was. There were also balloons, a bowl of fresh berries, water, and a room with great views on a high floor.

The Standard is obviously a chic hotel, and Paige's attention to detail really made it a memorable stay. Highly recommend.

title: NYC Weekend
text: Stayed here for a few days since it was extremely close to Family, Clean quiet rooms and extremely friendly staff. Close to a lot of great eats and local attractions. Close to public transportation, made traveling around extremely easy

title: NYU drop off made easy and fabulous
text: With the mixed and many emotions associated with dropping your freshly minted freshman off to college, it really helps to be staying somewhere like The Standard East Village. Just a short walk from NYU, and staffed with genuinely warm and helpful people, a lot of the stress of the experience fell away. Our room was gorgeous with a breathtaking view of the city skyline which was a fitting farewell splurge for our son before he slept his first night in his dorm. Move in day was chaotic but the proximity to Third North made it much easier to manage and the staff was patient, kind and really responsive to the myriad of our requests. We've already booked for Parents Weekend and I'm really looking forward to it!

title: Miss
text: Great hotel and AWESOME service!! Very quiet and divine beds!! Really VERY VERY helpful people from front desk!! Beautiful location!! Many nice restaurants and bars. Will comeback!! Hopefully very SOON!!

title: Belle vue, mais prestation plutot décevante dans l’ensemble
text:
Magnifique vue depuis les chambres. Quartier branché et sympa.
La literie est très bonne. Le design est moderne mais reste assez basique pour un hotel qui se veut trendy.
Personnel souriant et sympathique.

Pour le reste, la prestation est assez décevante et en deçà de ce que nous avons eu pour d’autres séjours à New York dans cette gamme de prix.
Chambres très petites, n’offrant quasiment pas de rangements ce qui est genant pour un séjour de plusieurs jours. Frigo et air conditionné très bruyants. 
Restaurant plutôt tourné vers les clients externes, bondé le week end, service très lent au petit déjeuner.
Parties communes et prestations quasi inexistantes (pas de gym sur place mais sous traitée à un club de quartier, pas de machine à café dans les chambres …)
On paye le coté hype du quartier mais la qualité des prestations n’est pas au niveau attendu pour le prix.

title: The Standard Rocks!
text: The hotel is clean, hip, luxurious and it’s always a great stay. The rooms l, while not huge, feel luxurious and the beds are phenomenal. They’re bright and extremely well stocked with good stuff. The best is their cafe and and of course Narcissa.. a destination New York restaurant. Front desk staff is super helpful and be sure to meet Franck who treats you like a long lost friend.

title: My new favorite
text: My husband and I found ourselves needing to stay overnight unexpectedly in the city yesterday, and happened across this wonderful hotel when looking for places in the area. Immediately upon entry, after seeing the adorable garden room on the right and the cool cafe/bar on the left, we were pleasantly surprised before we even reached the front desk. Once there, we were assisted graciously by (Nicholas ?) who worked very quickly to get us situated into our room. Within moments, we were met by Paige, also at the front desk, who, without hesitation and with the most kindness and professionalism I’ve experienced in quite some time, arranged for us to have some needed toiletries brought up to our room. We had a lovely conversation with her as she escorted us to the elevator area, which is unique and very cool itself. Our room, small but very well appointed, was on a high floor, with a beautiful view of downtown,  and had an exceptionally comfortable bed, chic bathroom, and was spotless. Thanks to Paige, and our lovely first experience at The Standard East Village, it for sure will not be long before we return. We look forward to becoming “regulars” .

title: Amazing stay!
text: I have been to nyc on average of about 3 times per year every year for the past decade. I have stayed in numerous hotels but The Standard is easily my favorite. The service was fantastic and the room was beautiful. Everything functioned perfectly unlike older hotels in the city. Food was excellent for all tastes. I am personally hoping to make this my hotel every time I visit the city. Don't skip out on this one!a true gem!

title: Suneil Sikka
text:
Had a wonderful time at the Hotel . The hotel staff is very courteous and attentive to the needs of the Guest.
The GM Mr Lopez is always there and makes you feel at home . 
The hotel has nice lively restaurant and good food and co tails . It’s close to the best shopping area in NY

title: Great hotel, fantastic staff!
text:
I can't say enough good things about this hotel and the amazingly friendly and helpful staff. My trip's purpose was to move my child to NYC, not too far from the hotel.  Even before I got there, Paige, Manager of Guest Experience, took it upon herself to walk to the street and scope out the general unloading situation- I couldn’t believe how thoughtful that was! It really put me at ease to have the inside scoop so I would know what to expect when I arrived.  Things only continued to get better! When I got to the hotel, the staff, from the bellman, to the front desk crew was so incredibly friendly.   My room had an amazing view and was very clean and well appointed. Paige continued to check in on me during my stay, helping make what could have been a stressful trip into a very relaxing one.   I am definitely coming back and recommending to friends and family.
Basically, if you are looking for a hotel in this neighborhood, don’t bother looking anywhere else.  The Standard is at a great location, the service of staff was beyond anything I ever would have expected, and the bar and café offer delicious food at reasonable prices.  Whatever management is doing to motivate their staff- keep on doing it!

title: Fine hotel in East Village
text: I was assigned a very nice room, with an awesome view. But rooms are small. Hotels of this category and price range in NYC typically offer slightly larger accommodations. Having said that, bar/restaurant was very nice and the area is low key (if that is what you are looking for). Very different (in a good way) from Midtown or times Sq.

title: READ THIS REVIEW! You will stay here!
text:
I sent my family to New York for the first time recently. They are not world (or even domestic) travelers by any stretch of the imagination. So a week in New York is a very big deal. Just like you, I used the reviews to decide where to stay. The Standard East Village was an easy pick but that is just the beginning of the story. I called ahead and asked for the concierge desk to let them know that some travel newbies were on their way and to please help them whenever they could. Luckily for me, I got connected with Paige, the Guest Experience Manager. She was so gracious, kind and understanding - there is just not enough space to describe it on this review. She took their names, what the like to eat, where they were going and so on and so on. She welcomed them to the hotel, introduced them to the staff and really put them from a nervous state to totally at ease. All throughout the trip, she checked in with them (and me) to make sure all was well. They went to see the Statue of Liberty, Top of the Rocks, The Empire State Building etc... After seeing all of those world renowned attractions - the real star of the show was Paige. When they returned Paige was as much a part of the story of the trip than anything else. This was truly the best customer service experience, including all - not just travel or hotels - that I have experienced and I was not even there with them. If you like to be at the best place when you travel, then The Standard East Village is your place. 

There was one more thing... while the group was leaving, the youngest member left her wallet and iPhone in an uber. Out of 80,000 uber drivers in NYC - Paige managed to track it down and get it for us. She is the real deal.

title: Room with spectacular view!!
text:
We’re on the 19th floor, a corner wrap-around room with large windows, and with very impressive views of the city. We like the accommodations, the location of the hotel, and the friendly and helpful staff.
There is a young crowd here day and night, having a lot of fun.  NYU is nearby. 
Some of the best Japanese restaurants in NYC are within easy walking distance in “little Tokyo”.
The room needs a table large enough for two to eat room service meals. 
The bathroom also has incredible city views and  an old fashioned bathtub without a separate shower.
We have not been able to get reservations to eat in their nicest restaurant yet.  We have eaten in the cafe and the bar several times.  (Loved  the French style ham and cheese on baguette.)

title: Super séjour
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel ma femme, notre fille de deux ans et moi durant onze nuit. Le secteur est top et permet de rayonner à pied dans presque tout Manhattan. L’hôtel est à la fois chic et décontracté. Le service est bon, notamment le bar qui dispose d’une terrasse et propose une cuisine de très bonne qualité (comptez en moyenne 20$ par personne pour un petit dej copieux, la même chose pour un excellent burger ; plutôt conforme aux tarifs newyorkais). Il y a également deux restaurants que nous n’avons pas essayés. 
Concernant les chambres, elles ne sont pas très grandes, mais très bien équipées. La literie, kingsize est très moelleuse et la vue juste magique avec ces grandes baies vitrées.

title: Modern, liberating and out of the Ordinary Staff!
text: I've stayed in many NYC Hotels but by far Standard East Village has been the best. At check-in I was greeted w/a smile & a yummy froze. My room was modern, loved the bathroom, with view like no other.

title: A short but great experience!
text: The hotel is ultra hip and contemporary, and the staff were friendly and very attentive. Our room was perfect: clean, comfortable, had all required amenities (the blue tooth speaker was a nice touch) and with a great view of the east side.

title: Great spot.  Better service
text:
100% recommend The Standard in East Village.  I have spent time at all the Standard properties and have lived in NYC a while back.  This was a pleasant homecoming.  The manager Franck was incredibly helpful and available.

See you again soon!

-Robert
FarfromBoring Promotions

title: Modern, Fun & Clean
text:
Just stayed here for my bachelorette weekend. I am from NY and I've been to a lot of different places in the city.  This hotel is by far one of the cleanest, fun and has the nicest staff ever!! Location is in the East Village which is a fun area with lots of good eats and fun things to do.  We had a beautiful view and I loved that the floors in the bathroom were heated! Also, so easy to pull up in the front and valet the car into the garage. 
Can't wait to come back!

title: Lovely.little.boutique hotel
text: An exceptionally nice choice, the staff here is extremely helpful (Thanks, Paige). Several restaurants are on the premises, with many appealing eateries within walking distance. Modernist and angular, but still homey in it’s own way. First time here, but I look forward to a return visit.

title: Outstanding customer service
text: So my partner was travelling to NYC from Australia and stayed at the standard east village. I contacted the hotel with an idea of me placing a particular item in the hotel as a surprise for my partner when she arrived. The hotel, especially Paige S, were super helpful and excited to help. They kept up communication with me every step of the way and even sent me photos of the room before she arrived with the surprise. I couldn't be happier with the customer service, and from what I have seen on facetime with my partner and her comments the hotel itself is awesome :)

title: Great stay!!
text: Came in town for a visit with my daughter.  Loved this hotel!!  Awesome location, perfect size!!  Very cozy with a darling outdoor patio n such wonderful employees!!  Bed was comfortable and bathroom was great!!  Can’t wait to stay again!!

title: Celebratory Weekend
text: This was not our first stay at the Standard and definitely will not be our last. The staff is always so very cordial and helpful and our room was once again spectacular. We love the Standard for its ultra convenient location as well as the great spot to have a few drinks with friends.....and once again, the people!

title: Perfection
text: The Standard at Cooper Square is my home away from home. The property is artfully curated, from the optional red lights above the king sized bed to the tastefully provocative art behind the registration. Towering discreetly in the historic LES, the hotel offer walks to some of the best restaurants in the city as well as the much needed Crunch gym across the street. Most importantly the Standard team could not exhibit greater excellence. They go far above and beyond to ensure my stay is dreamlike. I’m treated like family by every member and welcomed with warmth every time I arrive. Honestly, I rarely want to leave and couldnt imagine a Manhattan trip without my Standard stay.

title: Un Weekend Super dans un Hotel geniale
text:
Nous somme reste dans le cartier du East Village pour notre weekend devasion. 

Super cartier remplie de chose a faire (bar, restaurent , music ect.. ) 

L'Hotel a rendu notre weekend encore plus speciale ! une super chambre avec une vue impronable sur la vie de New York ! 

Un grand merci a Franck qui a su nous recomender de nombreuse adress et itinerer varier pendent notre sejoure. 

Je rocomend vivement cette hotel et son equipe ! service top !

title: Birthday Weekend
text:
I  must say The Standard really raises the bar for me of what I expect from all hotel moving forward.
They made my weekend fantastic, The Suite, staff and the great Sunday brunch really left me satified completely, this hotel seems to really have it all, including the location which was perfect for meeting my friends out, close to a dog park which my Toby loved. I think anyone contemplating the value of this hotel, contemplate no more. This is well worth every cent.  This will be my new location for staycations moving forward.

title: A window over NYC
text: Can you imagine yourself relaxed on your bed watching outside the spectacular view of a NYC sunset? This is what you get at the Standard, the perfect place located at a walking distance to fancy and great restaurant and the city attractions.

title: Hip Hotel in the Right Location
text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our week-long stay in July 2018.  One of the reasons we chose The Standard, East Village, was because it was within walking distance of our friends' apartment, but to our delight, it was also within walking distance of so many interesting shops and restaurants!  Originally from NYC, I was able to easily "walk down memory lane" and visit some old haunts.  It's close enough to a few subways, too, but you can also catch a cab right out front because it's on a main avenue.

But speaking of restaurants, we have to give a shout out to the Standard Cafe, a must-stop on most days for their cappuccino.  The bartenders double as baristas, and they do it right.  And definitely try the cafe's Flatbread, a nice ~10" square covered in arugula pesto and a salad of arugula, thinly sliced zucchini and squash, dressed in a bright citrus vinaigrette.

On our first day, we had arrived early and were prepared to store our luggage until our room was ready, but to our surprise, our room was ready AND upgraded.  It was on a higher floor with a great corner view.  The room was very clean and well appointed, although the carpets showed some wear and staining, but that's bound to happen with a lot of foot traffic.

The staff was always friendly and helpful -- actually reaching out to us with their contact info -- which will encourage us to stay at The Standard the next time we come back to NYC.  If you're looking for a hotel with a hip vibe, that's close enough to walk to most things in lower Manhattan, then look no further.

title: Welcoming and Hip Place To Stay
text: We stayed here four nights in late June of 2018. The property is full of interesting architectural features, and our room was of decent size by Manhattan standards, which all translated to a very good value. The beds are some of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. I never thought I'd sleep this well in the "City!" We especially loved the garden bar area and watching the World Cup at the main bar and restaurant out front. We ate breakfast here a few days and the food was always very good. The staff was the best part of our stay, as they always asked us, and kept asking us, what more they could do to make our stay even better, and then they did so! Staying here, we felt part of the "Standard" family, and we will surely be back!

title: Le restaurant est top !
text:
Service petit déjeuner d’une qualité remarquable, mets délicieux et service d’une très grande gentillesse. 
Visite également pour le dîner, toujours parfait, cocktails et desserts délicieux. 
Un grand merci pour ce super moment.

title: Best hotel I've ever been to!
text: Staying at The Standard East Village was such an amazing experience! The room was so clean and spacious and had an amazing view, the room service and cafe are amazing, and the staff are so sweet and accommodating. Special shoutout to Will who works at the front desk, who not only helped me very nicely and quickly when I got locked out of my room, but also made sure I felt like I had everything I needed throughout my stay. The bathroom and shower are beautiful and feel like a spa, the bed feels like heaven, the wifi is fast and more than capable of handling a night of Netflix bingeing, and the minibar is HUGE, including both drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic) and a wide variety of snacks. The surrounding area is one of the nicest in New York City. Definitely planning to stay here again in the future, and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC!

title: Birthday Stay
text:
I want to extend this biggest thank you to The Standard East Village for making my birthday staycation the best ever! The studio was BEAUTIFUL the  Personalized amenities and  birthday card were a great touch. Had a wonderful dinner at Narcissa. Danced in the café and had some great drinks. 

Just to shout a few people that made it extra special for me 
Will Shanna Jeremy in the front office, Andrew and Matt the overnight staff

Thank you again everyone!

title: Hotel descolado
text: Adorei o Hotel The Standard. Ele é descolado, jovem, e a vista é linda pois o hotel é todo de vidro. Quarto grande mesmo e super moderno. Localização excelente, com restaurante, farmácia, tudo perto. No hotel tem 2 bares e 1 restaurante. O serviço é bom e os atendentes são todos muito simpáticos. Eu e minha família gostamos muito. Recomendo os andares altos por conta da vista. Tem até uma varanda no andar térreo, que só dá pra usar nos dias menos frios. Adoramos tudo!!

title: Recent visitor/mixed review
text: This hotel is such a mixed bag, it is tough to pin down. The queen and double rooms are tiny and not worth the money, so you must go with the King suites, which are much more expensive. Very comfortable beds and nice bathrooms. Great views from upper levels. Must get rooms from 12th. floor and up to avoid noise. There is no concierge or desk service to speak of. The place has lousy, half assed concierge service with practically no response to requests. The bar scene is lively and eclectic, with a good vibe, and the location is great. Expensive to valet your car. All and all, too expensive for the service and value. The tv didn’t work in our room and the refrigerator was broken, but the room was clean. Felt the place was understaffed with very young help who were trying their best, but were a bit overwhelmed.

title: Great location, majestic sunsets but tight rooms!
text:
This is a trendy boutique hotel in the hip and happening area of East Village, New York City. 

It’s has a small, unostentatious entrance and lobby, but it seems a lot more emphasis had been given to the couple of restaurant outlets which are on the ground level facing the Main Street — and these are always buzzing with activity! 

It’s a small hotel by any standard. but smaller still are the rooms. For anyone measuring six feet and having a heavy-set frame - like I do - moving within the room can be a pain, with the king size bed taking up most of the space! 

But the redeeming feature was the help huge glass window panel which opens up to the city’s majestic skyline (our room was on the 17th floor and we had sweeping views of the city. The evening sunset during summer months is glorious, with its golden hues piercing through the glass panel to create an ethereal sight (see photo attached). 

The rest of the amenities in the hotel were fine, except for drinking water which was only provided on the first day after check in, together with couple of packets of cookies (very nice!). Couldn’t understand why they would charge for subsequent water refills. We have travelled throughout the world and this must be the first quality hotel which doesn’t provide bottled water to guests! 

If space is not a big consideration for you then this hotel has everything you need for an enjoyable stay. 

And if you are looking for constant buzz around you, you’ll love this East Village landmark for the happening place it is!

title: Exceeded my expectations
text:
I spent a week here.. they moved me from The 11th to the 16th floor in a corner king room on the quiet side with a view uptown. Great views and fab vibe and bar downstairs with very good coffee.  I loved the bathroom with its bench that I used for applying my makeup. Staff notice what your wearing and compliment you which is nice if your a fashionista like me. The room also had excellent lighting,  which can be an issue in some places.  
The only letdown in the room is the bed.. it's not a great bed

title: East Village Oasis
text: I love this hotel. The garden is lovely, the food incredible and the people are AMAZING! I can't wait to come back! The views from the Penthouse music series were unbelievable. Comfortable beds, awesome pillows.

title: Nice hotel great location nice city views!
text: I had a Corner King. The room was a decent size for New York City.  Within walking distance to everything the East Village and Greenwich village have to offer!  Front desk staff very courteous and professional. I can’t give it 5 due to slight musty smell in the room and the price.

title: Great Location, Lacking Value
text:
This is an expensive property.Typical hip, chic, Standard Hotels vibe. Long waits for service at the front desk, but staff were generally chirpy and attentive.

The king room was tiny, and devoid of any character. Having just come from the funky Made Hotel in Koreatown, The Standard East Village felt like a Holiday Inn, without the character. No art, funky fixtures, tea/coffee/iron in room. The only addition was a cushion in the shape of a mouth. Bar fridge and heater/air-conditioner were extremely noisy for a new building. At least the room had openable windows.

Bathroom was spacious and clean, but shower can't hold water and always flooded the bathroom. The soap provided was black in colour. I'm sure it was funky, but the drips stained the basin, and any white clothing that was splashed. Not very clever.

Lastly, The very comfortable bed had an additional mattress pad/topper. This had a huge lump on one side when we checked in that my wife literally had to sleep around. It took two mentions to the front desk to have this rectified, and then house keeping removed the extra layer and didn't provide us with another.

This is not a whiny review; while there was certainly nothing terrible about The Standard, you can definitely do better for the money.

title: Chic, Hip, and Great Location
text:
I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend trip, and overall I had a great experience, but the hotel definitely has a few small areas for improvement.

The location of this hotel is excellent, right in the Village at Astor Place / Cooper Union, very easy to walk to the East Village, Soho, West Village, NYU area, Union Square, etc. And, it's very close to the 6 train for access to uptown.

I stayed in a corner room, and it was worth it to pay a bit more for the extra space and improved views. The room decor is relaxing and modern, and designed to be functional for the small space. I requested a high floor, and the hotel staff was on top of it, giving me a room with a great view, above the street level noise. On the other hand, I requested an early check in after arriving on a red eye, and I wasn't able to get into a room until 2PM. Not a huge deal, but assuming standard checkout is at noon, it felt a bit odd that a room couldn't be ready earlier. Also worth noting, the hotel doesn't have a large lobby or lounge area that a guest could kill time in or relax in easily which was a bit problematic. There is an attached (hipster) restaurant, but not the kind of space to take out a laptop and sip a coffee for a few hours.

The room itself had a very comfortable bed and pillows and was relatively quiet - the corner windows made it feel much bigger than it was, and gave great light. A few complimentary fashion magazines made for nice reading and a nice treat for the plane ride home. The room's blackout curtains also helped at night to get a good night's sleep! The bathroom was large, with a full bathtub, but the toiletries were a bit subpar for a "hip" hotel (bottles attached to the wall, tiny hand soap that was dyed black making the sink look dirty whenever you used it, etc). And, the weirdest thing was - it was hard to figure out how to use the different light switches in the room - it took me two days to figure out how to properly turn the light on in the shower! I never figured out how to turn on the bathroom fan, if there was one. Also, oddly - the main room's window was open when I arrived, and it was so high out of reach that I had to call housekeeping / maintenance to close it - with a ladder... Odd.

The staff though, was always friendly - and as expected at a chic NYC hotel - hip and stylish. They were more than happy to help with bags, holding them before and after check in, as well as offering additional amenities and arranging for an extra bathrobe when asked.

All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in the city, but it could work on some of the finishing touches to help make it feel a bit more like home.

title: Beds Below Standard
text: This place tries too hard to be different. Good location and pleasant staff, but that's about it. The bed was very uncomfortable. Moreover the hallways are too dark and the music too loud. I felt it was overpriced for what you get. I would not recommend this hotel.

title: Show-Boat Central
text:
I live in NYC. I already pay a lot of money for a room; while it may not have views of the city or cooler than thou occupants, it has a much more comfortable bed in a much cooler area of the EV (really pushing it with Cooper Sq as EV -_-).

I would hate to see the room I was "upgraded" from; king bed on top floor was tiny, cold even with the heat cranked (most likely due to the look-at-me window) and noisy AF - could hear everything in the hallway. 

Front desk was typical surly NYC artiste moon-lighting as hotel clerk. I stayed here last-minute as an emergency.  The Standard properties cater to a very specific clientele; I can manage to not roll my eyes for a meal at one of their locations, but staying overnight I was defeated.

title: Hip vibe with relaxing touches
text:
While I have frequented the standard hotel on the high line many times, this was my first stay at the standard hotel in the east village. I was pleasantly surprised with the relaxed vibe and good service. 

While my room was exceptionally small, it was well designed and maintained.  The bathroom felt spacious and the views were spectacular. 

My favorite part was the garden lounge by reception where we enjoyed hours of lounging and sun while munching on some delicious snacks and sipping on yummy drinks. Best part is that they allowed our puppies to stay with us in the garden. 

I love this hotel and i will be back. You should check it out next time your in NYC!

title: Excellent Location. Noisy Room. Late Checkout Fee.
text:
Service: Great service with the exception of late check-out request. Staff member was unfriendly and imposed $50 fee for 1 hour extension.

Room (8th Floor): Very noisy air conditioner and fridge (unplugged in the end). Room/bathroom smelt musty. Reported issues to reception after one night but no resolution.

Location: Excellent location close to Wholefoods, Subway, and Restaurants.

Amenities: No gym, pool, or rooftop.

title: Clean rooms in a great location
text: This hotel is a stone's throw away from the Astor Place subway station, in what has become a very gentrified and touristy East Village.  The rooms were clean and well finished and the daily cleaning exemplary.  We were on the 12th floor, and it was very quiet, despite the loud bar at ground level.  The room was on the small size by NYC standards, but large by Tokyo standards.  If it is pleasure, not business, that brings you to NYC, highly recommended.

title: Me encanta!!!
text:
Es la cuarta vez que me hospedo en este hotel. El servicio es excelente, la ubicación es perfecta para mí, a pesar de contar con bar y restaurante que pueden ser muy ruidosos, en las habitaciones no se escucha el ruido. Las habitaciones son de tamaño regular (tienen de diferentes tamaños) y tienen todo lo necesario, son modernas y muy limpias. En esta ocasión nos dieron una habitación en la esquina con una linda vista.
Los desayunos son muy buenos, y no se diga el restaurante Narcissa, es simplemente fabuloso!!! 
La tarifa es alta, pero yo sí la pago por todas las cosas fabulosas que tiene. Me encanta este hotel y me volvería a hospedar aquí la próxima vez que vaya a NYC.

title: Cool Hotel with Amazing Views
text: We stayed 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay.  Good location and great service, but the thing that makes the hotel is the view.  We had a corner room (get a corner room) and the views were spectacular.  I also called about a week before our visit and asked for a higher room, also asked questions about getting to the hotel from the airports and the service was excellent.  Another review mentioned tiny rooms, but the corner was a decent size (it is NYC) and worked well for us as a couple.  The bathrooms are great.  We plan to stay there again, or check out the Standard Highline.  The maids also did a great job--one day it snowed, so we laid around most of the day, left at 4 to walk around, thinking our room wouldn't get serviced, but were pleasantly surprised when we returned that it was.

title: City vibes with the NYC view
text: The Hotel is inviting you to dare and indulge in the atmosphere of NYC from the entrance to your room. The mood of the decor the lighting the vibes gave me a sensual feeling; a feeling curiosity and satisfaction crept upon me. Being surprised for Valentine's Day with the view of the city and being able to enjoy it in my "birthday suit" all privacy, I'll tell you that for me and my love it was perfect. There is a bar and eatery inside the hotel and there is also space to eat outside that is still enclosed; I would describe it as visible yet hidden with a mystical aspect. The staff was amazing and always ready to assist. Walking through the hallways with the mirrored decor and entering the petite elevator drew us close as if preparation for how me would be feeling when we laid in that bed! Yes! those pillows and that pillow top baby. It's rewarding for the cost of the rooms but hey it's the Standard treat yourself! The view is in your face yet blocks away. Just pause, think about it, exactly you know that sounds amazing, but have to see it for yourself! Eating, shopping, and shows are reachable within a couple of blocks and more shopping just a couple of mins. in an Uber.  Enjoy!!<LGBT friendly>

title: Good location
text: Good location, friendly staff, good cafe on first floor. Room is small but clean and have interesting windows in bathroom. It is little bit expensive but good for business trips. Might not be a ideal choice for family with kids.

title: Grossartiges, trendiges Szene Hotel in Toplage
text:
Als zentraler Standpunkt in Manhattan absolut empfehlenswert, 
auch als Familie mit Kindern ab ca. 10 Jahren interessant.
Junges ambitioniertes Team, wenn man Glück hat und die oberen Etagen bekommt ..super Blick! Wir hatten Glück und wurden upgegradet!
Frühstück und Bar etwas überteuert, warscheinlich aber dem Standard New Yorks entsprechend.Viele Restaurants, Bars urige Shops direkt vor der Haustür
Insgesamt kein "uniformiertes Standardhotel" sondern ein Trendsetter mit entsprechender Kundschaft.

title: Great location, clean TINY rooms
text: Look - it’s worth a night.  Great location and really nice front desk (Ms Russo!).  Clean rooms with incredible views.  But OMG are they small and we were ‘upgraded’.   Hey it’s New York and the assumption is ‘get over it, we are trying to maximize price per square foot!’  Well, developer and hotel - you did!  And it turns me off.  Won’t stay again.

title: Excellent experience!
text:
We stayed at The Standard for 3 nights and didn't want to leave. Not only is the area my favourite in NYC, but the hotel itself, staff, and connecting bars/restaurants were one of a kind. Paige at guest services went out of her way to give us an unforgettable weekend —
 she really didn't have to, but she truly cares about her guests' experience. We could feel it.

Ask the concierge for recommendations in the area — they nailed it and gave us exactly what we were looking for. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. They have guests for life.

title: Spectacular room with a view and amazing service!
text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 7 nights and had the most amazing time. East Village is a fantastic location with excellent restaurants and cafes nearby. We walked pretty much everywhere but the subway was only 2 minute walk away. The bar on the ground level of the hotel was always lively and provided food and drinks. We stayed in a Corner King Room and had a view of the Empire State Building! Check out our photos. We couldn't fault the staff at all. The vibe of the hotel is young and friendly, they have great recommendations and we just had so much fun!

title: Excellent experience
text: The room, view, cafe, restaurant and Narcbar do not disappoint but it is the team of employees at the Standard- East Village that exceeded expectations. Everyone was not only genuinely friendly and helpful, they went above and beyond to ensure our visit was memorable.  We were in NYC to celebrate a 50th birthday in which Paige (Guest Services) personally ensured our room was adorned with cake, flowers, Prosecco and an amazing view of One World Trade. We got great recommendations from them for local dining, shopping and massages and each place was awesome.  The location of this hotel was also ideal with short uber or cab rides to most places (Madison Ave., WTC, Hamilton etc) and plenty to enjoy within walking distance throughout the East Village. Our room (2 doubles) was not big but we knew this up front and we were not there to hang out in the room. The beds were plush comfy and the bathroom (full size bathtub) had plenty of space. It was top notch and unpretentious!

title: Great hotel!
text:
For me, it’s One of the best hotels in NYC. Its the first time Im staying here and it won’t be the last! Kind of I love with it right now :) 
Big comfortable rooms, with huge windows and great restaurant to have breakfast and drinks.  They also give u free passes to crunch gym across the street... which is perfect. 
Love it!

title: A Gem in the East Village
text:
Decided to forgo my usual hotel in mid-town and stay at The Standard, closer to my daughter's apartment.  Stayed there for one night in January and, again, for two nights in late February.  Such a warm welcome which continued throughout both my visits.  Front desk staff was always ready to answer any questions and provide whatever service I needed.  Loved my rooms, the Standard King, for both visits.   Floor to ceiling windows provide great light and fabulous city views.  Had rooms both on the 12th and 18th floor.  I would suggest requesting a higher floor, such as I had, for the great views!  Beds are dreamy!   Toiletries are some of the best, if not the best, I have had at any hotel. Towels are generous in size and soft.  

The gym rat I am, I asked if the hotel had any discounts, etc.. with the Crunch gym across the street from the hotel.  They had complimentary passes!  So twice I was able to visit the well-equipped gym and burn off those extra calories one tends to consume in NY dining!  The complimentary gym passes is a big plus for me!  

Great location just a block or so from Astor Street subway station (the 6 line) and within walking distance to great restaurants on 2nd Ave and also on Bowery.  Easy walk to SOHO and NYU.  Speaking of restaurants, one must eat at The Mermaid Inn on 2nd street just a short 5 minute walk from The Standard.

The Standard has become my new "go to" hotel in NYC.   While I am a loyal rewards member for a major hotel chain (thus my previous hotel in mid-town), The Standard's service, location and quality of rooms and amenities will bring me back for future stays.

title: Treated like a VIP
text: Had the best time at The Standard East Village!! From the minute we checked in, we were treated like VIPs. Everyone was so friendly and helpful - especially Will Erwin at the front desk! He made sure that we were happy with every aspect of our stay.  And the rooms are so comfy and modern. We will definitely be going back soon. And we will certainly be looking for Will!!!! He is the go-to for all of your needs!!!

title: Hip place
text: Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. View from the 17th floor is spectacular! The courtyard next to the hotel has yurts, which were nice and cozy since the temps were in the 30's and 40's. The cafe is also a great place to hang out or catch up on work. If you like boutique hotels, definitely check out the Standard.

title: Amazing Staff/Amazing Stay
text: I had an incredible stay last night at the standard east village. I had used the one night app and booked day for for $170. This was going to be a surprise for my best friends birthday. Upon arrival I was placed in room 407, a perfectly nice room for a NYC stay but it didn't really say 22nd birthday. I went down to the best to ask about upgrading. The guest experience manager went above and beyond to enhance my stay. We were upgraded to room 1806 a suite with a living room, floor to ceiling windows throughout and  a sweeping view of NYC including the empire state building. Complimentary champagne was sent up and any time a needed anything the staff for warm, welcoming, and responsive. It was the best hotel customer service I have ever received. I highly recommend a stay here especially on a high floor!

title: Nice Hotel in Great Location
text:
I stayed at The Standard, East Village due to its location. So many gems in that neighborhood.

It was a quick NYC staycation and I was not disappointed. The hotel is very cute with modern vibes. 

The rooms are however very small given the price. I stayed in a room on the 3rd floor and thankfully I was alone because with two people it would be a tight squeeze getting around the room itself. I will say tho, the beds are extremely comfortable and overall the hotel/rooms are very clean.

title: Il peggior hotel di New York
text: L’ hotel e’ orrendo arredato con un gusto pessimo, le stanze non hanno le pantofole , c è un sistema di ventola del 1800 che fa un rumore fortissimo e il personale e’ scostumato e arrogante . Lo sconsiglio a chiunque . Esperienza pessima una delle peggiori .

title: Truly awesome!
text:
We just had a last minute impromptu night at The Standard and it couldn't have been better!  

Wonderful views from our great room. Really good bed w/ great sheets.  Had room service deserts which were extraordinary and Balthazar pastries and coffee this morning - perfect.  

Would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to discerning New Yorkers that want a staycation of a night or two.

Only drawback was the "hotel" restaurant and bar was overrun with large groups of "kids" drinking- around 11pm.  Wasn't too welcoming too hotel guests.

title: Nice hotel with excellent service
text:
Great location, very nice, spacious, clean room and super confy bed. The hotel also offers a daily gym entrance card for an amazing gym that is in front of the hotel. 
The service is absolutely amazing and the hotel has a very good cafe and restaurants downstairs. 

The only downside is that the air ventilation is quite noisy and in general you can hear whatever goes around in the hall, but besides that it's quite and they also offer some earplugs :)

title: Great hotel in everyway
text:
Wow wow and wow 
Standard east village 
This hotel is great price hospitality location can’t be better 
Slept like a baby super quiet 
Special props to front desk Will, Anna Marie , and Matt 

Thanks 

Peter Siroka

title: Nice room in a nice location
text: We had a room on the 3rd floor but had a view of the wall of the building next to us. But the room was very nice although quite small for the price. Then again, everything in Manhattan is small. The service was very good. No ice machines but they will bring you a bucket from the kitchen if you call room service. Will come back and try the cafe and restaurant the next visit. A little pricey but check for specials. Prices on the net were all over the place depending on when you wanted to stay. This is what you would call a modern boutique hotel. Better for couples rather than families with kids.

title: Revisit
text: I've stayed in August and service is consistent to my last stay. I realized that some rooms are better than others. I really don't recommend a connecting room as we had one with a coworker and could hear everything.

title: My impreion of hotel Standart
text:
I with my friends visited Standart hotel after New Year. We were looking for a cozy place to stay in New York for a few days and found this hotel. The hotel is awesome. The rooms are bright, cozy and spacious. The rooms has huge windows which offers stunning view of New York City.
Have you ever seen night New York from the 17th floor? This is an exciting sight. A cozy yard, decorated with toys and lanterns, added a feeling of New Year's fairy tale and magic.
And, of course, the restaurant of this hotel will not leave you indifferent. Beautiful interior and friendly atmosphere, crispy croissants and fruits in the morning and delicious cocktails in the evenings. And after a small party with friends, you can come to your room, where you can relax and take bath in bathroom with stylish interior. And one more advantage: girls who like to do morning makeup? The hotel has large mirrors. I think that they are created for girls who love beauty and perfect make-up.

title: Séjour agréable
text:
Bel hotel, bien placé, chambres sympas. Salle de bain (douche) agréable.
Seul bémol : l'isolation phonique des portes qui fait que par moment on pense qu'il y a des visiteurs dans la chambre alors qu'ils sont dans le couloir ou dans la chambre a coté

title: Wonderful hospitality and lovely NYC room.
text: We stayed three nights on a business related trip.  We enjoyed a corner room, with a super comfortable bed, heated floors in the bathroom, great shower and wonderful views of the surrounding area. All of the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful.  We thought it was an excellent location and would definitely revisit.  Admittedly, we were a bit surprised at the price of a morning cup of coffee!!

title: Disaster Dinner - Don’t do the winter Yurts!
text:
The Standard praises itself for creating a winter atmosphere in the admittedly authentic yurts. To raise the bar, you agree to a minimum consumption and staying no longer than 2 hours.

After a pleasant experience a year ago, we invited a group of friends for Sunday Feast hoping for a nice evening which it was not as the Standard completely underperformed. Upon arrival, we put in a drink order which took no less than 15 mins. We subsequently wanted to order Mulled Wine which we were quickly informed they had run out of ( really, you have a limited menu with a theme and run out of a staple) as they had also run out of one of the 6 dishes on the menu. The meatballs which we wanted as starters came Luke warm concurrently with the Fondue which is rather sparsely proportioned; but then I suppose we should be happy that they had enough burners which they weren’t sure in the beginning.

The only reason I give them 2 instead of 1 star is that the staff was noticeably embarrassed (with the exception of one woman who when asked about an extra table made it quite clear that they were capacity) and tried to be friendly.

title: The SUB-STANDARD Hotel, you mean?
text:
Bad enough that our room has one single light, an one that shines upwards to2ard the ceiling, from its base on top of the armoire.  (There’s no bedside light, and the desk light is inoperable. )
Bad enough that the bathrobe waiting for us in our supposedly clean room was visibly filthy (see attached). 
Bad enough that there’s neither a coffee pot in the room, nor a coffee dispenser in the lobby.  ( But guests can pay $4 per cup for cold coffee in the lobby.)

At a daily rate of $400+, NONE of this is acceptable.

But when the housekeeper sorted through my bedside belongings and threw away my own super-soft earplugs and replaced them with the bits of black coal included in the meagre bathroom amenities (see attached), a true and hope nest review is warranted. 
I mean, when is it ever okay for a hotel housekeeper to throw away a guest’s belongings? 

We come to the East Village at least monthly to visit our kids, but we will never come here again.

title: Hotel w good location
text: Trendy hotel with nice view over the financial district in the room I stayed. The main purpose of my trip was work but I stayed for 2 weeks so managed to enjoy the surroundings as well. Nice restaurant with nice outside seating where you could order either good breakfast or dinner if you wanted something easy.

title: The Most Amazing Hotel in NYC
text: We have been to NYC repeatedly, year after year.  We have never stayed at the same hotel, ever.  This year, though, we found The Standard East Village.  It is now out home away from home and is the only place we stay...just about to make trip number five this year for a hen weekend bringing people from across Canada and the UK.  We LOVE it!!!  LOVE!!!!  And, thank you beyond thank you to Shanna Phillip for all you help and TLC.  You are beyond amazing and I hope head office reads this!!!!  Love from the gals in Toronto, Canada.

title: Super sympa !!
text: Tres chouette endroit. La vue est incroyable, nous avons fait un tres bon apéritif au champagne, puis nous avons diné. Mais pour avoir la table accrochez-vous !!! Il nous a fallu une sacres chance pour avoir une table face à la vue. Mais l'ambiance était bonne. La musique assez forte mais pas trop.

title: Plus jamais !
text: Séjour de trois nuits pour raisons professionnelles tout début novembre, we du marathon. Première heure dans ma chambre  : le sèche cheveux prend feu, brûle ma chemise et mon soutien-gorge. Je me plains, on m'envoie un nouveau sèche cheveux, mais surtout un molosse de la sécurité pour s'assurer que je ne mens pas, j'envoie des photos à la responsable de l'hôtel en demandant réparation… j'ai droit à un bouquet de fleurs à 20 h la veille de mon départ et m'assoie sur une tenue. J'ajoute à cela un service déplorable dans la partie petit-déjeuner, lent, compliqué. Idem dans les couloirs (plateaux de petit déj pas enlevés des couloirs l'après midi), bref, même si les chambres sont plus grandes et agréables que dans l'autre standard, je ne reviendrai pas vu le prix des chambres !

title: Excellent location and quality
text: The hotel was extremely comfortable and clean. Everything was at the expected quality for a good four star hotel. It is  well located within walking distance of many shops and locations. The breakfast was very good and reasonable priced.

title: Great corner room
text: We stayed in a very nice corner room. The view was amazing. It was quite roomy for a "boutique" hotel, especially the bathroom and closets. Bed linens are fantastic! Breakfast downstairs was also good. Front desk staff was helpful and efficient when I needed them.The drawback is that the gym is across the street, at the Crunch. It's a good gym but not part of the hotel.

title: Great location, no amenities.
text: I loved the lower east side location, its getting better and better in that area.  Lots of new hotels are opening in that area.  Service is just average and rooms are small.  Good restaurant and just ok bar.  No gym, no spa no rooftop.

title: A NYC favourite
text: I've stayed here several times, mostly for business and it has become favorite 'go to'.  The rooms are on the small side, but very well set up and most have great views.    The bar has a fun vibe and is an easy place to have dinner with a group, but it also works if you are traveling solo.    There is no gym in the hotel but they provide a pass to the Crunch Gym across the road.   The neighborhood is terrific.

title: Top Notch Customer Service
text: We were blown away by Paige Siegwardt and her team. It was our wedding night so we were hoping for a nice comfy room to close out such a beautiful day. Paige went above and beyond to help make our stay special. She met us a day earlier to steam my dress for the ceremony. When we checked in the next day she had upgraded up to one of their favorite rooms which had THE best view and included a bottle of bubbly for our special day. We can't say enough nice things about the level of customer service we received from all areas of this hotel. If you want a memorable stay on the Lower Eastside, then The Standard is it. Paige, thank you for helping to make this a weekend we will treasure forever.

title: Loved it! My kinda hotel....
text:
I really loved the Standard East Village. Quirky set of buildings muddled together with an iconic modern tower. 

Cute outdoor area beautifully decorated to match the season as well as an abundance of choice for food and drink. Definitely grab a last drink in the main bar. 

Rooms are awesome, beds super comfy and amazing bathrooms. Views are what you used to dream about before you ever went to New York. Showering as you look out over the East Village on to the financial district. 

Mini bar. More like mini shop, and actually fairly priced without feeling you’ve been ripped off. 

Staff on the front desk are really helpful and happy to offer assistance with any request. 

The East Village is my new hang out and so is this hotel. 

See you next time.

title: hotel moderne offrant une magnifique vue sur new york
text:
très bel hotel, très moderne avec un staff jeune et dynamique.
Nous avons pris une corner room offrant une magnifique vue sur la ville. 
la chambre n est pas tres grande (25m2) mais la litterie est de tres bonne qualité ainsi que l ensemble des materiaux (salle de bains notamment).
le meilleur hotel que j ai fait à new york

title: Very Noisy-couldn't sleep!
text:
My husband and I were staying over while we were visiting our son at NYU.  It was a little more than we wanted to spend but loved the location and at check in we were very pleased that they upgraded us to a king corner room.  We were looking forward to our stay.

We had a great day in NYC and returned to our room around 10:30 PM tired and ready for sleep.  First of all the room was very hot and we had to turn the thermostat way down to cool it off.  Then we couldn't get to sleep because of some VERY loud music.  We finally called the desk and they said there was a party in the penthouse and they would send someone up and it would be ending soon. Well it didn't stop until 2am.  To add insult to injury when we woke up early,  we went to look for a coffee maker and there wasn't one!  Every 4 star hotel I've stayed at has a coffee maker.  Then they charged us $10 for two cups of coffee! Unbelievable.  We complained at check out and they gave us $50 off the bill but didn't make up for my lack of sleep.  I would think twice about ever staying here again!

title: Subpar experience and unacceptable housekeeping mistakes
text:
We are currently staying at the standard east village and while the location is fantastic, I can't say the same regarding the rest of the hotel's offerings. 

The most egregious mistake that has sparked this review is that housekeeping FORGOT TO PLACE A FITTED SHEET on our bed! It is now 2am and I'm dead tired and just discovering now that the bed consists of 1. Comforter then 2. Flat sheet, then 3. The raw bed mattress!!!! Wtf!? I have stayed in hotels across the globe and of varying prices and have never experienced this.  It is irritating, unacceptable, and really frustrating to come home to this.  

Housekeeping also removed the robe from the room without replacing it, and did not put all the appropriate towels out for us (missing small hand towels and the floor towel). The shower leaks into the bathroom floor, so that floor towel is a necessity.

Beyond this, the room has a noticeable smell....like a musty smell of poor ventilation. We had friends stop by who also noticed the same. For the price of the room, I really, really expected that the room met minimum standards , which it did not.

title: Best Service
text: I actually didn't stay at the hotel, but in my experience talking to staff, they were all so professional, friendly and helpful. Paige Siegwardt went above & beyond to make the stay extra special for my boss. I can't wait to visit to have the same experience and tell everyone thank you in person! They are the best!

title: Great village location
text:
With a half dozen rooms per floor, this is a tall, thin building with great amenities. The linens and bedding are simply great. The floor to ceiling glass provides great views. (Of course, you are on view as well)  A couple of things I didn't like: no clocks and no ironing board. These are essentials for me. The lobby is tiny and can get a bit crazed. 

Very cool place but don't go if you are looking to chill. Definitely kinetic. Great rooms.

title: One Night Wonder
text:
The last night in New York and I thought, treat yourself. I had been recommended the Standard in the East Village by a friend for the amazing view and boy it did not disappoint. I arrived in a hurry. Luckily my friend had already checked in for us so the lobby staff were hasty in helping me with my bags and calling a lift up to my room. 

We had a room with a view of the financial district on the 15th floor. When we got back at night it was just spectacular. It was the 9/11 memorial so we got an incredible view of the lights. The bed was unbelievably comfy and very big. We slept like angels and woke up to the sweet view of downtown on a bright sunny day.

For two people the room was a little small when you have suitcases etc but I think the view outweighs the size. As I was only there for one night I have little to say about the service but a very comfortable stay and I would 1000% stay there again.

title: Great views .... great bar
text: Super cool spot to have a couple cocktails and watch the sun go down! Great views of the river and jersey shore... The smell of the pool drifting upwards adds a real summer feel even when it’s not v hot! Worth a visit

title: Best birthday ever!!
text: I recently celebrated my 60th birthday in NYC.  Without my knowledge, our daughter reached out to Paige at The Standard.   Paige became part of my birthday present as she made our stay the best experience I have ever had in NYC!  I was greeted with birthday wishes and hugs from the moment I checked in, to the bottle of champagne and hand written note on the afternoon of my actual birthday.  The room was beautiful....the staff was amazing.....and I can't wait to go back.

title: 50th Birthday Surprise
text: My boyfriend stumbled onto the Standard after meeting a friend for dinner one night, he loved the outside back garden and the food.  After dinner he went to the front desk to inquire about staying at the hotel, he met a woman (Shannon) at the front desk who gave him her card and said please contact me if you decide to stay here.   We booked a surprise for a friends 50th a week later.  The staff and Shannon could not have been more accommodating.
