They helped us sneak into her room so we could surprise our friend with wine and Happy Birthday message.  Shannon was able to upgrade her room to a studio which had an amazing view of the city.  Everyone was so nice and always had a smile, even the dinner out back was super delicious and the garden is as beautiful as he told me it was.   I would definitely return to this hotel...

title: Inoubliable expérience New Yorkaise
text: Nous avons passé quatre nuits au Standard East Village. Nous avons été upgradés dans une chambre king corner room du 17ème stage : la vue était à tomber, le lit ultra confortable, et toutes les petites attentions du personnel de l’hôtel à rendu notre séjour vraiment spécial. Le brunch du room service est très bien, le mini bar offre beaucoup d’options. L’atmosphère est détendue, tout en restant sophistiquée. Le quartier est vraiment très chouette. Je recommande à tous !

title: Fabulous stay with minor annoyances
text:
This is my 4th stay at a Standard hotel and whilst it wasn't my favourite it was still great. It's another very cool hotel. Rooms are really small but it's NYC, and showering while looking at the Chrysler building more than made up for it. Location is convenient to LES and everything it offers. 

Only cons are that the curtains are really awkward and don't allow you to block out the morning sun which made my first morning there after 26 hours of travel very rough. 
The service at the cafe is not great, I expected more given the fantastic service I have had at other Standard hotels.

title: The worst service I've ever experienced
text:
I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN. I am chocked by the service from the hotel staff. I was excited about finally staying at the standard and I liked my room when I checked in. However, my room had a door into my neighbours room with absolutely no sound proof. So when he came home drunk at 1 am in the morning and talked on the phone it was like he was in my room and I could hear the entire conversation. 

The first night I was so tired from travelling and I ended up going back to sleep. The second night I woke up again at the same time to the same guys conversation on the phone. After 15 min I decided to go down to reception. They told me I couldn't get another room and that they would send up security. I get back up to my room and he is still talking. The reception call ME and tells me the guard is on our floor but he can't hear anything. I couldn't believe it as it was SO loud outside my room and even worse inside the room. Reception ended up calling him. The guy lowered his voice but keep talking on the phone. The sound proof between the rooms are so bad that you can't event watch tv without hearing it. 

I got like 2 hours sleep that night because I was so upset and jetlagged. I go down to reception again and tell them if I can't get a new room I want to check out. So they tell me they can get me a new room and that they'll move my bags during the day. 

I get back at 7 pm and ask for my new room. The manger tells me THEY HAVEN'T CHANGED IT because they're at capacity and wonder who I spoke to. This is has been the worst stay ever and I am exhausted from not sleeping properly. I don't understand what I am paying for.

title: Nothing standard about the Standard
text: I had a superb stay at the Standard. I was on the 20th floor - exceptional views towards the East River and over LES. The staff were brilliant and attentive, the room well appointed and the bars and restaurants excellent, too. The brunch was good, the location is great and all round excellent stay.

title: Peace in the City
text:
Pros: 

It's naturally cool...not a bunch of idiots trying to be cool. There's a big difference, atmosphere so nice, inviting.

King Corner Suite is a very spacious, good room. So much light! I was on the 7th floor, and it was super quiet and away from the elevator.

Bed is on the soft side, which I like, but it's gonna bug you if you're a firm bed person.

The courtyard garden is a dream in the day. Get there in the fall when you can still sit outside.

Intelligentsia coffee available at place like two doors down, great convenience, best coffee.

Crunch Fitness is right across the street so you have no excuse.

Heated floors in the bathroom aaaaah heaven.

The staff at the front desk is out of this world friendly. Smiles, helpful, just the best ever.

The menu/staff at the streetfront lobby bar/restaurant are terrific. The omelet, the salad.

Cons:

You pay this much money, you need blackout curtains, not awkward curtains that don't open all the way without catching on the TV cords. This review would be five stars if there were blackout curtains.

The bath products weren't what I expected, but that's such a personal/scent issue. 

Some of the channels on the TV didn't work. That said, I didn't contact the management about it. I'm sure they would have fixed it because they fixed my water almost immediately after I arrived.

That lovely courtyard garden where I worked and relaxed in the day turns into an overpriced restaurant with terrible bland food and weak drinks. A violent departure from the service/food at the lobby place across the hall. Weird. 

My lip pillow was hipster cool...but it was also torn at the seams, just one of those things.

title: BEST HOTEL EVER!!
text: I stayed at the Standard East Village with my Mom who was visiting / celebrating her 60th birthday. I reached out to Paige (manager of guest experience) to see if there was anything she could help me with to make it a special experience. Paige went above and beyond in making it the best birthday ever. She emailed me back right away with all the information I needed and was so helpful in choosing a bottle of champagne to surprise the birthday girl with. She offered to hand write a note and look out for a complimentary upgrade which we got!!! She also set out complimentary snacks in our room & checked in with me throughout our stay to make sure everything was good. Paige is amazing & did everything in her power and more to make it a perfect experience!!! When my Mom arrived the bell boys and the front desk greeted her and wished her a happy birthday and were so welcoming. Every time we saw them they were so excited to see us - genuinely asked how we were and again wished my Mom happy birthday. It was truly one of the BEST staffs I have ever seen, I would 100% come back just for the hospitality.

title: Top Notch Experience - Perfection
text: There is nothing standard about "The Standard, East Village" - well, it seems the standard of excellence is what the name may imply.  What a wonderful 3 nights and 4 days I had in this hotel - from the moment I walked into the front doors and was greeted by an enthusiastic front desk team, to the time I left the entire hotel experience was wonderful.  I have to admit I may be a bit overwhelmed simply because the panoramic very from my suite on the 20th floor (room 2008) was breathtaking.  However, NYC has many hotels with "views", but what made this hotel wonderful is the substance behind the scenes and atmosphere.  The hotel is located in the "East Village" - a quirky, hip neighborhood that has transitioned over the years into a mixture of wonderful residential streets mixed in with all kinds of businesses and even some new corporate entities like IBM making a splash down the street with the new innovative marketing operations related to "Watson" - attracting an intelligence quotient supported by NYC that makes this neighborhood very special indeed.  Back to the hotel - the room (bed!) was extremely comfortable - and I will never take another shower again without feeling neglected - the bathroom floor is heated and the in-shower steam system makes the shower over the top - while any exhibitionist will be in heaven because the shower and bath itself is surrounded in glass - so you shower literally overlooking the city.  I was afraid to ask (and didn't) - and only assumed the windowed are tinted or positioned from the outside such that I was no "mooning" anyone during my stay!  LOL.  Seriously, the room is great, bed extremely comfortable and extremely quiet (someone told me the windows are sound proofed - not sure if that is accurate but it was an extremely quiet room).  I ordered room service and had breakfast/lunch in the restaurant, and the food is also delicious, along with excellent service.  So, stay here without hesitation.  Bear in mind this is not the Mandarin Oriental, Peninsula, or Four Seasons type luxury, but for those who want a more casual and trendy experience, combined with many of the nice aspects of 5-star properties, The Standard East Village is the perfect solution.  I can't wait to come back again.  Thanks to the staff and everyone for making my stay so special.

title: FANTASTIC NYC HOTEL
text: I love the Standard Hotels and in particular the East Village property on the Bowery in NYC, as the staff and management are extraordinary. My family recently stayed at the EV property and it was a five star experience for them due to the incredible team at this property. Thanks again for everything and always being just fabulous.

title: Great boutique hotel
text: Outstanding hotel. From welcoming guests at check-in to the rooms to the amenities. Everything is outstanding. Great little breakfast restaurant that is turned into a beautiful bar for the evenings. Great garden.

title: Great little hotel!
text: 10 days is usually a long time for me in a hotel; however, the staff, the location, the view from the 15th floor and the amenities made the time fly. Great little hotel just off Cooper Square. Highly recommended.

title: STILL GREAT!!!
text: Been going here for years and let me tell you the property does not miss anything!  From check in, room service, the bar and so on!  They do not miss a beat when it comes to your needs!  Definitely worth the stay!

title: The only place to stay in NYC!
text: I've been traveling to NYC a few times a year and this hotel out-delivered any other of my experiences. The rooms were spacious offering a king size bed, full amenities and a great view. The outdoor garden is perfect for relaxing and the food in any of their restaurants is outstanding. The staff is also very friendly and happy to help.

title: Terrific stay
text: The staff was great from check in to check out. The floor to ceiling windows made for some of the best views I've enjoyed at a hotel in NYC. If I'm in the area I will stay here going forward. Stayed in two different rooms and they are well laid out with surprising amount of room for the city. Great options surrounding the property too, restaurants, stores, etc.

title: Great memories
text:
Hotel molto cool nell'East Village che é un quartiere altrettanto cool a mio avviso.
Fuori dal casino ma vicinissimo a tutto, a piedi camminando si va dove si vuole da Little Italy-Chinatown-WTC oppure andando in su si va verso la Manhattan da vivere. Vicinissimo al Greenwich che vi offrirà la possibilità di ottimi aperitivi sui rooftop.
Camera dallo spazio ridotto ma ben pulita, cambio biancheria giornaliero, mini bar e cassaforte di buon livello.
Si sentono i vicini quando camminano nel corridoio.
Bar giù molto bello e trendy, prezzi elevati ma siamo a New York. Ci abbiamo passato una settimana e abbiamo pranzato solo due volte con le cameriere che non capivano l'ordine, un mezzo disastro anche nel conto ma tutto col sorriso.
Alla reception parlano solo inglese cosa che invece mi sarei aspettato molto diversa visto la città e la tipologia di hotel ma nessun problema per noi per fortuna.
Se siete come noi al 20esimo piano la vista é da paura!!! 🌆🏙

title: Cute concept, very poorly executed
text:
I was looking forward to my visit to the Standard, as I typically stay in a major brand hotel, and I was curious to see what kind of chic, urban experience the Standard could provide.   Overall, it was very disappointing.   I'll start with the positives first .. of which there were a few ...
* Location is great -- not many hotels service East Village, and the Standard is within walking distance of Astor Place, and only a 15 minute walk from Greenwich Village
* Front desk and housekeeping staff were very nice and friendly.
* The rooms do have floor-to-ceiling windows, which are pretty cool.  
Unfortunately, these good factors do not make up for ...
* The guest rooms have an overwhelming cheap deodorizer smell - by design!.  It smells like what they use in rental cars when trying to remove cigarette smoke odors.  When I mentioned it to the front desk at checkout, they told me that this "scent" is intentionally pumped into each room.  Unbelievable -- it really is an unpleasant smell.
* The smoking area is literally right outside the main front doors ... so it is impossible to enter the hotel without walking through a cloud of smoke.
* Despite the amazing floor-to-ceiling windows, the desk in my room was tucked in a small dark alcove next to the door -- virtually the only place in the room where it is impossible to see any windows!
* When I tried to call the front desk to ask about getting an iron/ironing board.  I couldn't find anything in the room which listed the front desk number.  There's literally no way to contact the front desk from your room.
* Restaurant is way over prices -- more than $20 for a continental breakfast.  Better to walk up the block to Ray's pizza for fresh NY bagels.
* The real kicker came when I saw my credit card bill.  After checkout, they charged me an extra $40.  When I called to inquire, I was referred to "accounting" where it literally took 6 calls to get someone on the line.  She told me that I was charged for a bottle of Smirnoff Vodka -- which was completely ridiculous.  When I told her that I didn't purchase any vodka, she was surprised and told me that she had to check with the front office and that I should call back in a few hours to see if they were willing to reverse the charges.  I asked her to call me instead, and of course, she never did.  
I can see from the reviews that some people love this place.  I won't be going back.

title: PERFECTO
text: situado en el NewYork que merecen los que aman esa ciudad...COMODISIMO...amplio ...limpio...con un servicio perfecto...restaurante divertido...terraza deliciosa...un digno STANDARD! en mi opinión mas cool que el HIGLINE...

title: Great New York stay
text:
Lovely hotel. Friendly staff. Convenient for soho and easy access to metro. Safe neighbourhood. 
I had fabulous views of 4th of July fireworks from my room. 
Cafe does a pretty good coffee and breakfast.

title: Nice stay
text: Thought I booked standard high line but it was east village. Turned out to be a great night. Rooms are small but definitely nice. Great service from staff as well. My only complaint is that the elevator in the hall every single time someone gets on or off it's thus LOUD beep. Very unnecessary and annoying in the middle of the night. I would go back but maybe ask for a room away from that.

title: Cool Hotel in a truly newyorker location
text:
The hood is so New York and near from everything you need. The ambience of Standard is so cool and the staff is very nice always trying to please you. 
The bed are extremely comfortable and  if you can stay at the high floors the view is amazing. The only thing I complain is the size of the wardrobe. It´s too small for more than one person an more than a couple of days. Just to clarify I´m a very organize person so when I stay at a hotel I like to organize my clothes and take out of my side my luggage.
But I recommend the Standard east Village

title: 'Wont you take me to, Funkytown'!
text:
The grinning pillow that greets you from the kingsize bed, with its Simon Cowell white teeth, is pretty much how we were left feeling after our stay here! Its just a fun place to be around. Our booking started with a phone call direct and I was greeted by Paige whom i had read from a review reply on here was a 'rockstar'. Well, i can confirm that this is the case as she didnt pull out a Fender and smash the solo from Lynyard Skinnards Freebird but my goodness did she go out of her way to make our stay there that little bit more special! We have little monsters..no not kids but Schnauzers and we looking for a pet friendly place to stay (not easy) and on hearing of our bearded friends Paige was as excited to meet them as we are being with them. This place likes dogs and ours were treated like VIPs.
They even had a welcome note for them in our room AND organic doggie treats! As they already have beards and now  are eating organic all they beed now are tattoos and they will be proper hipster dogs.
As our room wasnt quite ready on arrival, we sat and had juice in the tranquility of The Standards outside garden..this is so welcome from the craziness of NYC streets. A real hidden gem of a place. 
We requested a room with an East river view so, as an Englishman with an Amercan girlfriend, I could humbly watch your 4th July firework celebrations of no longer being part of our Empire. The view was stunning..just perfect. World Trade One was to our right which at night was something else. 
After beeing treated to quite a show of gunpowder we slept in the most comfortable bed EVER and in the morning had breakfast in the outside cafe. Breakfast was delicious..the chicken sausages were a  sausage sensation. 
Every member of staff we met were just gave the best genuinely nice service to us and always made the doggies feel very welcom. Special note to the guy who gave us a tour on arrival and very kindly allowed us to the 21st floor to see the views from the outside balcony and of course to Paige, whom from start to finish, made our stay fabulous. Somehow she knew of mine and my girlfriends shared love of Punk Rock music and included this in some reccomendations while we were in the East Village...this is beyond customer service and is deserving of special acknowledgement. Thank you.
This place rocks!

title: Gorgeous hotel that feels like home in the heart of Manhattan's East Village
text:
In a word, wow. When you arrive at a hotel and immediately think to yourself, "I want to live here," you know you've found something special. I recently stayed at The Standard, East Village for five days while throwing a fundraising event for It Gets Better Project in the property's stunning penthouse. First, a word about the penthouse - if you're ever in need of a unique and breathtaking space to throw an event, this is it. The views are astounding, the space is open and airy and you feel like you are literally floating above Manhattan. You'll capture incredible photos up here.

But back to the hotel... this is literally an escape from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan. The garden area to the back of the hotel offers games, coffee, greenery and a quiet getaway from the craziness of NYC. The cafe gives a bistro feel - the sort of place where you unwind with a cup of coffee, catch up on emails, catch up with friends and just unwind. Rooms are extremely well appointed with comfortable beds and showers that offer an incredible view of the city - something you won't realize you've wanted in a shower until you have it. The front desk and event staff make you feel instantly welcomed and are on hand to take care of your every need.

The Standard, East Village is one of the most beautiful hotels I've ever stayed in, and the care with which they handled our event was much-appreciated. They made us feel important and it was difficult to leave and get back to the real world. We highly recommend this property.

title: Great location, hip music and dark hallways are not enough..
text:
I stayed at this property several times over the years. My stay last week reminded me why I am always on the verge of leaving a review. My primary reason for staying at this hotel is the location, next to NYU. Other than that, I feel this i a weak proposition and value for the room price.
Sure the bell boys are nice and polite, the minimal lobby is bathed with coolness and hip music and the hallways are mirrored and dark. Once you are past this first impression, you get very little.
Upon checkin, the front desk was a zoo. Checking form has not been pre-printed, not has my wife been recognized for her many stays at the property. Naturally the room was tiny (706 - avoid), with very minimal amenities. Air conditioning was noisy and impossible to keep at a proper level. One light in the bathroom did not work. The sink had cigarette burn marks. There was no coffee machine in the room.
The hotel has three elevators, out of which one if for service. Regardless, the service people use all three, all the time. There was also maintenance been done and one was out of commission,  so it took us, after waiting in line, 31 minutes to get to our floor, mid day, mid week..
Bar is way expensive with weak food proposition. AVOID and walk out to the many options in the streets around.
In summary, if it was not for the location, I would have skipped this place altogether. Very pretentious and poor value.. Hopefully the other Standard is better..

title: Stylish Boutique Hotel in East Village
text: The word here is lively. Wow, the East Village is jumping and the bars and restaurants at the SEV are part of the scene. The rooms are smallish but cleverly designed. The view from the shower stall was a bonus. The safe in the room is large and works easily. The rooftop bar is closed except for private functions. Pity. Staff is sharp and efficient at front desk. Breakfast a bit chaotic for some reason. But that is a quibble. For the price it is hard to do better

title: THE MOST EPIC STAFF AND HOTEL EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD!
text: THE BEST SERVICE I HAVE EVER HAD AT A NYC HOTEL. I am a native New Yorker.My apartment in the Village had a massive fire this week  so I stayed here last night, 6/29. The staff was so kind and compassionate. Every staff member I encountered asked about  my situation and how they could help. From the Managing Director Renita, to Paige the Guest Experience Manager to Randolfo in their amazing restaurant Narcissa all made me feel so welcome during a very stressful time. THEY BOUGHT ME DINNER!!! EPIC HOTEL, FOOD, SERVICE and STAFF. STAY HERE.

title: Had an amazing stay
text:
Had a short, but wonderful stay at The Standard in East Village.
Staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful.  The room was lovely, and the hotel has a great bar and restaurant area to relax in.
Can't wait to go back sometime!

title: Cool
text: Enjoyed a short stay in this "cool" hotel and happy to recommend it to others. Very nice vibe. Rooms well styled and staff helpful & friendly. Bar was buzzing when we returned late at night - fun place.

title: Wonderful stay in an excellent property
text:
The location of the Standard could not be more convenient to getting almost anywhere as the two main subway lines are just a few minutes walk. The hotel is just the right mix of cozy and trendy with a great bistro that in the morning is perfect for a relaxed breakfast and then in the evening quite busy with music and a vibrant scene at the bar with a DJ.  The room I had facing Cooper's square was very comfortable and the bathroom enormous with shower and bathtub which was perfect after a long day walking around the city. 
I must say that I have been back to the Standard at least 4 times and will no longer try any other hotel in the city. Aside from the quality of the hotel,  I come back because of the people and service. I  love coming back and seeing familiar faces at the front desk welcoming me. Aidan and Will are delightful people. They are very helpful giving suggestions and always smiling, as is all the staff. It's definitely my home away from home in NYC.

title: Standard Low cost
text: Apesar de ser mais barato do que o Standard de High Line em nada perde em relação ao "irmão". Ficamos numa corner suite com cerca de 40m2 o que é gigante para os padroes de NY. Boa loalização em East Village! Casa de banho fantástica com uma vista fenomenal e para quem não tenha problemas com falta de privacidade. Ambos os restaurantes bastante simpáticos e com bom ambiente.

title: Another great Standard Hotel, the East Village at your feet.
text: Standard Hotels are hip, happening places.  This is the second one I've stayed in, the first one being in Los Angeles.  Close to the Bowery, it was centrally located in the East Village where restaurants overflow on weekends. It's perfect for people-watching.  We didn't even have to leave the hotel, the restaurant downstairs have attractive clientele.  The garden is a welcome respite in the urban jungle that is NYC. I like staying in different neighborhoods when visiting this city so it was a great location to explore this part of town.  Our room was clean and playful although the bathroom was designed a little wonky.  It got very wet when we took a shower, which was a couple of times a day when it's hot and muggy outside. This was minor.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The bed was super comfortable and sheets were high count, smooth and substantial to the touch. Thanks for the upgrade, I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great Hotel in posh East Village
text:
The Standard East Village is a great place to stay especially if you want to be in the exciting East Greenwich Village.  The staff was incredibly nice and helpful.  Especially Shannon (bar server) and Paige (manager).  Housekeeping was good.  Our room had great views and the AC worked well and the bedding was very good which are super important to us.  Best of all its very well priced.  At 5th St and 3rd Ave the location is central to Greenwich village as well as SoHo.  They even have bicycles you can borrow!
We will be back!

title: Great location!
text: Quick Overnight in East Village - limited hotel options for area and Standard had friendly staff, clean, although rates were high. Everything about the stay was easy, location, parking, amenities.  Would stay again.

title: Fabulous hotel!
text: This hotel is in a fabulous location (right across from the Village Voice). My room had a spa-like bathroom with great big white towels, city views, and friendly helpful staff. Three dining possibilities, and lots of restaurants nearby as well.

title: I love the Cafe for cocktails
text: This property is great! Thank you Shanna and Paige for going above and beyond. I also think the Cafe is on of my favorite bars in the city. There's a vibe that definitely makes you want to stay and have another drink. I think it's a great sport for people watching. The garden they have is also great for when the weather is nice. I will definitely return sometime this Summer.

title: The Standard
text: The issue I had with this hotel is the noise of the air conditioning which comes on intermittently through the night. Interferes with sleeping. Had corner king room. Staff pleasant, room small with little space for luggage. Stayed 7 nights. Cafe and garden good.

title: "Extremely helpful and kind staff!"
text: I was in NYC to move my two daughters back home after finishing the year at NYU.  From the check in with Colleen who greeted me with a huge smile and was so accommodating with every request, to the general manger Paige who checked on me and gave me complimentary admission to The New Museum and dining recommendations. All of the front end attendants were ready to help you with your bags or run something to your room but the absolute stand out employee was Aidan who I feel like I privately booked ahead to have him help me with moving the girls. He stored bags multiple times throughout the weekend, got me taxis, carried heavy items I couldn't have lifted and organized our pick up to the airport down to the timing and size of vehicle we would need for all of our luggage. I was somewhat dreading this weekend because of all the moving parts but the Standard East Village staff made it all run smoothly and I ended up having a really great weekend!

title: Pricy hotel sometimes good value per money depends on the amount of noise you are willing to experience
text:
Extremely designed hotel, the staff is friendly and the hotel is very nice located

some times nosiy parties goes on and the staff has no power or knoledge or will to do something about... . 

Location is good near to variety of dinning options, in one of the most trendy areas of the city.

title: Business Stay in East Village at a Fun Hotel
text: Great, very contemporary atmosphere in the East Village.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Excellent food, as well.  A comfortable hotel, with a vibe of energy and fun.  Reflects the neighborhood where it is located.  Hotel is a short walk to the subway for convenient access to quick transportation.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: I was in NYC for business and decided to stay here for 1 night. Love the vibe of the hotel. The area is great - I used to live in the East Village so I am very familiar with the area. The staff is friendly and warm and the restaurants were good too. Arrived on a Sunday and the restaurants were packed with cool, fashionable people - definitely my kind of crowd. I was on the 16th floor with the Empire State as my view which was pretty neat. Also, there were light snacks and full bar inside my room and the price was reasonable. Room was small but cozy - bed was great with high thread soft sheets and bathroom is nice. Will definitely come back!

title: Above and Beyond Customer Service in Fantastic Hotel
text: I stayed in this hotel for over 7 days, and had a fantastic experience! Paige from Guest Experience was so accommodating of my needs, and even had hot tea and snacks delivered to the room for my mom who had a cold. The front desk staff was always friendly and welcoming, and the folks manning the door were always conversational and happy to lend an umbrella or call a taxi for you. Aside from the people, the location is incredible, and was so close to hip restaurants and bars. The decor is modern and clean with great city views. Though the rooms are economical in space, you don't feel cramped up like you can feel in other NYC hotels. For business or for pleasure, I would highly recommend The Standard East Village!

title: Downtown Studio Room
text:
Stayed for 3 nights over Easter Weekend. 

Room: Downtown Studio (highest category of room type)

Important detail to note: While the description says "most" are on the high floors, there are two of these rooms on the 3rd/4th floor which provide zero view of a skyline. If I remember correctly, one of the front desk managers said there are a total of 5 downtown studios in this hotel. The other 3 are located on floors 19 and above.

Although we emailed a request for a high floor the morning of arrival (and notified them that we were checking in at 9pm), we were placed in room 408. Requested a high floor, again, and moved the second night of our stay. For the money you might pay for this category of room...i'd rethink the decision if you cannot be guaranteed a high floor. It made a HUGE difference. I was disappointed in check in, but they did take the opportunity to grant a request to a higher floor the next day. If you end up on the lower floor it is NOT worth the higher price. I'd consider a corner king as I believe there's a better chance you could get a higher floor, plus you'd pay a substantially lower price.

We ended up in room 1908 facing downtown and the west village. Beautiful views. Spacious room and nice set up. Complimentary wifi which worked well. Feather bed and comfortable sheets. Appreciated the full size bath gel/shampoo/conditioner combo as well as the heated bathroom floor.

Note: You must request an iron and ironing board as there was not one in the room.

Bar: After checking in, we had a few cocktails at the Cafe Standard next to the lobby. It was definitely busy and high energy. Had two appetizers and then called it a night. 

The Garden: Outdoor space on the side of the hotel that's simply beautiful in the Spring. Lots of flowers and decor made the space feel like it was not in the city. We enjoyed the spicy margaritas topped with red wine before going out to dinner one evening. Cocktails run: $14 ea

Gym: Daily passes are available at the front desk to access Crunch gym across the street. 

Location: Really enjoyed the location of the hotel. There's a CVS/Duane Reade a short 5 min walk from the hotel. Starbucks is 3 short blocks away, however, you MUST try the Coffee Project NY which is around the corner from the hotel.

Uber/Lyft from LaGuardia: As of April 4, 2017, if you need to catch an Uber from LaGuardia you must first ride the bus to a remote lot where the city has funneled all the Lyft/Uber cars to pick up guests. This temporary act was designed to decrease congestion at the airport. However, when heading back to LaGuardia for your departing flight, Uber/Lyft drivers can drop you off directly at the gate. Expect an additional 20-30 minutes on travel time.

Enjoy!

title: Great location hip hotel
text: Arrived early on a Friday and was happily surprised to get into my room. Polite, professional staff. Would be nice is a coffee machine in room or free coffee in lobby. Great bar scene and restaurant off lobby. Always enjoy my visit, East Village, little Italy, soho at your door Step.

title: Super cool, convenient, comfortable & beyond accommodating!
text: Perfect hotel for our overnight stay and campus tour of NYU! From the early 11am check-in (which is totally unheard of in NYC), to the gracious and inviting front desk staff, to IAN our superbly accommodating and very helpful bell cap; our stay was wonderful! Special thanks again to Ian for arranging our airport car service and taking great care of us and to Paige the guest manager who gave us some great inside info:) Much gratitude to both Ian and Paige and the entire staff at the Standard! We will be back!!

title: perfection
text:
From the moment we arrived at their curb; the people, the place, ........ Perfection. 
Fantastic staff, wonderful accommodations, and truly an exceptional part of the city. 
Thank you to all of those at the Standard who added to our enjoyable stay. 
I don't think it can be done any better!

title: My Favorite Hotel in NYC
text:
Hip, comfortable and fun! This is what I love about The Standard, East Village.
There is a small town friendliness, great bar, great food, superb customer service and the rooms are modern and views spectacular!

title: Not the cool funky hotel I remember
text:
We stayed here for two nights in March 2017. We had booked a corner King room via the travel agent in Sydney but on arrival they put us in a low room on the sixth floor 604 facing east which had an ordinary view back to the river. No, we couldn’t see the ACTUAL river. 

But it was better than staring onto a brick wall which is what they first put us into the last time we stayed here in 2012. Really!

After I complained, they moved us the next day to the 12th floor to Rm 1204. Same river aspect but it was better as we were higher up with more of a panorama. Still hardly a good start. 

The room was tiny taken up with the bed. Plus it had windows on two sides. At night one drew the sheer plus blackout curtain which ran on a track around the room to give you a blackout effect. 

There was the usual TV, safe in the wardrobe, mini-bar, desk with light (which I could never figure out where the switch was to turn this on), a stand for one suitcase, hooks to hang up your coats in winter. 

The bathroom was small but ok. It had weird thick silver curtains around the bath to prevent water splashing over the whole room during a shower. 

What really got us was the change to the exterior in the five years since we’d last stayed. In 2012, one entered the hotel underneath a long glass overhead entry roof and into a minimalist foyer with a reception desk. To one side, was a quiet refreshment room that opened onto a relaxing internal courtyard garden where one could eat breakfast in summer. 

All that is now gone. There is a restaurant Narcissa in its place and one enters the Standard from an old traditional door with metal panelling and stained-glass windows. Yes it’s comfy but totally unrelated to the sparse look on the outside and the minimalist rooms. Sigh. The Standard was a cool funky place to stay in the old days. Now it was the same as any other hotel in NY. Last time for me.

title: Expensive but good
text: I've been at this hotel a couple of times. the location is very nice, rooms are clean and the bed is awesome. Some rooms are very small. I think everything could be better according to the price. After staying there for more than three times in a year I asked for an early check in and they didn't aloud me and then for a late checkout on a Sunday and they charged me another daily rate.

title: Mixed Feelings about this Hotel
text:
My stay at this hotel was very good apart from some small issues.

Positives: the room I was given was large for New York. it had all I needed for my stay. The location of this place is close to all the places we tend to go hang out when in town. I would recommend this place to my friends and colleagues.

Negative: The room had a humidity issue. This was solved when the very friendly service person opened the top window to let out the moisture. I believe it was caused by the washroom. Once this was fixed, the stay was very pleasant.

My only concern was the first person i had at front desk was condescending and lied to my face about room availability when I asked for an upgrade. I find it disappointing to have to lie about availability when I'm clearly able to see space online or when i call reservations. Once caught in the lie, she was forced to honor the request. I do hope issues like this are resolved as everything else about the stay was great especially all the other staff I interacted with. 

my wife and i intend to stay here again in the summer if issues are rectified by then.

title: Excellente option, localisation parfaite
text: Hotel très bien situé pour rayonner dans le Village. La chambre au 20e est très silencieuse, litterie molle est confortable. L'hôtel met à disposition de bons vélos pour ballade à Brooklyn si le coeur vous en dit  (le pont Williamsburg est à 10 min). Le restaurant Narcissa est une bonne option pour le dîner, service très efficace et belle carte des vins, excessivement bruyant, mais bon c'est New York. Eviter le petit déjeuner de l'hôtel, pas très bon et temps d'attente très importants. Allez plutôt au Café Lafayette à deux blocks sur Lafayette St, viennoiserie incroyable et pan cakes à tomber par terre dans un magnifique cadre.

title: Stylish hotel with brilliant views in a lively part of NYC
text:
Our jaws dropped when we entered our room and saw the panoramic view of Midtown as well as the Hudson River.  This was by far the best part of the room and made our stay even more memorable.  The room itself (Queen room) was of a good size with many stylish touches and a very comfortable bed.  The location was also very good as it was within walking distance to many hip restaurants, shops and attractions and also a stone's throw away from 3 subway lines.  

Points for improvement would be (a) breakfast service at their restaurant could be improved - we had to wait almost half an hour for porridge/oatmeal and (b) we would have appreciated more info about hotel facilities upon check-in and in the room.

But overall, we had a fantastic time and we would consider staying here again.

title: Excellent!
text: We stayed on the 16th floor in a corner unit and the views were awesome. The room was very clean, the bed was super comfortable, the staff were so helpful and friendly, and the price was very reasonable. We valet parked our car because it was much easier than trying to find a garage somewhere. There are many restaurants and bars within a short walk. I will absolutely stay here again! Highly recommend.

title: Snowed in Stay
text:
Booked for Monday night to be close to work during the impending nor'easter and had a very pleasant stay. The best thing about the Standard was the staff; checked in by wonderfully efficient manager on duty. Had dinner at their restaurant (reviewed separately) and again, our server was very sweet and attentive - really charming. Ordered room service breakfast and the gentleman who delivered it was magnificent - steamed the milk for our coffee, brought up our drinks before our actual breakfast because he was afraid it was taking too long ( it wasn't), and then brought a second round of drinks with our food. The most gentle and caring man - he gets 6 stars! I did not catch his name, but he is tall with amazing dreadlocks and stunning leather jewelry. He not only deserves a promotion, but he should be training staff in superior customer service - seriously!

Here's what kept this from being a 5 star experience: no coffee or tea maker in the room, silver shower curtain a bit tacky but mostly just not functional, sheets were not tucked into the bed, and bed frame that caught my shins more than once.

The huge Windows and lovely soft but heavy curtains were great! Watched the sun set and the snow start to fall. The Standard is definitely funky, young, and eclectic- just the way I like it!

Just finesse those few things and you can call yourselves impeccable!

title: Todo bien
text: El hotel es perfecto para pasar unos días en una de las zonas más atractivas de NY. El bar de planta baja tiene una barra tremenda, un trago y a caminar. Las habitaciones altas no son enormes pero la vista compensa todo. El lobby es una película.

title: Hip hotel in NY
text: This was our first stay at any Standard. The staff was very nice, the hotel is very hip and trendy and has a cool cafe and a restaurant. If you are visiting for business or pleasure in this area its a nice place to stay.

title: Trendy but friendly, clean and a great location
text: I don't typically love trendy hotels, I prefer function or funky design features. This hotel certainly had some funky design features from big pink lip shaped pillows to a big red light for the room. (why???) Outside of the trendy design features, the hotel was still functional and comfortable. The staff was really friendly and i felt like they were available for anything i may need, but not in an overbearing way. The room was clean, quiet and the beds comfortable. The location was fantastic, i had never stayed int he east village before and i really enjoyed it. I will definitely be staying here again when in NYC and am looking forward to it.

title: Loved having drinks and snacks in a yurt in the winter garden.
text: The hotel was sophisticated but friendly.  It made me feel sophisticated and trendy while I stayed there!  The staff at the front desk was especially helpful, they were never to busy to address any questions I had.

title: Trendiest Hotel in Town
text: I've stayed at this property plenty of times but never got to experience it the way I did on my last trip. The room/view is always amazing depending on what category you pick and the staff is exceptional. From the wonderful front desk team (Michaela, Gio, Matt, Barrington, Jordan & Will) to the funky cafe servers (Shannon & Ashley) I truly enjoyed myself. What made this time more special was the Winter Garden. They have Yurts set up outside with fondue and hot alcoholic drinks that are done very well. It makes you feel like your in a whole nother place. I highly recommend anyone booking in the next few months to try out the Garden, it will definitely heighten your experience.

title: Rockstar Stay without the Rockstar Price
text:
I love trendy hotels. It's part of my "thing". So when I needed a quick stay in NYC, The Standard LES was suggested to me by a girlfriend who works at the DTLA location. I only stayed 1 night, but in that 1 night stay I was not only room upgraded by a very helpful front desk girl (Colleen, if I remember correctly), and received lightning fast room service by a bellhop named Aidan. Aidan even pointed out buildings' names from my breath taking view of the city so I could describe my room to my friends. 
I'd really like to point out that the friendly staff of The Standard LES never failed at any point of my stay to make me feel like family and part of the party; and the "1 night stand" app The Standard offers saved me a ton of money!! I didn't know it even existed until Paige, yet another helpful woman at The Standard, gave me the tip. I booked a room for the night all from my phone and ended up being upgraded mere moments after I checked in. 
Then there's the room. It had just snowed all night/day and so the view was flawless and shining like diamonds! As Aidan pointed out to me, I had almost every iconic building/bridge right in front of me. Spacious seating area with giant windows and completely functional windows and central air. I'm huge on spacious bathrooms as well and when I saw the bathroom I was just floored!! Again, giant windows and a large spa-like bathtub and shower with designer soaps. Also, the bed-- designed by the devil himself so you never want to leave the room ever again-- the softest most luxurious bed on the planet!!  You could order some wine and food service and camp out in there all night if you wanted to! (guess what I did). 
Speaking of food service, I ordered the "Andy Warhol" which is a deliciously grilled cheddar cheese with a side of tomato soup that is still making me drool. The dining space is constantly bumping with either a DJ or just once again  with very friendly bar tending staff like Julia(?) and the new bar manager whose name escapes me but he was there also just chatting and being very attentive. 
I sincerely hope to stay again soon for a longer amount of time in the future.

title: Fabulous and friendly
text: I have now stayed at this Standard half a dozen times, as I'm in NYC often on business.  The hotel is has a stunning decor, the staff is highly trained and incredibly warm and accommodating.  Every room I've had as been gorgeous, immaculately clean, super comfy bed, gorgeous views.  The location is really convenient and close to other amenities.  I will be a frequent guest!

title: Fantastic decor
text: I loved this hotel. The design was amazing and my room, even if quite small was super comfy. You can see into the shower from the bed, to me that felt erotic. The breakfast was pricy but amazing, I never needed lunch after that.

title: Chiq NY style
text: Nice hotel, a room with a fantastic view over New York skyline. Very good restaurant and bar, service minded and nice staff always with a smile and helping hand. Gorges breakfast mejey for a power start in the morning!

title: Very Trendy with Awesome Views
text: We found this Hotel through Hotel Tonight app. We wound up in a $400 room for $175 and was very pleased. Room was a bit small but that is common in NYC. Tried to get into the Boom Boom Room upstairs but without being on a list, they wouldn't even consider it :( Other than that, great location, great views, decent price thanks to our app and the service was good.

title: Very cool spot in a cool area with amazing views
text:
So first off, make sure you tell your Uber driver to take you to the Standard in East Village. As there is another Standard Hotel in the meat packing district. Secondly, ask for a room as high as possible. I believe anything above the 9th floor will be a sweet view, unobstructed by other nearby buildings. I looked over at my fiance and said, hey look there is the One World Trade Center looking right at us. Pretty incredible. 

The good
As I said before, the baller views
Clean, Modern rooms designed with modern sensibilites.
Very comfortable bed and cool lighting options in the rooms
attentitve staff
cool restaurants in the hotel. High quality
Busy but not crazy part of Manhattan, safe, young and hip scene

The bad
the rooms are kind of small. The bed being so huge does not allow for a lot of room to move around
My major issue with this hotel is the noise. Now, not all rooms are designed this way, but the guy nextdoor to us was so bloody loud, going on until well after 4 AM and I could hear..every..single..word...At one point, this guy said "You know, I think I need to express myself more" That was it. I had to call the front desk. I did and they were very attentive, offered me another room. I declined as it was 4 in the morning but a phone call next door did the trick.

Overall, a very good experience. Will be back and reccomend to others.

title: Room with a view, best-in-class personnel
text:
We stayed 2 nights in the hotel : the view from our 19th floor room (full of light with a beautiful view) was definitely worth it. 

Hotel personnel was very kind and professional. 

Perfect location next to Astor Place

title: Vilken utsikt!!
text:
Trevligt hotel beläget på Cooper Square i New York.  Den lite ruffiga receptionen och foajén som möter dig när du anländer försvinner snabbt tack vare ett trevligt välkomnande av personalen och mycket bra service.

Jag hade turen att få rum 1 på översta våningen. Rummet var förvisso inte särskilt stort men var rent, fräscht, hade en mycket skön säng och framför allt en fantastisk utsikt över Manhattans skyline. Extra plus är att du har utsikten från såväl sovrummet som från badrummet.

Provade även restaurangen på hotellet både för middag och frukost. Även här var servicen, på amerikansk maner, mycket bra! Maten var god men med tanke på Dollarns värde så blev det kanske inte helt prisvärt, en omelett för 200 sek är kanske lite häftigt!

title: Don't miss the Winter Garden
text: We had a great experience at the Standard from the moment we walked in the door. Our room was upgraded to a corner king room at no additional charge. We had a beautiful view of the city from two walls of windows. I requested a hypoallergenic room. They provided hypoallergenic pillows and duvet immediately upon check in. The Winter Garden is wonderful. We sat in one of the yurts and sipped on delicious specialty drinks. Check out was a breeze. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Well done
text: Just arrived for a three day business trip and The Standard has already exceeded expectations. Room is well done, location is prime, and the staff (especially Barrington) are very accommodating. Looking forward to peeping the winter garden!

title: Very Pleasant Stay
text:
We spent 7 night at the Standard East Village on our most recent trip to New York.  We wanted to stay further away from Midtown and decided to stay here after reading several positive reviews. We were really impressed! Our room was small but it offered a great view of the city from the floor to ceiling glass. We had the morning sun in our room so it felt good waking up every morning.  All staffs were helpful and attentive.
The café in the lobby was perfect for breakfast and drinks in the evening.
We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family!

title: An authentic, charming place in the East Village
text: The Standard is beautifully situated for a stay in Manhattan, with subway service close by and the pleasures of Washington Square Park and Tompkins Square Park just a few blocks away through lovely little streets full of splendid little restaurants and shops.  There is a much more diverse, artsy and happening feeling here than in the stuffy upper east and west sides, and the Standard fits perfectly.  Staff are young, energetic, friendly and charming, while the interior spaces are often visually striking and compelling, if a little dark and hall-of-mirrors claustrophobic on the main floor.  We had a corner room with gorgeous views that was clean, comfortable and just a little funky. Next time we're in NCY for a show or to visit the museums, we'll go back to the East Village and to The Standard.

title: The Standard, East Village
text:
This hotel deserves more than five stars. All the staff are kind friendly knowledgeable smart and funny. The rooms are stunning with amazing views. I was there in August 2016 and I'm going back October 2017. I just booked my room. So excited! Thank you Will Jordan Shanna Paige and everyone else at The Standard.
Rebecca Loudon

title: A nice hip hotel
text: We spent 4 nights at the Standard East Village - a well situated hotel in the East Village.  The room was clean and we had a great view over the city from the floor to ceiling glass.  The decor is stark and it is not conducive to any in-room work (desk is VERY small).  The small bar/cafe in the lobby was good for a quick breakfast and for picking up a espresso drink to go in the morning.

title: Great Hotel; Excellent service
text:
I visited just before Christmas and was there for a couple of weeks.  The size of the room was tiny but traveling alone this was easy to copy with.  I also had a corner room will full window wrap around that made it less claustrophobic than it should have been with a view of Brooklyn Bridge, Chrysler and Empire State.  Funky decor and incredibly comfortable king sized bed. 

I especially liked that after Day 1, i was greeted regularly by name from the staff in front and porters.   I like this detail as it feels like I'm home, when I'm not.

Downsides - mini bar and room service were excruciatingly expensive with a $7 delivery fee on top of gratuity.  My corn chips and guac ended up costing $22 USD.   The food in the bar area (not Narcissa - i did not eat there) was terrible and overpriced as well.  I do not recommend the root vegetable soup - and it shouldn't be on the menu tbh.

Overall - their Winter Garden was fab, service was ace and comfortability of the room was more than adequate.  I would stay again.

title: An excellent stay in a well-located hotel
text: We visited The Standard during a city stop-off on a Christmas time visit to the state of New York. The room was comfortable, and the bar downstairs was super-cute. The hotel is on the pricey side, with some costs feeling slightly uncalled for (a $8 charge for any room service seems a little steep to run a plate of fries up the elevator...) however I can't say anything against the wonderful staff that are employed here. They were all kind, courteous and attentive. A special shout-out to Will on the front desk who was excellent for tips of where to eat/visit in the local area and generally made sure we had everything we needed to enjoy our stay.

title: Great staff, good buzz but small room!
text: Overall this hotel met our needs. The location was good, staff were friendly and helpful particularly at reception. Bar was always busy with a young crowd. Good buzz and atmosphere. However the rooms( at least ours) was pretty small and not inexpensive. Generally we would gave expected a bigger room in an American hotel. Food in the hotel was of a reasonable quality but choice was limited. Best to eat out.

title: Ok, but not worth the price
text: I'm not sure I get what all the hype is about. This hotel is ok, but definitely not worth the extremely high price. My room was so tiny I could barely walk around the bed, and the closet was so small there wasn't room for shelves. I will admit the bed was very comfortable but I doubt that (plus the great location) can justify the $400+ per night they charge.

title: Lost its buzz, service & standard
text:
Two years ago this place was fun. Great atmosphere in the bar, friendly service and a great experience. 

This trip was completely opposite. The Corner King suggests a more comfortable space but its design is cramped & lacking. Two suitcases for travelling means there's almost no space, even before shopping. The alcove desk is impractical and only served as a space for bags with a half sized wardrobe to hang only a few items. 

The bathroom was really poor. Metallic shower curtains hiding the tiles that needed to be re-grouted & bleached clean was shocking. Poor ventilation showed, with many areas covered in black mould which was pretty awful. Under the shower/bath there were some missing grout and more evidence of discolouration. 

Building management need a far better level of service attention than housekeeping. The room 1902 should be shut & renovated. After two requests to upgrade a trio of sullen front of house staff first declined saying 'no'. It was only after emailing the office that I got a message from Bryan Devlin saying they could move me to room 308 at a $100 a night increased levy. The room was better & bigger, only to find the under floor heating in the bathroom was off which meant a night of freezing temperatures if you wanted to use it. The service team the next day said there's a fault and spent some time fixing it up. 

Maybe my expectations are too high having stayed in some impressive hotels, EV Standard was extremely unimpressive. 

Each room should be checked appropriately for customer stays, a better process to identify maintenance needs, checking bathroom products are actually full & full record of room renovation history. No follow-up from the Director suggests arrogance & a lack of authenticity to customer service. 

The cafe/bar was another odd experience, empty except for a few tables. I'm sure there's a scaled back team but I felt higher levels of service should be expected at The Standard. 

It was an awkward/ horrible hotel experience & the only person who saved the day was Michaela who was exceptionally helpful. Had she not been there on day three I would have checked out. 

My advice would be check the room before  you sign-in & have a backup. When I think of other better hotels in NYC like Wythe & Nomad, I'd struggle ever to go back to Standard EV.

title: No complaints
text:
We only stayed one night which was a 1am check in. Staff were super accomodating to our needs. Room service  menu a hit for a pair of very weary and hungry travellers.  

The room was very well kept. Clean and tidy. The bathroom was very good, decent shower head and bath. Bed was really  comfortable and really good plush pillows.

Staff at checkout time were very efficient and friendly.

Would stay again.

title: Great, comfortable stay; excellent customer service and food
text: I was in town to have ankle surgery and went straight from the hospital to the Standard.  The hospitality blew me away.  Paige at the front desk made sure I was comfortable, asked if I needed ice and inquired how I was doing the next day.  The room was cozy, clean and the perfect place to recuperate.  The food was great--nutritious, delicious and comforting. Every hotel staff member I met was courteous, helpful and friendly.  I would stay here again and again. I hope to have a cocktail in one of the heated Yurts in the Winter Garden courtyard next time--so cool.

title: Great spot, great staff
text: Recent trip evealed a staff that says YES and nothing etetr when tarveling, nice views, accomdating breakfast even after menu changed. Good drinks and nice bar staff. Rooms are clean and mini bar is very well stocked.

title: Nice but not exciting
text:
Stayed here for a few nights as a solo traveler, the room is tiny although I took the corner one, very nice design and high end bed and amenities , nice trendy bar and cafe downstairs but this location is not here or there and the stuff not so helpful in getting you around to nice places or creating a welcome feeling, prefer to go a few blocks down to Sixty hotel better location and friendlier stuff.
They could easily make this place amazing and connect you with the standard meatpacking by shuttle or have a spa or social room with special tips that the standard is famous for.

title: Great staff, comfortable rooms, good food
text: Really like thos place as they accomodate. Food is good, place is clean, stylish  and comfortable and has a great vibe. Good location near all the new restaurants. Fun bar scene. late xheckout if yoi need and reasonabkly priced rooms for NYC.

title: Relentlessly trendy and cute but a good value
text:
From the silly in house publications to the grotesque pillow with lips and the red lighting at the bed, this place really lays it on. But most of the staff comes at you happy and positive, the pricing seemed a good value, the breakfast cafe not too overpriced with good food. Our room, 1810, had nice views and was quiet enough. The bar is a hopping party scene on weekends. About 70% European guests.
We liked it better than the nearby Hyatt Union Square, a little less $ at about the same level of quality. Location is good if a bit  seedy in spots. If you can afford it the restaurant Cacio E Vino Italian place at 80 2nd ave, a block away, has a great menu. Don't miss the Ring Pasta if you go there.

title: STANDARD FOR GOOD SERVICE
text: We stayed here recently to attend a function for my grandson.we normally stay elsewhere, because this place an the Bowery down the road have gotten out of our normal price range. Well that part hasn't changed, but I have to stay the pleasant attitude of the staff made a big difference in our opinion of the place. From check in staff, to bellmen, to waiters and waitresses, they all had a great attitude and represented their hotel well. Probably not a regular spot for us, due to the price range, but would stay there again.

title: Ruined my Perception of the Standard Brand
text:
One of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in NYC (although I only stay at nice 4* ones).

The service is unprofessional. It's almost like a bunch of inexperienced college kids who are concerned with themselves more than guests ran the hotel. When I drove up to the hotel there was nobody to offer a valet parking (keep in mind this is Manhattan so you cannot just leave the car and walk into the reception). 

The 5th floor Corner King room had terrible view of a part of the roof that belongs to the hotel with trash and tools on top of it - I know this is NYC but at least they could keep it nice and clean. 

Our room never got cleaned on Saturday. I called the reception and asked for it in the afternoon and when we came back around 8pm it never got cleaned. When I later spoke to the cleaning staff they said that nobody ever told them to clean the room. Clearly no communication between staff. 

Finally, I left my electric toothbrush in the bathroom. I contacted the hotel next day to see if they found it. It took couple phonecalls and several emails to get the answer (although each time I was assured that I will get an answer right away). Of course the toothbrush was not found (here's a novel idea "Lost & Found"). Do not stay at this hotel. 

Go to Standard in Meatpacking which is very decent or choose from multiple other decent hotels at this price point.

Nice things: comfortable beds and some of the staff was nice but that is to be expected at this price point.

title: Amazing hospitality, convenient location, and nice rooms with a view
text:
I stayed at The Standard, East Village for one night for my 21st birthday so I could go out downtown and enjoy the night with friends. When we got there, my girlfriend told the front desk staff in conversation that it was my 21st birthday. On top of enthusiastically wishing me a happy birthday and making sure we were all set, the staff brought up a nice bottle of champagne, water, and treats, and a birthday note.

As a first time guest at the hotel, I was very impressed at their service and just as impressed with the quality of the rooms. Though the size of the room was on the smaller side, everything was very clean and organized and the view of the city was fantastic. I was looking for a hotel that would be nice but also affordable, and this really hit the jackpot.

title: Excellent hotel in convenient location
text:
Had a great two-night stay at The Standard, East Village. The room was spacious by New York standards, but more importantly it was clean, modern, and comfortable. Possibly the first time I've slept well in a New York hotel. Staff were helpful and friendly, and the valet service was excellent. The bar downstairs serves up some great cocktails.

The Standard, East Village is a great starting point for visiting lower Manhattan: Greenwich Village, Union Square, Chinatown, Little Italy, Nolita, Tribeca, and much more.

title: Quirky in new york
text:
I stayed at the standard east village for a few days (business trip). 

From the outset the staff were very friendly/helpful and go the extra mile to make your stay that bit more special. 

Rooms are a good size given the central location and provide some great views over the city. They feature some quirky decorations (those 💋 pillows!).

The bar was very lively at night and overall the place has a great vibe which gets very energetic once the evening sets in. 

Breakfast was extremely good, lots of options/great value (a La carte) and what's really cool is that there's a semi-outdoor area (with heaters for winter). 

Special mention has to go to the restaurant Narcissa. I ended up going on my own one night (staff were very accommodating/good company) and was able to sit up at the kitchen bar. Food was fantastic, really wholesome options, great flavours and original combinations. If you're staying at the standard make sure you visit Narcissa!

The stay made my business trip memorable and I certainly would recommend the standard for holiday/weekend visits too.

title: Great Location for a Very Nice Hotel
text:
This was the first time we stayed at The Standard East Village hotel. The awning was the only hint that we were in fact at our destination, but that was a clue as to how the hotel operates. A very subtle exterior, a very nice interior to the lobby. Immediately, the staff were helpful and friendly as we entered; we felt we made the right choice in staying here.

The room's first impression was very modern decor with detail on how the room was to be used. The room was roughly divided 60/40 bedroom/bathroom, which really was about right considering how much time you actually spend in the room.

But the shower- fully glass enclosed, with a steam function to soothe while you shower. Awesome!

We were there for three nights and found the room to be very clean each time we came back to the room. What a great feeling after a long day out.

title: Great location with hip bar with a few minuses
text:
We stayed 3 nights at the Standard. What I liked:

The hotel staff is very nice and friendly.  The hotel room itself is small as expected for a NYC hotel.   The bathroom and bed were very functional and comfortable.   The Standard Cafe (bar / restaurant) inside the hotel is very happening on a Saturday night and great for people watching.   The location was very good - just a short walk to several subway stations.  You are also very close to the NYU campus.

Here are a few areas of improvements:

1) Sound insulation between adjoining rooms.  We were in a room with adjoining feature and you can hear everything next door as if you were in the room with the other guests.    I also found the mini bar refrigerator kind of loud at times - probably doesn't help the room is small.

2)  room service time expectation.  We ordered room service the morning of our departure and was told it would take 25 to 30 minutes.  However it took 50 minutes instead.  This is usually not a huge problem except that we were on a tight schedule with a flight to catch.  I would prefer if the room service just tell us it would take 50 minutes so we can decide if we have time to wait for it.

title: the hotel continue to take me money ....
text:
I'm still waiting for a reply from my emails. after a 2 days stay, i paid around 1000$ for 2 nights but after my trips they still continues to take me money from my bank account without any explanation ! I sent many mails but no success. The  accounting department doesn't want to reply me. I didn't use the mini bar or other service in the hotel but they took me money twice !

I do not recommend this hotel because they don't have any customer service.

title: Best Downtown Style & Experience!
text:
Good vibes, positive energy and hospitality with style! Perfect for work and play. Fun downtown NYC neighborhood.

Super warm and friendly welcoming upon arrival a few weeks ago. Throughout my stay the front desk and crew were super awesome whether I was in the lobby, bumping into staff in the elevator, or in need of a taxi. My room was the perfect haven and I loved the attention to detail throughout the hotel.  

I also stayed at the High Line for one night which had spectacular views and a much appreciated gym at the top but I have to say the crew at the EV location was very personal and took especially great care of me. Looking forward to staying there again this week!

title: Perfect mini-vacation
text: We were able to take advantage of a flash sale to book a corner king room for a Friday night.  We were greeted by Akilah at the front desk.  In addition to handling the check in she provided us with a list of things to do in the neighborhood.  When we were ready to go to our room she didn't just point us to the elevator, she walked us to the elevator.  Our room on the 4th floor was wonderful.  The bed was amazing; it was like sleeping on a cloud.  The bathroom was gorgeous.  I'd love to see it in my house.  Every staff member we encountered could not have been nicer.  Attentive housekeeping staff, great bartenders in the Cafe & Narcissa.  Wonderful brunch at Narcissa.  Loved the duck hash!!  The hotel is on the heart of a bustling neighborhood.  There are interesting shops and foods & beverages to suit every taste.  We live a 90 minute drive outside of the city.  Typically, we take the train in for an activity & return home the same night.  Our stay at the Standard was treat we gave to ourselves.  We enjoyed it so much we plan to treat ourselves again.  Thank you to everyone.

title: excellent guest relations
text:
We always come back to the Standard East Village when in NYC.
The outstanding Staff like Paige and Michaela, stand ready to quickly to accommodate any concerns. The location,window views and smart room design are exceptional.

title: Highly recommend this fabulous venue!
text:
Every detail of The Standard, East Village is nicely presented.  From the luxurious bedding to spacious bathroom, we enjoyed the modern design. The views are splendid and the location provides easy access to subway, NYU and Soho neighborhoods. 
The staff were friendly and accommodated my late arrival and special requests.  The cafe served delicious coffee and a nice breakfast menu. I would absolutely stay there again on my next trip to NYC!

title: Great stay at a vibrant East Village hotel with great access to NYU, SoHo and transit
text: Excellent accommodations from the room to the food & drink, with a very friendly staff willing to take on any requests.  We had a king bed, with modern furnishings, sporting a great view west of NYU/SoHo and north towards the Empire State Building.  Bathroom was was spacious with a large walk in shower.

title: when price (and location) are the luxuries
text:
Great location in the East Village, but small room smelling of bleach, no reading lights at the beds, dated carpets, dirty window. Very noisy room - loud AC and loud neighbroing room doors.
Large functional bathroom. 
Minimalism for 5 star prices

title: Stylish, modern and clean with small rooms.
text:
The hotel feels really vibrant with lots happening and is a hangout place for trendy 20-somethings who flock here in the evenings for drinks and socialising.  The room that we had was small, very small in fact. However, it had absolutely everything we needed with a well thought out floor plan.  The shower was excellent and the room (and shower room) gave us a breath-taking view of NYC. Really stunning.  We were on floor 20 I believe, so it was a real treat to see the city for the first time from a stunning view.  

The bed was reasonably comfortable, the TV and sound system was useful and worked without any issues.  There was a safe and mini bar and the room was immaculately clean.  We also attended a gig in the penthouse which was sadly the closest I will get to staying in the penthouse! A truly amazing 360 degree view from the wrap-around balcony that I'll never forget!

We did eat in the restaurant, although just snacks as they had limited (but tasty) vegan options that were at the top end of expensive.  

I'd recommend this hotel for a city break and for exploring the fantastic East Village in NY.

title: It's ok, but needs improvement
text:
I've stayed in this hotel for around two months in total over the past year and a half (3 stays) for work and I'm not really sure how I feel about it. I return to it due to it's excellent location, but the rooms are quite hit and miss. 

Sometimes you are in a room with so little room to walk around the bed you end up hitting your legs or falling over things. The other issue I have is that they seem to rent out the penthouse on a regular basis as a music venue, so there is often super loud music in your room for nights on end, as well as lots of people using the lifts to get to the penthouse, so you are forever waiting in a queue to take the lifts to get to your room.

Some of the staff are very friendly, but everyone seems to be quite young and they seem more interested in chatting to their colleagues than helping guests. 

That said, the rooms are always clean, and the location is great. Don't have breakfast in their overpriced cafe - there are so many amazing places to eat nearby.

title: Party night
text: It's built in convenient area , a lot of train options or easy way take a cab. Staff is so courteous n professional.We had party on 21 floor and when i got off from the elevator just few steps away ,the City view was so beautiful n especially in the night.if you plan to arrange a cocktail party you should book this place . Could be little heavy on your pocket but you will love this place......cheers 🍻

title: This might be ok, depending on the room you end up in
text:
People tend to rave about the views they had when they stayed in this place. We might have been unlucky. We stayed in a 4th floor room at the back of the building, had a tiny window, a dark room and no view. I would not return to this hotel. It's a party place at night time (we had party folks hitching a lift up with us, who were clearly not hotel guests and who were on the look-out for a, well, stairwell). Because they have various food venues, they made sure not to have a coffee maker in the room (who are you kidding!), so I had to trek down in the morning to purchase the wake-up coffee. Ridiculous.  They had, of course, space for a minibar, so this hotel is good at upselling stuff, not so good at providing basic amenities that one would expect given the room rate. You won't be surprised to learn that there's no gym or pool as that would not increase profits. The room was small (I ran a few times into the wall mounted TV, because it was so close to the bed), but functional. The bathroom was immaculate, had a great shower and made up for some of the mentioned shortcomings. I did like the bistro downstairs, pleasant atmosphere, waitering staff were a bit slow, but super friendly, as was everyone else.

WiFi was thankfully included in the roomrate, but it was unreliable. My phone showed that I was always connected to their server, but more often than not, I still did not have a functioning internet connection. Eventually I gave up and switched back to roaming and voila, things worked a treat.  

I guess if you decide to stay here, aim for higher floors at the front of the hotel, not its back. The place is pretty new at the time of writing, so everything is up to scratch w/ re to quality of bedding, cleanliness, bathroom amenities.

title: Super Hotel
text:
C est un super Hotel, avec une vue époustouflante . Le service est top. Et que dire du brunch juste une tuerie. J y suis allé avec mon épouse on a adoré le personnel été au petit soin L ambiance été chaleureuse. À faire et à refaire . 
Très bon rapport qualité prix .

title: Standard Grill Restaurant E.V
text:
Bruch at the East village of Standard Hotel.
Great Bloody Mary"s (spicy horse radish ) and Bellini to start the day. Fritata's with bacon, French toast, burgers or dauck hash top with a friend egg are the usual orders.
Too cold to sit out as they did not open the street garden which was so nice in the summertime. Indoor are just split into two different bars and located separately.Attentive service. best to rsvp cos we waited half hour with walk in for six.

title: Excellent hotel, very well located
text: Super nice, friendly and trendy hotel in the East Village, NY. The room are excellent and the view is fantastic (was on the 9th floor). Friendly and helpful staff. In room dining is good. Easy access to all transportation. Must see!

title: Great stay!
text: We are repeat visitors and this latest stay was even better than the others. What a wonderful and happening hotel perfectly situated in the city. I inadvertently left a very important item in the room after check out. Calvin of guest services was just awesome and interrupted what he was doing to go into the room and retrieve the item and arranged its return.

title: Great stay with our 16 month old!
text: We stayed at the Standard this past weekend with our 16 month old daughter and some other family members. The customer service was amazing (we ended up being extremely high maintenance guests). Starting with my multiple phone calls in advance of our stay to work out if the room we had booked was large enough to fit a crib, eventually upgrading to a larger room and then requesting that another family member's room be directly next door so that our baby monitor would work for the babysitter. We arrived before check in on Friday and Shanna helped us to get into our room ASAP as our daughter needed to nap. Our daughter promptly threw up in the freshly cleaned room. I called the front desk, and they had housekeeping up to clean the room within minutes. The next morning, I asked to have our room made up sooner than later as we were out early and would need to come back for a midday nap. Bryan called one of the maids to come in early and had our room done before we even finished breakfast.  We lost at least 5 keys and Paige remade keys for us multiple times. On Saturday evening we left for dinner and realized we had forgotten to leave a key to our room with the babysitter, who was in the room next door with the baby monitor. I called the front desk to explain the situation, and they brought up a key to her within minutes. Everyone at the front desk and the bellmen were completely enchanted with our daughter and bent over backwards to help us; it was completely unexpected and so appreciated. The rooms are definitely small (as to be expected in NYC), however we will absolutely be staying at the Standard the next time we're in town, as the customer service can't be beat.

title: Absolutely AMAZING
text:
This is a beautiful hotel. The room was immaculate and incredibly comfortable. Beautiful down pillows and comforter. and absolutely spotless. Every member of the staff was polite, smiling and helpful. Paige, who greeted us when we came in, was delightful. She was cute, charming, polite, helpful and was SO excited when we asked her to assist with Broadway tickets. She came through spectacularly. She and Michaela made a terrific front desk team! 
One year ago I had to cancel a trip to NYC due to unexpected health issues. At that time the staff was so understanding and kind, I vowed to stay there on the next trip. I did stay there and would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone

title: Birthday
