text: Love This Hotel!!!! Not your typical bah-humbug hotel. The staff was fabulous. Every one was friendly and welcoming, from the Front Desk, Lobby, Room Service, Bar and Restaurant! The rooms were very nice,the beds were so comfortable and and the views were amazing. I wanted to give a shout out to Carlos who made a special trip to my room to bring me hot peppermint tea for my sore throat!!! And to Danielle, the Bartender who made me feel so at home. Thank you Standard East Village!!!!

title: Gute Atmosphäre mit kleinen Schwächen
text: Die gebuchte Kategorie Corner King war zunächst extrem enttäuschend im Verhältnis zum Preis (im achten Stock). Das angebotene Upgrade auf die Studio-Kategorie im höchsten Stock war fair für 75 Euro und das Zimmer schön. Allerdings ist alles etwas lieblos eingerichtet, was schade ist. Die Atmosphäre und das Café sind klasse, die Umgebung des Hotels ist spitze. Das Restaurant war klasse, wir waren zum Brunch dort. Alles in allem gut, mehr aber nicht.

title: Best place to book a meeting room
text: Our company host offsite meetings every month. After researching about 10 hotels to book a meeting room, I came across the Standard Hotel East village. I am so happy we booked our meeting here. Our CEO (who has very high standards/nothing impresses him) said "this was the best experience we have had for offsites" which was great because I got brownie points and it was nice to hear CEO was very happy with the whole experience. From the start Teresa Nolan & John DeArmas were very helpful they answered my questions quickly and were very accommodating to our needs.. I never heard a "No we can't do that" from them. They made it all happen seamlessly and offered little perks that were oh so welcomed! They worked with our budget and even after the event they were there to make sure we were happy with the experience. I would totally recommend this hotel for booking a meeting room..the hotel is really nice , clean , food is delicious. Over all a 5 star experience! Thanks to the STANDARD staff !!

title: Best view of lower Manhattan
text: At first glance, the lobby looks small and crowded because of the heavy traffic from hotel guests and employees. This place can get very busy so the receptionists aren't as warm and welcoming. The hallway to the elevators are dark and confusing full of mirrors. You'd have to find the button to the elevator. However, once you open the door to your room and you happen to get a room at the higher floors, the view is Stunning!! The entire wall is the window! made of glass and the it is breathtaking to see lower Manhattan and the view of the hudson river. The bathtub is insanely huge and you have while taking a bubble bath with a glass of champagne. Very romantic and peaceful. Would stay here again!

title: AMAZING customer service, beautiful hotel!
text: My husband and I live in NYC and every year for his birthday we stay at a hotel in the City - tourists in our home town. The Standard, East Village is, hands-down, the best hotel we've stayed at in years. Why? 1. So easy to book online and I could pay everything upfront - and there's a discount if you do that. 2. The customer service is SUPERIOR. Paige, at the front desk, heard us talking birthday plans and sent up a bottle of champagne as a surprise. 3. Clean, clean, clean. 4. Super comfy bed. 5. Go to the restaurant Narcissa - Michelin rated and it is truly outstanding. We stayed only one night but felt like we got away. Can't wait to try the Standard Highline next year!

title: Cute little hotel
text:
My friend and I went to New York for the weekend and decided to stay at the standard east village since my friend had already stayed previously at the Standard meat packing district and wanted to try the newest addition.
The hotel is cute, it's quite small, and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful.
The rooms are ok, nothing out of the ordinary, but the beds are extremely comfortable!
Overall an enjoyable stay, but personally I would prefer a different location for my next trip.

title: Beautiful Hotel and Location and Customer Service is superior!!!
text: The entire staff including, Paige have the customer skills needed to make one feel as if one is in their home town.  I just about on my third stay there and can't wait.  It's my favorite hotel in NYC !!!

title: Fantastikt hotell!
text: Trendigt, bra läge och en underbar utsikt. Bodde här i 5 nätter. Rummet vi bodde i hade fönster från golv till tak och ned en fantastik utsikt över staden. Frukost serverades i deras talsvar pga ombyggnation vilket inte gjorde vistelsen sämre.

title: Amazing location
text:
The Standard is one of mt favourite hotel chains in USA. They always provide an amazing customer service, they have a very flexible and custom treatment to every customer. Rooms are cozy, cute, comfortable and fully equipped.
Stay in The Standard, will never regret.

title: Best one night getaway
text: I booked a one night stay for my fiancé's 30th birthday since he'd been mentioning how he wanted a peaceful night's sleep without the kiddies. So we left them with the grandparents and upon arriving we were greeted by Jermaul who was so friendly and helpful. He showed us up to our room (20thfl) and we were completely amazed at how cozy but spacious the room was and completely floored by the views we had from our room. We live in the East Village and we have never seen our neighborhood or other surrounding areas the way we were able to see them from our room. The sunset & sunrise were so spectacular and every staff member we encountered were so courteous and sweet. There were even some fabulous goodies for my fiancé and I to enjoy during our stay and they were so yummy. We would definitely recommend staying here even if for a one night getaway. We slept like babies and hope to return soon!

title: Hotel carino ma.....
text: L'albergo non è  niente male. Sicuramente le stanze sono di buon livello e vorrei vedere con quello che costano. Il personale disponibile e cordiale. La nota negativa è sicuramente la colazione veramente al di sotto di alberghi di pari livello, assolutamente da migliorare sia per quantità e qualità. Il posto è un po' fuorimano però c'è la fermata della metropolitana molto vicino. Non lo consiglierei

title: Friendly place in the East Village
text: I love staying at the Standard East Village – it feels like being part of the fabric of the East Village. The entrance is small and efficient, flanked by the café on one side and the garden area on the other. It is just a wonderful place to come back to after a busy day in the city, to grab a drink or just hang out. Even though the space has a fairly hipster feeling, our welcome by the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. (Shout out to Michaela! We are returning soon!) We had a corner king room with fabulous views.  The bed was comfortable, and the towels huge and soft.  My only complaint is the coffee situation - - there should be a coffeemaker (nespresso) in the rooms or an urn in the lobby in the mornings. Room service is 24 hours, but sometimes you just want a peaceful cup of coffee at 6am, and not have to call or pay $18 for it. Yes, the Starbucks is just a 6 minute walk, but still…

title: Great location & exceptional, friendly staff!
text: We booked The Standard in East Village after staying in the Millennium Hilton the first two nights of our trip. The Standard was a wonderful experience. We were greeted and checked in by Michaela. She was very friendly and convinced us to upgrade to a corner King room with a better view (worth it). Will was also very friendly and gave us some good recommendations for food in the village (Mermaid Inn was great). When we Checked out Jacob was also very nice. He stored our bags for us for a couple hours and got them for us very quickly when we returned for them. We had a great experience there. Would definitely return on future trips. The hotel also had a great general vibe and decor :)

title: Thankfully, a short trip
text:
First the good:  
 - The staff is an absolute delight.  Every one of them was friendly and helpful from the desk to housemen to room attendants to hostesses and servers.  
 - The room was bright and cheerful and the view grand.
 - The bath was well appointed with (hallelujah!!) decent bath tissue and facial tissue  (admittedly a major thing with me).
 - The bed was quite comfortable as were the pillows.
 - The wi-fi was dependable and fast enough for my needs

Now the not-so-good:
 - I know this is NY but there was no room for anything.  The 'desk' was more of a thin classroom-style table you'd see in some meeting rooms.  The chair not a desk chair at all - and so close to the bed it was barely usable.
 - There was no clock in the room.
 - In order to use the closet space I had to take out the luggage rack that was crammed into it.
 - They'll probably never have to replace the carpet since it's only under the bed, not in what little walking space there is from the door across the room.  
 - It's been a very long time since I've been in a hotel without at least a small coffee-maker.  Hopefully not a trend.

Thankfully I was alone and only there for less than 24 hours or the negatives above would have seriously annoyed me.

title: Friendlist Hotel In NYC
text: I have stayed at he best hotels in NYC Carlyle, Surrey, Cassa but this was the friendliest hotel yet. From the desk to the bellmen to the waiters, I could not have received better attention. Paige and Kelsey at the desk made me feel so welcome  along with Jacob and Andrew the bellman I also enjoyed the service provided by Spenser outstanding. This hotel treats its guest like they really matter I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to feel special. The restaurant is fabulous and a happening place. Try it you will be pleased

title: Bello ma un po' troppo "lower"
text:
Hotel molto bello, arredamenti moderni e di gusto con camere spaziose e luminose.
Personale disponibile è molto cortese.
Veniamo ai lati "NO": 
la colazione, con quello che costa, non può include solo la "continental" con un SOLO bicchiere di "orante juice" e se ne vuoi un secondo lo devi pagare. Lo stesso dicasi per una omelette..... Non pretendo di avere un pranzo compreso, ma ormai in tutti gli hotel di un certo livello, la colazione spazia in un ampio buffet ed un'altrettanto ampia possibilità di richieste "alla carta". Se a questo aggiungete che il ragazzo a cui abbiamo chiesto 5 Continental ne ha portato soltanto 2 dicendo di aver capito solo quelle e che per portare le atre 3 ci ha messo circa 30'.......il voto naturalmente scende.
Inoltre, si trova si in pieno Greenwich village, ma un pro troppo fuori dalla Manahattan "da vivere".

title: A garden oasis in the Big Apple!
text:
Having never been to New York I was apprehensive. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. The hotel room was compact but not in the least pokey. I walked in to see full length windows and the street but NO noise.
Great garden you can relax in. Contrary to everything I expected from this work related trip it was simply great. I can't wait for an excuse to go back and the hotel is well located, easy walking around to everything. Do yourself a favour and stay there!

title: Moderno e trendy, buono ma troppo costoso per quanto offre
text: Bell'hotel, interamente rinnovato da pochi anni; è una torre in vetro e acciaio alta 20 piani. Dal tetto, vista libera a 360 gradi. Si affaccia su Cooper Square, nell'East Village,  zona Sud Est di Manhattan in grande evoluzione e rilancio, piena di nuovi negozi, ristoranti, locali. Da qui si arriva tranquillamente a piedi a Washington Square e a Greenwich Village, oppure a Soho e Little Italy. Annessi all'hotel un café e un ristorante entrambi frequentatissimi (clientela giovane e trendy); un piccolo giardino sul retro, nessun altro spazio comune oltre all'ingresso con reception. Arredo minimalista e funzionale, di buona qualità con qualche tocco glamour ma niente lusso. Ho dormito in Camera Queen al 14mo piano, decisamente piccola ma luminosa e piacevole, letto superconfortevole, armadio essenziale con cassaforte e minibar fornitissimo, bagno con finestra e doccia grande. Pulizia ottima. Free wifi. Servizio professionale e abbastanza cortese. Un paio di difetti: impossibile non sentire l'andirivieni di gente nel corridoio, sia di mattina che di notte; impossibile silenziare l'aria condizionata. Tutto sommato: hotel che consiglio e dove tornerei; guardando però qualità/prezzo, è decisamente troppo caro per quanto offre.

title: In the middle of everything
text: Stayed here and was very surprised by how nice it was .The rooms are small ,but the views and the ambiance surely makes up for it .The service was great and the food was surprising good .You can get in a taxi ,or walk and your close to everything the city has to offer .Shopping is everywhere and cafes are plentiful .The bathtub in my room was heavenly after a long day of shopping  in Manhattan .Very reasonable rates ,comfortable rooms ,great views in the middle of the best city in the world .I recommend this hotel budget friendly and lovely .

title: Brilliant
text:
Dont expect very high luxury, or big rooms but doorman and reception team were one of the best i ever saw. Cafe at lobby at the road side and at garden excellent service. 
Rooms just enough for your needs but amazingly bathroom was better than any kind of luxury hotel.
Minibar was excellent too. Namely price /performance is the best for newyork. Very suggetible.
Thanks to everybody who are involved for service.

title: Home!!
text: This hotel does exactly what it says on the tin. Welcomed by Paige at reception she is the best, I'd take her with me if I could. Hotel is clean, efficient and happy. The bar is lively, the garden is there for repose. Very happy with my stay and the staff were awesome. Great hotel great location. Parking is a little pricey at $55 per day way more than parking lots. Anyway convenience costs!! Great place though highly recommended.

title: 5 star staff & service
text: Stumbled across this gem as I was looking to book two rooms for a weekend stay in NYC. Fantastic location adjacent to numerous restaurants, shopping, and historical landmarks. World class staff who routinely goes above and beyond to make each visitors stay remarkable. Eclectic feel with an amazing staff of Manhattan. Couldn't find something negative to say about this hotel if I tried. Extremely grateful to have stayed at this hotel.

title: Great eclectic hotel with fantastic views and staff
text:
What a fantastic find.
The location is energetic and fun ... my first visit to NYC for a few years, so it helped with getting re-introduced to this fantastic city.
The rooms were fantastic and the view of the city exceptional. 
The staff were excellent, hard-working and helped out with logistics, deliveries, and how to get around the city wonderfully. 
I would without a doubt return to the Standard East Village the next time I visit New York and I highly recommend it.

title: Oasis in the City
text: I just returned from moving my son in to the dorms at NYU. We stayed at The Standard East Village and it was perfect. The room was clean and large enough (given NY space), the staff was friendly and helpful, and the location was perfect: close to Tisch and the bookstore, close to the dorms, close to K-Mart for dorm room shopping, close to wonderful restaurants and shopping. We will definitely stay here again!

title: Great stay!
text:
Stayed here for several nights a few weeks ago.  East Village location is a pleasant and energetic location.
Michaela(sp) and front staff are exceptionally hard-working, making my family's stay most comfortable.  Was always greeted each day with respect and courtesy and above all, no unnecessary attitude-  just bright smiles.  Housekeeping provided well-kept rooms.  Plan to stay here again in the future.

title: Excellent location, attentive staff and fantastic beds
text: We stayed at The Standard, East Village from the 20th to the 27th August 2016. It was an absolute pleasure from start to finish. We had a stressful journey from the airport to the hotel and the receptionist who welcomed us was gracious and accommodating. She arranged for a cool drink of water for us which was badly needed. She also facilitated an early check in. I was impressed with the room. High floor and corner. Excellent views of mid town and the East Village. The room was quite small but that's typical of NYC hotels. The location was perfect. As a long time visitor to New York I am no longer interested in the madness and the hordes at Times Square. The East Village is quieter and less frenetic. The subway is a 3 minute stroll away so everything in Manhattan is accessible. I would without a doubt return to the Standard East Village the next time I visit New York and I highly recommend it to other travellers.

title: Top notch service
text:
I was greeted by smiles and a very friendly staff when I arrived to check in.  My morning started at 4am flying to New York to move my daughter into her dorm at NYU.  The morning was hot , hectic and chaotic.  So I really appreciated the welcome I was given when I finally arrived at my hotel.  All I wanted was to clean up and relax.  I showed up around 3:30 in the afternoon and was informed that my room had been upgraded, but was not ready yet.  The check in staff stowed my bags and ushered me into The Standard Cafe and  gave me a drink and appetizer for my trouble.  I hadn't even ordered my drink when she reappeared with my room key.  The cafe was very relaxed and exactly what I needed.  
My room was spotless. It had a HUGE window with a beautiful view of the city.  The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet and relaxing.  Any staff that I encountered while walking around the hotel always greeted me and asked if they could be helpful in anyway.

title: Stay at a dog friendly hotel, the room may have a pee smell
text: I stayed here once before and had a great experience.  This time when I got here to take my son to move in day at NYU I got two rooms by each other and the one we got reeked of urine.  I found two spots on the floor from what looked like doggie doo and urine.  I called and they offered to move me, but we had already unpacked and we weren't spending a ton of time there so it wasn't worth the hassle.  They also offered to come and clean it (that's what I want, a cleaning lady in my $400/night room scrubbing the carpet for dog pee.  Well, I had rated this higher last time, but now feel that it is at best average.  I will request a room that doesn't smell like urine if I stay here again, something that I wouldn't think I would need to do at a hotel of this level and price. So if you are not into dog pee, beware!!  You may have to smell pee or wait for a cleaning lady to scrub your floors and smell cleaning products at check in.  Bummer.

title: The Standard, a standard that all hotels should strive for
text:
We arrived late evening after a 30 hour long haul, checkin complete in two minutes! Welcomed by a personalized message and complimentary drinks in room.

Rooms - Large for NY, clean and modern. Lush bed with pillow top, we were in a king corner room with amazing views uptown. Noise minimal from main street (Bowery st). Split system aircon worked a treat. 
Bathroom had a double size single head shower with great pressure and heat, and a sign of consistent cleanliness - clean grouting. The heated bathroom floor was a highlight. Minibar well stocked, standard hotel pricing. 

Same day Laundry service no issues, again standard hotel pricing. 

Concierge service - Wow! A big shout out to Paige for all her help on our first day, tips, maps, general demeanor, it set us up for the next 10 days in our attempt to experience everything NY had to offer. Second shout out to Monique for helping us out with some reservations around town, above and beyond and completely unexpected!

Room service, not an exhaustive selection but every meal we tried was on point. Prompt and hot, with excellent service from Dakota, thanks buddy! The Ribeye was to die for, along with the Fried Chicken! Standard hotel pricing. My partner, a sugar addict, loved the chocolate mousse dessert.

A big thank you to Paige and the extensive team at The Standard East Village for making our first NY experience even more memorable than ever! We will be back!

title: great stay & service
text: Stayed overnight for my wife's birthday. Hotel staff was courteous and provided complimentary "touches" to ensure a comfortable stay - room upgrade and snacks with a personalized note. Great location and easily accessible.

title: Big City Vibe with Exceptional Customer Service
text: I enjoy staying at the Standard hotel.  It is trendy, has a great patio and great views from the rooms.  The staff is terrific.  They are friendly and their to ensure all their guest have a great stay.  For example, Johan E went above and beyond for me just this week.  I stayed a month ago at The Standard and realized that was likely one of the places I could have left my glasses.  I called and inquired. Johan looked for me but did not find them.  The next day he called me back and said he took the time to personally go through everything one more time on my behalf.  The glasses were there. He contacted me and shipped to me that very day.  The personal service is outstanding.  Thank you Johan and the entire staff of the Standard.

title: Great Service/Great Hotel!
text:
We had a wonderful stay at the Standard! The staff is so friendly, the rooms have great views, and are clean and comfortable. I left my phone in the room and realized about an hour after checking out. We called the hotel and Johan, the Guest Relations Supervisor, personally went to the room and retrieved my phone so that I could pick it up from him. He was so friendly and kind!

From the room to the lost & found, The Standard, East Village is top-notch!

title: Trendy hotel, but small rooms
text:
The rooms are small but well distributed, the views are amazing if you get a room with floor-to-ceiling windows. Unfortunately, their air conditioning and heating are old and dusty and really noisy. The rooms are also generally not very well noise isolated. 

I tried their room service twice and it both occasion it was delicious. Unfortunately they don't have a true breakfast menu. 

Checking-in / guest services are too informal for my personal taste, they are not very helpful like in any boutique hotel. Whenever we asked for some help with reservations, they wrote down things in pieces of paper that of course get lost.

title: Great hotel!  Roomy for NY and staff was absolutely fantastic - friendly, helpful, and invested in making our stay great
text: The service at this hotel was stellar, from the check-in process to accessing internet service.  All staff was so friendly and accessible!  I loved the room - spacious for NY - and clean and updated.  The outside seating at the restaurant was exactly what we needed after a long travel day - and just the right kinds of food for a late dinner.  The service continued 3 days later when I called to see if they had found an item I left there.  They did, and Calvin in Guest Relations was beyond helpful.  He located the item and had it mailed to me right away.  I'd stay here again any time I'm in New York.

title: A home away from home in NYC ...
text:
The Standard East Village is my home away from home in NYC. The staff is amazingly attentive and friendly - service TRULY comes first here. 

The rooms are always spotless and project a stylish simplicity - but they vary in size; some are tiny and some are huge and spacious - you pay for what you get. The views from the higher floors can be absolutely astounding with sweeping vistas of NYC. 

High floor Corner King rooms are the best value, in my experience. And always request a room with a bathtub - they're wonderful for a nice, long soak. 

The restaurants and bar downstairs are hip and often crowded with locals and guests alike - but the staff will always make sure you get a good seat. Delicious food and cocktails can be had in all locations ... The garden is a particularly nice place to hang if the weather is nice. 

And if you don't want to hang at the hotel you're right in the middle of the East Village - what more could you want? 

Room service is also great (the breakfast sandwich is just - wow) ... Even the moisturizer they leave in the rooms is top-notch. 

But again, it's the service and the people that make the Standard East Village great - the manager, Jane, runs a great operation and Paige, at the front desk, is a simply delightful human being (dare I say friend??) ... I see the same friendly faces working there again and again which means they take great care of the people who take great care of their guests.

title: Great Stay, Great View!
text:
We stayed here for a night over my birthday weekend. I was originally going to give this 4 stars but then I remembered the beginning of the trip and changed my mind. 

We were headed over to the East Village from Times Square (boyfriend suggested seeing what was showing at the TKTS booth but we bailed after deciding we didn't want to see a show). I called the Standard to see if they would let us check in early. They said it wouldn't be a problem, they even had a room ready (well it had been cleaned- just not inspected yet. Bonus points that the rooms have to pass inspection before they are assigned!)

My GPS was not aware that they closed down the main street and surrounding areas for a marathon and they wouldn't be open until 1:30. We called the Standard and Kelsey was quickly trying to find out the fastest way for us to get to the hotel and also suggest we park at the valet and walk over. I totally appreciate the fact that she went out of her way to get us sorted out.

We ended up grabbing lunch, we were getting frustrated and just needed to get some food (him) / libations (me) to calm down. By the time we were done with brunch the street was open and we were able to get to the hotel no problem. She even had our original room on the 16th floor still available!

The rest of our stay was wonderful and right on par with the Standard brand. We love the Standard in Miami and often grab a drink at the West Village location on the roof so we are familiar with what they are about. The service was wonderful, the location was wonderful and we had such a great time.

Narcissa was excellent. Wonderful food selection and top notch service. They even remembered it was my birthday!

My only complaint is the Cafe in the morning. The food selection is good (as long as there is oatmeal I'm happy) but I'm one of those "Diet Coke in the AM" freaks that need their fix first thing. Who doesn't offer free refills on fountain soda? That was weird but if that's my only gripe, I'd consider the stay more than successful!

title: Great place to stay in the East Village!
text: Booked a weekend at The Standard because it was close to our son.  LOVED this hotel and will be making it a regular destination for our trips to NYC.  Room was beautiful and had fabulous views of the city.  Unlike a lot of NYC hotels and airbnb apartments, there was plenty of room for my husband and me. Service was perfect and the hotel staff was friendly to a person.  The location was perfect, too. Great restaurants surround and parking on the street was no problem.  Whole Foods and a YMCA were also a few blocks away. Hotel provides pass to gym across the street and helped us with a running/walking route.  You won't be disappointed!

title: My home in NYC
text: I have stayed at The Standard East Village for a weekly trip to NY for the past 3 summers. It's location is perfect, the rooms and cleanliness are excellent and the service has always been outstanding. The food is also really good in the cafe/lounge. For anyone staying in Noho or the East Village it is the best hotel out there. You can walk to most attractions and feel safe in the Cooper Square neighborhood!! 5 stars !!! I'll be back 😊

title: Moderno e Eficiente!
text: Se você está com o namorado ou marido é um ótimo hotel, super moderno, serviço impecável, embaixo tem um restaurante incrível! Mas se prepare pq é moderno mesmo, tipo o banheiro tem a vista para o mar com uma parede de vidro e é integrado ao quarto, com filhos já não fica muito adequado! Lindo!

title: If a hotel could be a Millennial, it would be The Standard
text:
Right from when you enter under the canopy with The Standards ironically upside-down logo, to when you meet the very pleasant but young staff (I don't think I saw anyone older than 35 working) to the hotel magazine which could be substituted for a lifestyle magazine this hotel leaves and breathes the Millennial experience. 

I certainly don't mean this as a pejorative since the service was great, the rooms were large comfortable and well appointed and the washrooms had a spa like feel; however, the hotel obviously caters to a young hip professional demographic. Not that I think someone outside of this group would feel unwelcome but it certainly is not your business hotel of years past.

Some of the extra amenities that I enjoyed included the extra large towels that must have been 4-5' long, large windows with great black-out curtains and the red button above the bed that turned the white light to red. I suppose this could have been a romantic touch but I would use it as a way to cut down on blue lights which we hear are harmful before sleeping these days.

Some negatives included few power outlets (or most were askwardly located) and no USB outlets which I would expect from a modern hotel, especially since there was no alarm clock, there was a large scratch on our TV, the carpet had not seen a good deep clean in a very long time and there was bizarrely only one sheet on the bed which either served as a fitted sheet or a flat sheet - we weren't sure.

Definitely a great hotel on the boutique side which should be enjoyable and comfortable for most visitors. Those expecting a traditional hotel room may be turned off.

title: Hip hotel at a great location
text:
I stayed for three nights in July, and was very satisfied with both the room, the pre-ordered continental breakfast as well as the staff and service in general. My credit card had initially been charged a little to much when I made my reservation, but everything was sorted out when I checked out (Thanks, Paige!)

I will definitely consider staying here again the next time I travel to NYC.

title: Fantastic service, very cool vibe and perfect downtown location.
text: Stayed with my 12 yr old daughter for a week of NY sightseeing and really had a perfect time. All the staff made my daughter feel totally welcome from the word go and Matt at the front desk couldn't have been more helpful and recommended some great spots for us. The place has the feeling of a boutique hotel whilst being effortlessly informal. We loved the cafe for breakfasts and are now missing starting our days there :) Very highly recommended.

title: Minúsculo!
text: Os quartos de hotel em NYC não são exatamente famosos por suas dimensões, mas a falta de espaço do Standard chama atenção. Para piorar, o banheiro - de azulejos pretos, que eu sei que muitas pessoas odeiam porque escondem a sujeira - tem porta de correr em madeira com várias frestas: num quarto minúsculo, haja intimidade! A cama também não é das melhores (tive que pedir para trocarem o topper do colchão, por conta de um buraco), e tudo isso por um preço bem alto. Por outro lado, a localização é excelente para quem, como eu, adora o East Village. Além de tudo, o restaurante e o bar do hotel são ótimos e bem avaliados. Dá para pedir no quarto, por exemplo, o clássico cheeseburguer do Standard, com direito às melhores batatas fritas (fininhas) de NYC. Ah, hóspedes podem usar a ótima academia da frente de graça.

title: One night at The Standard
text: Really wonderful hotel! the location was great, the staff was wonderful and the room was fantastic! Upon check-in Paige and Michaela (spelling?) were very friendly. Paige helped us get some Kinky Boots tickets and directions on getting to the show. Ian was super polite and prompt with bringing our bags to the room. We were fortunate enough to get a mini tour of the property. Our room was amazing! 2 walls were all windows w/a view all the way to Freedom Tower. At checkout Kelsey suggested we leave our bags w/them while we went sightseeing before the driver took us to the airport. i can't forget to mention the car service that picked us up at the airport and dropped us off. They were awesome!

title: Fantastic Hotel. Fantastic Neighborhood.
text: Loved it and could not believe how cool the neighborhood is and could not believe how great the rooms are and I loved the view from the 17th floor room. The room was cozy but fine for me, husband and 17 year old son. The bathroom was cool and spacious and super quirky/fresh. Frankly, I loved that the restaurants downstairs were so happening and the adorable little garden that served food was hopping. Perfect hotel. Was not expecting a palatial room and when I'm in NYC, I don't hang out in my room anyway. It's NYC!

title: Great location, comfortable, hipster hotel
text:
I just returned from a one-week stay at The Standard, East Village. The hotel is incredibly hipster, with fashionable young people walking in and out at all hours. I don't quite match that crowd, but I still felt welcome. My queen room was on a corner on an upper floor. The views were absolutely incredible. From one window, I could see the Empire State Building, Chrysler building, and other beautiful Manhattan buildings. From another, I had views across to Brooklyn, including the bridges. The bed was very comfortable, with a cozy duvet and a delightfully smooshy mattress topper. The location was convenient to several Subway lines and a wide variety of bars, restaurants, and sights in the area. The bathroom products were nice, and I particularly liked the ginger body wash.

The only reason I give this hotel four stars rather than five is some slightly odd design choices. Specifically, the shower had two half curtains running along it and a lip of only perhaps one inch to keep water from the rest of the bathroom. Given the shallow lip, it would have been easier to have a full shower curtain running the span of the shower. I was in constant worry of the position of the curtain overlap during my showers. The other odd design was the television, which was thrown in a corner in front of a window. You don't want to sacrifice the gorgeous views for a television, but I was tripping over it to get to my side of the bed, and it had significant glare from the large windows whenever I did turn it on. I don't have a solution for this. Perhaps the solution is televisions on demand? I was far more interested in the view than the tv, except for when major news was happening.

title: Great Location, Comfortable Small Rooms
text:
I was a little afraid to book at the Standard. After all, I'm an overweight middle-aged woman who was traveling to New York with friends and family to celebrate our 60th birthdays, and everyone knows how young and cool and hip the Standard brand is. But one of the other birthday girls on our trip had stayed there before and told us we'd love it. And she was right.

So let's start with the thing all Standard hotels are known for: the innovative and whimsical design touches. The East Village property is in a converted apartment building, with a small narrow lobby that seems bigger because it opens up to a garden patio on one side and the casual dining Cafe on the other - which not only has a lovely patio, but even the interior is designed to bring the outdoors in with a forest of plants hanging from the ceiling. The Cafe bar was hopping with beautiful people when we arrived, but we were made to feel welcome. The food and service were both great.

The rooms are small - the queen bed takes up most of it! But that bed is comfortable and the folks who put the room together did a good job of getting all the other expected amenities into it without forcing the guests to bump into stuff. The bathroom was a lot larger than one would expect and made good use of its space. Comfortable bed, excellent shower, well-stocked mini-bar. Pretty much everything you can ask for in a city hotel.

One of the other couples has a kid attending NYC, so the location was perfect for visiting her apartment (a good thing because our own college student daughter stayed with her friend there - we knew our room would be too small for her to stay with us).  It was a short walk to many of the attractions we wanted to visit on this trip - and no big deal to hail a cab or get on the subway for the ones that weren't as close by. 

Finally, some nice words for the staff - all of whom went out of their way to make us comfortable. We forgot to request a late check-out on our last day, which was an issue when our last bit of sightseeing went over. However, Paige at the front desk took care of us and arranged for the bell staff to remove and hold our bags for us so we could enjoy our last day in New York City.

title: Love this hotel!
text: I absolutely love the Standard hotel in East Village. It has a great restaurant, bar and hangout area. I love how funky the rooms are decorated and how well the staff treat the guests. I’ve had great interactions with all of the staff members but Shanna and the entire concierge staff stand out as being especially helpful and kind. I have and would recommend this hotel for anyone looking to stay in a place as cool as its neighbourhood.

title: Great, hip hotel with excellent service, nice cafe, amazing garden and restaurant
text: My husband and i stayed here for a week during a recent trip to New York and really loved it. Only about 2  blocks away from the Astor Place metro (the 4, 5 and 6) and about 3 blocks from 8th Street NYU (the N, R, Q trains). The staff were so friendly and helpful, both at the front desk and in the various restaurants. They even gave us free passes to the gym across the street, which I used 4 times! There is an upscale restaurant at the hotel, Narcisa, which is pricy but very good; a cafe for more casual fare and for breakfast, and a garden open only sometimes, which was a wonderful place to hang out. Room was modern and comfy though our basic king room was a little small. Definitely would go back!

title: Fantastic stay!
text: Just stayed 4 nights at the standard east village. What a place! Rooms spacious and spotless, what a comfy bed!! On arrival, as it was my birthday, they gave us wine and goodies! V nice. The view from our room of the Manhattan skyline was amazing....Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, couldn't fault this hotel, loved it. Our first stop if returning to NYC❤️

title: Disappointing. For the young crowd (who can afford it!)
text:
Thought for $300 a night this would be a good hotel but was very disappointed. It was a good location to explore the East Village though Cooper Square is under construction and noisy and frenetic. 
Rooms are small and poorly appointed. No power point at desk for laptop etc.
Furniture reminded me of college dorm/Ikea at best! Guess the cheesy vinyl lip cushion should have been a give away.
Comfortable bed - plush+ mattress - pillowtop on top of pillowtop but not fitted sheets. Shower leaked. Poor layout - TV in front of window. Was no designer consulted in setting up this hotel?!   Lighting is horrendous. Could not use garish bed lights, had to get out of bed to turn off more subtle lighting.  Bathroom accessories? Er... those mass soap/shampoo dispensers you find at the gym?
This hotel is for the 20s/30s crowd. Pretty noise bar scene at night. nice garden area and outdoor eating area. Pet friendly which doesn't suit people with allergies. Staff too young to know what good service is.

title: Our Favorite Place
text: We just returned from another fabulous stay at the Standard East Village in NYC!  The entire staff could not be more accommodating and helpful.  Let me mention just a few of the people who made our stay so great!  Reuben, the doorman/bellman was always there to welcome us with a friendly face, a smile, and a greeting.  Austin made sure we had a table or another comfortable spot any time we stopped in for a drink or snack.  Jackson was attentive to our every need at the Cafe and enjoyed hearing about what we had been doing during the day.  At the front desk, Paige likes to exchange suggestions and reviews of entertainment of all sorts.  Her ideas are very helpful.    Finally, Jane, is amazing.  She made sure our stay would be perfect from start to finish, and she was successful.  My husband and I love this hotel and cannot wait for our next trip to NYC and the Standard East Village.  Thank you to all who made our stay so much fun!

title: Wow! Such a great hotel!!
text: The hotel was amazing. From the second we checked in to when we checked out every staff member was extremely friendly and helpful. Mack gave great recommendations for restaurants nearby and very helpful when helping add another night to our stay. The view from the king room was beautiful and the bathrooms had a tub to enjoy a nice bubble bath. I would without a doubt recommend this hotel to friends and family and can't wait to return!

title: Buen servicio , calidad y confort en el descanso , sobre todo la cama y el baño
text: Ubicación perfecta para desplazarte ,  los restaúrantes son maravillosos y por destacar el Narcisa , su terraza y su brunch , y por supuesto el café -bar. Tiene acuerdo con él Gim que está enfrente Que esta fantástico . Que

title: AMAZING HOTEL AND STAFF
text: Beautiful hotel. The view was awesome from my room. The bartenders were awesome at the bar. Staff at the front desk was amazing and incredibly accommodating. I had so much fun, ill be staying here every time im in NY.

title: Top location small rooms
text:
I booked a four night stay at The Standard East Village for me and my family. The room  was everything but a king room. Very tiny and with a bed that was not a king.
The staff was very friendly. Location perfect.

title: Summer Staycation in the East Village!
text: We had a friends bachelorette party here and it was so lovely! Jane, The Director of Guest Experiences took amazing care of us along with all of the rad people that work there! We had a beautiful corner room with incredible views of the city and were greeted with a bottle of champagne and snacks in the room.  We had a beautiful dinner in the backyard of Narcissa, which was exceptional food!  We ended up at the Bar late night and had a great time with all of the bartenders - everyone was super fun and friendly! All in all, super cool spot! Love this location because it feels a bit smaller and more intimate!

title: True Happiness - The Standard
text: Five stars. Professional, kind, intelligent staff. Atmosphere is unlike any place in the city, beautiful and modern. Rooms are clean, quite and comfortable. Highly recommend staying here you will not regret it. And the gym (crunch) 1 block away is free for guests and has everything for a solid workout.

title: Boutiquehotell med pittoreskt läge!
text:
Ligger bra till i East Village för att utforska det området! 
Rummen är något små för det pris man betalar, men rent och snyggt. Entrén och bar/restaurang är väldigt välkomnande och modernt!
Tyvärr blev det en felbokning ifrån mig, skulle hamna på the Standard i Meetpacking, så hade HELT andra förväntningar - men mitt eget fel...

title: Man's Best Friend
text:
While moving my daughter into her new apartment - with her dog, we needed a hotel for the weekend.  The Standard was a wonderful surprise.  Incredibly large rooms, with fabulous views. 2 nice restaurants: Café - excellent for breakfast and Narcissa - really beautiful, did not get a chance to try. Narcissa - has a beautifully designed private garden one can enjoy dining outdoors. In addition to this the hotel also has a beautiful patio/garden one can savor drinks.  
Staff is extremely attentive, Lucy our dog got the 5 star treatment.
A hotel like the Standard will make my travels to NYC so much easier now, especially  knowing I can bring my dog (at no extra charge).  I give them 5 stars for service, attentiveness and caring for man's best friend - extremely important to me.

title: bar and restaurant visit
text: Visited the bar and private dining area Art The Standard during a recent visit. Amazing views and service at the vibrant bar. private dining experience is highly recommended: shared European Fusion platters with great wine pairings, thoroughly enjoyable!

title: Perfect
text:
Highly recommend and will definitely stay again. 
The bed was so comfortable, view was spectacular, and no hallway noise in the night!
Front desk staff was superb. We also ate at Narcissa for some snacks and all of the food was lovely.

title: Unpleasant check in - beware
text: I was treated very inappropriately by the receptionist upon my check in at 12.00 Sunday 12 June. She inferred I had not paid ahead when really the problem was caused via my agent the flight centre Australia ! and I was quite worried It caused me a lot of stress and anxiety . No one offered to help me with my luggage . This insulting unfriendly welcome has left a very nasty taste. I hope the rest of my stay improves.

title: Fabulous Stay!
text: This was my first time at the Standard Hotel and it was fabulous! I finally found my favorite hotel in NYC! From the moment I arrived, the front desk attendants are friendly and welcoming to the person that escorted me to my room. Room service was amazing-food was fresh and high quality. The rooms were great! Bed was comfortable, sheets were incredible and the views were great. I loved loved my stay! The staff and rooms were just the best! Highly recommend staying here and I cannot wait for my next visit!

title: Careful with extra charges after you leave
text: This hotel will send you extra charges after checkout claiming "they made a mistake". If you get an invoice for all charges and pay upon checkout, it is not good business practice to send extra charges without warning or previous explanation. No invoice either so extra charge cannot be expensed.  It is a pity that a good property is badly managed.

title: NY Groove
text:
Splendid stay and many thanks to all for making us feel so welcome . Very ,very  comfortable bed and what is a good hotel without a groovy bed ? Would highly recommend an early breakfast and a late brunch ......both outstanding . 
Looking forward to our return

title: Amazing Views
text:
We had a room with huge floor-to-ceiling corner windows, really great to look out. The catch is that we were looking out at the Lower East Side, which isn't the most interesting part of the NYC skyline. But still. 

The room itself was a little crowded with 2 double beds, but comfortable. The bathroom was well equipped with a comfortable tub. Service was good. The lobby can be a packed party crowd in the evening, but not noisy in the rooms.

title: Chic, clean, friendly, good location, poor WiFi signal
text: This was our second stay at The Standard Hotel (East Village) and we loved it.  Yes, the rooms are small, but so are all the other hotels in NYC!  The staff is what makes this hotel amazing.  They are so VERY friendly, greeting us every time we walked into the hotel.  We had a corner room on the 12th floor (king) ...1203, to be exact.....and the views are amazing!  Both of our boys live in the East Village, and this was 5-6blocks from their apartments, so it was great for us.  Very comfortable beds and pillows (and we are picky about that!).  WiFi was free, but not a very good signal.  We kept popping in an out of WiFi/LTE.  There was an option to pay $19.99 for upgraded WiFi (not sure if that was daily, or for our whole stay), but we didn't do it.  We weren't going to be in the room that much.  In addition (I think it's related), several channels weren't available (just normal channels, too....NBC, CBS, etc) because of poor signals.

title: Fabulous
text: Awesome hotel. Super friendly staff and the corner rooms are superb and spacious. Had the privilige of a very early check in and a very late check out. One of the coolest neighborhoods in the City. We will come back here again. Thanks Standard foolks! Made our last day a  memorable one!

title: Perfect Location in East Village
text: While I love the southern Manhattan and in particular Soho, Nolita and East Village is perfectly located. Few blocks away from shopping, cool restaurants and cafés. The hotel has cool design and the service is great. I was little disappointed of the view from the room but hopefully I got better luck next time.

title: Loved the location
text:
This hotel was fantastic, not only modern, but staff were all so friendly. There is a bar and cafe along with a restaurant which had a great vibe and served good food and drinks.
The rooms were great. Bed was so comfortable, room was an OK size but enough for what I needed and the bathroom was quaint and again, all you needed. Great views too.
Over all, I had a great experience and was able to walk not far to the metro, down the road to great deli's, cafes and bars.
I recommend heading to Russ & Daughters for a breakfast bagel, amazing. Or at night, heading down to Wren or Saxon+Parole for drinks.

title: Amazing views and location!
text: Right in the heart of super cool East Village, walking distance to pubs and amazing eateries. Every room above the 4th floor has a view but I stayed on the 18th floor and it was breathtaking!  It was raining one afternoon so I just stayed in and relaxed, I even had a view from my tub and shower!

title: Great Hotel with Class
text:
Staff was very pleasant, especially Page.  They were very accommodating..
We had the best cupcakes delivered to our room that were so delicious.
The room was clean, comfortable and quiet.  The view was amazing. We had such a great time and would do it again.  Can't thank everyone enough!

title: muy buen descanso, ubicado en el corazón de noho!
text: Me encantó el hotel, súper moderno y las habitaciones amplias para lo que es nueva york. Si te vas a ubicar al sur de la ciudad, es una opción a tener en cuenta ya que está a dos cuadras de la diagonal Broadway que acorta camino en toda su trayectoria a lo largo de NYC ya que es la única avenida que cruza de punta a punta en diagonal la isla. A pocos metros de subtes, cooper square, union square en los alrededores del hotel hay numerosas tiendas, delis y hasta un k mart. Sin duda una excelente opción para quienes evalúan hospedarse próximos al bohemio y alternativo downtown.

title: Get a high floor room!
text: Somehow everyone I was traveling with scored a high room with an awesome view of the Empire State Building. But I got a room on a low floor looking out buildings, and I didn't really like it, the carpet was dirty and it felt a little dingy. Some of the design elements were cool, but not enough to save it. The room was a 3, but I’ll give it a 4 for the cool vibe. We spent a lot of time at the restaurant/bar downstairs which has good breakfast and good drinks. You're right in the East Village so you're close to a lot of great restaurants.

title: Best Hotel In the East Village!
text: My partner and I went to NY for the weekend to attend a friends wedding on the Hudson River. The staff at The Standard East Village could not have been more accommodating! When we arrived there was a guest in the lobby with his 2 dogs which made the atmosphere feel like home. ( we have 4 rescue dogs ) The lobby was welcoming and had a NY vibe we were looking for without the attitude. We booked a corner king room (1107) which has a great view of the village, floor to ceiling windows that wrapped around the room, and an awesome steam shower and heater bathroom floors! Unlike most NY hotel rooms, we found ours to be spacious and hip. Everyone employee we came across was polite and asked how our stay was. The hotel offers free passes to Crunch Fitness which is located across the street. We'll be back!

title: Wedding ceremony
text:
Recently my daughter celebrated her wedding with a party at the Standard Hotel. 110 guests enjoyed a 4 hour party on the 21 floor party room. THE VIEWS WERE BREATHTAKING, A COMPLETE 360 degree of the most beautiful skyline in the world.
The food was not only delicious but very well presented. There were three nicely sized rooms with seating optional allowing for freedom of flow. Each room had access to an outdoor patio that circled the rooms. Two well stocked bars and a buffer area allowed for
easy access and great conversations. Neils, Jacob, Michael and Jonathan did an outstanding job making sure every detail was covered. 
I can not begin to tell you how impressed the guests were with the totality of the event. 
My daughter, Erika and husband, Dimitri have a memory they will never forget.😅😍

title: Great view, brilliant location, small rooms
text: Had read about people's issues with the size of the room but booked for four nights anyway and wasn't disappointed. We were on the 20th floor and had a fantastic view of the city, a nice comfortable bed and good shower - it was all we needed. We were out exploring for all of our days so only came back to the room to sleep so the size didn't bother us. Staff were friendly and helpful. Brilliant location with so many restaurants and bars around and close to the subway to get about. Cabs routinely stop outside so never had to wait either. Could have done with a coffee machine in the room but we would walk five minutes down to Ray's Pizza place in the mornings at 6am (thanks jet lag) and pick up coffee and bagels to take back to the room. Would definitely stay here again

title: Exceptional Customer Service
text:
I was amazed at the way I was treated by every staff member! They all go out of their way to ensure whatever you need is provided. Paige and Chris at the front desk were exceptional! Thank you for a wonderful stay!
And the hotel is beautiful clean and I will definitely be back!
Great job to all of the staff and management!

title: Theatre Trip--Head of Passes
text: OK, I have wanted to stay at the Standard ever since seeing it out the side of my eye while visiting the Whitney Museum in the Meat Packing District. This weekend I chose the East Village location since I was going to the Public Theatre. Everything about this location is hipster and swanky. The best thing? You can look out over NYC while taking your shower. The linen is high thread count. The mattress feels like goose down...BUT...BUT...BUT...the mattress in room 1905 leans so badly to the ground, I had to sleep smack in the middle of the bed to prevent an unfortunate case of vertigo. Please rectify this mattress problem dear people. On my next visit to the Public Theatre, I still will choose the Standard. One more thing. A red Standard Souvenir journal cost $135.00. I wanted one so badly until I discovered the cost. No, it is not mole skin. It is not leather, pleather, or plastic. Who is making such a purchase? Oprah!

title: Best views in NYC and outstanding service!
text: We stayed here for a night during a business trip to Long Island. The staff was welcoming, friendly and beyond accommodating. Jermaul was especially helpful and kind. The hotel itself was trendy, clean, in a great location with extremely comfortable beds. The view from the penthouse was not to be missed and the best view I have ever seen of the city (Empire State on one side and One World Trade Center on the other). The only downfall was the server we had in the hotel restaurant. Although he was friendly, I had to ask for our check multiple times and ended up having to poke my head into a staff only area to remind him once again to bring us our check. Besides that one small mishap, our trip was perfect! I would definitely stay here again!

title: Amazing stay, with great staff, style, and substance
text:
My partner and I stayed here for my birthday over the past weekend.  I cannot say enough good things about the hotel and its team.  Jane, in particular, helped organise so many things before we even got there and made us feel very welcome.  

We had booked a corner king room and it really was lovely.  A great amount of space with a comfortable (soft) bed and beautiful bathroom.  Each day the room was cleaned immaculately and was a joy to come back to. 

The team at the hotel were always fun and friendly.  Unfortunately, we didn't discover the garden until a few days into our stay.  It's really lovely and a bit of an oasis from the hustle and bustle of New York.  

Definitely on our "stay here again" list.

title: Great location and staff
text: We enjoyed our stay here and the rooms were pretty cool.  We came to visit NYU and its right there so we will be coming back often.  Nice to have a comfy place to stay when we visit my son at college.  The bar down below is a real hotspot so you don't need to leave the hotel to 'go out'.  They also have two restaurants.  It's pretty small but convenient and clean.

title: young and hip crowd
text: The Standard, East Village has all the feeling of a great boutique Hotel but it is much more than that. Yes, the rooms are small, but they are modern and comfortable. The service staff is a pleasure to deal with, they have an answer for all your questions. I was fortunate to be there on the 1st of 2 sunny days, allowing for the garden restaurants to have people sitting and dining outside. I met my cousin and her daughter for lunch and we ate at Narcissa, although a little pricey the food was well presented and very tasty. My only complaint about the room, no clock!!

title: Wonderful hotel with extraordinary staff!
text:
I stayed at the east village Standard once on a whim, very last minute because it was the right location.  But I went back three more times, because of the PEOPLE. I never write reviews but after staying 3 times I need to describe the people at this hotel.
The first person I met was Kelsey. She was lovely and welcoming and took time to give me dinner ideas in the area. Then MIke, was just an authentically great guy. Took my bags, made me feel welcomed, and the remembered who I was when I came back down to the lobby. He went out of his way to make sure I knew how to get to my appointment. 

The next time I stayed, Paige not only gave me a warm welcome but let me charge my iphone (I forgot my charger!) and made me feel confident leaving it (my life) behind the counter for an hour while I went for coffee. It's moments like that, that make ALL the difference in the world. And Max - SO friendly - told me where to get coffee. 

The most recent stay, I walked in, completely distracted because i was late for a meeting and there was Mike who remembered me, grabbed my bag and told me "ive got this, just get to your meeting." Doesnt get much better.

title: The Standard continually delivers
text: We had the opportunity to stay at the East Village Standard on a recent trip to NYC. The room was really fun, comfortable and roomy from NYC standards. We loved the view and how nestled into the skyline we were. We throughly enjoyed the bar with a melee of different folks and in the Standard style, a melee of  styles and impressions. It was a place we really relaxed and had a nice time being in the moment. We were able to snag a table by the kitchen inn the shaker inspired Narcissa restaurant. We throughly enjoyed the food, the spirit of the place, the smart and inviting service and the creativity coming from the chef. This Standard reminded me of the downtown LA Standard in their services and spirit. I hope we can come again. Feeling pampered and spoiled.

title: Great price, great location
text: If you can find the entrance... There was construction going on outside and my cab driver dropped me a block away.  I actually walked in through the restaurant but then they led me to the tiny reception area. The front desk clerks were very friendly. I had a corner room with lots of light. Very clean too. Felt safe the entire time I was there. Close to subway stops and a 24 hour CVS down the street if you need any last minute travel items. The bar was completely packed at night so couldn't get in there but went for coffee in the morning and was again greeted by friendly and helpful staff. A great deal for NYC.

title: Loved it.
text:
We arrived at The Standard with a last minute booking after checking out of an awful   hotel in the East Village and we were wowed from the moment we walked in. It was 8am but the place was buzzing and everyone welcomed us with a smile and a chat. Paige at reception was great throughout our stay- really helpful, chatty and nothing seemed too much trouble- shes's an absolute credit to the hotel!

The rooms were lovely and clean, amazing views of the empire state (thanks to Paige!) and beds were comfy. The area is perfect for what we wanted to do in the city as there are hundreds of bars and restaurants to choose from. We didn't eat at the hotel but the food looked very good. There's a lovely garden for drinks too. Mike was also really helpful upon check out- helped with bags and arranged a car to the airport. 

All in all, we were rescued by The Standard, felt completely looked after and I'd go back tomorrow :-)

title: Killer Stay at The Standard
text: Definitely a place I will be coming back to time and again. Not only is the building beautiful but it has tons of character. The decor is modern and hip. The rooms were exactly what you needed - nothing more, nothing less, comfortable and inviting. My girlfriend loved the bathroom and spent a lot of time relaxing in the tub with a lux bubble bath. Marley at the front desk was awesome. He had a great vibe and made us feel welcome - even late at night. We ordered room service too and it was quick and delicious. The burger was absolutely perfect. We had so much to choose from in the neighborhood and ended up hanging out on St. Marks Place at a few bars.

title: NYC's Best hotel for tourists and locals. End of story.
text: Any means to rate this property beyond 5-stars? Because that's what they deserve. From my repeated short and long stays at this property over the past 2 years, I can say without any reservation, that everyone in their staff and crew can deliver what you need, when you want it, and how you want it. My numerous stays came with some very particular needs and I'm very clear and specific about them. Yes, I've been called  "a difficult guest" for someone who doesn't get it. The Standard East Village, gets it. And gets it done very well. That's all.

title: Cool and calm in the East Village
text: Friendly and helpful staff, comfortable and (for New York) reasonably big rooms, luxurious beds. The bar is great, and the courtyard is a nice place for a drink when the weather is good. The bathrooms are a little weak, but adequate. I have stayed there a couple of times and will stay there again.

title: Incredible views, fantastic spot
text: I checked in to The Standard, East Village late one night after booking a room there last minute on the Standard Hotels' app, "One Night Standard". After a long day, I was greeted by two incredibly friendly people who checked me in and said they would set me up with a great view. They weren't kidding...the room was fantastic. Right at the foot of the bed was a full wall of window with a fantastic view of lower Manhattan, and all the bridges to Brooklyn. The bed was so so comfortable, the shower was great, and the people here are the best. I was only there for a very short while, so I didn't get to take advantage of the restaurant or the bar, but at checkout, the owner was there with his two dogs, and was so friendly, outgoing, and genuinely wanted to hear about my experience at the hotel. The staff there were so helpful, giving me a full list of suggestions as to the best spots in the neighborhood. The Standard, East Village has a great vibe, the staff there make it feel like a community, the views are phenomenal, and the neighborhood is so endearing. I HIGHLY recommend The Standard, East Village.

title: Perfect Spot
text: Had a great stay at the Standard East Village.  Had taken a red eye and got into the city at 5:30 in the morning. Went straight to the hotel assuming I would just drop my bags and come back and check in later but Jordan (super helpful front desk person) was able to get me into a room right then and there! How fantastic to be able to take a shower and catch a couple more hours sleep before heading out for the day.  It is in a great location, close to great food, shops, and bars.  The Standard, East Village has definitely become my go to place to stay when in New York.

title: Birthday Weekend
text: My friends and u stayed at this hotel fora birthday weekend celebration and it was a great choice and place to stay. The staff was really friendly and made us feel like we was a top priority staying at their hotel. The bar had a great atmosphere and I just loved how they had a photo booth near the bathroom.  Jordan Stone who works at this hotel as well as Marcus gave us great customer service and helped us with all of our needs during the stay. I would highly recommend for anyone to stay here for the rooms are beautiful and the staff is superb

title: Lovely hotel with GREAT staff!!!!
text: I recently stayed at the standard for my 30th birthday with some friends and it was great! We were greeted at the door by a smiling, well groomed Garret.  He assured us to let him know if we needed anything. Every staff member we came in contact with greeted us with a smile and hello. The hotel is very clean and modern! I completely fell in love with the heated floors in the bathrooms!!!! Jordan is another staff member that really made our stay one to remember. He was also smiling, well groomed and well mannered. He answered alllllllllll of our annoying questions with a smile. He filled us in on everything about the hotel (including the picture booth that we took full advantage of!) and things around the hotel. I will definitely be back and I highly recommended this hotel!

title: Always a Good Time!
text: I can never say enough good things about The Standard East Village.  All of the staff -from housecleaning to front desk to bellmen to managers and everyone else - go out of their way to make every moment of your stay pleasant.  On our last visit, I was pleasantly surprised when the front desk staff remembered us from previous visits.  We made a request for an extra light in our room and it magically appeared in no time.  We needed a car service to attend an event, and again, every detail was arranged and could not have been better.  The staff are friendly and accommodating.  The rooms are spotless and beautifully appointed.  A short list of this wonderful staff would include Brittany, Jordan, Page, Ian, Angel, Austin, and, definitely, Jane.  I am looking forward to my next trip to NYC and would not even consider staying anywhere, but The Standard East Village.

title: Cute hotel, great staff
text:
Marley Nelson was there when I arrived, and was super welcoming, nice, polite, and made my stay much better! I asked to move rooms due to the noise, and he didn't hesitate for a sec, and helped me out find something better for me. Loved his energy and service! Also Jordan helped me get checked out and was also great.
Thanks for the nice staff and super cute hotel!

title: Terrific hotel and staff
text: We have stayed at the Standard several times...it gets better with each stay. The entire staff is great (front desk, bar/lounge and the doormen)...Paige at the front desk was a standout. The rooms are well-appointed, and the shower is a dream. An easy walk to the 6 at Astor Place, and you are Uptown in a flash.

title: OK, typical hipster hotel but with better staff and tolerable noise levels.
text:
Yes, it's a quasi "boutique" property frequented by hipsters. If that's you're cup of tea then you'll like this property. I normally avoid those hotels but this time I needed one within easy walking distance of NYU's Stern School, leaving me with few options. 

Overall I enjoyed my stay. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but reasonably fresh, tidy and quiet. In-room lighting is problematic, and some traditional amenities like clothes irons aren't provided. The bar is pretty good. However, the cost is very high for what you get, even by NYC standards - hence I award them only three stars.

title: Great stay
text: Comfy bed. Nice room. Roof top view was amazing. The location was fun but perhaps I am not young enough anymore to hang with the hipster crowd here. The room was small but it is NY so to be expected. I would stay again. Price seemed reasonable for Manhattan.

title: Nice honeymoon trip but not very friendly
text: We stayed here at the start of our honeymoon. My husband was a bit disappointed as he'd requested a certain type of room and they allocated the opposite to what he had asked for. The room itself was very nice, lovely views, comfy bed and a great bathroom. We found the staff not exactly rude but not really providing the friendly service you expect from a hotel of this standard. The location of the hotel is great, we loved exploring east village and found lots of great spots for breakfast and drinks in the evening. We took advantage of the free cycle hire one day and rode the bikes all the way over to Brooklyn. It was a great touch to have the bikes for hire and we'd recommend others to take advantage of it (though they only have limited bikes so you have to check them out early).

title: Good place to stay
text: I booked a king standard room here for 2 nights and it was fantastic. The room had great floor to ceiling views of the lower east side, the hotel restaurant and bar were delicious and the staff was extraordinary friendy and helpful. They even found me a replacement tie and tied it for me when I discovered I lost it. The bathroom was fantastic with the most dreamy tub in all of NYC. The only downside about this place is the Valet parking. Beware! My car was ticketed for being in the loading zone of the hotel as it was waiting on the valet parker, I was not made aware of the ticket until I checked out. Also the lot that the car was parked in, broke into my car. Apparently the loading zone is now a fire zone in nyc so all cars parked there will be ticketed. It took a few calls and a few weeks worth of due diligence, but the hotel eventually took care of the ticket, after it doubled of course. IF you are not driving (valet is 45 a day), then i totally recommend this hotel.

title: Front Desk Rep Makes The Trip
text: I have now stayed at the Standard Hotel-East Village four times in past two years. I originally choose it as it was so close to my daughter's places in Manhattan. But, because of great stays I've had, I've returned three more times. And, I just booked my 76 year old mother whose taking my 19 year old niece, for six nights come this April. Yeah, I'm paying! Worth it. Hotel is a great location and I love the amenities and rooms. But, it's the staff, Paige at the front desk in particular, that has made my stays. Paige booked a great restaurant for 12 of us for one of my daughters college graduations. She's helped me out when I've brought my mother before; my Mom is not an easy guest! It's been so nice to have a great Manhattan hotel to stay at that still has the personal touch of a "Paige" that gets to know you and help you out on subsequent trips.

title: Just stay
text:
Just stay.  The rooms are excellent, the bathrooms compact yet great and the bed superbly comfortable.
 
As (or more importantly since every good hotel provides a charming workable room), the neighborhood is a magic blend of fast vanishing old New York, the unique collection of bars, music, local shopping and restaurants of the East Village, NoHo, SoHo and the Lower East Side with direct subway access to the best of Broadway.
 
The people are best of all.  Particularly Morgan at Narcissa.  It’s extraordinary food with delightful variety, terrific drinks, great wine choices by the glass and unequaled food quality

title: Ausblick und Lage top
text:
Nettes Hotel mit recht großen Zimmern. Kreatives Design, hatte Blick zur Straßenseite, sehr nett, aber auch abends etwas laut. Meetingraum im "Penthouse" mit sehr gutem Rundumblick.
Lage ideal, um morgens einen Lauf durch die Stadt zu machen. Bin in einer Stunde um die Südspitze von Manhattan und wieder zurück. Im Hotel kein Gym, aber Gutscheine für das sehr gute Fitnessstudio auf der anderen Straßenseite.

title: Lovely modern boutique hotel
text: We spent a night at the Standard in December 2015. It was in a perfect location for us, and we had received a special rate, under $200 per night. The staff was very helpful, the room comfortable and we enjoyed the wonderful restaurant, Narcissa, which is part of the hotel. The cafe/bar served great coffee and a lovely breakfast. We will be sure to return!

title: Very Dissapointing, Dirty and Cold (both literally and figuarively)
text:
My girlfriend booked an Standard King room for my birthday last weekend, and we couldn't have been more disappointed. The first room we were given was right in front of a noisy elevator and had an incredibly stained carpet, hairs in the bathroom, and a putrid sour smell like someone had puked in the room. We asked to be moved to another room and were told that the hotel was fully booked. We asked to be moved to the Standard on the west side and were told that it was also fully booked.

Later, we were shown another room that was smaller and similarly dirty (hairs in the bathroom again and a very stained rug). At this point we just asked for our money back and said we would go to a different hotel. The manager was very rude, said that they have a strict cancellation policy and was generally very unaccommodating. The Standard's cancellation policy was totally irrelevant at this point: we had checked in, we were delivered incredibly substandard rooms and we were asking to walk away from the situation. 

If this story had ended there, it would be bad enough. However, we moved to the second room only to discover that the heat was not working. It was literally one of the coldest days in the history of NYC and the room was frigid. It took multiple calls to the front desk to get someone to come take a look at our heat. When it became clear that our heat could not be fixed we were offered a space heater. We said that the space heater was unacceptable, and we were eventually moved to a new room (that somehow magically appeared, despite earlier assertions that the hotel was fully booked...). 

The next morning, we went to have breakfast at the Café. The heat was apparently out in the Café as well because it was incredibly cold and the servers were wearing blankets and handing out blankets to the customers. 

I've saved the best part for last, though. We were told that we would be contacted by one of the more senior managers on the Monday after our stay to discuss what happened. It's now Wednesday and we have yet to be contacted by anyone from the Standard. They clearly couldn't care less about their customers. 

The quality of the rooms, service and amenities is absolutely abysmal. It would be fine if this hotel were a Best Western, but for the same price (or less) of the Standard East Village one could stay at the Ritz down town (if that's your thing) or the Ace (if that's your thing) or myriad other quality hotels in the city. The front desk workers and the managers are cold, unaccommodating and generally incompetent.

title: Free Upgrade :)
text: Booked and checked in on pretty short notice, as I arrived at the front desk they gave me a complimentary upgrade to a beautiful corner room on a high floor with a view of downtown.  Let's be real, it's NYC so the rooms are much smaller than in most other parts of the world.  The facilities are great though, love the outdoor restaurant, especially in the summer.  And the service was top notch.  I've stayed at other Standard hotels, and this one is one of my favorites. The location is great and I would stay again on any visit to NYC.

title: The Best!
text:
This is my favorite NY hotel! The people and the style are the best!
You can eat anytime. The staff go out of their way to make you comfortable!
I now just stay here every time I am in town. I really like staying here!

title: Terrific hotel, Perfect location
text: We usually stay in midtown Manhattan but wanted to try something different so chose this hotel for our recent stay for my birthday. It was the perfect choice! The neighbourhood has everything you could want (french bakery, excellent theatre, Starbucks, access to the subway) within walking distance and feels much quieter and less hectic than midtown. The staff were consistently friendly and warm throughout our trip. When we checked in we mentioned we were seeing some shows and one of the women introduced herself and the others working as the 'Broadway Crew' so we were excited to give them updates on our shows throughout the weekend. Rooms are nice and modern, great views of the city and make good use of their space. We'll be back for sure!

title: Luxury property, but prefer its westside counterpart
text: Since this hotel was not originally designed as a Standard hotel, it lacks that certain j'en sais quoi. The rooms are well designed/stocked, the restaurants are fabulous, the garden is great, the east village can't be beat; yet it lacks the energy and excitement of its sister hotel. All okay, if you have not been the Standard Highline.

title: Great Staycation at Standard East Village
text: I stayed overnight at The Standard East Village to enjoy a staycation. I was pleasantly greeted by a very personable front desk. Brittany and Chris were so helpful and welcoming. After checking in I came back down to have a drink at the cafe. The cafe had a great vibe and was tucked away which made it feel even more special. Later I ordered room service and ordered the grill cheese with tomato soup. It was delicious! I highly recommend staying at The Standard East Village. The front desk & cafe staff were exceptional with their service. I will be returning. Thank you

title: Best First Honeymoon!
text: We had a two-sided window king room on the 14th floor that overlooked the city towards Brooklyn.  The staff is AWESOME!  We happened to mention we were celebrating our first wedding anniversary and when we came back from dinner, there was a bottle of champagne and a note from the staff!  So cool!  The rooms are cozy and it is centrally located to all the East side of the city has to offer.  The door men were really friendly and hailed cabs and had our car there super fast for departure.  We have stayed at both Standards.  Love them both but the staff at this one was seriously friendly and it suits our 50's+ lifestyle! Also, it is not quaint, it is fresh, modern and stylish!

title: Great boutique hotel without the NYC boutique attitude!
text:
I stayed overnight to visit my niece at NYU and take her to dinner. The rooms are not big but as big a room as you find at these types of hotels. They are quirky looking and well decorated.

The restaurant was great foodie meal and a perfect place to take a young college freshman for a special meal!

title: Unique and trendy hotel
text:
I gave The Standard a try, even though I'm usually a Marriott/Kimpton girl, and I wasn't disappointed.
The girl checking me in was really nice.
Rooms are VERY small, but they make the best of the space. Furniture was very minimalistic and streamlined.
The location is fantastic.
I wish this space had a rooftop terrace, but they do have a nice restaurant (which I didn't check out)
